Came for lunch and the service wasn't great.  The food was OK.  I had the sashimi Benito box. The miso dressing on my salad was watery and bland. I guess they forgot the seaweed salad I ordered.  I told the waitress and she didn't even apologize or ask if I wanted it.  When she brought the bill, she said \"I took it off the bill for you\" with a big smile, like she did me a favor.  Of course she took it off the bill, I never got it.

I very, very rarely write in to Yelp, but I feel like I need to be the tie-breaker on this one, as the reviews are wildly divergent.

There are two possibilities for this place.  Either

a) it entirely depends on when you are here

or

b) people don't know what good BBQ is here in Madison.

Now, I live in NYC now, so I'm a bit food-spoiled.  But I love BBQ, so my standards are pretty low.

This was not good BBQ.  I had the full ribs, with mac & cheese, succotash.  Sides were alright, nothing to write home about.  The ribs were overcooked and dried out, and were intolerable on their own.  Sure, if you slather them in enough BBQ sauce, they taste alright, but so does cardboard.

Don't go.  Overly expensive (at least by Madison standards) and just flat out not good BBQ.

When it comes to service this Dairy Queen is the worst.  It's always dirty and there's never a manager on duty.  If there's a spill it stays on the floor and doesn't get cleaned up.  The gal came out with our food and a little girl ran in front of her.  The gal spilled our drinks but didn't replace it.  We had to go back up and ask for it and she also forgot my daughter's smoothie.

Ugh.  Food that is not nearly as good as Taco Bell is priced like it's four diamond fare.  And to go with it, enjoy the weakest drinks on the strip.  The only reason this place gets 2 stars instead of one is that the service was good.

"Limited gastronomical options. My recollection is that the cost per individual was fifteen dollars. Frankly, it seems to me that a more satisfactory dining experience could be attained by consuming a burger at a different venue. While the postprandial course was intriguing, the culinary offerings were unremarkable, consisting merely of grilled or deep-fried poultry, mashed potatoes, steamed vegetables, and a smattering of other unexceptional items. Furthermore, the interval awaiting admittance was considerable, and I remain perplexed as to why this particular buffet was so popular."

Very small selection. I think it was $15 a person. Seriously... I think you are better off grabbing a burger. The desert was cool, but food wise.. you literally get up to grab your food, and that's it.... there is no extra food that will be coming out, just chicken, grill or fried, mashed potatoes, veggies, and a few others.. but nothing is special about this buffet. The wait to get in was crazy... and I still can't understand why.

I must say that the look of this shop is lovely but the experience I had there was terrible: \n\nFirstly, I had to pay the fee to try on the dresses and then they were so rude about me bringing more than two people with me to try on, though of course I wanted to bring my mum, step mum and mother in law to see my wedding dress. The staff were condescending and pushy and lots of the dresses fairly tacky looking. However they turned out to be the best of a bad bunch so in the end I did buy my dress from them. On the day however the corset was very hard for my bridesmaid to do up, agony to sit down in, warped in shape by the end on the evening and left me with bruising around my ribs that lasted 3 months. Being in pain like this really put a dampen on my wedding day so needless to say, I cannot recommend them. Also, the dress they made me looked nothing like the one I had tried on initially in shape so I was disappointed with the look despite any modifications they tried to make.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are woefully limited and fail to provide a satisfactory dining experience commensurate with the cost. None of the menu items possessed sufficient gastronomic quality to justify expending financial resources upon them, and Las Vegas boasts an abundance of superior eateries worthy of patronage."
Not a lot of variety for the price. There was nothing that tasted really good that I would recommend wasting your money on. There are much better places to eat in Vegas.

This place is pretty much a home garage style business tucked away in a side commercial building selling Micargi Walmart bikes. 

I found them on Craigs List and decided to take a look last week after visiting many other bicycle shops looking for the perfect bike. Hey, if you want to purchase a cheap Walmart bike sold out of a makeshift shop, then this might be your place.  
They had a small work table scattered with tools, no computer and it looked very unorganized. Defiantly does not look like not a typical service bike shop with no building sinage except for a sticker on the window. Their Craigs list ad advertised check us out on Yelp and I did.

The facility is nice and clean and appears new. The sales staff is nice and friendly and the prices seem very reasonable. 

The main problem here is the range check-in staff. We were told there was one lane open and then a wait. We took the open lane for a group of 5 and thought we were lucky. The lanes on both sides were open and unused the entire time. I stepped out to let the staff know and see if we could split and use two lanes. I was told no, that they were currently used. The staff has cameras and can see that they are not. When challenged politely that they lanes in fact were not being used the staff behind the counter seemed annoyed and rebuked the suggestion that they were open. 

This left the impression that they artificially creating wait times. During our entire time there 4 of the available 8 lanes in our area were open and not being used. They were not damaged or broken either.

So if you have to go here press the staff on lanes. Make sure you aren't being made to wait for no reason. There are other places to shoot and perhaps you should go elsewhere.

I persist in frequenting this establishment, despite the recurring disappointment it yields.  Its ambiance, replete with playful ornamentation, fails to compensate for the gastronomical shortcomings that I experience.  Specifically, during two separate luncheon visits, my burgers were overcooked, rendering the patty unpalatably dry and lacking the succulence that I have come to expect from a high-quality burger.  Furthermore, a comparative analysis reveals that the meat, when evaluated independently of the various toppings and condiments, does not differ substantially from that offered by the nearby Five Guys franchise.  Therefore, considering the premium price point of this restaurant, I must advise against investing in their burgers, as they fail to provide commensurate value.  Instead, I recommend patronizing Five Guys, where the culinary experience is bound to be more satisfying and worthwhile.

"Boo! I had the displeasure of visiting this establishment previously, and it was utterly dreadful. The ambiance was akin to a cacophony of deafening sounds, with nary a seat in sight and exorbitant potations that did little to quench my thirst. The tunes that blared from the speakers were an affront to my auditory senses. It begs the question, how do patrons tolerate such an environment? 

Amidst the chaos, there was a modest acrobatic performance that failed to perturb me excessively, and the gyrations of the go-go dancers provided mild amusement. 

The clientele was a motley assortment of individuals, deviating from the customary mix of rowdy revelers and their companions found at other nightspots. Instead, an eccentric array of elderly and seemingly socially awkward patrons populated this venue. 

In conclusion, it was a surreal experience, to say the least. There is no logical explanation for anyone seeking to replicate the essence of this establishment's namesake, as it falls woefully short of that aim. 

My rating of one star is solely due to the presence of a photograph of Elton John on the wall, which fortuitously contributed to the completion of a running joke for the evening."

Hmm.. came here drunk as a skunk so which means i dont remember anything good about this place.\n\n2 stars because these communist bastards jack up their prices and their quality isn't getting better.

I'm not a huge fan of purchasing overpriced and underrated electronics here but my husband insisted on buying another best buy computer, even after our last terrible experience. So here i am with his computer again... in line at geek squad.  You have two employees working with seven customers and three employees in customer service standing around watching us get pissed off.  Great job!   Next time I'm buying dell direct.

"My culinary expectations were not adequately fulfilled during my stay at the expensive rest home, primarily due to the subpar quality of the food provided, with the exception of the salad bar, which offered a modicum of satisfaction and thus warranted an additional star in my assessment."
I didn't like anything... Expensive rest home food...  Actually the salad bar was ok, that's why they got an extra star..

The service was sluggish, which was discernible from the prolonged duration it took for our order to be fulfilled, and the lackadaisical demeanor exhibited by the staff during the process. We ordered a nonfat chai latte augmented with a shot of espresso, a beverage that did not strike us as particularly complex or challenging to prepare. However, upon consumption, we discovered that the chai was tainted by an unpleasant bitterness, attributable to the absence of adequate straining of the herbs, which also rendered the texture gritty and unpalatable. The sole redeeming features of this establishment were the aesthetically pleasing decor and the inviting ambiance of the patio area. We did not sample any culinary offerings, but they appeared visually appealing.

Service was slow. Ordered a nonfat chai latte with shot of espresso, not too complicated. The chai was bitter due to the herbs not being strained out which also made it gritty- a very unpleasant texture in a drink. The only pluses about this place is the decor & patio. Didn't try any food but it looked good.

It was indeed a curious phenomenon that we encountered on that fateful Monday evening, wherein the culinary offerings at the buffet appeared to be woefully inadequate and lacking in both quantity and quality, leading one to ponder whether this dearth of gastronomical delights was a result of the day of the week or a more systemic issue; alas, our expectations for a more diverse and sumptuous spread were left unfulfilled, and we were compelled to seek sustenance elsewhere, thereby necessitating a more comprehensive exploration of the various buffet options available in order to satiate our hunger and culinary cravings.

This eatery exudes a timeless charm, the culinary offerings are quite satisfactory. However, the hospitality aspect of the establishment leaves much to be desired, thereby necessitating a rating of two stars from my perspective. In my opinion, the quality of service is an indispensable element of the dining experience.

The manager exhibits a remarkable lack of cordiality and displays an unaccommodating demeanor. When I attempted to arrange a gathering for approximately thirty individuals, the manager informed me that he was disinclined to accommodate a group of our magnitude during the evening hours. He indicated that we could arrive at either 5:30 or 9 pm, as our party would occupy excessive space and he had other clientele to consider. It is evident that the manager is oblivious to the fact that he has just relinquished the opportunity to generate revenue from thirty confirmed dinner orders... A monumental blunder on his part.

I have never been subjected to such discourteous treatment. Consequently, I shall refrain from patronizing this establishment in the future. Las Vegas boasts numerous steakhouses, rendering it unnecessary to frequent this particular venue where one is likely to be treated with disrespect.

"It is gratifying to note that an array of plant-based options graces their menu, but it is regrettable that the quality of their vegan offerings leaves much to be desired. Upon ordering the vegan enchiladas, I was presented with a dish that closely resembled vegan chicken strips rolled within tortillas and smothered in sauce, which was a far cry from my expectations. Furthermore, the side salad that accompanied the entree was conspicuous by its absence. It appears that special requests pose a significant challenge for them, as my spouse, who adheres to a lacto-ovo-vegetarian diet, requested a customized version of their cheese enchilada with vegan chicken strips in place of the meat. Unfortunately, the initial plate presented to us consisted solely of chicken enchiladas, while the second iteration was limited to vegan enchiladas, which fell short of our expectations."

The good news is that they have a nice vegan menu. The bad news is that they are not that great at serving vegan food. I ordered vegan enchiladas & they ended up serving me vegan chicken strips rolled up in torillas with sauce. The side salad was also missing.\nThey also don't do well with special orders. My husband is vegetarian & asked for a normal cheese enchilada with the vegan chicken strips. The first plate they brought out was just chicken enchiladas. The second plate was just vegan enchiladas. Not that great in my opinion.

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."
 Our culinary excursion at this establishment proved to be a rather unsatisfactory affair, characterized by an excessive duration between courses, which led to prolonged intervals of inactivity and a perceptible lack of zest in the consumables that were eventually presented before us. Specifically, the vegetable paella we ordered arrived at our table in a tepid state, devoid of the rich, savory flavors that we had anticipated. Furthermore, we were dismayed to discover that the so-called "poatos bravas" consisted merely of potato chips, which paled in comparison to the authentic, crispy potato dish that we had eagerly anticipated. Notwithstanding these disappointments, there were a few redeeming features of our meal, specifically the refreshing gin and tonics that we imbibed, as well as the tantalizing endive with goat cheese tapas that briefly elevated our spirits.

Very slow service.  Very lack luster food.  We had periods of 15-20 minutes in between dishes being delivered.  Vegetable paella was cool when it came out and not flavorful.    The poatos bravas are potato chips here.  Disappointed since everyone loves the real potatoes Bravas. The highlight of the meal were the gin and tonics and the endive with goat cheese tapas.
Food isn't as good as the Southend location and the service is terrible 2 out the 6 times I've been. Good beer selection though
I wanted 10 once wheat grass , they charge d me 5 times 2 onces price instead of 8 extra one once. Bad

My gel manicure exhibited pronounced delamination and separation from the nail bed in extensive flakes after a mere week, which was profoundly disappointing given the copious acclaim and commendation it had received prior to my utilization; thus, my expectations were not merely unfulfilled, but also thoroughly dissatisfied with the overall quality of the manicure.
My gel manicure started peeling off in big chunks after a week.  I read all these good reviews so I was really expecting a great manicure, but I wasn't impressed.

"The MGM Grand Buffet fails to impress, offering an unremarkable dining experience with too much repetition across its extensive selection of culinary options. Despite the presence of delectable choices such as crab legs, prime rib, turkey, ribs, shrimp, pasta, pizza, and sushi, the overall quality falls short of expectations, particularly when compared to superior alternatives like Bellagio's or Wynn's. Specifically, the crab legs disappoint, as they do not effortlessly extract from their shells, necessitating an excessive amount of time and effort to enjoy. Furthermore, the remaining dishes are merely adequate, lacking any exceptional characteristics. Considering the steep price point of $30 ($40 on weekends) for an all-day buffet, patrons may rightfully anticipate a more satisfying experience. To elevate their standing, MGM Grand Buffet must enhance the quality and distinctiveness of their offerings."

Nothing Grand about this buffet.  While serviceable, there are definitely better meals to be had in LV, buffets included.

Like other LV buffets, MGM Grand Buffet has a wide variety of food to offer: crab legs, prime rib, turkey, ribs, shrimp, pasta, pizza, sushi, so on and so forth.  The prime rib was pretty good but, unfortunately, none of the remaining offerings were particularly special at Grand Buffet.  The crab legs are not as good as Bellagio's or Wynn's.  in fact, I'm not sure if this is a  sign of quality or what, but the crab legs at MGM didn't  pull cleanly out of the shells as they do at the aforementioned Bellagio or Wynn buffets.   I found myself spending too much time trying to pull the meat out of the shells, despite the fact that they are already split cleanly in half. The remainder of what I tried was ok, but nothing special at all.

I go to a LV buffet intent on eating back any money I've gambled away, so I have higher expectations than this.  Like some other casinos, MGM Grand Buffet currently offers a buffet all day long.  For $30 ($40 on weekends) you can have mediocre buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner instead of just one meal.  Need to step it up MGM!

Service is a little slow (which may not be a bad thing depending on your mood), but the food is just okay.  Very friendly staff and a nice atmosphere, but the best thing we ate was the Greek salad, and for those prices, it should have been better.

I am a regular here, but must say that I was very disappointed last time I was there, I went to get a nail broken fixed I waited for over an hour! Ridiculous...  \nI like this place a lot but I only have my nails done with Libby, every time I have had it with someone else it is NO good, no to mention that I HATE that they keep talking among themselves in vietnamese, so rude. Once I knew that they were saying something about me and I asked what they were saying about me, they just said oh yes we were talking about your beautiful eyelashes... yeah right!

I took in a large garbage bag full of clothes and brand new skiing outfit. They didn't purchase anything. The majority of the stuff I took in was in good conditon, classic style, and name brand stuff. I even had a dress with the tags still attached. I asked why they didn't buy anything and the buyer in training said that the condition they were in and the style wasn't what they were looking for. I saw some of the clothes they did have and it was in worse condition than my stuff.

Perhaps the drabbest of the Marriotts I have ever stayed in.  Unfortunately this was a forced choice by our conference location.  By far the inferior sister of the Marriott in uptown, I was glad when my stay was over.  My room on the 18th floor was damp and smelled a little funky.  A somewhat of nice touch was the sort of turndown service, where the hotel staff came around each room offering candy bars.

Conference facilities are actually pretty good and the food decent enough to warrant a recommendation for future conferences.

2 stars for the passable stay, but stay in uptown or Southpark Marriotts if you can.

We endeavored to partake in a culinary experience at this establishment, motivated by copious accolades that had been bestowed upon it; however, our expectations were not entirely fulfilled, as our dining experience was marred by an unfortunate sequence of events. Specifically, the atmosphere, which had initially been satisfactory, was significantly disrupted towards the conclusion of our meal by the proximity of a table that was undergoing alterations, transforming the surrounding area into a veritable construction site replete with drills and other loud power tools. It is worth noting that this occurrence took place during the luncheon period, which made it all the more incongruous that such a disturbance should have occurred at a time when the restaurant was brimming with patrons.

The gastronomical offerings themselves were somewhat lackluster, with the burgers, in particular, failing to meet our expectations. While the selection of toppings was undoubtedly inventive and intriguing, the patties themselves were conspicuously devoid of moisture and flavor, leaving much to be desired in terms of their overall taste and texture. Furthermore, the lower halves of the buns were observed to be disintegrating, which only served to exacerbate our disappointment.

Notwithstanding these shortcomings, the hospitality we received during our visit was pleasant and cordial, even if the quality of the cuisine did not entirely live up to our expectations.

We tried it because of rave reviews we have heard, but left disappointed.  The ambiance was fine execpt towards the end of our meal they decided to adjust a table nearby and it became like a construction zone with drills and loud power tools.  Granted it was during lunch, but we still felt it could have been done at another time when most of the restaurant was not full.

The burgers were okay, but not at all what I would consider great.  They were not very juicy, or flavorful in and of themselves, but there were interesting toppings to choose from. And, despite the burgers not being juicy the bottom of the buns were falling apart.

The service was pleasant but the food didn't really hit the mark on our visit.

This was my first time at SP. We waited about 15 min after being seated before someone came to take our order. We were never offered or asked if we wanted anything to drink. We started with pot stickers and egg roles then continued with orange chicken. After ordering, the pots tickers came right out and tasted old and deep fried when the menu said pan fried. Within 2 minutes after getting the appetizer our entree came out. It really worries me when food comes out that fast. All the food tasted old and refried and the fried rice was mushy.

The service was not good and no one came back to check on us or to refill our drinks. The waited disappeared and the only reason we got boxes or a check was because the busser  saw me looking around for service. 

We will probably not return.

Eh. Had a business lunch there recently and was underwhelmed. A couple of things were good, one was great and couple were absolutely undistinguished. 

Lunch for 4 was $200, and a couple of people left hungry. 

Great dish with grilled fish on brussel sprouts in horseradish cream sauce, and one of the sushi rolls was great, look for teh one with Saracha. They don't have ice-tea. Atmosphere is a bit like dining at a restaurant in a mall, because that's where it is. Oysters were the smallest I've ever seen, literally. Service was passable.

This review pertains to the Lake of Dreams production.
The performance takes place every thirty minutes once the sun has set. According to the website, the show commences at eight o'clock in the evening; however, due to the lingering presence of sunlight in the sky, the start time was postponed until half past eight. This delay was quite disappointing.
We returned to the venue at half past eight, and the show lasted a mere three minutes. A colossal frog ascended to the summit of the artificial waterfall and performed a melodic rendition of "What a Wonderful World." Although the display was moderately captivating, I had anticipated a more extensive presentation.
Subsequently, we attended the second showing at nine o'clock that evening, only to be met with a technological malfunction. Throughout the exhibition, two spheres traversed the pond in circular motions (a relatively lackluster spectacle). In the midst of the performance, the illumination suddenly ceased, and the music halted abruptly.
In conclusion, this particular show cannot rival the alternative complimentary presentations along the strip. Instead, it is recommended to experience the Bellagio fountain display.

I am going to express my satisfaction with my facial waxing and pedicure treatments; however, I must admit that the manicure process left much to be desired, as the application of shellac resembled dried clumps of candle wax on my nails, prompting me to request that the attendant redo the procedure utilizing regular polish instead, owing to the considerable amount of time I had already dedicated to this endeavor; furthermore, I must note that my novice niece, equipped with a Sally Hansen shellac kit purchased from Walmart, managed to achieve a superior outcome in merely 20 minutes, which raises questions regarding the quality of service provided for the substantial fee of $80, not including gratuity.

Au Bon Pain is a popular chain of bakeries/cafes that offer an array of delectable pastries, sandwiches, soups, and salads. However, my recent visit to one of their locations left much to be desired in terms of customer service. Specifically, the cashier seemed to prioritize her personal affairs over my patronage, engaging in a lengthy text message conversation while I waited patiently to pay for my breakfast. This lackadaisical attitude towards customer care was particularly striking given the absence of any other patrons in the establishment at the time, rendering her behavior all the more inexcusable. Furthermore, the fact that she continued to compose and send messages without so much as acknowledging my presence or offering a cursory apology for the delay left me feeling disrespected and ignored. In light of these events, I cannot help but wonder if ABP management might benefit from implementing stricter policies regarding employee conduct during working hours, particularly when it comes to attending to customers in a timely and respectful manner. Notwithstanding the above grievances, the quality of the food itself was satisfactory, with the apple cinnamon oatmeal being a highlight. Adequate employee training and supervision could greatly enhance the overall dining experience for future patrons.

"Intrigued by the enigma surrounding the continued operation of this eatery, situated within a poorly designed parking area of a strip mall, my spouse and I opted to venture inside and sample their culinary offerings. It was peculiar to discover that each burger was accompanied by an unconventional assortment of toppings, including chili resembling canine food, mustard, onion, and pickle. Furthermore, the patty itself was remarkably thin, rivaling those found at a certain fast-food chain. While the fries were palatable, the overall dining experience was underwhelming. Moreover, the caliber of staff employed at this establishment seemed questionable, as exemplified by the girl manning the drive-thru window. Puzzled by the restaurant's ability to maintain its operations, we departed with a sense of bewilderment."

Well not impressed.  The only good thing was the chips and salsa and my Dr. Pepper which was self serve.  Had the carne-asada burrito.  It was dried up beef with guacamole that lacked flavor.  I ask for the pico on the side and they brought me another bowl of salsa (great).  Well the cheese crisp was good, but fell apart as we were eating it.  The wife like her Chicken Burrito with green sauce, but in my opinion it was the stewed chicken place in a tortilla and the smothered with sauce and cheese then put under the broiler... All this for $22, well, last and only time...  OH...  The service and employees were great...

I was super disappointed with this place... My boyfriend really wanted to go here so we decided to swap Jason's deli (which is right across the street )for this place. that was a bad idea, the service was horrible they made us wait so long and charged us for things without letting us know first this is the second time I've gone to a PT's run Company... Even our first experience at PT's was absolutely horrible...  The servers acted like we were a nuisance and they didn't even want us there it took a long time to get our food and the even messed up on the order And still charged full price for it. But on a lighter note the food was actually very good my boyfriend got a steak salad and I got a hamburger and it was very very good so my suggestion to you is to call it in and pick it up and enjoy you are meal somewhere else. I really wanted to enjoy this place but I guess the hunt for a good pub and eatery is still on in full force!

Bummer. It transpired that we opted for an evening of merriment and revelry, colloquially denoted as 'happy hour', at an establishment purporting to specialize in avian culinary delights. Our order comprised of two glasses of ale, complemented by an assortment of wings, which regrettably failed to meet our expectations. Specifically, the quality of the wings was subpar, lacking both flavor and moisture, leading us to surmise that the grilled preparation method, followed by a generous application of sauce, may have contributed to their unfortunate dearth of palatability. Furthermore, our server, while not unfriendly, displayed a marked indifference towards our presence, bordering on apathy, during the course of our visit. Notwithstanding, the ambiance of the venue itself proved rather pleasant, boasting an agreeable atmosphere conducive to conviviality. In conclusion, we shall not return to this establishment, as its distance from our customary haunts renders it somewhat inaccessible, and alternative dining options hold greater appeal for us.

Bummer.    Went for happy hour.  Ordered winds and a beer.

Service was satisfactory on a busy world series final game.

If you cook, then cook!   Wings were so blah; what's the point.   Ordered Honey Hot.   Well, salt is hotter than those wings.   And they were dry perhaps because i asked for the grilled, then tossed in sauce method (for a $1 more).  Another friend said the same thing and he got a different sauce.  So not a wing place.

Beer selection ho-hum.

Atmosphere.  Good.  

Will I go back, not unless there is a compelling reason; it's off the beaten  track for me, but friends wanted to try it.  Will explore other options.

Service advisor that greeted me was showing little interest of my LS issue.  They were running around in crisis trying to locate loaner car for someone else.  Not what I am use to by a Lexus dealership.  I drove away.

I only went here because i had a coupon that came in the mail. The store is not setup in a way that it easy to get around and serve yourself. They don't have a wide selections of flavors. The toppings have even a less of variety and were all just about empty. \n\nThe girls working the front counter were just sitting around on the counter and were not too friendly at all.

First time eating here, didn't think the food or service was all that great. The restraint has a pot of bowling broth in the center of the table and you go to fridges and select what you want to cook. The food just didn't have enough flavor in my opinion. However there is a small selection of food that you can have cooked by the chefs in the kitchen. The beef tenderloins were amazing and did have a ton of flavor if you do go herein strongly recommend eating here. The service was the main reason for the two stars I would often have to wave several times to get the attention of one of the three servers and it was not busy at all there were only 2 other tables in the restaurant. Even when the servers would stop by the table to grab some of the empty plates it was hard to get their attention to ask them for something. One even walked away when I was in the middle of ordering another dish. Also the ice in the drinks had a very odd chemical odor however I didn't notice a taste difference. The restaurant is very clean and modern hopefully it was just a bad experience.

B\u00e2ton Rouge is a dining establishment that I typically enjoy visiting (specifically, the location situated in the heart of downtown Montreal, within the esteemed Complexe Desjardins, ranks among my most preferred branches). However, my recent visit to this particular venue left me feeling somewhat underwhelmed. 
  The pace of the service was sluggish, bordering on glacial! Indeed, the prolonged delay in attending to our table made it challenging to maintain a semblance of tranquility, particularly when attempting to keep fidgety young children entertained and contained within their designated seating areas. While the menu did feature an array of options tailored to younger palates, the tardiness of the servers significantly diminished our overall dining experience. 
  In terms of culinary offerings, the quality was unremarkable, with the exception of the specialty lobster poutine, which proved to be rather delectable. Unfortunately, the cucumber mojito we ordered lacked the distinctive flavor profile we had anticipated, tasting more akin to plain water than an expertly crafted cocktail. 
  In conclusion, our experience at this specific B\u00e2ton Rouge branch fell short of our expectations, with the majority of aspects ranging from unremarkable to disappointing.

Bâton Rouge is normally a restaurant I like to go (the one downtown Montreal, in the Complexe Desjardins, is one of my favorite of the branch). But this one left me...dissatisfied.   

The service was slow! Like...suuuppeeerrr slow. And yes, they may have a menu for the kids, but because of slowness of the service, your patience will grow thin while you try to calm down toddlers and preschoolers in their chairs. The food was an average "OK", nothing to drool on...except the special lobster poutine they had: that one was pretty good! The cucumber mojito tasted more like water than a mojito, unfortunately.  

Overall, the rest was pretty average for our experience at this branch.

I honestly can't think of a sushi experience that wasn't better than Yellowtail.  We walked in without reservations and had almost no wait.  The atmosphere is like a nightclub, the music was loud and terrible, and it was extremely dark.

Putting all of that aside, the food was mediocre at best.  The sauce that the tofu came with tasted exactly like Oriental Ramen broth.  The rolls were extremely small and had minimal flavor, the edemame was adequate although half of it was overcooked.

I think their slogan on the business card said it all:

"Yellowtail - Barely Adequate"

Chipotle...translation...Chipotle...which means commercialized Mexican food in layman's terms. So as far as this goes I am a much bigger fan of Baja Fresh across the street and after this last experience at Chipotle I will probably continue to dine at the Baja Fresh location across the street.
So I am have never been a huge fan of Chipotle, except for the fact that the portions are huge.
What I am not a fan of is spending $10.18 on a single burrito and a tiny little bag of stale ass chips and day old salsa. I mean the burrito was filled mostly with beans and rice, the cost on that for them must be a whole 7 maybe 8 cents per portion. Ridiculous.
I was not extremely impressed with Chipotle to begin with the novelty has worn off and so has the food taste. It's not good anymore. At least not at this location. Bland...not good for Mexican food.

Very pricey and a very slim selection of only cocktails. You can't take your own pictures and have to pay for theirs. It's a tourist trap for sure but if you can afford it- its worth checking out if you've never been. Just be prepared to spend a lot of money.

The statement pertaining to my absence in the future has been unequivocally conveyed, as I have visited this establishment on three separate occasions, primarily due to its proximity to my domicile, with the intention of determining whether my initial assessment was erroneous; however, it appears that the third attempt has solidified my conviction regarding the subpar quality of the culinary offerings, specifically the pancakes, which contain an excessive amount of baking soda or powder, resulting in an unpleasant taste and texture, while the omelets are overcooked to an unpalatable degree; conversely, the mimosa I sampled briefly provided a satisfactory experience, yet ultimately proved insufficient to salvage my overall impression of the restaurant.

I will not be back. I've been here 3 times because they are so close to my house, each time trying to see if maybe I'm wrong. Well 3 strikes you're out. The pancakes had way to much baking soda or powder and the omelets are overcooked. The only thing that was good was the sip of mimosa I had. Not impressed.

My family and I were looking for places to eat, while in Vegas, and we came upon this buffet. We thought we'd try it out since it was an all-you-can-eat buffet for $9.99.\n\nI thought, coming into this buffet, the food would be good. It was alright. The food was salty, and some were even cold. The service there was friendly, even though you could barely hear what they are asking you.

Candy Coated Recipe 

Sugar Factory, please add...

*3 large sized "Cross-Trained" Employees
*2 happy Attitude Adjustments 
*1 medium sized Refrigerated Display Case

To your already...

*Delicious selection of candies, baked goods, & cold treats  
*Bright & colorful establishment

Yes, there was only one person helping with order taking and making of the labor intensive products they have on the menu even though there were 4 people. I guess no one can help that person out. In addition to the velvet brownie & chocolate milkshake, we ordered 4 macarons that were $1.50 a pop for the half-dollar sized yum-yums. Unfortunately, they aren't kept cool in a refrigerated section so they just get hard and downright nasty sitting there. The girl behind the counter said they make them fresh everyday and that they were popular. It's a shame I paid 6 bucks for nasty wafer like cookies. I could have bought myself 2 boxes of OREOS with that money. The only thing going for this over-priced place is the Couture Pops! Sure their pricey but it's all about being seen with those bling-blingin' trendy lollipops. I bought one with a box of refills ($40).

Slow service, mediocre food and the temp in the dining room was very cold.

We tried this place years ago when they first opened.  The food then was not good and we wrote the place off.  Last week we found ourselves looking for a quick bite and decide to give it another try.

The food is no better now than it was when they first opened.  The Gyro meat was dry and salty, the fries were still frozen in the center, my son's chicken strips were mostly breading and the salad was soggy and tasteless.

The service was very slow.  We were one of three tables in the whole place and our food took about 20 minutes to come out.

I am a home owner in this neighborhood and proud of where I live. I truly want the local businesses to be the best of the best but unfortunately this place could use a visit from Restaurant Impossible.
Eh, basically shoes for old women.  The only reason they're even \"famous\" is 'cause of Sex and the City... though I did love the knee-length cage boots.\n\nChristian Louboutin FTW.

"My expectations were not entirely fulfilled, as certain aspects of the culinary offerings did not align with the elevated standards that had been enthusiastically portrayed by patrons. Specifically, some of the sushi selections failed to impress my palate, and the sight of an extensive queue for the crab legs prompted a visceral reaction. Despite these underwhelming experiences, I am willing to grant the establishment a second opportunity to demonstrate its merits during my subsequent visit to Las Vegas, as my memory does not retain any particularly remarkable features of the buffet."

I guess I didn't think it lived up to its hype..maybe it's because some of the food just didn't taste like how everyone was describing it to taste. Some of the sushi was rather gross and I saw the line for the crab legs and almost cried. I'm actually going to give this buffet another try the next time I'm in Vegas since I don't remember anything special about it.

Nice break from the heat. Went twice over the weekend. Waitresses were very nice but the manager with the soul patch was a tool. Had it not been for his lack of hospitality,  I would have given it a 5 star rating and would have spent a lot more money! Since they don't care about repeat business, they won't have mine!

I went in with some girlfriends on Friday night, we sat down at about 9:45pm and ordered a couple margarita's which were good and tasty. Unfortunately, that was the only good thing.  The female  wait staff all seemed like they were on drugs, just odd behavior and super fast and twitchy.  We ordered some tacos which were at best bland and really nothing to write home about.  The beans were good and the chips weren't bad.  It was also odd that the wait staff was using a table in the restaurant as their personal dining table.  Although it was winding down, it just seemed unprofessional.  I live downtown and won't be going back, So-Cal Fish Taco has way better food and service.

I have had a profound affinity towards this establishment in the past; however, my recent experience has led me to reevaluate my stance. Despite their elevated prices, I have previously enjoyed their culinary offerings, particularly their pizza. Although it may not compare to the gastronomic excellence of New York-style pizza, it has been satisfactory. However, my most recent acquisition of a pie on Tuesday, June 2nd, 2009, was disappointingly devoid of flavor. Unfortunately, this has not been an isolated incident. As a patron, I have come to expect a certain level of consistency in the quality of the food and service. On multiple occasions, I have dined in and observed the staff exhibiting signs of annoyance and rudeness. Consequently, I have decided to terminate my patronage of Northside Nathans.

"The utterance 'Meh' accurately encapsulates my sentiments regarding this establishment.  The culinary offerings were merely adequate, with the beans and hot sauce being the sole exceptional component.  I opted for a shredded chicken burrito combination.  While I was gratified to observe that the burrito wasn't excessively proportioned (an all too common phenomenon, wherein the burrito transcends the dimensions of one's cranium), my satisfaction was short-lived, as the remainder of the dish failed to impress.  The chicken was characterized by an unfortunate lack of flavor and an unusual sogginess (upon cutting into the burrito, I was met with an unexpected release of liquid - a truly off-putting sight); the rice was unremarkable in taste; and the beans, while palatable when copiously augmented with hot sauce/salsa, were unable to salvage the dish from its overall mediocrity.  Suffice it to say, I shall not be returning to this establishment in pursuit of consumable items.  Rather, I shall seek alternative sources for satisfying my hunger."

My experience at The Cheesecake Factory was not motivated by the customary factors; rather, it was prompted by the eatery's promotion of half-priced slices of cheesecake on National Cheesecake Day. Despite the queue to greet the hostess, she efficiently managed the influx of patrons, and I waited merely thirty minutes to be seated. Our server was quite personable and knowledgeable about the novel cheesecake flavor introduced that day, enhancing the overall dining experience. Additionally, we received complimentary bread, with the wheat option being my preferred choice over the white. In regards to my cheesecake selection, I opted for the fresh strawberry variety, which unfortunately did not meet my expectations. While the creamy texture of the cheesecake was satisfying, the absence of a distinct cream cheese flavor was noticeable. Furthermore, the graham cracker crust failed to maintain its structural integrity. Unaware of the slight price increase for the fresh strawberry cheesecake compared to other intricate options, I was taken aback by the total cost of my bill. Ultimately, the unremarkable cheesecake did not compel me to return to the establishment in the near future.

I have had the pleasure of visiting the Town Square location on a couple of occasions, and my experiences were generally positive. However, my culinary excursions to the Tivoli venue yielded decidedly mixed results. Specifically, the sweet potato and chicken risotto, priced at $16.25, exhibited an unfortunate lack of texture and flavor, its gummy consistency and bland taste reminiscent of paste. In contrast, the fettuccine napoli, available for $15.95, demonstrated a modicum of improvement, yet still fell short of truly impressive. The standout dish, in my opinion, was the kid's cheese pizza, which not only satisfied my palate but also spoke to the establishment's family-friendly atmosphere. It is worth mentioning that while the menu prices are reasonable, patrons can avail themselves of discounted appetizers during happy hour, a temporal window in which said items are offered at the tantalizing price of $3 apiece.

I liked the Town Square location the one or two times I was there. But the food I got at the Tivoli location was mediocre at best. The sweet potato and chicken risotto ($16.25) was gummy and tasted like paste. The fettuccine napoli ($15.95) was better, but nothing stellar. The best thing I tried was the kid's cheese pizza. Yeah, that means the place is kid friendly. The prices are reasonable -- although from what I hear happy hour is the best time to go since apps are $3 each.

Really the only reason to eat here is because you're starving and it'll take 20 minutes plus to walk across the ginormous MGM grand to cheaper and tastier food options.. Other than that my \"gourmet\" sandwich tasted pretty awful and cost me a near fortune. Strip dining can be tough, but you'd be better off at Mickey D's...

Firstly, the positive aspects: The ambiance and adornment of this establishment are truly remarkable, boasting an expansive, historic church that exudes a captivating charm. It is, undoubtedly, a unique and enjoyable venue to visit.

Next, the somewhat disappointing aspects: While the locally brewed beverages are adequate, they are, regrettably, overpriced. We would unquestionably frequent this establishment more often and ultimately spend more if the beer prices were not so exorbitant.

Lastly, the unsatisfactory aspects: The culinary offerings. Unfortunately, we sampled only a single menu item, which proved to be deplorable. Their "homemade chips" arrived as a lackluster, cold, and soggy spiral-sliced potato dish that was both stale and saturated with grease. In short, they were inedible. The bartender maintained that they prepare them fresh daily, but our portion seemed to have been sitting in its own cold grease for hours, rendering them unpalatable. We courteously returned them, although the bartender appeared less than thrilled, leaving us apprehensive about potential disagreements regarding payment for the remainder of our visit.

In conclusion, while this bar possesses an intriguing atmosphere, the appeal has diminished for us due to mediocre beverages at inflated prices accompanied by unimpressive cuisine.

First, the good:  The atmosphere and decor is amazing, it is a huge, beautiful old church and is just such a fun space to visit.

Next the not-quite-so-good:  The beer is okay/average for local brewery swill, but  considerably overpriced.  We'd visit a lot more often and probably end up spending more overall if the beer prices weren't so outrageous.

And finally, the not-good:  The food.  Granted we only tried one item, but it was AWFUL.  We ordered their basket of "homemade chips" and they were disgusting - cold, soggy spiral-sliced potatoes that were stale (not crispy) and congealed with grease.  Inedible.   The bartender said that they "make them fresh every day" - ours had apparently been made in the morning and had sat around in their own cold grease all day.   We politely sent them back but the bartender didn't seem very happy about it and we spend the remainder of the visit wondering if we were going to have to argue with her about paying for them (as it turned out, we were not charged). 

Final thoughts: it's a cool bar, but the novelty has worn off for us. Mediocre beer at inflated prices and terrible food.

The place is nice and the customer service is pretty good. 

I expected a lot more from the food. I got an original stash  burger. The buns taste just like store bought buns and they get soggy with everything they put in them. The beef patty was dry and had no flavor. I ended up leaving most of the soggy buns and eating everything else. The fries are pretty good though. I expected a lot more, especially from a $15+ burguer. 

Ever heard of GBurger down on socal? Now those are good burgers and for $15 you get a huge one that tastes 10+ times better

I came here for the first time they the drive thru--the popolo girl that took my order was rude. She also forgot my coconut bark, so I went in to get it. She had some attitude when I walked in and showed her my receipt. She just kept asking me if it was in the receipt. I said I just went thru the drive through and she repeated it back to me, to which she asked if it was on the receipt that I was showing her-she saw it and gave me the bark with no apologies--just attitude.

I really liked this place the first time I came here, but this past visit made me terrified to come back. I told my nail technician before we even started that my nails were a bit sensitive, and if she could please go as easy as she could. As she went to take the gel topcoat off, the sander clipped the top of my nail and sanded my finger. She apologized and said that someone had left it on a different setting. Wouldn't you check first before using a machine like that?? As the manicure went on and throughout, she had me pulling my hands away in slight pain. I guess I should have spoken up more, but I really just wanted to get it over with. She finally finishes, and starts doing the hand and arm massage. Then suddenly she grabs my upper arms. WHAT?! Stunned, I paid and got the Hell out of there. Today (one day after my manicure) the gel polish on my thumb has already lifted and peeled off. Some of the other nails are following suit. I've also noticed bruises on my arm from where she grabbed me! I will never return there. Ever.

We were here for a convention which was all day in this Hilton. The hotel is dated, but the pool appears updated and the conference room is small for about 200 people. I didn't think this place was spectacular and was glad to have booked the Hyatt to stay.

The deplorable quality of the customer service proffered at this establishment is utterly reprehensible. It is patently evident that the staff does not prioritize the needs and concerns of their clientele, instead treating them with an air of annoyance and inconvenience, as if their presence were an unwelcome interruption to their daily routine. Furthermore, the inventory management at this location is woefully inadequate, with a dearth of stock that renders it challenging to locate suitable items. Regrettably, the store manager, Julie, appears to be either oblivious or apathetic to the plight of her customers, failing to demonstrate any semblance of advocacy on their behalf. In light of these factors, it is unlikely that I shall ever opt to patronize this business again.

Again, breaking my rule about chains, especially a gas station, but just be careful. While the prices may be good, they're REALLY fast on the trigger finger, and will demand payment before processing any sales or discounts. Then they'll look at you like YOU'RE the one with the problem when you tell them something was on sale or had a lower marked price.\n\nIt picks up a whole star for convenience when it's right next to my work.

"It has been a duration of thirty days since we adopted our diminutive female canine companion. She has successfully overcome the challenges posed by roundworms and giardiasis. Currently, she tips the scales at eleven pounds, at twelve weeks of age, and is displaying a propensity towards continuous growth. I did eventually acquire all necessary documentation from the rescue organization on January 3rd, including an agreement, a gift of insurance, and a divergent vaccination record. However, upon submitting a claim to the insurance provider, it became apparent that coverage would be limited to solely include the components pertaining to the actual maladies she had afflicted her. Thus, we have opted to initiate the vaccination process anew. Our juvenile canine companion has two additional rounds of vaccinations remaining. Approximately six weeks hence, she shall receive her rabies inoculation, subsequent to which we shall arrange for her to be spayed. Furthermore, we intend to have her microchipped, for which purpose Moondooggies has graciously offered to locate a regional rescue organization to fulfill the task. I am currently awaiting their response. 

Pesce exhibits a cheerful demeanor and a delightful temperament, which has endeared her to our family, including our offspring and our other canine companion. She has seamlessly integrated into our household and has become a cherished addition. 

Although certain aspects of the initial stages of her adoption proved distressing, ultimately, we are profoundly gratified to have welcomed this youthful female canine into our lives and are committed to providing her with a prolonged and joyous existence."

This marked my maiden encounter with the conveyor belt variety of sushi, and regrettably, the culinary experience proved to be a profound disappointment, characterized by an unfortunate lack of gastronomic excellence and an utter dearth of flavorful sensations. Furthermore, the prices, while admittedly affordable, seemed to be inversely proportional to the quality of the fare, ultimately contributing to an overall sense of dissatisfaction and disillusionment with the establishment's offerings.
this was my first experience with the conveyor belt type sushi. The sushi was not good at all. poor quality and tasteless. prices were very cheap which is probably why it was not tasty...

Doesn't hurt to get your car washed here.  Gas is pretty well priced too, usually a few cents more than Costco.  Car wash prices are OK for the service you get, but still what I consider, not cheap.  Had to take off two stars for \"Danny's Glass\" which is at that same location.  DO NOT have your glass fixed here.  I had a small CLEAR chip on my windshield..  They offered to fill it for $40.  I should have stopped them when they took the drill out.  Now I have a an opaque drill hole, and a clear chip and a larger divot than before.  I complained to the manager and he told me to call corporate offices for a refund.  How annoying.

I read a bunch of these reviews prior to going here and thought I'd give it a try. I ordered the green curry. I wasn't asked how spicy I wanted it, so I had to tell him. No biggie. He dropped our food off and didn't come back for quite some time. I had to do the ole \"wave your hand in the air\" to get his attention (something I'm normally opposed to doing). The curry was awfully bland, almost like they it dumbed it down for the South Side crowd. I asked for more curry powder, but he told me they only use curry paste and walked away. I suppose that was his way of saying I don't get any...\nI guess what i'm trying to say is that this place would be good for a person that doesn't like Thai food. Nothing too authentic, flavorful.

Seriously unimpressed. Ordered delivery from here last night. Lots of food, but not much flavor. I had orange chicken.. One slice of orange in the whole order and not much orange flavor (or any other either). Hubby had Szechuan Chicken. It had a very strong onion flavor - but not much other flavor. We also ordered Pot Stickers. They were big, but again - not very flavorful.\n\nAll in all, not worth the wait or the money. I guess it would do in a pinch, but not if I had any other options.

So what is so great about this place. It is located in the middle of the Palazzo and has no atmosphere. We went for happy hour and got a $3 glass of their private label wine (It tastes like Rutherford groove which goes for $5 a bottle WS) 

Their overpriced wine/spirits flights ($20-$40 a flight) are half price during happy hour, so happy hour makes the price for the flights not too laughable. 

I can see people stopping to get off their feet and have a drink, but I would not call this place a wine bar. It is just the seating area for the adjacent overpriced wine shop.

The egg roll wasn't too bad but the house special chicken just seemed a little off and dry.  Also the fried rice had quite a few of those hard crunchy grains of rice and burnt eggs.  The service was incredibly fast for take-out so I would definitely go again, just maybe order something with beef or pork.  The prices are pretty hard to beat, $16 for two dinner combos!

"The concatenation of culinary delights offered by Cheesecake Factory is indeed impressive, boasting an extensive menu that caters to diverse tastes and dietary preferences. Moreover, the establishment takes pride in its spacious ambiance, creating an inviting atmosphere for patrons to indulge in their gastronomic desires. However, the quality of service at this particular location (Green Valley) can be somewhat unpredictable, oscillating between exceptional and subpar experiences. Therefore, if seeking a more consistent dining experience in the vicinity, it may be wise to consider alternatives such as Elephant Bar or PF Chang's. It is worth noting that while some servers at this location have demonstrated exceptional proficiency and dedication, others have appeared less than enthused to be present, which can detract from the overall satisfaction of a meal costing nearly $100 for a family."

We opted to partake in a midday repast at this all-you-can-eat establishment today, primarily due to the copious amount of laudatory remarks that numerous patrons have bestowed upon it; however, our culinary experience fell short of our expectations. We paid a sum of $79.99 for two individuals, and in retrospect, it would have been more judicious to allocate such funds towards dining at an upscale eatery instead.

The variety of comestibles available was rather limited, and as ardent devotees of seafood, we were dismayed by the absence of any notable aquatic delicacies. Moreover, the trio of sushi options did not entice us to indulge, as their visual appearance failed to convey a sense of freshness. The majority of the edibles we consumed were devoid of flavor, and the assortment of confectionaries did not prove to be particularly palatable either. Frankly, we find it challenging to comprehend the rationale behind the effusive praise lavished upon this establishment by certain patrons. Perhaps our gastronomic standards are simply more refined than those of others. In any case, we would not advocate for visiting this venue.

We chose to have lunch at this buffet today because of the great reviews everyone is leaving here, however we were disappointed. We paid $79.99 for 2 and I wish we spent it at the nice restaurant.

Food selection was very small. I love seafood and there was nothing of that sort. Just 3 types of sushi which I didn't risk eating as it didn't look fresh. Most of the food we ended up eating was really tasteless. Desserts were not tasteful either. I just don't understand what people are raving about. Maybe we just have high standards.
Would not recommend this place.

I really wasn't impressed. Over crowded. Servers are slow. Food bins were either empty or restocked with stuff other then what was posted. Mongolian BBQ - had great flavor, but the meat has bones in it, YUCK. Italian & Mexican were OK. The BBQ ribs about a B-. Just real average buffet. Not worth my time to return, when better buffets can be found closer to home.

I reside approximately six blocks distant from this establishment, and I must admit that I had not been cognizant of its existence until now, despite traversing the surrounding area on multiple occasions via automobile. It appears to be minuscule, obscure, and secluded, blending in with the adjacent structures almost imperceptibly. Upon entering, one cannot help but notice the diminutive size of the interior, which is further exacerbated by the lack of illumination. The proprietors, however, are quite affable and hospitable, although their efforts to create an inviting ambiance are somewhat impeded by the cramped dimensions of the venue. Notwithstanding, the wine selection is rather restricted, which may deter certain oenophiles from frequenting this locale. Furthermore, the late hours of operation, while potentially appealing to some individuals, do not particularly resonate with my own preferences. In conclusion, while there are no glaring deficiencies or shortcomings that would dissuade potential patrons from visiting, neither are there any exceptional attributes that would compel me to return.

I live around 6 blocks away & have never noticed! even driving by you will likely miss it: very tucked away, tiny & hidden.  Small & dark inside, little 'patio' sandwiched btwn 2 buildings.  Very limited wine choices. Seems to be a big draw with regards to staying open till 2am? (I must be old, not a selling point 4 me).  Staff & Owner very nice, but sorry, just no atmosphere happening here to entice me back?  All & all, no particular cons, nor any pros to rant nor rave about here.... sigh....

My brother recommend this place when he was in Vegas for his friend's wedding. He told me how much he love their chicken wings. So I gave this place a chance to see what's it about. It's pretty much like an Asian fusion place or more of a Korean spot. They have karaoke private stations in the back and a bar. When we went there it was really dead. We were their only customers. But the ambiance is cool. We ordered some fried pork cutlets, Korean bbq, sweet potato fries, shrimp tempura, watermelon soju, and of course their wings since it's the most popular there. But I've had better and cheaper of all of those food. Now, let's talk about their wings. They have I think 3 different flavors for the wings and we tried them all. The wings are chunky pieces. It's not like wingstop or buffalo wild wings size wings. But as far as taste goes, it's alright. Didn't really like it actually.. And as far as the service/staff, they were really nice and on point. But I'm not sure if that's really how it went down or if it's because they didn't have any other customers to pay attention to but us. I don't think I'd ever come back here unless I decide to give this place one more chance but I don't think I will.

Ordered a banana nut muffin, received a blueberry muffin. When I spoke with the manager, she rudely asked me if I wanted blue berry or banana, when clearly I'm returning to exchange the blue berry muffin. 

Food was decent, just poor attitude/service when confronted about the issue of an error on their part.

Probably would not come back to this specific location.

I am thoroughly perplexed as to why I ever had the inclination to visit this establishment in the first place. I opted to dine at this restaurant during the luncheon hour on a weekday, primarily due to an intense yearning for a plate of fluffy pancakes. Upon entering the premises, I observed that the atmosphere was predominantly devoid of patrons; yet, the level of service I received failed to meet even the most basic expectations. After being seated at a table, I waited an extensive period of time before a server finally acknowledged my presence and took my order. The culinary offerings that were presented to me were merely adequate, which led me to question how such a renowned establishment could possibly falter in their execution of such a straightforward dish. Throughout the duration of my meal, I did not receive any subsequent visits from my server, nor did I receive any inquiry regarding the quality of the food or any offers for additional assistance. In fact, I was compelled to request a glass of water numerous times before it was eventually brought to me, coinciding with the presentation of the bill. Based on my underwhelming experience, I would strongly advise against patronizing this establishment.

"One star for the delectable chicken strips and fries accompanied by a creamy homemade ranch dressing, and an additional star for the hospitable service rendered by the affable delivery person. However, the pizza crust possessed an unpleasant texture reminiscent of stale leftover matzah, which was unfortunate. Furthermore, the peculiar cutting style, involving small squares, made it challenging to consume without creating a mess. My craving for a scrumptious pizza pie, conventionally cut into slices, remained unsatisfied. Unfortunately, I squandered $28 on a medium-sized pie and chicken strips."

One star for the decent chicken strips and fries with homemade ranch dressing, and one for the service cause the delivery guy was nice. However, the pizza crust tasted like stale leftover matzah. Then they cut it into little squares and you couldn't pick a piece up without making a mess. All I want is a good pizza pie and cut normal into slices! I just wasted $28 on a med pie and chx strips.

Service was slow, even though the place wasn't that crowded for a  late Friday evening. We ordered drinks, chips and salsa, and Fundido.  We received the drinks. Waited longer that average. The Fundido appears, but not the chips and salsa or silverware. ...And we wait. We were finally able to flag down a waitress (not ours) and request napkins and silverware. Scurring, our waitress walked pass and we were able to inquired about the chips and salsa and placed our dinner order. The waitress (in no rush) eventually brought the salsa to the table, but no chips...WTH (duh!)  Drinks were great! Food was delicious! Service suck!!!

"The eatery's exorbitant prices are incongruous with the quality of its culinary offerings and ambiance, rendering it a mediocre dining experience. Our visit on the final evening of the Dining Out Charlotte promotion, during which we partook in the $30 dinner special, serves as a case in point. In the company of two other couples, we opted to bring our own vinous beverages, yet the total cost still amounted to a whopping $100 per pair. Furthermore, the Ragout dish, which all three of my fellow diners selected, proved to be a gastronomic misadventure, leaving them feeling unwell for an extended period. A plethora of superior establishments in Charlotte offer a more satisfying dining experience at a comparable price point. Noteworthily, the manager's absence from our table during a time of sparse patronage due to inclement weather raises questions regarding the restaurant's concern for its patrons' satisfaction."

Harrah's does have a prime smack dab in the middle of the strip, walk out and get mobbed by people location, I'll give em that.
They've also held their own and stayed upto par with the Casinos spending Millions on remodeling and keeping current.
Harrah's did nothing of that sort, they know their location is enough to keep them up there as one of the must visit places.
Me, I think Harrah's sucks.
It's old and musty and seemingly in exactly the location where all the drunk kids stumble around outside.
The carpets are stained, the ceilings are low, not very inviting.
Both places I tried to eat at, Gorden Ramsey and KGB pissed me off so...sorry Harrah's i won't even bother walking through next time.

BEWARE! This place adds 15% tip WITHOUT telling you! So for the late night gamblers high on drinks, they are very much likely to add their own 15% tip in the "tip" line!! Unless they were like me, after leaving tip, went back to check the bill and found out the waiter already sneaked in the tip, yet still left the "tip" line empty for you to add and sign!

And i would left double tip had i been serviced well... BUT at this place you had to get up and get your own side dish! Yup, i wouldnt even want to leave 15% if i serviced myself half of the time!

Food was okay, there were two flies flying around in the restaurant.. Burger King is cleaner.

People sometimes say that this is the best buffet in town... *rude game-show buzzer*... wrong. Not too shabby, but really nothing to write home about. I was totally bugged when we went here during their transition (remodeling) phase and they seated us in a storage room with a makeshift food line and stainless steel spoons provided to use as serving utensils - they were so hot, no one could even hold onto them. I promise, the next time a place like this (upscale buffet) tries to pull something like that, I'm going to demand my money back. I don't like to be disrespected like that. Close down if you're going to compromise class... and safety, too... I burned my freaking fingers!
This Casino is old. I really needs a remodel. It is connected to the Tram which you will have to walk to Aria *kind of a long walk* and then from Aria there is a tram to Vdara and Bellagio.

Costumer service was slow. Took 15 minutes to get our waitress and 15 minutes for our drinks to come.

South west wrap, my sister like her wrap, but needs a hint of spice, she said.

Banana bread french toast, grandma said it was so sweet. The sauce was drenched when she got it. Definitely no need syrup for these bad boys. She liked her bowl of fruit better.

Veggie Omlette with potatoes. VEGGIE, yeah. No veggies. More of cheese and egg whites. didn't finish it. It was too bland, but tapitio and ketchup made it better.  Haha.. my potato was over cooked and had so much season on it. My whole wheat bread tasted old and stale. Im over all disappointed.. shrugs..

Just because a restaurant has white tablecloths does not mean it has good food but reviewers of Flemings must be so impressed with the tablecloths that they overlooked the taste of food.  Worse restaurant I've been to in a while, and that includes the food I am forced to eat at the airport.   I had  fish, that tasted institutional - something off high school cafeteria menu. It was an insult to the sea.  The service was good, which is why this place got two stars and not one.

"I fail to comprehend the appeal of this establishment, particularly given my dietary preferences, which tend towards vegetarian options that are rich in nutrients and promote optimal health; indeed, upon perusing the menu, I find that there is little to nothing that caters to my culinary inclinations. Furthermore, my recent visit with my offspring served only to reinforce my ambivalence towards this eatery, as the chocolate brownie pie we ordered took an unacceptable duration of 15 minutes to prepare, and failed to impress the palates of any of my three progeny."

Coming from Texas, I am extremely familiar with great mexican cuisine. Tex-mex has been a longtime favorite since the day I first had unlimited red and green sauce. That being said, my expectations may have been too high coming here. 

- The atmosphere was great. The decor made the place really come alive (very similar to many restaurants in Charlotte). You feel like you are in Mexico.

- Sauce is solid, honestly nothing to rave about but it gets the job done.

- The entree's are just really bland. 
1) My cousins enchiladas came out cold
2) My enchiladas were just bland
3) Nobody on our table (10+ people) came close to eating their food because it just lacked flavor. 

Honestly, I wouldn't come back here unless someone really wanted to go here and I had no choice. The positive is the staff is friendly and the place is nice.

I had an ardent desire to cherish this establishment, to partake in a delectable breakfast on a daily basis during my sojourn. However, my experience was marred by subpar service, precluding me from returning. Furthermore, the culinary offerings were not particularly impressive. Notwithstanding, the ambiance was a tranquil respite from the cacophony of the strip, enveloped in an air of elegance. Unfortunately, I was subjected to discourteous treatment by the server, which seemed to be predicated upon my sartorial choices, despite my attire being a suit and not sleepwear. My gastronomical selection was the corned beef hash, whose flavor was satisfactory, yet its texture left much to be desired, bordering on an unrecognizable consistency due to its excessive granulation. The aforementioned service was a source of immense vexation, with an interminable wait for my check that approached the 20-minute mark after requesting it. Although I am willing to accord Verandah another opportunity for a morning repast based on the plethora of laudatory reviews, it shall not be in the near future.

I wanted to love this place. I wanted to eat breakfast here each day of my trip. But my service was SO bad, that I couldn't return. And the food wasn't anything to write home about. The atmosphere is so nice.. a beautiful escape from the noise of the strip. I don't know if I didn't look rich enough to be dining here.. but that is how the server treated me.. and I was wearing a suit, not pajamas! I ordered the corned beef hash and the flavor was good but the texture was not. It was ground up so much that I don't think it could have been considered a hash. The service was just such a frustrating experience.. I actually think I waited for my check for almost 20 minutes after asking. I would be willing to give Verandah another chance for breakfast because of all the amazing reviews.. but not anytime soon.

The service today really was disappointing and slow.  They only had one person that worked the cash register in the whole place and she was also restocking which took away from her register duties.  It took several mins just to get an acknowledgement and several more to place an order.  Funny thing I was the only person in line.  Normally, we never have any issues with this location.

Had dinner with a party of 6.  Service was spectacular!  Wine suggestions were exactly what we were looking for.  Salad was very simple and plain with no \"wow\" factor.  I'm a nice Italian girl so I figured I would order spaghetti bolognese.  This was highly suggested as the server stated the pasta was house made.  When it came out it reminded me of lunch room spaghetti.  The noodles were tasteless and too thick.  The sauce was ground beef and tomatoes.  I passed on dessert but the complimentary biscotti was a sweet little touch...\nI won't visit again...

"Although numerous indigenous individuals appear to hold Paradise Cantina in high esteem, I must confess that my experience there was somewhat underwhelming. In the company of a group of acquaintances on a Friday evening, we visited the eatery, which exuded a merry, unpretentious ambiance reminiscent of a dive bar. Unfortunately, the culinary offerings did not quite live up to our expectations, as the chicken tacos I ordered were rather lackluster in terms of flavor, with the chicken being overcooked and dry, and the tortilla itself was also somewhat unimpressive. However, the happy hour promotion, which entailed purchasing one beverage and receiving a second gratis, was indeed quite appealing and an excellent way to initiate a festive evening, though perhaps not the most suitable choice for a primary destination."

"I shall endeavor to articulate my thoughts succinctly and without equivocation. My assessment of the establishment in question is twofold, comprising both positive and negative aspects. To begin with, there are numerous superior dining options available within this price bracket, with SW being a prime example. Furthermore, the cost of the cuisine is, in my opinion, excessive relative to its quality. In addition, the seating arrangements were less than ideal, as the couches adorning the walls were noticeably worn and the tables were positioned at an uncomfortable height. It was necessary to request relocation. Moreover, the busser appeared to assume responsibilities customarily assigned to servers, while the server failed to demonstrate the standard courtesies extended to patrons, such as introducing themselves and welcoming guests. Furthermore, the hostess was compelled to take our dessert order due to the absence of our server, which proved particularly vexing. An additional grievance was the presentation of my scotch with cocktail ice, which I deemed wholly unsatisfactory for a beverage priced at $22. On a more favorable note, the ambiance was pleasing, with tasteful lighting and decor. Additionally, complimentary appetizers in the form of French fries were provided, which were of satisfactory quality. The hostesses displayed commendable accommodation, and the selection of beer and wine was impressive."

I'll make this to the point

the bad:
1. There are much better restaurants in this price range, SW being one.
2. The food is overpriced for what you get.
3. Don't sit on the couches on the wall, they're way over used. The table was at my chest and had to ask to be moved.
4. The busser did the server's job, besides take orders.
5. The server didn't introduce herself nor welcome us to the restaurant (not being picky, but many patrons expect this when you're paying $130 per person.)
6. The hostess had to take our dessert order because the waitress was nowhere to be found, which is extremely irritating.
7. I had to send back the scotch I wanted because they gave it to me with cocktail ice. This is completely unacceptable for a $22 scotch.

The good:
1. The decor was very nice and not too bright or dark.
2. They give out free appetizers, french fries, which are pretty good.
3. The hostesses are very accommodating.
4. Decent beers and excellent wines.

The facilities were VERY VERY NICE. Extremely well kept, smelled great, area for children and it came with free stuff! Lots of free formula stuff. Which is cool. 

She wasn't a terrible person. But to say she is the nicest woman I've ever met would be an understatement. We wanted it to be a surprise for us and she kind of made it seem like an outlandish request because a previous customer complained to her. I felt a little weird because having a gender surprise these days seems to be like it would be pretty normal IMO. 

Prices were good, although the "potty shot" was extremely unclear. With that said, I do believe in her determination. She is experienced and surely saw the parts she said. However, the picture was not a classic shot and is very very unclear.

Update: after posting my last review I was offered a free meal and a refund on the over charge. A wonderful gesture. We happily enjoyed the meal with much better service then. However, we were never given the refund. I had multiple emails saying they would refund it that night but nothing ever happened. It seems like that experience perfectly sums up Via Brasil, trying but falls short.

"Indulged in an open-faced turkey sandwich that unfortunately did not live up to my gastronomical expectations. The utilization of sliced deli turkey, which did not possess the quality one would hope for, was coupled with a salty, canned brown gravy that failed to enhance the flavor profile of the dish. Even the accompanying mashed potatoes, which lacked both texture and taste, were unable to redeem the meal from its overall mediocrity.
