However, upon experiencing the gastronomic delights offered by Five Guys, I now comprehend the disparity in quality and am willing to compensate the additional expense for a superior dining experience, specifically Culver's signature Butter Burger. In conclusion, Culver's surpasses its fast food competitors in Surprise, Arizona, in terms of culinary excellence and value, rendering any previous misgivings regarding price utterly irrelevant. The restaurant's shakes are also noteworthy for their rich, creamy texture and delightful flavors, while their burgers and fries are cooked to perfection, further solidifying Culver's status as a premier dining destination. It is worth mentioning that the cheese curds remain the undisputed highlight of the menu, warranting repeated visits and enthusiastic endorsements.

My wife and I came to this restaurant on a Friday night. The weather was beautiful so we decided to sit outside. The outside area was a little crowded. You can tell they try to fit as many tables and people in their patio as they can but it didn't bother us at all.  They also have an English menu which what was good, since we don't know any French. 

This restaurant has a huge selection of different pizzas. They also have a huge selection of toppings. It can be a little overwhelming when deciding what to order. It took us a while to decide what we wanted. 

So we finally decided and we ordered our pizza. We sat and talk for a while and enjoyed the nice weather. The pizza arrived pretty quickly and it was great. The crust was perfect. We had so many toppings on our pizza that we had to eat it with a fork and knife. I would've gave this restaurant 5 stars, but it only gets 4 because the service could have been better. I had to flag the waiter down on numerous occasion just to get more water. With that said, I definitely would go back to this place the next time i'm in Montreal.

"I have been indulging in the luxury of bringing esteemed individuals to this exquisite establishment for a quarter of a century, relishing in the ambiance and delectable cuisine that has consistently impressed my guests, whether it be for commemorating momentous occasions, bidding farewell to respected educators, or simply treating out-of-town visitors to an unforgettable Sunday repast."

I love Grand Lux Cafe!!

This location is not quite as good as the Venetian location, but its just as nice.  Great servers, the place is nice & big & clean. Always a pleasure to eat here. 

Major Recommendations:
Molten Chocolate Cake. Seriously tastes as delicious as it sounds. I would go here just for this. Must order probably around when you get your first entree or appetizer, depending on how fast you eat, because it takes about 20 minute to prepare.

This evaluation pertains solely to the lodging facilities. The accommodations were remarkably luxurious, given the cost. They were spotless and contemporary, with a bed that was also incredibly comfortableâsuperb pillows. The shower was the epitome of perfectionâa convenient shelf, adequate illumination, and excellent water pressure. Additionally, there was a beautiful lit makeup mirror that rotated, allowing those who prefer to shave in the shower to do so with ease. The rooms were peaceful, and the ventilation was outstanding. These are the essential elements that a hotel room should be assessed on.

The staff members appeared friendly and cooperative, willing to oblige whenever feasible. However, their room service meals were slightly inconsistent, which prevented them from attaining a perfect five-star rating. The location's reputation precedes it; thankfully, it is not situated on the strip.

Love this place. I initially found it via the Phoenix LocalDines website and since then it's been the go-to date night restaurant for for my wife and I. We've only ever ordered from the dinner menu, so I can't testify to the quality of anything but the items they offer in the evening. However, we've never been disappointed and the variety keeps us coming back to try new things. \n\nTry the Blue Corn Enchiladas and Chimi with sour cream green chile sauce. And definitely order the Guacammus and Waffle Fries for appetizers... you won't be disappointed!

I think this place gets a bad rap. Sure, it might not have the same charm as Wrigley Field, but the seats are comfortable, the weather will never ruin the game, they use real grass on the field, and the layout is just designed so much better than any old ballpark. You never have to walk very far for a hot dog or a toilet.\n\nAlso, let's not kid ourselves about the Suns. In the last 10 years, the Diamondbacks have been the local major sports team with the best chance of winning a championship in any given year.

Mystery Castle is pretty dang weird.  You get a lot of the vibe just by looking online, but it's definitely interesting to see in person.  The guy who built it used a lot of cheap, recycled items.  I was most fascinated by the burned bricks, they were super cool!  The two guys working were so incredibly nice and enthusiastic during the tour.  It's cash only, and I thought it was worth the price. However, it really seemed like the creator was a d-bag.  When you read the synopsis, he built a real castle for his daughter - who he had abandoned 15 years before.  Sure, it sounds like he had some redeeming moments when he contacted his wife and kid that he had left without a word and passed on his money to them after he finally kicked it, but the guy had an elaborate bar with a \"wishing well\" (which was pretty clever) so people could order their drinks downstairs and have them brought upstairs, because he hosted a lot of parties.  Just, you know, without his wife and kid.  It would have been nice to go on the tour when Mary Lou was still around, because she's the one I actually find interesting in the family.  Cool experience, but the thing my husband & I talked about most afterwards was the dad who left his daughter when she was 4 years old and thought about her from afar.

The text is: Mystery Castle is pretty dang weird.  You get a lot of the vibe just by looking online, but it's definitely interesting to see in person.  The guy who built it used a lot of cheap, recycled items.  I was most fascinated by the burned bricks, they were super cool!  The two guys working were so incredibly nice and enthusiastic during the tour.  It's cash only, and I thought it was worth the price. However, it really seemed like the creator was a d-bag.  When you read the synopsis, he built a real castle for his daughter - who he had abandoned 15 years before.  Sure, it sounds like he had some redeeming moments when he contacted his wife and kid that he had left without a word and passed on his money to them after he finally kicked it, but the guy had an elaborate bar with a \"wishing well\" (which was pretty clever) so people could order their drinks downstairs and have them brought upstairs, because he hosted a lot of parties.  Just, you know, without his wife and kid.  It would have been nice to go on the tour when Mary Lou was still around, because she's the one I actually find interesting in the family.  Cool experience, but the thing my husband & I talked about most afterwards was the dad who left his daughter when she was 4 years old and thought about her from afar.

The modified text is:

Enigmatic Mystery Castle presents an unconventional and captivating ambiance, which can be perceived through both virtual and physical means. The resourceful builder, who opted for a plethora of economical and recycled materials, has crafted a structure that exudes an air of peculiarity. My fascination with the charred bricks, in particular, was piqued during the tour, as they boasted an undeniable allure. The two gentlemen conducting the tour radiated warmth and fervor, making the experience even more enjoyable. Although cash payment was the sole option, I deemed it a worthy investment. Notwithstanding, the castle's creator appeared to possess a questionable character, as evidenced by his abandonment of his four-year-old daughter and subsequent lack of involvement in her life. Despite occasional displays of compassion towards his family, he prioritized hosting numerous social gatherings, complete with an innovative \"wishing well\" bar feature. Unfortunately, these events took place sans his spouse and offspring. A tantalizing experience, yet the most discussed aspect post-tour revolved around the father's decision to desert his daughter at such a tender age and his subsequent remorse.

I would give them a 5, but there's the one thing - I'll bring that up later.\nFirst of all, they gave us WAY too much food for our dollar. Not complaining, but man, a lot of food. The carnitas were the best we've had in a very, very long time. The carnitas were crisp in places, spiced just right, with a perfect texture. Last time I had carnitas that good was about 8 years ago in Mexico. The tortilla was so hot and fresh. That, alone, would warrant 5 stars. The service was friendly and fast. And, they're open 24 hours. These guys are walking distance from my hotel. Perfect!\nMy one and only complaint is that the taco shell of my taco was overcooked and too hard. But, everything, everything else was perfecto!

"My spouse and I have frequented Minecci's on multiple occasions. Although we have not indulged in their pasta dishes, the items we have ordered have been palatable. Specifically, our preference is for the lightly battered cod, which is adorned with marinara sauce and a few kalamata olives. While the breading could be omitted, the dish remains flavorful. The soup has consistently been of high quality, while the salads, though unremarkable, are still adequate. However, my sole criticism of their culinary offerings pertains to the veal parmigiana. I found it to be somewhat lacking in quality, particularly given the price point, and surmised that this was due to the utilization of ground meat rather than a filet. \n\nThe ambiance of Minecci's can be described as nostalgic and subdued, yet it exudes a certain charm reminiscent of a quaint family eatery. The dÃ©cor, though not lavish, appears well-maintained. This establishment may not be suitable for a sophisticated urban dweller's evening out, but it serves as a cozy setting for a casual date or intimate family gathering."

"Goodness gracious! This establishment boasts an abundance of merchandise and an extensive array of options, rendering it a veritable shopper's paradise. My goodness, had I not already indulged in a spree at the outlet stores, I would have undoubtedly acquired an impressive quantity of attire from this very location. The selection available for the fairer sex is truly staggering, and the offerings in San Francisco pale in comparison. Alas, the atmosphere within these walls is rather chaotic and clamorous, with a considerable throng of patrons contributing to the din. Furthermore, I must express my dissatisfaction with the policy adopted by one of the cashiers, who opted to accept solely credit or debit cards, thereby occasioning a delay for those individuals opting to tender cash payment. Lastly, it is worth noting that instead of utilizing traditional shopping carts, this store employs pulling baskets, which, in my opinion, adds an additional layer of complexity to the shopping experience. My sympathies extend to the unfortunate soul tasked with tidying up the premises at the conclusion of the day, as the prospect of confronting such disarray can be overwhelming, to say the least."

"I have had the pleasure of partaking in culinary indulgences at this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say that the gastronomical experiences have been nothing short of exceptional. It is my belief that the restaurant is indeed a family-owned enterprise, as evidenced by the diverse array of dishes and the dedication of the staff. The menu boasts an innovative fusion of Italian and American cuisine, offering an extensive selection of prime rib, pork, seafood, and a delectable caesar salad, all of which are executed with equal finesse. My personal inclination is to opt for the Italian options, primarily due to the fact that it is the primary draw for my visits. However, I must commend the linguine with king crab and crispy leeks, which are complemented by a sublime lemon butter sauce. My spouse, on the other hand, takes great delight in the traditional spaghetti and Kobe meatballs. The service is impeccable, and the ambiance is further enhanced by a stunning decor. Additionally, the restaurant takes pride in an impressive wine list, as well as an assortment of expertly crafted cocktails. In conclusion, this eatery exudes an undeniable allure, making it a sophisticated and desirable destination for epicureans."

"Upon perusing culinary establishments within the vicinity, we chanced upon KJ kitchen, which was highly recommended by a fellow Yelp member. Subsequently, we decided to partake in their gastronomical offerings for the first time. Our dining experience was truly exceptional, as the delectable fare served was of unparalleled quality. Specifically, we sampled the Pork Belly, Oxtail complemented by a rich red wine reduction, and a Pork Chop prepared in the Cantonese manner. Notably, each dish was expertly prepared and presented, leaving us utterly satiated. Additionally, the complimentary soup and dessert were also thoroughly enjoyed. Although the restaurant was bustling with patrons upon our arrival at approximately 7:30 pm, resulting in a brief delay in the serving of our meals, our satisfaction with the edibles remained undiminished. In fact, we are eager to revisit this esteemed eatery, albeit either prior to the peak dinner hour or subsequent to it, in order to avoid an overwhelming throng of diners."

walking through the airport on way to gate. Thinking about the nasty food I'll likely eat when I reach it. Pass by Blanco. Angels singing with ray of light. I've been to the location in the Tucson hills. Its consistently great food. What a nice surprise in an otherwise awful food environment. Way to go Phoenix airport. Fish tacos were a solid choice.

"The individuals who constituted the patient population within the confines of the medical establishment in question displayed an exceptionally hospitable demeanor towards us, particularly a certain registered nurse assigned to the cardiac department who exhibited an extraordinary level of congeniality and accommodating behavior, thereby significantly mitigating the inherent stress associated with being hospitalized. However, it is worth noting that certain aspects of the physical infrastructure did not quite meet our expectations, specifically the creaking hinges on the bathroom door, which produced an unsettling noise throughout the night, and the water faucet, which exhibited a discernible tremor upon activation, ostensibly due to an airlock in the plumbing system. Be that as it may, both my spouse and I have had occasion to seek medical attention at John C. Lincoln, and we have faith in their ability to provide quality care when needed."

"We had an exceptionally satisfactory experience collaborating with this enterprise, whose prices were remarkably reasonable and affordable. Their extensive inventory presented us with a diverse array of options, to the point where it became somewhat challenging to make a decision. However, we were ultimately able to select materials that met our needs and preferences, and the results were truly impressive. The quality of their wood laminate flooring and new baseboards was evident in the finished product, which exceeded our expectations. Furthermore, we appreciated the integrity and honesty of the people we worked with, which fostered a positive and trustworthy relationship. Consequently, we are eager to continue our partnership with this company when we undertake future renovation projects, particularly the upgrading of our upstairs living spaces."

"Mesa's culinary offerings surpassed my expectations, boasting an impressive array of delectable dishes that catered to my palate's discerning inclinations. The ribeye, in particular, showcased a remarkable depth of flavor, while the jalapeno cornbread exhibited a delightful synergy of spicy and savory elements. Furthermore, the establishment's spacious interior and welcoming ambiance made it an ideal setting for larger gatherings, which we took advantage of during Restaurant Week by indulging in their exceptional three-course prix fixe special for a mere $56 per person."

I have been here since I was a kid. The thai food is F A B U L O U S! The only problem is that they really should waive the extra rice fee of $2.50 if you have four or more people. But other than that, this is the BEST thai food in Las Vegas and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that wants to try something new or any good thai restaurant.

"The experience was satisfactory, with a range of alternatives available for selection. Its geographical position was advantageous, facilitating ease of access. However, our expectations were not exceedingly elevated."

The bartender is amazing.  The entrees are amazing.  What I did not like was being charged $15 for sashimi that was have the portion and double the price of my local sushi restaurant for quality that was half the quality.  If i am going to be charged that price for sashimi I expect to have the finest fish available.  This was not the case.  The lamb belly is out of this world.  I had the rabbit dish another night, but wish I would have had the rabbit first and the lamb second as nothing compares to the lamb.

"We opted to partake in an early evening repast on a Monday, as our offspring were experiencing hunger pangs and were cognizant of the fact that certain establishments offer complimentary nourishment for juveniles on this specific day of the week. Upon arriving at the venue, we were greeted by hostesses who appeared to be engaged in leisurely conversation, leading us to harbor apprehensions regarding the quality of service we would receive, based on previous experiences and reviews. However, we were seated in a timely manner, and our server materialized within a span of two minutes to take our beverage orders. Throughout the meal, the service we received was indeed satisfactory, as our server struck a balance between attentive and unobtrusive, ensuring that our needs were met without being overly intrusive. A male individual, dressed in plain attire, approached our table and enquired about the quality of our dining experience, to which we responded affirmatively. Subsequently, he surreptitiously approached me from behind and removed my empty cup, inquiring whether my server was providing me with an additional beverage. I replied in the negative, and it is worth mentioning that, while we assumed him to be a manager, a introduction or visible identification would have been appreciated. Notwithstanding, the culinary offerings were palatable, and the service generally efficient. It is also worth noting that a prolonged period of time, extending from 11 am to 7 pm, Monday through Friday, is designated as 'happy hour' at this establishment."

"It is comprehensible how an individual can harbor animosity towards this establishment, primarily due to the extensive queue that encircles the premises. The similarity between this scene and the Indiana Jones attraction at Disneyland is uncanny. Fortunately, I possessed a Fast Pass, which enabled me to bypass the line, thereby avoiding an excruciating wait. My acquaintances informed me that certain patrons had been waiting since 10 pm and had only recently reached the front of the line. The prospect of enduring such a lengthy delay was unsettling, to say the least. Upon entering this venue, my inner demon became apparent, albeit metaphorically. The ambiance of this establishment has a peculiar effect on one's psyche, prompting a carefree and whimsical demeanor. Although I typically find house music to be irksome, there was something peculiar about this setting that compelled me to engage in frivolous behavior, characterized by an uncontainable desire to leap up and down. The vast dimensions of this space enable it to accommodate a sizable crowd, comprising individuals who share a common objective: to partake in enjoyable activities. The evening concluded in the early hours of the morning, with my feet experiencing exhaustion to the point of near-crippling discomfort. Nonetheless, I must express my gratitude towards XS for the exceptional treatment I received."

I have nothing but great things to say about the Mac Shack! High quality pasta, fresh vegetables, and a friendly staff! I ordered carry out this time and even after the drive home the food still had great flavor! \n\nGreat vegetarian options!

Of all the newfangled \"FroYo\" places, this is the one I frequent the most. Of course, that is mainly due to the proximity to CenPho & their \"twitter Tuesday\" special. They have consistent flavors & toppings. I am a creature of habit, so I stick to the cookie monster with tiny little peanut butter cups. Yes, tiny PB cups, so cute! My experience has been that the price is a little higher than the competitors. However, I follow them on twitter and only go on Tuesdays now. They have a \"secret\" word that, if whispered creepily, gets you 1/2 off the price. So for two frogurts, me & the BF spend about $5. NOT TOO SHABBY.

Overall is a good place to eat. It's a tasty sandwich for a cheap price, specially considering the location.\nI had the all American sandwich which I liked but didn't loved because it had cranberries on it. My boyfriend had the cannonball and loved it.

"Matt Goss, formerly associated with Palms hotel and casino, has now transitioned to Caesar's Palace hotel, bringing his extraordinary talent and captivating stage presence to a new venue. Although I have yet to witness his performance at the latter location, I am confident that it will be equally, if not more, spectacular than his previous shows. Goss's powerful, sensual, and svelte voice, accompanied by his remarkable dancing skills and affection towards his audience, creates an unforgettable experience for those in attendance. Additionally, the inclusion of his skilled band and alluring female dancers further enhances the overall quality of the production. As a result, I find myself compelled to participate in the musical experience, singing and moving in tandem with Goss's performance. Upon receiving the opportunity, I will undoubtedly attend his show at Caesar's Palace, eager to indulge in the enthralling atmosphere once again. Indeed, the show exudes an essence of sexuality and passion, resonating deeply with the audience through its tantalizing music."

The uncertainty regarding the culinary quality of this establishment, situated within the luxurious confines of the Plaza hotel, was palpable, yet the gastronomical experience yielded a pleasant surprise, as the consumables we sampled, specifically the poke bowl and the seared ahi plate, exhibited a proficiency in flavor and preparation that was gratifying, albeit, when it comes to the genre of poke, the superiority of their affiliated venue, Poke Express, located on Craig road, becomes apparent.

Wasn't sure what to expect but it was not cheesy, which I really appreciated. They are funny, a little political, and they do neat illusions.\n\nBefore the show, there's a guy on piano and one on bass. The bass player is an unassuming Penn. There's audience interaction throughout the show. Afterwards, Penn and Teller meet and greet people as they exit until every last person gets a chance for a photo or autograph, which I think is really, really nice.

Beso is situated within the luxurious Crystals shopping mall, in close proximity to the esteemed Aria resort. Upon entering the establishment, we were greeted with exceptional hospitality, as we were promptly seated and presented with an extensive wine list, followed by the rapid arrival of our orders. The prices of the entrees at Beso range from the upper $20s to $50s, and with the addition of tips and taxes, the total cost per person can reach approximately $75, provided that one desires beverages and sides.  

Our culinary excursion began with the delectable oyster shooters, which did not contain alcohol, much to our delight. Among these, the tomato gazpacho oyster shooter reigned supreme in terms of flavor and quality. For our main courses, we opted for both the tuna and salmon options, which were skillfully prepared and served in generous portions. Although sides are available for purchase, they are designed to be shared, and the wild mushroom side dish, priced at $11, was excessively large for two individuals to consume.  

Despite feeling satiated, we were intrigued by the enticing dessert menu and decided to indulge in the heavenly churros, accompanied by a rich caramel sauce and creme. To our astonishment, we managed to devour all six of these delectable treats.  

The lavatory facilities are located upstairs and can be accessed by taking an elevator and navigating through the nightclub. Additionally, Beso features an outdoor patio seating area and a cozy dining room, the latter of which is not particularly spacious but offers comfortable booths. Our table offered a picturesque view of Aria's fountain, as well as a distant perspective of New York, New York's iconic fake Empire State Building, providing a sense of familiarity and comfort, reminiscent of dining at the renowned Zylo Steakhouse within the W hotel.

I always have a great time. 

Huzzah !

If you love the sun and happy people then this is the place for you.

The price to enter is a little spendy but for a full day of fun and people watching it is worth it. I suggest this festival and all it has to offer.

"Wow! My acquaintance, a local in Las Vegas, recommended this venue and offered to transport me there complimentary via shuttle from the strip, primarily due to the unpleasantness of driving on the strip. Upon arrival, I was pleasantly surprised by the interior design, which exuded a distinct western ambiance. The establishment itself encompasses two levels of gaming and an expansive cinema. I indulged in the buffet and was thoroughly impressed by the culinary offerings, particularly considering the reasonable pricing. It's worth mentioning that the buffet features a varying themed menu each day of the week. On Saturdays, prime rib is the featured entree. Additionally, I discovered a bowling alley on the premises, which I intend to visit during my next trip to town. In contrast to my experiences on the strip, I found gambling at Sam's Town to be significantly more enjoyable. Not only did I emerge victorious, but I also managed to avoid incurring any losses during my approximate three-hour gaming session. The machines were remarkably generous towards me, and the cocktail waitstaff provided attentive service. Overall, it was a truly delightful encounter, and I eagerly anticipate returning to Sam's Town in the near future."

I possess a membership with Massage Heights for approximately nine months at this point. I am unlikely to engage in such a pursuit once again. I hold this establishment in high regard, yet my place of employment, a resort situated on the renowned Las Vegas Strip, provides an enhanced experience through various minor details, including additional pampering, hydration, and nutritious snacks both prior to and subsequent to the massage therapy session. Although my workplace does not offer a comparable membership program, I deem it a worthy investment to indulge in such luxuries periodically. Upon culminating my one-year contractual agreement with Massage Heights, I shall refrain from securing another membership, as I believe that alternative services offering superior quality are available for the price I pay.

I am also somewhat conflicted about Tram's.  I have been a few times now, and it seems to be somewhat hit or miss.  I've had the Pho a few times, and while always fairly good my satisfaction largely hinges on the amount and freshness of basil and mint that is brought out.  The other dishes are usually well made and well seasoned.  \n\nI enjoy the short menu and the waiter who is fun to interact with.  This place is usually pretty busy even on a weekday evening.  Surprising given the location.  Definitely better than Pho Minh up the street, but I still think Spice Island has the best Vietnamese dishes in town.

"On my inaugural visit to this eatery, I must confess that my culinary experience has been utterly transformed, as my previous lack of enthusiasm towards Asian cuisine has been drastically altered to an unwavering fondness, thus ensuring my future patronage."

I am always skeptical when I visit a Thai place because I love massaman (mussaman, etc.) and find very uneven results across the Thai restaurant landscape. I've had salty-as-hell massaman, nearly-raw massaman, and flavorless massaman.  I gave this a try.

This was Very Good Massaman. The potatoes were actually cooked through. The shrimp still had the tails on them, which I hate, but they were good. The sauce was tasty (though somewhat  reminiscent of tomato bisque soup). I really enjoyed that dish.

The decor was pleasant- wood everywhere, not overly crowded with tables. The floor didn't look as if it had been swept for a couple of days, though (sorry, Pin Kaow- that evening sun shows everything on a smooth shiny surface!)

I tried the rice and coconut ice cream for dessert and was not impressed with the rice, as it was gummy.  I'll come back for more more massaman, but no dessert for me.

wow, this place is pretty delicious.  i came here in a large group and was able to try a bunch of things.

for apps, we got the fois gras, spicy crab salad, and the tuna tartare.

for dinner, i ordered the "surf and turf" which was not your standard surf and turf.  the "turf" consisted of a huge chunk of fois, and the "surf" was a pc of butterfish.  all of it was on a bed of shredded brussel sprouts, and there was a black truffle sauce on top...completely decadent.  i tried some other dishes and side dishes too, including the creamed spinach, the gnocchi, and the lobster au curry.  the creamed spinach was fabulous.

for dessert, i tried the chocolate souffle, mix candy bar, and choc and praline bush.  the souffle was the best dessert, and it came w/ a side of pistachio ice cream.  yum!

This eatery has consistently maintained its status as a personal favorite of mine, primarily due to the exceptional quality of their signature Gyros, which boast succulent lamb meat and a perfectly balanced z sauce that harmonizes the flavors, rendering them unparalleled in my culinary experiences. Notwithstanding the reasonable price point of $8 per Gyro, the generous portion size and satisfying taste make it an unquestionable value. Additionally, the option to combine a delectable combo meal, inclusive of crispy fries and a refreshing beverage, with a nominal increment of merely $2, presents an irresistible opportunity to indulge in a veritable gastronomic delight. I strongly advocate for a visit to this establishment, which exudes a warm, welcoming ambiance reminiscent of a quaint family-owned business, although its actual ownership structure remains unclear to me.

"This venue offers an optimal setting for a convivial gathering with acquaintances during the happy hour time frame, whereupon I derive immense pleasure from the totality of the ambiance, the specialized beverages, and the Japanese-style cuisine. Notably, they proffer an array of creative and delectable martinis, coupled with reasonable pricing on sushi and nigiri during the aforementioned happy hour period. Moreover, the experience is further enhanced by partaking in one's repast while seated at the sushi bar, thereby allowing patrons to observe the culinary artisans meticulously crafting their fare in real-time, directly in front of them."

If you are seeking a delectable and captivating burger experience in the city of Las Vegas, this establishment is undoubtedly worthy of your consideration. Their culinary offerings boast an impressive array of flavorsome burgers, including the Bahn Mi and Kalbi varieties, which are utterly divine and unquestionably among their most popular selections. Additionally, the restaurant serves an assortment of crispy fries, encompassing both sweet potato and oxtail chili options, which serve to further enhance the overall dining experience. While certain aspects of the venue may exude a strip mall ambiance, the superior quality of the burgers and the extensive beer selection more than compensate for any perceived shortcomings. A visit to this eatery is unequivocally recommended, even if it necessitates a slight detour or additional effort to locate.

"Maggiano's culinary offerings are indeed remarkable, with their chicken Alfredo dish being a personal favorite of mine due to its unparalleled flavor profile. Although I have had the pleasure of sampling various other menu items, this particular entree continues to hold the top spot in my esteem. Additionally, the chicken francese and potato dishes are equally palatable options that contribute to the restaurant's overall gastronomic excellence. Furthermore, the exceptional customer service we received during our visit, particularly from the maitre'd Loray who efficiently accommodated our seating needs, and our attentive server, only served to enhance our dining experience."

"Inexpensive, flavorsome, and satiating. We sampled the pho, spring rolls, and lemongrass chicken; all were delectable and merited repetition. However, my culinary exposure to Vietnamese fare was limited, thus my opinions may lack refinement. 

The proprietor, an individual of marked personality, took it upon himself to select our repast. Fortunately, we were unpretentious and disposed to accept his recommendations, finding him more amusing and captivating than overbearing. 

The venue was bustling, despite our arrival at 7 pm on a Friday, and given their policy of not accepting reservations, accommodating larger groups would likely prove problematic."

"It appears that this eatery is a veritable hit-or-miss affair, with the culinary experience oscillating between exceptional and subpar renditions. I have had the privilege of partaking in their gastronomic offerings on multiple occasions, and while the salad bar consistently impresses, the remaining dishes exhibit marked variability in quality. Despite the occasional inconsistency, I have opted to procure a salad from their establishment on numerous instances, as the convenience of takeout proves an attractive feature. Alas, the popularity of this restaurant during peak hours often translates into a sizeable assemblage of patrons, rendering a tranquil dining experience somewhat unlikely."

"Indulge in the captivating ambiance while relishing the extensive seating options; personally, I opted for the privileged position at the bar, allowing me to witness the artisanal crafting of my delectable rolls. During my visit, I noticed several televisions strategically placed throughout the establishment, broadcasting live sports events while I savored my culinary delights. It's worth mentioning that they offer a delightful happy hour promotion on weekends, although I decided to indulge in their all-you-can-eat option. The assortment of rolls not included in the all-you-can-eat selection is available for a mere $0.99 each, an incredible value. My recommendation is to sample their signature HONEY ROLL HONEY ROLL, an unparalleled gustatory experience. Additionally, for a mere $9.99, you can enjoy a half-pound of succulent crab legs accompanied by an unlimited supply of delectable rolls. \n\nThe rolls are presented promptly, showcasing their freshness and quality. Not too much rice is used in the preparation process, which complements the dish nicely. I must admit that I am also quite fond of their Rainbow Roll offering. Initially, the service was somewhat sluggish regarding plate removal and refilling my beverage; however, they compensated for it and provided exceptional attention to detail throughout the rest of my dining experience. Whenever I find myself in the vicinity in search of sushi, I will undoubtedly return to this establishment for lunch. Furthermore, their menu features Kobe Burgers, which seem substantial enough to induce a satisfying food coma. I must commend the creativity and innovation displayed in the naming and ingredient selection of their various rolls."

#aroundchandler So I finally made it here. So much hype about this place. Now I don't consider myself your average wing eater. I eat a serious amount of buffalo wings. I even made it to state championship for a wing eating contest. The wings here are good. The wings them self are average, but the sauces are way above average.  I always judge wings based on the standard hot. The hot was fairly hot, but very tasty. I also tried the ATL rub. The flavor was fantastic. I'm not a cool aid drinker, I stay away from sugar. But the fact they had cool aid I thought was pretty cool.  I will be a regular here and will try all 18 flavors of wings!!   #chandleraz

We indulged in a delectable luncheon at an all-you-can-eat establishment, whereupon we were presented with an array of gastronomical options, each station showcasing a distinct culinary style. While the diversity of the offerings was indeed impressive, the quality of the fare was somewhat inconsistent, with certain dishes proving to be palatable while others fell short of our expectations. However, the beauty of a smorgasbord lies in its ability to allow patrons to sample a variety of edibles without committing to a single plate, thereby enabling us to savor an assortment of flavors and textures. According to our familial consensus, the standout items on this particular visit were the chilled and grilled jumbo shrimp, coleslaw, corn bread, Italian chicken stew, bok choy, carne asada, flan, and chocolate mousse cake.

"The sole reason that this establishment does not receive a perfect rating of five stars is due to the fact that the ordering process can be somewhat perplexing and chaotic, and during our most recent visit, the tables were not adequately cleared in a timely manner. However, the culinary offerings are undoubtedly delectable, boasting an innovative concept and utilizing fresh, premium ingredients. We thoroughly appreciate the ability to swiftly procure a superlative pizza, but certain operational refinements are still necessary before this dining venue can be considered truly exceptional."
The reviews were NOT exaggerating when they mentioned SLOW service. It was terrible. However, when the steak and eggs did come... Delicious! But it took 20 min at least.

When trying to think of where to go for a steak dinner The Greentree Inn came to mind. I had never been here in all the years of living so very close. I was glad I chose this establishment. Food was excellent and I loved the feel of the place

It's nice to see a chain that is committed to doing something and doing it well. We have a local Habit restaurant here in California. On a whim, we decided to drop into one near our hotel in Phoenix last week. Both my wife and I ordered the same thing we always do--mostly to see if the experience was consistent. Well it was. Consistently yummy, might I add.... If you find yourself in Chandler with a hankering for a great burger, I highly recommend the Habit.\n\n4 out of 5 stars for the food being a little on the pricey side for the amount that you get. But who am I to quibble, we'll still be back.

"Mmmmmm...gastronomical excellence personified by an unctuous, savory delight...I mean, simply dabbing it with a napkin would not suffice, for the palatable, mouthwatering slices remained resolutely saturated with an abundance of rich, velvety grease...kind of good, if you will! 

In pursuit of a culinary experience beyond the ubiquitous franchises, I ventured forth to New York Pizza, only to find the establishment bustling with activity on this particular Wednesday evening. Undeterred, I expedited my order with alacrity, opting for a solitary pepperoni slice...which, much to my satisfaction, cost a mere trifle of $3! 

The interior ambiance, though modest in its appointments, exuded a certain charm, comprising a few tables, chairs, booths, and televisions...unpretentious, yet functional. 

To my delight, my pizza emerged from the kitchen with remarkable celerity, allowing me to hasten my departure with minimal delay! 

The crust of the pizza demonstrated a satisfying texture, generously adorned with an array of pepperonis, cheese, and, of course, a copious amount of that delectable, golden elixir known as grease. The sauce, too, boasted a subtle, yet tangible piquancy, striking a harmonious balance between flavors that left me in accord with Ben G's sentiments; although diverging from the traditional New York-style pizza, it remained undeniably scrumptious! 

My gastronomical exploration of this eatery merely whetted my appetite for further indulgence, particularly after laying eyes on the delectable Philly cheesesteak that another patron had ordered, its tantalizing aroma wafting through the air, beckoning me to return and sample its splendor."

"It is utterly delightful to partake in a culinary excursion to this establishment, as it offers an array of delectable victuals that cater to diverse gastronomical inclinations. Patrons can indulge in a plethora of savory delights within the interior premises, where they can luxuriate in cozy booths accompanied by state-of-the-art televisions for an enhanced dining experience. Alternatively, they may opt to relish their meals alfresco on the picturesque patio, where they can bask in the serene ambiance while enjoying the company of their faithful canine companions. Of particular note are the mouthwatering aju sliders, which are sure to satiate even the most discerning palates with their explosion of flavors and textures."

It was a brief excursion from Mesa, but I had some reservations about boarding the train due to the presence of certain individuals; however, given that it was a public mode of transportation, I decided to overlook my apprehensions and proceed with my journey. Unfortunately, the brevity of the trip did not preclude me from experiencing physical discomfort, specifically in my legs, which were exacerbated by the seating arrangement during the brief voyage and persisted for several days thereafter, owing to my medical condition known as Restless Leg Syndrome. Despite these inconveniences, I acknowledged the benefits of utilizing public transportation, particularly in terms of conserving fuel, and thus, I would consider it as a viable option for my daily commute if I were employed in close proximity to a pick-up location. However, I must caution others to exercise vigilance when parking near such locations, as I learned the hard way by incurring a substantial fine of $200 for an erroneous parking maneuver, which resulted in the unfortunate impoundment of my vehicle. Notwithstanding this setback, I would still be willing to undertake the journey again, albeit with greater attention to detail regarding parking arrangements.

We did the wedding helicopter package and got married on the night tour over the strip. It was AMAZING! We sat right next to the pilot and the view was so spectacular it felt like we were flying the plane ourselves!  

There was the option to add a photographer and/or video of the ceremony. We added the photo package and were very pleased that we did. He took tons of shots and it was a great memory. Since the same guy who takes your pictures wil be the one who does the video we said "no" to the video since we didn't see how he could do both things at once. I'm so glad we chose that. 

One thing I would recommend is to make sure the microphone on your headset works before you take off. No one could hear me on mine and I had to say "I Do" about 10 times before they could hear me. Fantastic experience and anyone who is wondering about getting married this way will be so happy!

Ah...another Charlotte staple when choosing a ultra gourmet and romantic evening.  This was my first visit to the Fig Tree and I was very excited to see what it was all about to say the least.  I had already decided on my entree before even walking in the door so I was all set.  Thankfully, my girlfriend with her grand ways made reservations during the same time they were decorated for Christmas so the atmosphere was just perfect for us.  I ended up getting the grouper that came laden in a butter sauce with lobster meat that adorned the top.  It was great!  The cheese plate we had prior was good as well but may be a bit overpriced at $17.  My girlfriend ended up getting the pork chop entr\u00e9e and wasn't pleased at all with the preparation of the chops as they were a bit too fatty....shame.  I later tried the chops and I would have to agree they weren't exactly fat free but I soldiered through it anyway...ha!  The service was impeccable and delightful and the whole experience (all be it a little downtrodden due to the chops) was good enough to have me back again

"It is my utmost pleasure to indulge in the delectable offerings of Dunkin Donuts, with a particular fondness for the Toasted Coconut and Chocolate Frosted cake variety; these scrumptious treats constitute the epitome of culinary excellence, in my humble opinion. The vast majority of the time, I opt for the Coffee & 2 donuts combination, as it provides an ideal balance between satisfying my craving for caffeine and indulging in the rich, sweet flavors of the aforementioned donuts. My frequent patronage of this establishment has led to a familiarity with the staff, who have become adept at recognizing my voice when placing orders via the drive-thru; this rapport has been fostered by my consistent ordering of the Toasted Coconut & Chocolate Frosted cake duo, which, I must stress, is a crucial aspect of my Dunkin Donuts experience. It is worth noting that, on occasion, the staff has erroneously provided me with a chocolate glazed or chocolate frosted glazed donut, which, while delicious in their own right, do not compare to the unparalleled taste of the Toasted Coconut & Chocolate Frosted cake. To ensure an optimal experience for patrons such as myself, I highly recommend taking advantage of the coffee punch card, particularly if one tends to favor medium-sized cups of coffee."
My better half indulged in a midday repast alongside a fellow employee yesterday, and their culinary experience was thoroughly relished and gratifying, kudos to them for their proficient endeavors.

"I derive immense pleasure from the extensive array of tapas offered at this esteemed establishment, my dear spouse and I having sampled a diverse assortment of plates, ranging from one to two selections per category, with a particular fondness for the profoundly flavorful deep-fried artichoke and the lavish foie gras, while the delectable deep-fried beignets, also known as bunuelos, proved to be an absolute delight."

"I had the pleasure of partaking in an evening outing with my significant other at this establishment, and I must say that my expectations were thoroughly surpassed by the ambiance, hospitality, and culinary offerings. The ingredients utilized in the preparation of the dishes were remarkably fresh and delectable, with the Chow Mein being particularly impressive, boasting an unparalleled level of quality that rendered it the most satisfying instance of its kind that I have had the pleasure of consuming in recent memory. The staff members were incredibly cordial and attentive, providing a level of service that greatly enhanced our overall experience. However, I must admit that the lone sushi roll we sampled, specifically the Golden Cali Roll, fell somewhat short of my lofty expectations, eliciting a tepid response from myself, although my companion seemed to derive greater enjoyment from it."

Token Limit: 512 tokens
Accepted Token Types: Letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), spaces, punctuation marks (.,!,?, -)

Please note that this task requires modifying the given text while preserving its original meaning. It's not about generating a new text or creating a summary. Also, please ensure that the modified text doesn't exceed the token limit specified in the problem statement.

Love the taro yogurt and mochi balls! The only down side is the lack of seating and the fifty bajillion college kids that swarm this place. Maybe that's just the old woman in me, but this place gets really loud! I definitely like it here better than Mojo's so I'll take my yogurt to go and enjoy it in peace!

We stayed at the Golden Nugget 6/29-6/30/13. First time staying at this or any hotel Downtown. Our Rush Tower suite was nicer than our suites in the Palazzo where we normally stay. There were many factors that really could have hampered our stay - 117 degrees....lost money....brought my 10 year old...pool was packed.....BUT....We had an amazing time!!!! The staff here is very attentive. Their clientele aren't flashy nor trashy. The table limits are perfect. The food is good. The room rates, food rates, drink are very reasonable. The pool is so much fun!!! 

My wife never takes the time to reserve a spa appointment in advance and regularly gets a annoying response from the big hotels when trying to get a same day appointment. She made a same day appointment for a pretty big ($200 treatment) and said the spa in the Golden Nugget was very good and a good value!!!

She actually wants to go there with her girlfriends but I think maybe my players card room discounts are not transferable to her

Do not be afraid to venture out 'Downtown' Vegas. We ziplined and watched the free concerts.

Really can not wait to get back there!!!

Moved close by and went here for the first time loved it, Kay is awesome she's really good but time efficient at the same time which is very hard to find sometimes. Normally I get someone at a different salon who is slow but does good or someone who is fast but not good she is the perfect blend of both. Very pretty salon with beautiful pedi bowls and massage chairs. Not over priced and quality work, big selection of gel colors to choose from and comftorable setting! I give it a thumbs up and will be coming here from now on to see Kay.

I have been a patron of this esteemed establishment for approximately two years, and I must say that their culinary offerings, particularly their shrimp fried rice, have been nothing short of exceptional. Conveniently situated in close proximity to my place of employment, this restaurant has proven to be an ideal location for a quick and satisfying meal. The service here has consistently been of the highest quality, with the staff exhibiting a commendable level of efficiency and warmth. Furthermore, their luncheon menu offers a diverse array of delectable options at remarkably affordable prices.

I had some issues with Cox years ago but I stuck with them. The last couple times that I went in there I had great experiences. They worked with me to lower my bill and were quick and helpful. I'll give 'em some props for that.

"It is imperative to emphasize that my affection for the Arizona Humane Society's mission and their remarkable Campus for Compassion remains unwavering, despite certain reservations regarding the scarcity of canine inhabitants during our trio of visits. The society's commendable efforts in rescuing and rehoming animals are undeniably praiseworthy, and it is conceivable that our misfortune in encountering unoccupied kennels may be attributed to either unfavorable timing or an exceptionally efficient adoption rate. Nonetheless, curiosity piqued, I couldn't help but ponder whether the underutilization of their spacious, climate-controlled facilities might be a contributing factor. 

In hopes of optimizing the allocation of resources, I respectfully suggest increasing the influx of adoptable dogs from nearby shelters, thereby capitalizing on the Campus for Compassion's impressive capacity. My sincere appreciation for their endeavor is underscored by my unwavering belief that each furry denizen, upon entry, receives meticulous care and attention. Noteworthy is the strategic design element of a low partition between adjacent kennels, effectively diminishing animal stress by curtailing direct visual confrontations with potentially irate canines. Additionally, this thoughtful feature facilitates the efficient transportation of dogs to and from their living quarters, further minimizing potential distress. It is indubitable that this shelter stands out as a paragon of excellence among its peers."

I couldnt wait to get back to a Smashburger after having my first one in Vegas. I got the Sincity burger in Vegas and they dont offer anything like this that i saw here. :-(\nSo i deceided to get the Arizona burger and it was ok, if it was my first smashburger i wouldnt be craving it though like i did with the sincity burger. So now i still have to wait for that crave.

"It is utterly inconceivable that I have not furnished an update to my review in a timely manner, considering the profound impact that Lo Lo's has had on my gastronomical experiences! Indeed, my ardent yearning for your delectable offerings has been unwavering ever since I had the privilege of partaking in a single bite of your sublimely prepared fried chicken; a culinary masterpiece that has left an indelible mark on my palate, and one that I must confess has eclipsed my predilection for any other establishment that purports to serve comparable fare! 

The ingenious fusion of your fried chicken and waffle constitutes a veritable symphony of flavors that is simply unparalleled, and it is this very combination that has captivated my taste buds and rendered me a steadfast devotee of your esteemed eatery. Moreover, I must aver that my affection for Lo Lo's surpasses even that of Roscoe's, a restaurant that I have heretofore held in high regard! 

My most recent visit afforded me the opportunity to sample the #8, also known as the 'Betty Boop,' which consists of a waffle accompanied by a succulent fried breast. I must say that the dish was every bit as scrumptious as I remembered it to be, with the waffle maintaining its characteristic lightness and fluffiness, while the fried breast exhibited an unwavering commitment to culinary excellence that is fast becoming a hallmark of your establishment. In point of fact, I would venture to suggest that the quality of the fried chicken at Lo Lo's has become the standard by which all other such dishes are measured! 

Furthermore, I took great pleasure in sampling the Kool Aid, which was served at the ideal temperature and presented in a jar, thereby lending an air of rustic charm to the entire experience. And lastly, I must not neglect to mention the macaroni and cheese, a dish that was executed to perfection and characterized by an judicious balance of cheesy goodness that left nary a doubt as to the culinary prowess of your kitchen staff! 

In conclusion, permit me to extend my sincerest gratitude to Lo Lo's for once again providing me with a dining experience that was nothing short of extraordinary. Oh, and might I add that the ambiance of your establishment is redolent with an atmosphere of sophistication and refinement that is certain to captivate the discerning patron?"

Upon entering the establishment, I opted for a pedicure and was immediately struck by the hospitable demeanor of the staff, particularly the two female attendants who exhibited exceptional cordiality. The ambiance of the setting was inviting and warm, albeit somewhat thermally oppressive, perhaps due to the seasonal transition. Nonetheless, my attention was quickly diverted to the extensive array of nail polish options available, which impressed me immensely. Furthermore, the presence of chairs equipped with back massage functionality was an added bonus, contributing to the overall comfort and relaxation of the experience. Additionally, I was pleased to discover that some of the staff members were proficient in Mandarin, which further enhanced the pleasantness of my visit. Ultimately, I departed feeling satisfied with the reasonably priced basic pedicure I received, and I am eager to return in the future.

"The dimmest drinking establishment in Charlotte boasts an ambiance characterized by an extreme deficiency of illumination, rendering the presence of surface dirt and grime on the floor indiscernible to the patronage. While personal experience has not confirmed the actual existence of an unsanitary environment, perceptions vary among patrons regarding the cleanliness of the premises. Notwithstanding, an Irish-themed pub in close proximity offers a dual-level interior and outdoor seating arrangement, partially sheltered from precipitation during the warm season, thereby accommodating diverse preferences. A popular game of skill and chance, cornhole, is available for play on the exterior patio, providing patrons with an opportunity to offset a portion of their beverage expenses through friendly competition. The service staff maintains a welcoming demeanor, fostering a relaxed atmosphere that contrasts with the livelier environs of alternative downtown watering holes."
Very hometown feel in this place. I came here to check out the open mic they have on Thursday nights. And it was great environment and cheap drinks! Great combo!\n\nCan't wait to go back!

"The boyfriend was ecstatic about the multitude of flavors he had perused on the company's digital platform, but his enthusiasm was short-lived upon arriving at the establishment, as there were merely a paltry five options available. Consequently, his assessment of the experience was a mediocre 3.5. Notwithstanding, he did express that his coconut custard was rather delectable. In contrast, my appraisal of the Western flavor was an unwavering 4, as the combination of rich, velvety texture and the subtle crunch of salted pecans resulted in an unparalleled gustatory delight. My craving for this indulgence was so intense that I found myself yearning for a bowl of it even during the writing of this review, despite the lingering aftereffects of a satiating dinner. Although the portion size may have appeared formidable, the frozen treat surprisingly struck a satisfying balance between lightness and creaminess, effectively negating any concerns of excessive indulgence. Furthermore, the well-illuminated surroundings of the shop alleviated any trepidation one might harbor, rendering the experience not only enjoyable but also anxiety-free."

Although I discover it somewhat costly for the value received, the cuisine is, on the whole, exceptionally flavorsome, and I unreservedly endorse the Kabob Grill to any individual who takes pleasure in Mediterranean delicacies. The tabbouleh, potato harra, shawerma, and lamb kabobs (notably tender and delectable) are especially deserving of recognition. The pickled condiments exhibit remarkable quality, boasting an impressive piquant vinegary flavor. The hommos, presented alongside flatbread, displays commendable texture, although I personally prefer a hint more citrus. The meat pies and grape leaves, while acceptable, could benefit from additional seasoning or zest. The establishment offers a diverse assortment of wine and beer, featuring several robust, foreign brews that I have yet to encounter elsewhere. Frequently, they distribute coupons through publications in Ballantyne.

What a cute little place to have breakfast! 
I just recently attended a bridal shower brunch here and it was so cute!  
The food was super tasty, I had the creamy corn porridge with maple glazed sausage and cinnamon sugar roasted apples. I took a chance on it, it sounded like it had a 50/50 chance of being either really good or really heinous! And boy was I glad when it came out and was soooo good! 
This place could be 5 stars if the staff wasn't so lax and a little more attentive. This was the whole table (8 ladies) first time coming to this place, we were not instructed that drinks were self serves for the basics (water, coffee, juice) we had to figure that out on our own, and no one at our table was asked if they would like a mimosa or any other drink other then the self serve stuff. 
I do look forward to going back!

"This lodging establishment seemed to exude an ambiance reminiscent of a luxurious apartment complex, boasting generously proportioned rooms that were appointed with an array of furnishings, including plush couches, dining tables, sinks, and expansive bathrooms. Despite the spaciousness of the accommodations, the tariff was surprisingly reasonable, with my particular abode costing a mere $25 per night. However, certain drawbacks were evident, such as the somewhat antiquated appearance of the rooms, which seemed to lack a certain je ne sais quoi in terms of aesthetic appeal, not to mention the presence of a minuscule television set. Nonetheless, I chose to evaluate the hotel based on its own merits, rather than allowing its proximity to the famed Las Vegas Strip to influence my assessment."

"My recent dining experience at Joey's culinary establishment was an unexpected delight, characterized by an ambiance that exuded charm and hospitality, complemented by exceptional customer service. Upon being seated, we were presented with an assortment of delectable corn bread muffins that served as a harbinger of the satisfying repast that was to follow. The chowders, which my mother and I sampled in diverse varieties, showcased a masterful blend of flavors and textures that left us both impressed. Furthermore, the principal courses were generously portioned, allowing us to fully appreciate the culinary prowess of the chef. In conclusion, I would highly recommend Joey's to those seeking a dining experience that combines quality, value, and a warm atmosphere, and I personally look forward to returning in the near future."

We indulged in a delightful milk chocolate bar, characterized by an velvety peanut butter filling, which we savored with great relish. The fluidity of the peanut butter filling was truly delectable, prompting Luis to remark that it closely resembled the flavor profile of a Snickers bar, albeit absent the crunchy texture of peanuts, which, for individuals belonging to my particular age group, would be more commonly associated with a Mars bar. Additionally, our interaction with the courteous and competent cashier/clerk, Antrez, was thoroughly pleasant and satisfying.

The restaurant is fairly new and located in the ground floor of a old Bond Warehouse just off Constitution Street.  They have made use of the double height ceilings and put in a mezzanine level, creating a small area ideal for large groups of people and providing more table space.  We received a warm welcome and were seated at our table near the large arched windows.  The interior is clean, simple and especially liked the candles in red coloured glasses dotted up the stairs.  Giving to space an almost zen-like feeling.\n\nAll the staff were authentic Spaniards which felt reassuring.  I love tapas and so this restaurant did not let me down.  The menu is broken down into 3 sections, 'From the orchard', 'from the sea' and 'from the farm'.  We ordered 6 tapas between the two of us, wondering if it would be enough? Thankfully it was plenty, the dishes were small but tasty.  Do try the pork and mushroom cream sauce and Monkfish, prawn and squid in tomato sauce.  First time I've eaten squid that isn't rubbery, it just dissolved in the mouth, lovely!

"Optimal tortilla chips accompanied by delectable salsa, ardently coveted for personal consumption in copious quantities. Upon hosting social gatherings at my humble abode, I customarily opt for the Fiesta platter, boasting an assortment of culinary delights. Generally, the quality of the fare served at this establishment warrants high praise, with the exception of a solitary instance in which the Pollo Fundido, a dish characterized by its crispy, golden exterior and savory, melted cheese interior, was unfortunately sold out. In its stead, I received a standard chicken burrito, a commendable substitute yet lacking the tantalizing allure of its fried counterpart. Efficiency in service and scrupulous attention to maintaining a clean environment are additional hallmarks of this eatery."

The gastronomical establishment boasted an artistic ambiance replete with a trendy atmosphere, which enticed my spouse and me to partake in a delectable midday repast within its confines. Upon perusing the menu, we opted for a pair of sandwiches that showcased a harmonious convergence of flavors, featuring the complementary ingredients of mango, Cajun chicken, and avocado, thereby eliciting a savory delight that left us both utterly satiated.

I frequent this establishment on a regular basis due to my association with a group of individuals who are employed in the culinary department. The edibles served here are of superior quality, and I have had the pleasure of sampling a majority of the offerings. Particularly noteworthy are the Reuben, the Cajun, and the Royal, all of which are deliciously indulgent, albeit somewhat detrimental to one's health. To maximize your gastronomical experience, I suggest sharing one of the larger portions with a companion, thereby enabling you to sample two distinct varieties. Additionally, the venue boasts an impressive array of brews, which serve as the perfect accompaniment to the delectable fare.

"My culinary experiences at this establishment have been nothing short of exceptional, particularly with regards to their delectable fried rice, which boasts an impressive composition of generously-sized vegetables and meat, thus setting itself apart from other eateries that opt for minuscule, chopped ingredients. The Mussaman Curry is undoubtedly one of their premier offerings, with its rich, well-balanced flavors that never fail to satisfy my palate. While the sizzling beef is a close second, a recent carry-out order unfortunately featured meat that was not only tough but also severely overcooked. Notwithstanding this minor setback, the restaurant has consistently demonstrated a willingness to accommodate special requests with ease, albeit at an additional cost for each item. Furthermore, they have instituted a revised spice scale of 1-5, with 3 now representing the previous 5 on their old 1-10 scale, which may take some getting used to. However, my primary grievance lies in the fact that they have erroneously prepared dishes on two separate occasions, once omitting spice altogether and another time excessively seasoning a dish, resulting in an unfortunate incongruity between what was ordered and what was served. In both instances, the issues were promptly addressed, but it remains perplexing as to why such mistakes occur with such frequency. Patrons can also benefit from a loyalty program of sorts, whereby accumulating points based on expenditures leads to earning $10 off a future purchase, and select members may even receive exclusive discounts via email, as I recently did. Despite these occasional mishaps, my enthusiasm for this establishment remains unwavering, and I eagerly anticipate my next visit."

Was visiting the Scottsdale area on vacation this past weekend and was looking for some good sushi in the nearby area.  I found this restaurant on Yelp and I'm glad my friends and I decided to go.  We had such a great time!  We met the owner Greg and the sushi chef Miki.  Not only was the food great, but so was the service and atmosphere.  I would highly recommend trying this place out.

"Exquisite outdoor dining area! \n\nMet with a coterie of companions and relished the porcine platter, accompanied by delectable miniature pancake-esque accoutrements and the piquant mashed potato preparation; both culinary offerings were truly exceptional."
Excellent meal. I had the Mahi Mahi and my wife had the Salmon, which were both awesome! The service was quick and friendly. Looking forward to going back to try something different!

"An exceptional venue for unwinding, indulging in delectable cuisine, and savoring refreshing beverages in the heart of Phoenix; this establishment boasts a team of remarkably friendly and accommodating personnel, offering an array of diverse options catering to varied preferences."

"Prodigious culinary mastery, unparalleled gastronomic delight! Service, albeit somewhat languid, was nevertheless rendered with an air of elegance and refinement, characteristic of the quintessential Gallic hospitality. I would, without hesitation, avail myself of the opportunity to partake in such an epicurean experience once again, should fate afford me the privilege of a future visit."

Interesting concept. This place is quick-service, order at the counter, sushi restaurant. You go in, place your order, pay for it, and then they bring it over. You fill your own drinks at the machine.\n\nThe sushi was fine. It was nothing special but the prices are great and the service was very fast. If I lived or worked around there, I could definitely see myself going frequently.

"My affection for this establishment persists even after a night of excessive alcohol consumption, specifically on the subsequent day when the lingering effects of the previous evening's indulgence are still palpable. In fact, my fondness for Pho knows no bounds, regardless of the day or time. The prices of Banh Mi, a traditional Vietnamese sandwich, are quite reasonable and offer an exceptional value considering their flavorful taste, despite being slightly diminutive in size compared to other eateries. The quality of both the Pho and various other menu items surpasses expectations, with the notable exception of spring rolls, which, while not necessarily subpar, fail to meet the high standards set by the rest of the menu. Patrons may also partake in a diverse array of boba beverages. However, a minor drawback exists in that the staff occasionally feign comprehension of our orders, leading to errors in the final product. These insignificant discrepancies include omitting garnishes such as cilantro or erroneously including excessive amounts of certain ingredients."

"I have been frequenting this establishment on a consistent basis, and have yet to encounter any of the problems that others have described in their reviews...

The sushi rolls are undoubtedly one of the highlights of the menu, with the Vegas roll being a personal favorite of mine; it has a delightful balance of flavors and textures, and the presentation is visually stunning...

As for the service, I have always found it to be prompt and attentive, even during peak hours; on one occasion, we had a large party of 15 people and the staff handled it with ease...

However, I must say that the state of the restrooms leaves much to be desired; they are in dire need of renovation and proper maintenance, and the sound of employees engaging in personal conversations on their cell phones while using the facilities is not exactly conducive to a pleasant dining experience."

You're getting an extra star for two solid reasons.  

One is because the remodel is over and the store is pretty again (and a bit fancier).  Two, and thee most important part, this iggle has the best quality and well made sushi out of any Iggle's out there!  Believe me, I've eaten many a rainbow roll from many different locations around the Burgh and nothing has compared.  Dare I say, it's as close as you get to going to a good sushi restaurant.  Bold statement, right? 

I  just love me some sushi and want it often, quick and convenient and this serves all those purposes with upholding the quality.  Need a quick sushi fix?  This place is it!

This establishment purports to be a diner; however, it is essential to acknowledge that the quality of service is inconsistent and the ambiance is unremarkable. Despite these limitations, the culinary offerings are generally satisfactory. To optimize your dining experience, consider the following suggestions:  
1. Consider sharing a malt or shake with a companion, as these frozen delights are not only delectable but also substantial in portion, rendering them suitable for sharing. Given the generous size of the meals, splitting one of these treats between two individuals is advisable.  
2. Upon perusing the menu, select an item that piques your interest and remain loyal to your choice. While a few exceptional dishes (such as the meatless meatloaf) truly stand out, the remainder of the offerings are merely average. Consistency is key when it comes to savoring the flavors of this eatery.  
Following a comprehensive assessment, I would assign three stars to this establishment. Nonetheless, the extensive variety of vegetarian options warrants an additional star, elevating the overall rating to four stars.

Food, service, and ambiance were impeccable.  The only negative on our visit was the horrific lounge singer who proceeded to butcher multiple Beatles songs to the extent that I'm sure the deceased Beatles (RIP!) were rolling in their graves.  Fortunately he stopped at some point throughout the meal.  Sooooo on that unappetizing note, let's move on to the food...


calamari - unbelievable!  Delicious, tender perfectly cooked and seasoned calamari with a great accompaniment of shallots, asian noodles, carrots, scallions, cashews, and red chiles in a lovely sauce.

halibut cheeks benedict with lobster and Hollandaise - delicious.  perfectly cooked biscuits (says the Southern girl who knows my biscuits), the hollandaise was well-done - not too stiff, not too heavy, and perfectly cooked eggs.  The little side salad with it was just ok.

lobster bisque - delicious.  Not too creamy, lots of lobster flavor goodness, pleasing texture.

asparagus with hollandaise - tender, fresh baby asparagus 

corn - amazingly fresh and flavorful.  It was hard to stop eating it.

bananas foster butter cakes - a bit too sweet for my taste but everyone else loved it.  The butter pecan ice cream was divine.

godiva chocolate cake with vanilla bean ice cream - Oh.My.Goodness.  Were licking the plate not frowned upon (in some places,) I would have.

Whitehaven Sauvignon Blanc - lovely, light, fresh bouquet.  Kim Crawford lovers will enjoy it.  

from the moment you walk in the door, it's all about quick, efficient, professional service.  Everything we had was amazing. Definitely a great place for a special dinner.

Free is beneficial, particularly in Las Vegas, where a spectacle of some kind takes place overhead every hour along Fremont Street, providing a captivating experience for those gathered to observe. I have consistently been drawn to the downtown area due to its ease of accessibility, as opposed to the strip, where pedestrians must traverse extensive distances between hotels. Additionally, the comparatively seedy nature of downtown contributes to its appeal. The temporary cessation of neon illumination and the ensuing pause in activity, during which onlookers remain transfixed by the brief display, serves as a testament to the inherent fascination of the spectacle. Following the conclusion of the light show, the street reverts to its previous state, and individuals resume their various pursuits. The essence of this phenomenon lies not in the performance itself, but rather in the peripheral aspects surrounding it, with the observation of human behavior being the primary focus.

Having relocated to this geographic locale from the state of Ohio, I found myself in pursuit of a proficient massage practitioner. Following a thorough examination of online reviews pertaining to local masseuses, I opted to engage the services of Jill. She delivered an exceptional 90-minute therapeutic massage, articulating a comprehensive understanding of muscle stretching techniques, including the recommendation to maintain a static stretch for a duration of 40 seconds, a novel concept that I had not previously encountered. Consequent to this satisfactory encounter, I have elected to schedule recurrent appointments with Jill at intervals of three weeks, eagerly anticipating each subsequent session. I unhesitatingly endorse Jill to any individual seeking a tranquilizing massage experience.

"Steve Wynn endeavored to create an unparalleled gastronomical experience in Las Vegas, and his efforts have been met with resounding success. The Wynn buffet boasts an unrivaled level of culinary excellence, showcasing a wide array of delectable dishes expertly prepared with only the freshest ingredients. From the mouthwatering thin-crust brick-oven pizzas to the succulent, meaty crab legs and the tender, flavorful New Zealand rack of lamb, each dish on the menu is a testament to the establishment's commitment to gastronomic excellence. Furthermore, the inclusion of unique and exotic elements, such as the Asian noodle soup bar, fresh longans, and Asian pears in the pear salad, serves to enhance the overall dining experience. However, it is worth noting that the exceptionally long wait time, which exceeded 1.5 hours in some cases, detracts slightly from the overall enjoyment of the buffet. Perhaps considering the implementation of a FastPass-like system, similar to those found at popular theme parks, could help alleviate this issue and ensure that patrons can fully appreciate the Wynn buffet's unmatched culinary offerings without undue delay."
Not easy to find. In the back of a shopping center. In went there for Pho all the time. It's the closest I can find to the noodle I had home in China.

I thoroughly enjoy visiting Arrowhead Mall, as it ranks among my most preferred shopping destinations. The thoughtful design of the layout enables me to easily navigate the various stores, affording me a comprehensive view of the diverse retail options from multiple vantage points. Furthermore, the presence of an Apple Store only serves to enhance my shopping experience. My personal preferences include American Eagle and Foot Locker, while my spouse can indulge in a wide range of retail therapy, keeping her occupied and content. Upon completion of our shopping excursion, we can select from a variety of dining establishments, providing us with an opportunity to relax and recharge. This mall's proximity to our residence obviates the need for an extended journey to alternative shopping centers such as Arizona Mills or Fashion Square Mall, unless we opt for a leisurely drive.

"Perhaps my anticipations have yet to undergo thorough metamorphosis upon entering the Veterans Affairs healthcare system, but thus far, subsequent to two medical appointments with physicians and a couple of excursions to the laboratory, in addition to today's encounter with a dietitian, I must confess that I harbor an unwavering sense of satisfaction. Not only have I been impressed by the absence of substantial queuing, but also by the seamless and virtually pain-free nature of blood sampling procedures, as well as the unwavering dedication and benevolence displayed by volunteers. Although it did require an extended duration to gain admittance into the system, my experiences have led me to formulate nothing but laudatory remarks regarding the personnel and their services. It appears that the VA facility in question caters to an enormous populace, while simultaneously exhibiting a commendable level of solicitude towards patients' necessities. My sincere gratitude extends to each and every individual involved in providing such attentive care."
