Deals were found thru out. Its good to see more booths were staffed then not. It's all new stuff so if your looking for pre owned or tools go to the outdoor one. It's a dollar to get in. The mini donut Booth is gone but plenty of places to eat are open. Security is present so don't try it. It's goof to come here on hot 100 plus degree days. Grab a smoothie and wall around.

This place is really nice.  I feel seriously spoiled when I try to go out in SF or in Sacramento because nothing I've been to seems to even come close to topping XS.

XS's biggest and best feature is its size.  Plus the entrance (as you approach the opening of the interior of the club) is really really impressive, especially since it opens out into the pool area and expands around it into a pennisula around the pool.  

However, I went during memorial day weekend and the place was PACKED. I've never seen it so busy there and was a bit of a turn off that it was so packed inside.  I went on sunday (not saturday, saturday was stupid crazy and the cover was ridiculous; plus we got in for free on sunday).  I think Keri Hilson was there singing her songs but she sounded so off I think the they told her to stop performing (?) 

Also the music there tends to vary a lot, if you're used to listening to hip hop/ pop music at a club, XS will do that but on occasion it'll do a quick switch to some house music and totally throw most people off guard.

"Commencing with an acknowledgement of the hospitable demeanor exhibited by the personnel stationed at the points of sale, it is imperative to emphasize that such an amicable disposition is not only appreciated but also expected, particularly when considering the substantial discrepancy between the price paid and the manufacturer's suggested retail price. Notwithstanding this caveat, the employees demonstrated a commendable level of cordiality, respectfulness, and gratitude towards their patrons. Furthermore, the cinemas, albeit somewhat unsatisfactory in terms of the tidiness of the restrooms and auditoriums, managed to garner a rating of four stars, largely attributable to the laudable customer service proffered by the establishment's staff."

" Allow me to proffer a solitary term for your perusal, my dear progeny; 'porkbellies', if you will, and, furthermore, permit me to elaborate upon the preparation of these delectable morsels via the medium of grilling, thus imbuing them with an unparalleled depth of flavor and texture that, when accompanied by a trio of complementary sides - rice, pickled eggplant, and macaroni salad, all crowned by a judicious portion of cucumbers - transcends the realm of culinary indulgence, elevating the dining experience to an unprecedented level of gastronomical nirvana, if you will, and, I dare say, rendering any further embellishment or refinement utterly superfluous."

"The ambiance was enhanced by the melodious strains of good music, which complemented the potent concoctions served at the bar; furthermore, the rooftop terrace offered an expansive view of the surrounding area, although it did tend to get overcrowded, thereby detracting from the overall experience, hence the rating of four stars instead of five. Notwithstanding, gaining entry was a seamless process, and we were not subjected to any cover charge. Additionally, it is worth mentioning that the establishment boasted an impressive connection to the renowned Playboy Club, facilitated by a single, imposing escalator."

While the food here is good, and the service very friendly, the menu seems somewhat limited and isn't as exciting as I've seen in other places.

The food is good, clean, and reliable.

While it was during the week, the place was absolutely empty around 1pm.

Why aren't here more people here?

"Airline reliability and punctuality are paramount, and this carrier excels in both aspects, boasting an impressive on-time record. Additionally, their fleet's overall cleanliness is laudable. As an ardent fan of air travel, I thoroughly enjoy utilizing their services, particularly the early morning red-eye flights that enable me to arrive at my destination feeling refreshed and invigorated. While the complimentary in-flight meals may not be the most delectable or sophisticated, they serve their purpose adequately. Consequently, I highly recommend considering this airline as your first choice for travel between Las Vegas and Honolulu, or vice versa."

After a late night of dancing and gambling... where better to feed the tummy than at the California Hotel.. I think more specifically the Cafe.

Their menu has lots of choices but I only come out this far from the strip for the Ox Tail Soup! and I am not the only one... when you glance around tables they are mostly filled with giant soup bowls and the accompanying bowl of rice.  

It is a bit far from the strip.  This past time I went the cab driver dropped us off in a sketch area because he wasn't sure where to go.... In my past experiences the taxi driver's usually know where to take you. 

The ox tail soup is huge and filled with lots of meats carrots and celery.... sometimes a few floating mushrooms. It is always more than I can finish but always hits the spot, especially in the winter time when it is colder out.

I haven't gambled much here but their tables are on the cheap side.  Yay low table limits! it means I can stretch out my money longer!

After going to Gordon Ramsey's Pub and Grill the night before, this was 100x better. We got there right at 11 so we wouldn't have to wait for a table. This place is clearly popular and there were 10 parties waiting at 11 already so if you have to wait a long time, it should be no bearing on how you rate the restaurant. There were lots of tables, lots of staff, and when we left around 12:30 the place was teeming. 

Our server was very knowledgeable, she explained the menu and gave us her recommendations. Her service was great and she kept checking in on us.

The burgers were delicious - no complaints. We got the sweet potato fries that we could barely finish as there were so many. This place was priced very reasonably considering that it's a Vegas restaurant. For $13-15 a burger, you can't really complain.

Great place and we're sad we didn't get to try the shakes.

My husband and I always enjoy Hef's. The atmosphere is cozy, yet usually hopping and exciting. The clientele is usually quite diverse. Their fried tomatoes are delicious and the drinks are good. Great neighborhood bar.

At the car wash, an establishment specializing in the cleansing of automobiles, one can observe a multitude of patrons eagerly awaiting the transformation of their vehicles from grimy to pristine. The ambiance is enhanced by the rhythmic chanting of "whoa" by those in attendance, further emphasizing the jovial nature of the experience. It is evident that Danny's Family Car Wash, with its numerous locations throughout the valley, has established a successful enterprise, as evidenced by the constant influx of customers and the eagerness of employees to provide expeditious and meticulous service. As a personal testimony, I must confess that I have been remiss in prioritizing the cleanliness of my vehicle, but the sense of satisfaction derived from entering a spotless car is unparalleled. Although the quality of service at Danny's may not be extraordinary, it surpasses my own abilities and saves me valuable time. Furthermore, I recently discovered that visiting the car wash on Tuesdays offers an added benefit, specifically a $2 discount for female patrons. This revelation serves as a reminder to take advantage of this perk in the future. Indeed, being a lady does have certain advantages, even in the realm of automobile maintenance.

Although it is situated within a strip mall and the interior illumination is somewhat dim, this establishment exudes an atmosphere that is both welcoming and informal, making it an ideal setting in which to indulge in comforting cuisine. In the event that your party consists of four individuals or more, you may be compelled to partake of your meal alfresco, utilizing the outdoor seating located at the entrance of the premises. Additionally, there is a minimal counter area where you can consume your repast while simultaneously observing the culinary process involved in creating the aforementioned crepes. My order, the Frisco crepe, consisted of a delectable combination of fresh blueberries enveloped in a tangy lemon curd, further complemented by a generous sprinkling of powdered sugar and a side of rich whipped cream. While this culinary creation proved to be utterly satisfying when accompanied by my unlimited morning coffee, I could not help but crave a slightly more substantial amount of lemon curd within its composition. Regardless, this venue represents an excellent destination for either initiating your crepe-consumption experience or expanding your gastronomical horizons beyond your customary breakfast options, thereby providing a truly enjoyable and multifaceted dining adventure.
I wanted a good burger and got it here. It was cooked to order. Staff were nice....not jerks and not trying to rush you or pressure you. I really liked the onion rings and options for your burger.

"In my family, there exists a rule which stipulates that when purchasing a dwelling, it is essential to ensure that a liquor store is within walking distance. This principle originates from the necessity of maintaining a well-stocked supply during the winter months, when inclement weather may render driving impractical, thereby leaving one and their family confined to their abode for an extended period, with the unpalatable prospect of sobriety looming large. Such a scenario is utterly unthinkable! Hence, I am able to saunter to Mike's establishment, a modest yet comprehensive purveyor of potent potables, boasting an impressive array of vintages, spirits, and brews at prices that are eminently reasonable and devoid of any trace of pretension or haughtiness. During a sweltering summer, I found myself in pursuit of a refreshing vinho verde, a crisp, fruity, and effervescent white wine of Portuguese provenance, ideal for quaffing in abundance while remaining economically feasible. By sheer serendipity, Mike's had a quite respectable selection, available at the remarkably affordable price of $5 per bottle, a true bargain by any standard! In my opinion, such a commendable effort deserves unstinting praise."

Very fresh ingredients. Authentic Italian recipes. To me the decor is very authentic as well. This place delivers too, and fast! I agree that the garlic bread on the hoagie bun isn't the best but the have countless awesome items and I haven't even tried them all. I also didn't like the fried zucchini, but only because I prefer a thin zucchini filet instead of the large chunks.\n\nThe Italian Beef is Amazing! Loved the fettuccine Alfredo. I think I like the Sicilian pizza is one of my favorites of all time. The mattarocca  on it is sooo yummy!

This is a really great hotel.

Perfect location on the Royal Mile: you really can't ask for more - aside from the very steep hill that you have to climb from the train station. I had a perfect view of Arthur's Seat from my room, which encouraged me to get out and go see it.

Interesting older architecture, with a crypt-like bar area. The room was very nice, especially since it had a Nespresso machine in the standard room: a Radisson first for me. Bed enormous and super comfy. TV not great though - the reception was poor and even though the technician came out to take a look, they couldn't make it any better.

The reception service was extremely good, I asked for a restaurant recommendation where I could sit quietly and enjoy a nice meal with my book without being harassed. They fully understood, took me through some options, and then called the restaurant to reserve me a table. Awesome!

"Substantially improved compared to our initial stay, during which the establishment was undergoing transformation from Aladdin to Planet Hollywood, we were pleased to experience notable enhancements upon our return. Specifically, we opted for the 'Hollywood Hip' accommodation for a single night at a cost of $159, inclusive of tax, which afforded us a spacious, two-queen, non-smoking room on the 17th floor. Additionally, we received complimentary amenities, including a free bottle of Skyy Vodka valued at $45, $40 in casino play, and various other coupons. The lodging itself featured a generous size, complete with a 42-inch plasma television for our entertainment while preparing for our evening excursions, as well as a well-appointed bathroom boasting a bathtub, separate shower, and two sinks, accompanied by an ample vanity area for the ladies to prepare. Furthermore, the hotel staff considerately provided us with newspapers and an assortment of OK magazines for our reading pleasure. However, the illumination within the room proved insufficient, leaving the space dimly lit, which the females in our party found particularly bothersome. Moreover, the bathroom experienced excessive heat and humidity, likely due to an overabundance of light sources. Notwithstanding these issues, we generally enjoyed our stay, despite minor shortcomings, such as a bed with lingering stains that we chose not to address given the late hour."

Suite accommodations of generous proportions at a cost-effective price point. A mere ten-minute pedestrian commute to both the basketball arena and the baseball stadium. Strategically positioned in the central business district, surrounded by an abundance of establishments catering to culinary and libational inclinations, all within a stone's throw proximity. No need to consider renting an automobile or utilizing personal transportation, as all essential amenities are conveniently accessible on foot. Eagerly anticipating a future visit during the peak season.

Great find! Had the beef arepa, was pretty good, I also had the chicken salad one, wasn't great.. but what I really loved was there grilled chicken with rice and beans.. delicious!! I have to try the empanada next time, they looked great!

"Despite the dearth of exceptional attributes that would render this drinking establishment truly remarkable, patrons appear to hold a particular fondness for the venue's adult milkshakes, which seemingly compensates for the overall mediocrity of the bar's offerings and ambiance, the latter of which bears an uncanny resemblance to numerous other establishments dotting the Saddlebag Trail, replete with an abundance of speakers that contribute to an atmosphere that, while perhaps not utterly lacking in charm, fails to distinguish itself in any meaningful way from its neighboring counterparts."

Jim and Tabitha, proficient mixologists, excel in their roles as bartenders, providing an exceptional experience for patrons who partake in the establishment's Wednesday comedy night, which offers an enjoyable atmosphere and reasonably-priced fare that satisfies one's gastronomical inclinations.

Since my last visit, during which I had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable offerings, they have opted to replace the erstwhile uncomfortable yet aesthetically pleasing chairs with new, comfortable, cushioned seating options that are, regrettably, somewhat too expansive to accommodate the tables with which they are situated.

Upon initiating our culinary excursion, we elected to commence with the Summer Rolls, which, much to our delight, proved to be substantially larger than anticipated and, similarly, far more scrumptious than expected. The beef enclosed within the rice paper wrapper exhibited a magnificent charcoal-like flavor and was complemented by an array of fresh, crisp vegetables, as well as a hint of invigorating mint that served to enhance its overall appeal, particularly on a sweltering summer day such as this. Furthermore, the accompanying light fish sauce served to augment the flavors of the dish.

My personal selection was the Spicy Stir-Fry, which, although not as fiery as I had anticipated, nevertheless possessed a satisfying piquancy. The white meat chicken was skillfully prepared and infused with a diverse array of flavors, while the dish itself boasted a diverse assortment of fresh, crunchy vegetables enrobed in a sauce that struck a perfect balance between flavors. This particular offering, available for the remarkably reasonable price of $7.25, ranked among the most satisfactory dishes sampled thus far.

Throughout my various visits to this establishment, I have yet to encounter any dish that has failed to meet my expectations. Moreover, I find myself continually impressed by the unique offerings available here, which seem to diverge from the standard fare encountered at other Vietnamese restaurants.

The culinary offerings presented by this eatery appear, on the whole, to be quite consistent and reliable.

"Wow! The portions here are way more generous than I had anticipated. Not to sound overly parsimonious, but the prices had deterred me from frequenting Fuego Bistro for quite some time. The menu boasted an array of delectable options, and I relished my Cuban sandwich - A LOT - during my lunchtime visit; yet, the dinner prices appeared somewhat prohibitive.

Upon returning for happy hour, I indulged in a superlative mojito and savored mouthwatering sliders. However, the notion of dinner still harbored some reservations. Subsequently, I encountered a Groupon, but its stipulations (purchase of two entrees) failed to sway me, personally. My companion, though, possessed a Groupon and proposed meeting at Fuego Bistro for dinner.

Lo and behold! The dinner portions are gargantuan! It's no wonder the prices are what they are. Easily share an entree between two people, or take home leftovers for another meal. My plate was adorned with a veritable plethora of shrimp - at least a dozen, by my estimate. The pork dish boasted mounds of tender, juicy meat. Moreover, you have the liberty to select two sides, all of which are scrumptious.

In conclusion, don't allow the dinner prices to dissuade you from experiencing the culinary delights that Fuego Bistro has to offer. Not only is the food exquisite, but the quantity more than compensates for the cost, both in terms of quality and quantity."

During our inaugural commemoration of conjugal bliss in the city of Las Vegas, we opted to visit the renowned Margaritaville establishment, situated within the premises of the illustrious Flamingo resort. Upon entering the venue, we were immediately struck by the lively ambiance, characterized by the presence of live musical performances. We elected to sample their culinary offerings, specifically the delectable tacos and an array of flavorful margaritas infused with diverse ingredients. Our gastronomical experience was indeed pleasant, and we thoroughly enjoyed the festive atmosphere. Consequently, we would highly recommend this eatery to families with offspring seeking a convivial dining environment.

"In my subjective assessment, the most excellent Vietnamese eatery within the city limits of Las Vegas is indubitably this particular establishment. It is invariably thronged with patrons, particularly during the weekends, which serves as a testament to its gastronomical prowess. The comestibles served by this restaurant are unwaveringly authentic, generously portioned, and have been enthusiastically endorsed by my immediate family. Despite the expeditious manner in which our orders were fulfilled, the quality of service provided by the staff left much to be desired. There were numerous instances wherein our attempts to solicit the attention of the waitstaff were met with indifference or deliberate avoidance, which seemed to suggest that our needs were not of paramount importance. Nonetheless, I am inclined to opine that this shortcoming is offset by the delectability of their culinary offerings."

This establishment purveys an extensive array of alcoholic beverages and associated accoutrements tailored specifically towards adult consumers. Upon entering the premises, I was immediately struck by the sheer volume and diversity of potations available, with row upon row of various wines, beers, champagnes, liquors, and spirits stretching out before me in a meticulously organized display. The staff members present were both cordial and helpful, further enhancing the overall experience. 
  My personal preferences lean towards a particular type of beer that I had previously encountered in Albuquerque, and much to my delight, I discovered that this location carried not only that specific brew but also several other delectable options, such as the Alien Stout and Nut Brown Ale. Additionally, I came across the Wells Banana Bread beer, whose flavor profile surpassed my expectations. 
  While perusing the wine selection, I found it to be somewhat overwhelming due to its vastness, and thus, I opted to defer exploring that particular section of the store for a future visit. However, I do intend to return and sample the Dreaming Tree crush red and Barrymore Pinot Grigio. 
  In order to cater to the diverse needs of their clientele, the store offers an impressive assortment of glassware, ranging from plastic travel wine glasses designed for outdoor consumption to more sophisticated alternatives. Furthermore, they stock a variety of snacks, including refrigerated meats and cheeses courtesy of Boarhead, alongside more modest choices such as chips and snack mixes, albeit at slightly elevated prices. 
  In summary, this establishment provides a comprehensive collection of goods and services, all conveniently housed beneath a single, well-organized roof, thereby catering to the requirements of discerning patrons seeking to indulge in alcoholic beverages. My initial visit has left me thoroughly impressed, and I believe that this venue far surpasses its neighboring competitor, Lee's.

"The quality of instruction provided by the staff and coaches at this establishment is truly exceptional; however, the designated viewing area for parents and guardians leaves much to be desired in terms of both accessibility and comfort. The space is woefully inadequate to accommodate the high volume of spectators, resulting in an overcrowded environment that makes it challenging to secure a seat, particularly during lengthier classes lasting two hours or more. Frequently, parents are compelled to stand for extended periods to observe their children's activities, which can be tiresome and uncomfortable."

"We have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by Root on two separate occasions in recent months. Our initial visit was indeed a remarkable experience, as the atmosphere was conducive to relaxation and enjoyment, with an adequate number of patrons and an ambient level of noise. Our server, a knowledgeable and affable individual, engaged us in a most delightful conversation, discussing various topics such as beer and cuisine, which served to enhance our dining experience. The fare provided by Root was also quite impressive, with their wine list being particularly noteworthy. \n\nHowever, our second visit proved to be somewhat inconsistent in terms of quality when compared to our initial outing. While the edibles were generally satisfactory, the Brussels sprouts, which had been prepared to perfection during our first visit, were unfortunately overcooked on this occasion. Furthermore, our server appeared to be somewhat lacking in his attentiveness and proficiency, as he failed to demonstrate the same level of enthusiasm and dedication to ensuring our satisfaction as his predecessor had done. Thus, our experiences at Root can be characterized as either exceptional or merely average, depending on the specific visit in question."

Update - 05-March-10   They improved the parking system finally.   Good job guys.   \nAlso, kudos to the field workers.   After a spirited rainstorm right before Saturday's race, they worked hard to get the track dry so the race could start.   Good show.

"This gastronomical indulgence constitutes the sole instance of an acceptably palatable pizza I have had the pleasure of consuming within the city limits of Pittsburgh, subsequent to my exposure to a plethora of pizza establishments in close proximity to the Oakland district, thereby rendering all other culinary options in this particular genre utterly irrelevant and inconsequential in light of the unparalleled quality proffered by the esteemed Institution of Independent Pizza Vendors, thereby precipitating an unwavering allegiance to their gustatory offerings whenever the pangs of nostalgia for a genuine New York-style slice impel me to seek satiation."

"Our quest for an idyllic venue for our nuptials culminated in the selection of Bahama Breeze, which proved to be an excellent choice owing to its relaxed ambiance and ample opportunity for socializing with our guests. The gastronomical offerings were indeed delectable, and the 9 pm scheduling of our fete allowed us to indulge in their appetizer buffet, which was relished by all 25 attendees. The atmosphere was characterized by a lighthearted and convivial spirit, and it appeared that everyone partook in the merriment. However, a few instances of staff uncertainty regarding their duties and responsibilities slightly tarnished our experience, leading to a four-star rating. Nonetheless, the staff exhibited warmth and hospitality, and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves."

Their food is amazing. The tatami rooms are just add ons to the whole dining experience.  The unagi bowl is WORTH IT. A little pricy but all sushi places are. If you get tired of buffet, definitely try this place.

A Groupon arrangement rendered this an exceptionally advantageous proposition. Following my initial visit, I assessed that the quantity and caliber of the fare rendered the customary price point at least moderately reasonable. However, upon my return, I noticed that the servings were marginally diminished in magnitude. I attribute this to the fact that the non-Japanese sushi chef lacks comparable proficiency and generosity. Notwithstanding, I am content to convey a generally favorable account of my dining experience.

Sunday at the park with solin.
  we went to spring valley park after searching for dog parks on the Internet and this park had the best recommendations. There are three fenced sections for different dog sizes. so I went into the small one since solin is  a poodle. (dropped at my doorstep) the area is very large' there were a lot of dogs and people at that time, large enough to throw Frisbees for dogs to chase. there's also a water fountain for dogs and dogie bags, not the ones you take home, this are supplied for your convenience so you can clean after your best friend, so please do so! 
  solin  had a great time! he went crazy all over the park like a kid in a candy store. he couldn't mark this place enough, I worried he would dehydrate.
  hey! stop it! (my dogs' smelling another dogs butt) " don't worry " said the owner of the other dog, as she went on telling me  that that's the way dogs get to know each other. " The smell tells them everything about the other dog and they know right away if they're compatible based on the aroma."  Are you serious! I been using e-harmony! .......and she walked away....

Great park for dogs.

I surmise that there are both advantages and disadvantages to having a reasonably decent Mexican restaurant in close proximity to one's domicile. The apparent benefit being the ease of access to delectable cuisine and beverages (typically Dos Equis or Modelo for myself), followed closely by the conspicuous drawback of undermining one's physical fitness regimen for the day. However, I generally relished this eatery, with the exception of its cost. Although, in the overall perspective, it is not excessively expensive, and its prices are comparable to those of other Mexican restaurants. For my part, if I am seeking a convenient, nearby Mexican restaurant, this establishment would certainly be my preference. Nevertheless, if I am intent on economizing, I would venture a few minutes further down WT Harris towards the institution of higher learning and indulge in Zapatas (my utmost favorite).  
I found every other facet of this business to be agreeable. The ambiance and decor were suitably arranged for a Mexican restaurant, creating a pleasant atmosphere. The culinary offerings were skillfully prepared and were quite appetizing. The beverage selection was plentiful. The hospitality was impeccable. What more could one request, truly? This establishment featured specialties, which appeared enticing to the majority. Undoubtedly deserving of a trial visit!

So I found this great little restaurant on Yelp during one of our many Vegas trips and I have to say that I am in love with the french toast sandwich!!!! I'm a huge fan of savory and sweet and this place nailed it to the wall!! Great place to have breakfast after dancing the night away on the Las Vegas strip! I just wish I lived closer because the food here is amaziiiiing and totally crave-worthy!

Ooh, nice! You know somewhere's ok when they deliver your friend a drink with a clockwork monkey on a string. Chessboard floor, plenty of seating, nice downstairs by the looks of things and an efficient, if taciturn, water.

What I really liked was that the instant anyone arrived, the waiter appeared with a weeny tumbler of water to drink while a harder option was decided upon (or not-so-hard, in my case).

There's not much in the way of a written menu - just a price list with names and prices, so you'd have to enquire. I think the idea is you pick one - like a lucky dip, hence the name. That's my guess anyway. I requested a mocktail and was asked not what kind of flavour I'd like, which is the usual question, but what I'd like to avoid. Heh. Interesting. No bananas, please, I say, and off he zooms to create something for me.

Well, full marks for the not-banana. It definitely didn't have any of that in it. Also no coffee or lamb, so we're on a winner here, folks. All the same, it didn't knocktail my socktails off; it seemed to me more like just bitter lemon with a mint sprig. That said, it was very mature - not that sweet and fruity - and lots of lovely crushed ice to play with afterward. Also, it only cost £3.50. Huzzah!

I am fulfilling my civic obligation as a juror twice a week for a duration of four months, which conveniently allows me to explore a previously unfamiliar part of Phoenix during my retirement. Each day, I indulge in culinary excursions to diverse establishments, savoring a variety of delectable dishes. Cartel Coffee Lab, a trendy eatery boasting an eclectic ambiance, offers an array of tantalizing options beyond their specialty coffee drinks, including breakfast, lunch, and possibly dinner. Upon ordering the BLT, I was inquiringly asked if I was agreeable to the presence of an egg on the sandwich, to which I responded affirmatively, having been exposed to a similar variation of the dish, known as a BELT, during my sojourn in Canada. The friendly server, who attended to my needs with remarkable attentiveness, ensured that my dining experience was thoroughly enjoyable, engaging in conversation and expressing genuine interest in my satisfaction with the meal. While I cannot confer a perfect rating without multiple visits, I assure you that the quality of both the nourishment and hospitality at Cartel Coffee Lab warrants a hearty recommendation. I eagerly anticipate my next visit, when I shall relish their espresso offerings and likely upgrade my assessment to a well-deserved five stars.

Staff is really nice. Rooms are adequate. The pool is really large and has waterfalls...and was clean when I was there. I didn't have to wait for anything. Lazy river was neat. The restaurants on site are spendy...but tasty. Great for pool fun w kids.

After having been terrestrially domiciled on this planet for a duration of twenty-seven revolutions of the earth around the sun, I ultimately had the gratification of partaking in a culinary experience of Korean BBQ for the first time in my life, which transpired in Las Vegas of all locations. We relinquished our ten-dollar beverages at XS and decided it was an opportune moment to relax the gastronomical constraints of our belts at D.J.K. Two remarkable individuals of Korean descent navigated us through the menu; alright, that's a slight exaggeration...they placed the orders on our behalf, but I am exceedingly grateful that they did! It is imperative that you sample soju, a potent Korean liquor that complements the cuisine remarkably well. Additionally, if you happen to be present between the hours of eleven o'clock in the evening and two o'clock in the morning, you will receive a twenty percent discount on your total bill.

"This gastronomical establishment, specializing in delectable Italian cuisine, has proven to be the most exceptional in Las Vegas, boasting an impressive menu that includes an array of mouthwatering pizzas and equally tantalizing dinner entrÃ©es. My personal preference is the chicken Marsala, although I have also indulged in the shrimp Alfredo, various pizza options, and focaccia, all of which have garnered unanimous approval from both my local and visiting acquaintances. While placing an order for delivery may present a minor challenge due to the youthfulness of the female staff members, who can sometimes struggle with effectively communicating the details of the order, the expediency of the delivery process and the superior quality of the culinary offerings more than compensate for any initial difficulties. Moreover, the prices at this eatery are eminently reasonable, making it an excellent choice for those seeking a satisfying dining experience without breaking the bank."

"Indubitably, my experience during the latter portion of the twentieth century's final decade was characterized by an unwavering fondness for this establishment, which served as the culinary epicenter of my inaugural visit to this city in over a decade and a half. My gastronomical expectations were not only met but exceeded, particularly with regard to the succulent crawfish appetizer that preceded the main course. It is utterly inconceivable that I would tolerate such an extended hiatus before once again partaking in the delectable offerings of this esteemed eatery."

Great concept, basically as much toppings you want for $12.

The pizza is the perfect size for 1 person too. The crust is nice and thin. So you can easily finish this by yourself without feeling guilty of eating all those calories.

I was glad to hear that there is another branch in Hillcrest, San Diego. So I will definitely stopping by that restaurant as well.

Again, the pizza is good. Good quality, and choose your toppings or just go for their standard menu, all for $12 per pizza.

"Tremendously delectable tacos and an ambiance that exudes an air of intriguing uniqueness! As an individual who frequently embarks on journeys to Texas, I must say that the quality of these tacos rivals, and perhaps even surpasses, the culinary excellence of those which I actively seek out during my sojourns in the Lone Star State."

"We visited this establishment for a midday repast with Rand H., and our culinary experience was rather satisfactory, boasting an extensive array of approximately 40 diverse items, analogous to the customary Indian smorgasbord in scope. The preliminary liquid offerings, specifically the egg drop and hot and sour varieties, were indeed delectable, prompting me to partake in a bowl of each. The primary dishes, encompassing a multitude of flavors and textures, were executed with remarkable proficiency, warranting top marks - five stars, to be precise. However, their concluding sweet course, comprising jello, sliced peaches, and those minuscule, gelatinous spheres commonly referred to as lychee, proved somewhat lacking in quality. Notwithstanding this minor shortcoming, we enjoyed a superlative luncheon at a most reasonable tariff of $5.75; regrettably, the hospitality we received fell slightly short of excellence, thereby precluding a perfect five-star rating. Nonetheless, in light of the exceptional culinary prowess displayed, I confer upon them a respectable four stars."

This review is only for the crepe I had...it definitely satisfied my crepe-craving and sweet tooth! It had nutella, whipped cream, caramel, chocolate sauce, bananas, and candied hazelnuts. There is no possible way to have a bad day in Vegas when you start off breakfast like this ;)

"My culinary experiences at this establishment have been consistently satisfying, with the ambiance and outdoor seating being particularly noteworthy. Following my initial visit, I opted to reserve judgment until I had sampled their offerings on multiple occasions. Now, having patronized them thrice, I can confidently attest to the delectability of their fare. However, it is unfortunate that the quality of their service has been inconsistent, with prolonged waiting periods and momentary lapses in attention to detail. Notwithstanding these drawbacks, the merits of their gastronomic creations and overall ambiance warrant further exploration."
Nicer thrift store, many items to choose from, they got rid of there 99 cent days, and half price/99 sent colored tags. not too much junk. overall a trip worth while, especially for cloths! ;)

Tonights vacation dinner destination was Bandera, located in Old Town Scottsdale. We heard lots of good reviews for Bandera, and were excited to try it. Bandera is also a sister restaurant to Houstons and The Rutherford Grill (both 5-star ratings from me).

We got there about a half hour earlier than our reserved time, and enjoyed a drink and the Deviled Egg app on the patio. Our table was ready in no time. We ordered the Grilled Artichoke and Cornbread sides...the artichoke was fantastic. The cornbread was the best I've ever had. For my main course, I ordered the Steak and Enchilada. The 6oz filet was sliced into three small pieces and had a maroon spicy sauce on the side. The enchilada had their signature rotisserie chicken inside. Both were tasty.

The wifey had the Macho Salad. The salad arrived and for whatever reason, it was missing the rotisserie chicken. They quickly corrected it, and she enjoyed it quite a bit.

I liked Bandera, but it was a touch off. Maybe it has something to do with the Mexican fusion? Good, but not as good as their sister restaurants. 4-stars.

I am rating the massage therapist who did an amazing job working on my knots a few days ago. Her name is Miranda! She is one of those who needs a little warm up to get her to talk. Skinny girl but with such strong hands and fingers! She seems to be knowledgeable about what she does. I will be back to see her in less than a month!\n\nThis branch is clean and most of the staff seem friendly. I can't remember the name of the girl at the front desk. She is nice but very business-like, does not have that cozy/friendly/welcoming type of personality.

The theaters are all very nice and still looking brand new. The snack bar has a wide variety of snacks for the little ones. My oldest ordered corn dog bites! The cashier at the snack bar even had it delivered to our theater since they took a while to prepare.

During my visit to the establishment amidst the culinary celebration known as "Montreal poutine week," I had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable brisket poutine, which boasted exceptional quality in terms of the taste and presentation of the meat; however, it is worth noting that the service we received was somewhat sluggish, resulting in a wait time of approximately half an hour for our poutine, and given the limited seating capacity of the venue, it may be advisable to opt for takeaway instead.

This establishment evokes memories of the coffee shop iteration of the boba store where I am employed, which I find rather peculiar. Upon entering and departing, we were cordially greeted by the staff, who exhibited a relaxed and accommodating demeanor. The pricing system was straightforward and reasonable, with amounts rounded to the nearest dollar, which I greatly appreciate. I opted for a soy iced latte, which was quite impressive, boasting a distinct earthy quality that differed from the customary coffee beans I am accustomed to. The flavor was neither overpowering nor bitter, striking a perfect balance between strength and subtlety. The welcoming ambiance of the interior design beckoned me to linger with companions, engaging in one of the various board games available. However, my primary intention was to utilize the venue for academic purposes, thus I refrained from indulging in the diverse amenities offered. Unfortunately, the cashier professed unfamiliarity with the renowned grouchy cookies, much to my surprise. Notwithstanding this, I was pleased to discover prompt and hassle-free Wi-Fi connectivity. Regrettably, the distance between this establishment and my residence precludes me from visiting more frequently, as I would have liked.

"Tammy Coe Cakes has emerged as a culinary haven in Phoenix, boasting an array of delectable edibles that have captured the palates of local gastronomes, while the hospitable nature of its staff has fostered a sense of belonging among patrons, thereby solidifying the establishment's reputation as a cherished component of the city's epicurean landscape."
Was looking for WOC's and the sales person was really friendly to my surprise. I would def come back here if they have stock.  Better lucky next time for me.

i'm only 5'2\" and i had to get some low rise jeans hemmed...this place is prompt, does great work, and is quite kind.... Not the lowest price, but well worth what they charge which wasn't much more than a typical tailor..

This place was discovered purely by accident.  I wanted some noodle dish and i was near my old high school I googled good noodle places on my phone...this place.came up...i was like why not just try it for take out...i pulled up and i walked in and looked at the menu...i was so confused...tbey have italian and asian choices...i was like great this place cannot be too good if they are offering two types of food...but i was there already so i was going to try it...i was conflicted i love italian but i wanted asian so i got a staple...pad thai...it was delicious...full of flavor and i was very impressed! Since then i have been back and this place is good...i go here if i am in the area...its super casual...i love to take the food home and eat if while watching my reality tv and desperate housewives show...good place you should try it!

There are not much dim sum places here in Vegas. One of the very few I go to is Orchids Garden. \n\nCompared to the other dim sums I tasted, this one is not bad. They have variety of choices, the price is modest and the place is huge.

Mango, chili, lime, oh my! This pie is awesome. The first bite is strange as it's spicy, yet rich and tart. Go past the first bite and you'll be back for more (if you can handle the spice!). \n\nI enjoy Mama Toledo's!

We visited this establishment during their happy hour promotion approximately two weeks prior to composing our assessment, but unfortunately, we were unable to provide our feedback in a timely manner as the business had already ceased operations by the time we were prepared to share our thoughts, with said closure occurring in June of 2013, thereby rendering our intended review obsolete.

Mon Ami Gabi is one of the few places in Vegas that I felt was good value for the price. I had breakfast here one morning and ordered the Blueberry French Toast, and I must say, it was delicious. Large slices of bread, fresh blueberries, whipped cream and blueberry syrup on top. Yum!

"Four stars for reasonable prices and satisfactory culinary offerings, albeit marred by an unfortunate encounter with a certain staff member, Sabrina, whose lackadaisical demeanor and inadequate communication skills unfortunately tarnished an otherwise pleasant dining experience; specifically, upon being seated at a booth, the aforementioned employee approached our table to take our order, at which point I politely requested that my spouse and I be accorded separate tickets, owing to our preference for individualized checks, but was met with resistance and an inflexible application of restaurant policy, with no attempt made to elucidate the underlying rationale or justify the disparate treatment vis-Ã -vis adjacent booths, leading to our reluctant decision not to return, which regrettably highlights the pervasive problem of indifferent customer service in certain establishments, perpetuating a negative stereotype of disengaged employees in less prestigious vocations."

Dear AMC Rainbow Promenade,

It appears that 1990 has contacted us to reclaim its movie theater, which we presume has become somewhat antiquated and is in dire need of a comprehensive renovation. Indeed, it is reasonable to assume that this cinema was once a bustling hub of activity, boasting state-of-the-art technology and a vibrant atmosphere that attracted numerous moviegoers during its heyday. However, with the advent of modern multiplexes featuring luxurious reclining seats, cutting-edge surround sound systems, and expansive screens, this particular theater seems to have fallen behind in terms of popularity and amenities. It raises the question of when was the last time an AMC 10 was encountered, as it appears that larger, more contemporary theaters such as AMC 20 or 30 have become the norm. Nonetheless, there is a certain charm and appeal associated with cinemas like this one. Not only do they offer consistently affordable prices and friendly staff, but they also provide an unpretentious and tranquil environment that allows the primary focus to be on the movie itself and the company of those watching it, rather than being distracted by excessive frills and lavishness.

In essence, while the absence of extravagant features may detract from the overall experience, the simplicity and intimacy of this theater can transform an ordinary movie-watching experience into a pleasurable and memorable occasion, especially when combined with good company and an enjoyable film.

Yelp Personal Challenge - (045/366)

"The young gentleman, Kiddo, entered the photography studio for his senior portrait session, adhering to a prearranged appointment. Following a brief interval of approximately fifteen minutes, during which time he changed into his formal attire, he emerged from one of the rear studios. Subsequently, a thorough examination and evaluation of the diverse photographs and poses ensued, resulting in an exceptional quality of images. The studio's proficiency and expertise were evident in their ability to capture the essence of the moment and portray it in a visually appealing manner. Additionally, they offered a unique opportunity to take supplementary photographs in casual attire, which proved to be an excellent complement to the traditional graduation gown shot. Ultimately, my satisfaction with the experience and the quality of the photographs led me to recommend this studio to my acquaintances and loved ones, with a return factor of eighty-five percent."

I derive immense pleasure from experiencing the opulent ambiance of Encore, which rivals that of its esteemed counterpart, the Wynn. The lavish decor, replete with vibrant hues and delicate butterfly motifs, creates an atmosphere of unparalleled elegance that imbues me with a sense of affluence merely by traversing its grandiose premises. Furthermore, the resort boasts an impressive array of gastronomic establishments that cater to discerning palates. Notwithstanding its refined allure, Encore remains relatively unfrequented compared to other high-end properties, thereby ensuring a tranquil and undisturbed experience for patrons. The assortment of expertly crafted cocktails available at various on-site watering holes serves as an added inducement, while the picturesque pool area offers a serene oasis amidst the frenetic energy of Las Vegas. Moreover, the accommodation's parking facilities prove convenient and easily accessible, further enhancing the overall enjoyment of one's stay. Alas, the prohibitive cost of indulging in the resort's gaming options unfortunately precludes my participation, as the minimum betting requirements hover around a hundred dollars per hand. Nonetheless, I find solace in the fact that Encore remains an aesthetically pleasing venue, ideal for leisurely strolls and casual exploration.

Omg, best dinner ever, try the meatballs for an appetizer !!!!! It's unassuming how good it was going to be but we will be BAck next time we are in Vegas. Good value as it was not I the casino. I enjoyed the sangria? Although don't sit overlooking the mall, it's very warm by there. Sit inside the resturaunt

"It is common knowledge that individuals harbor animosity towards this establishment, and I must initiate my discourse by emphasizing that I abstain from consuming animal products. Consequently, I am unable to provide an assessment of the kabob; however, it appears to be somewhat pricey. Nevertheless, they offer an array of alternative cuisine that is not necessarily inferior in quality. I have partaken of vegetarian sandwiches and similar items here that have been quite satisfactory, and their prices are more reasonable than those of the kabob. Additionally, they possess a menu comparable to that of a pizzeria (albeit under a distinct name and contact information), which features exceptional pies that are delivered with remarkable expediency, even during inclement weather conditions."

The true eastside contender.  Sakana is a real deal Ayce ace.  

Appetizers like dynamite and nigiri are second to no other ayce sushi joint.  With fresh and oversized cuts of fish.  You have got to give these guys a try.  Rice ratio is still the best feature to this restaurant.  Gone are the no limit uni, sweet shrimp, fresh oyster and deserts.  Those have now joined the ranks of the "1 per".  Sadly there were no uni and fresh oyster today.  All that aside it is still an excellent choice for a man vs. sushi night!

The fried stuff was great.  The specialty rolls were good.  The star of the show for me was definitely the Super White and the Garlic Tuna.  My meal mates were definitely impressed with the quality for ayce.  Lobster and Popcorn Lobster Rolls had them smiling today.  The Bulgogi was not the favorite for them.  Indulge in the Quail Egg.  

I feel bad for ordering a bite more than we could chew.  It's a mistake giving everyone a turn at the ordering sheet.  They kindly did not charge us for the last 2 rolls that we over ordered..  Thanks guys!  Service will be courteous and pleasant here.  I am willing to restore the missing star in this rating if they have Uni next time we come.  Yes there will be a return visit from us!

I am delighted to be cognizant of the fact that this establishment has been reopened under novel administration. Prior to its closure, I would have likely accorded this eatery two stars or fewer, due to my perception that the premises were consistently unclean and my concern that such lack of attention to tidiness in the work environment might raise questions regarding the quality of their culinary offerings. However, since this particular Burger King has resumed operations, it appears to have undergone a considerable transformation for the better. The personnel are meticulous in their approach, exhibiting a high level of friendliness and promptness. Additionally, the venue is now noticeably more sanitary. I sincerely hope that this upward trend will persist.

"Based solely on their delectable pastries, which showcase an unparalleled level of culinary mastery and expertise in the art of baking, I would unhesitatingly bestow upon this establishment a perfect rating of five stars. However, my evaluation process does not succumb to such superficiality and shallow assessments, but rather encompasses a holistic approach that takes into account various other aspects of the dining experience, including the quality of the food, the ambiance, and the service. Thus, I shall provide a comprehensive review that reflects my genuine sentiments and impressions of this restaurant, without being unduly influenced by my admittedly immense fondness for their sublime pastries.

The dining area exudes a warm and inviting ambiance, with the option to sit outside and savor the delicious fare amidst the picturesque surroundings. The service has consistently demonstrated exceptional quality, with the staff exhibiting a keen attention to detail, prompt responsiveness, and an unwavering commitment to ensuring the utmost satisfaction of their patrons.

My personal preferences, while not exhaustive, include a few select items that have earned a special place in my heart and taste buds. These include, but are not limited to, the flavorsome hummus, the delectable gyro, the crispy flatbread pizzas, and last, but certainly not least, the mouthwatering pastries that have captured my palate and left me in a state of unabashed delight. In conclusion, this restaurant has secured a place among my favorites, and I eagerly look forward to my next visit, when I can once again indulge in their culinary masterpieces."

Service was great and so was the food.  I now want to open my own \"sliders\" restaurant after enjoying the chicken parm sliders.  Great selection of beers and several options for tasting flights.  Their deserts looked amazing but we didn't save room.  Overall, great experience and one of the most reasonably priced meals we ate while in LV.

I didn't stay here but I came here to walk around and shop! Planet Hollywood would be a really good place to stay at because its kinda in the middle of the strip plus SHOPPING!!! They have sooooooo many stores inside! I love all the lights outside of this place and inside its just so fun! I think I can spend hours inside shopping..=)

This establishment proved to be exceptional, boasting impressive attributes such as efficient and friendly service, an accommodating staff, and a superior quality of food. Specifically, the pace at which our orders were fulfilled was quite rapid, almost instantaneous, which greatly enhanced our dining experience. Furthermore, the presentation of the dishes was aesthetically pleasing, with each item being carefully arranged to create a visually appealing composition. However, I must admit that I would have preferred it if they had offered sashimi as an alternative to sushi, as this would have allowed me to better appreciate the natural flavor and texture of the fish without the distraction of rice. Nonetheless, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who takes pleasure in indulging in sushi, as the portions are thoughtfully designed to provide an optimal balance of ingredients. Overall, this dining establishment is certainly worthy of praise and recognition for its commitment to providing an exceptional culinary experience.

"Indubitably, the culinary experience offered by this establishment is of unparalleled excellence, with the GARLIC CHICKEN accompanied by an abundance of savory gravy being a personal favorite. The portions are copious, and the prices, reasonable. Although, it must be noted that the Adobo can, at times, exhibit a propensity towards excessive saltiness. Nonetheless, the Adobo Fried Rice Omelet transcends mere culinary indulgence, reaching an apogee of gastronomical delight. A word of caution, however, the establishment's seeming indecision regarding their expansion into California may prove to be a hindrance to their otherwise well-deserved success. An expedited resolution is recommended."
What's not to love! Old town Las Vegas. Tons of lights.\nZipline. Lights. Gambling. Lights. Great food. Lights.\nA must in anyone's lifetime. And can I say this again ... I won here too!

We had a wonderful time no problems and staff were very friendly. We tried to extend our stay from four nights to seven but they were booked up solid. Shuttle was excellent with grocery runs and trips to the strip. We will be back !!!

We are situated approximately one-quarter of a mile away from this exceptional eatery. Formerly known as the Brown Bag Sandwich shop, I had the pleasure of dining there on several occasions throughout the year. However, since its transformation into the Arizona Sandwich Company, I have had the privilege of indulging in their delectable offerings on a weekly basis, and for valid reasons. All of the sandwiches I have had the pleasure of consuming have been utterly sublime. The bread, with its unparalleled softness akin to a goose down pillow, is truly a culinary masterpiece. Each dish is served with an ample portion, irrespective of the item selected. Their sides are scrumptious, and the assortment of desserts, while not typically within my gastronomical purview, appear utterly captivating. The staff, having familiarized themselves with our presence, graciously welcomes us by name upon arrival, fostering a sense of warmth and hospitality. The daily specials are an unmitigated delight, rendering the need to peruse the menu futile. Unwavering in their excellence, I have yet to encounter a single disappointment. Furthermore, keen patrons may capitalize on a frugal $2 sandwich by remaining vigilant and responsive to the establishment's Facebook updates. Offering a swift and seamless dining experience, the venue boasts an impressive proximity to the intersection of University and 52nd streets, directly east of the QuikTrip. Moreover, the efficiency of the restaurant enables a speedy in-and-out duration of fewer than fifteen minutes, catering conveniently to the hectic schedules of its clientele. You are cordially invited to partake in the indulgence.

The Times Square Neighborhood Restaurant is a neighborhood jewel. Breakfast is tasty at a totally reasonable price. Dinner of pizza and wings were some of the best we have ever had. A great local restaurant with excellence service, great beers on tap, and authentic Italian food at such a reasonable price. Don't pass this place....it truly is a must try!

"I am utterly dismayed in my own ability to have postponed visiting this culinary gem for such an extended period! I halted by on a Friday evening and was able to partake in a swift and expedient dining experience, completing my meal in a remarkably brief span of time! 

I opted for the customizable bowl option, selecting succulent steak, flavorful rice, and a vibrant broccoli accompaniment, all unified by a savory spicy teriyaki sauce. The sauce was presented separately, allowing me to tailor the intensity of spiciness to my individualized preference. The resultant fusion of tastes was a resounding success, as the sauce complemented the straightforward yet delectable ingredients flawlessly. 

This eatery boasts an extensive array of sushi, bowls, and salads, with prices that are eminently reasonable considering the generous portions dispensed. 

The interior design of the restaurant exuded modernity and spotlessness, while the staff exhibited brisk efficiency and warm friendliness. 

The sole drawback preventing this establishment from attaining a perfect five-star rating was the fact that the steak, although cooked to my liking, was slightly cooler in temperature compared to the remainder of the dish, and its lack of complete slicing made it difficult to thoroughly combine with the other components when I vigorously shook the bowl."

We had the pleasure of partaking in a delectable luncheon at this esteemed eatery in the company of some acquaintances during our sojourn in this charming town. The delay in being seated was approximately twenty minutes; however, the ambiance of the outdoor seating area, replete with a live musical performance and a picturesque view of Scottsdale and Camelback, more than compensated for the brief wait. I opted for the Market Sunflower salad, which boasted an array of flavorsome ingredients including blackened chicken, goat cheese, bacon, dried strawberries, blueberries, sunflower seeds, and my spouse chose the Smoked Turkey Ciabatta, featuring gouda cheese, bacon, sweet tomato, and roasted red pepper aioli. My culinary experience was thoroughly enjoyable, as I relished every bite of my salad; however, my husband's satisfaction with his sandwich was somewhat diminished, despite the fact that the sweet potato chips served alongside it were undeniably scrumptious. I would unhesitatingly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying repast.

Who would have conjectured that Las Vegas would eventually gain recognition for their sandwiches? Well, I am now convinced that they have accomplished such a feat, subsequent to savoring "Earl of Sandwich" within the Planet Hollywood hotel and casino. I placed an order for "The Full Montagu," which turned out to be a sizzling hot roast beef sandwich, complemented by turkey, Swiss, and cheddar cheese, lettuce, and, of course, the renowned "Earl's mustard sauce." I decided to omit the tomatoes, as I have come to realize that, at times, tomatoes possess an excessive amount of juiciness, which has the potential to overwhelm my sandwich, causing it to become somewhat disrupted;). Anyway, I also had the opportunity to sample the "Earl's grey lemonade," which I found to be relatively satisfactory, not excessively sweetened. The majority of individuals might argue that the most appealing aspect of a sandwich lies within the meat or the sauce, however, I firmly believe that it was the "Earl's artisan bread" that truly won me over. It managed to maintain a perfect balance between being robust enough to securely hold the meat and toppings, while simultaneously retaining a soft texture that prevented it from becoming soggy. Therefore, if you ever find yourself in Vegas and desire an alternative to the customary buffet, I highly recommend indulging in a sandwich at "Earl of Sandwich!"

What is there a better way to gain couple more pounds after dinner at Windsor, go next door to Churn!  I was so full after dinner, but couldn't resist the unique ice cream flavors, retro candies, vintage/silly toys, and bakery goodies all displayed around Churn.  My Niece had the Peach and Honey ice cream.  She didn't like it at all.  The pure honey overpowered the peach taste, which sounded good but was too sweet.   I had the traditional butter pecan ice cream sandwich.  You get to select from the baked cookies on the counter and the ice cream flavor.  Unfortunately, the ice cream wasn't frozen so it melted too quickly on a hot summer day.   I will probably wait until it's a little cooler to try other flavors on a pretzel cone.

"Although the prices were not excessively affordable, the quality of the cuisine was palpably superior, yet the hospitality was regrettably subpar. Our servers, despite their cordial demeanor, demonstrated a conspicuous lack of familiarity with both the menu offerings and the ingredients comprising the dishes they served. We sampled an array of sushi rolls, and my personal preference was unequivocally the unadorned avocado roll, featuring generous portions of fresh, succulent avocado. The mixed tempura dish did not meet our expectations, and we would not recommend it. However, the Monkey Brains appetizer proved to be a delightful surprise, diverging from our initial assumptions. Essentially, it consisted of a stuffed mushroom cap, filled with spicy tuna and enrobed in a light tempura batter, subsequently deep-fried to a golden crisp. Furthermore, the Lychee Martini deserves special mention, boasting a potency that was thoroughly enjoyable, coupled with an exceptional flavor profile. Notwithstanding the aforementioned drawbacks, we might consider revisiting this establishment during happy hour, when the Teppanyaki experience is available at half price."

"An exceptional venue for a leisurely Saturday repast, we were promptly accommodated, occupying a table adjacent to a picturesque window offering an incomplete perspective of the aquatic recreational area and arboreal tropicana, which proved to be a pleasant visual supplement to our culinary experience. Each member of our group relished their individual dish; my sibling and I opted to share the deconstructed Filet Benedict, which was thoughtfully divided by our server, while I also savored every sip of their signature Bloody Mary. One of our companions chose the Exotic Coconut Pancakes, featuring a diminutive coconut and mango butter, striking the perfect balance between sweetness and flavor, resulting in an unforgettable gustatory indulgence. An ideal setting for a relaxed yet refined breakfast."

"I have been conducting an exhaustive search for an exceptional breakfast establishment within my locality, and my culinary quest has ultimately led me to Parson's, a quaint, family-owned eatery that exudes a warm and welcoming ambiance. Despite its somewhat worn exterior, this cozy venue boasts an interior that is brimming with character and charm, which is further accentuated by the friendly demeanor of the staff. The proprietor maintains a hands-on approach, working closely with the team to ensure that every dish is prepared to perfection. The pancakes, in particular, are nothing short of sublime, representing the epitome of a traditional breakfast treat. The speed at which the food is delivered from the kitchen is truly impressive, and the quality of the cuisine is undeniable. In conclusion, Parson's is an unparalleled breakfast spot that should not be overlooked or underestimated, and I would advise ignoring the review of Jennifer D, whose perspective may be skewed by her residence in Snottsdale, a location where the concept of a genuine breakfast experience may be somewhat distorted."

The culinary experience was utterly superb, with the pho and fried rice being particularly delectable. Despite our enthusiasm for the meal, we encountered a minor hiccup in the form of unfulfilled expectations regarding the spring rolls, which regrettably did not materialize even after a polite reminder. Nonetheless, the satisfaction derived from the primary dishes was sufficient to preclude any lingering feelings of hunger, thereby rendering the oversight relatively inconsequential. Suffice it to say, we are eagerly anticipating our next visit to this gastronomic haven.

The only reason I didn't give this place five stars is cause it can be difficult to park near the back of Town Square where the theatre is during peak times. Beside that this place is definitely one of the nicest in Vegas. It is not as cheap as some of the other ones but the nice auditoriums, seats, and presentation make up for the added price. Additionally you have all the bars, eateries, and shops surrounding it so you can do other stuff easily before or after all within walking distance. This is the only theatre I have ever been to that has armed, yes several armed guards walking around inside, not sure how to feel about that. I have never really gone during the day but they have a lot of facilities for kids if you have them. Overall a really cool place worth the price.
Food was great and the atmosphere was lovely. The drinks were a little pricy, even tho it was happy hour. service was a little slow tooo.

I've been the Drai's twice now. The first night they closed guest list early, before 11:30pm. So our group of 3 ladies had to pay $20 each. Disappointing. The second time we were on guest again. Ladies were free and guys were $40 Saturday night Labor Day Weekend, which is a good deal. Guest list line moves fast.

The venue itself is spacious and elegant. It's like Marquee and XS in the sense that there's dance floor inside and a pool outside. Bars are located on opposite side of the dance floor. 

The highlight of Drai's are the lights. The LED screens, the LED disco ball, the lasers. Whoo fun stuff. Great DJs. 

BTW Drais is located at the Cromwell hotel, with free valet parking. Just tip the valet please!

Cheapest place to buy liquor.
For all the Californians, think of...Bev Mo!! 
$24 for a 750ml bottle of Hennessy. 

You can't go wrong with that!!!

"I am thoroughly delighted to witness the grand opening of Downtown Summerlin, boasting an impressive array of retail establishments, eateries, and services. Its striking resemblance to Town Square and prime location alongside the 215 freeway only add to its appeal. As a resident in close proximity, I have had the pleasure of observing its meticulous development, and I eagerly anticipate the arrival of additional reputable businesses, such as Earl of Sandwich and GAP, which would otherwise require an arduous trek to Fashion Show Mall. Furthermore, the luxury Regal cinema offers a welcoming ambiance tailored specifically for adults."

"Happy Hour reigns supreme, offering an unparalleled culinary experience with its delectable chips, salsa, and bean dip that are simply sublime. I frequent this establishment with regularity during happy hour and consistently indulge in their extraordinary Mexican Pizza, which boasts an unrivaled flavor profile. Additionally, their margaritas are a masterclass in mixology, expertly crafted to delight the palate. The service at this venue is also exceptional, thanks in large part to the friendly and attentive demeanor of Letty, who tends bar with remarkable proficiency."

We procured an exceptional offer from Hotwire for our temporary lodging at the MGM, which amounted to a mere $50 per night, inclusive of an unparalleled panoramic view of the renowned Las Vegas Strip. My incredulity was piqued by the hotel's economical pricing, given its opulent interior design, spotless ambiance, and expansive windows that afforded an unobstructed perspective of the city's vibrant nightlife. Although slightly irksome, the green light emanating from the exterior did not significantly impinge upon our enjoyment; we quickly acclimated to its presence following the second night of our stay. Furthermore, we were presented with a discount of $20 on the MGM buffet, which we deemed utterly worthwhile due to the culinary delights served, including an array of delectable morning mimosas that proved an ideal elixir for alleviating the effects of a late night revelry. Based on our thoroughly satisfactory experience, we would unhesitatingly reserve accommodations at the MGM via Hotwire in the future, as it fulfilled our expectations of a Las Vegas hotel by offering a combination of immaculate amenities, reasonable rates, and a prime location.

C'est le " first kiss" bar par excellence! Mesdames si on vous y invite il est fort possible qu'il  "mouve". Éclairage aux lampions, musique rétro propice à la détente, plein de recoins intimes et des drinks servi dans un bol (un peu comme un punch)... Une fois envoûté par la musique et enivré par l'alcool un peu trop sucré vous tomberez peut-être sous le charme comme sous la mitraille... 

Pourquoi 4/5: Les proprios de Big in Japan réussissent avec se bar ,ce qu'il ne sont pas arrivé à réaliser avec leur resto. Un endroit unique et original à Montréal. Ils ont transformés un bar crade en un endroit presque parfait. Se fut un coup de foudre instantané. 
Si ça vous intéresse et avez les $$$$$, vous pouvez acheter votre bouteilles de whisky. Elle sera suspendu bien en vue maintenu par un aimant au dessus du bar.... dépêchez-vous le nombre d'espaces disponibles sont limités! 
Mesdames si je vous y invite un soir de scotch et de brouillard vais-je y faire un " mouve" sentimental... et bien non pour le "first kiss" je préfère les parcs et les ruelles... mais ça c'est une autre histoire....

We paid a visit to The Keg for our evening meal and experienced a truly enjoyable dining experience, characterized by attentive and expeditious service, a culinary delight that left us exceedingly satisfied, and an atmosphere that exuded elegance and refinement.

Upon being seated, we were immediately attended to by a courteous and proficient server who presented us with menus and offered recommendations from the extensive offerings. The goat cheese appetizer, which we opted to initiate our meal with, was sublimely prepared, its rich, velvety texture and subtle tang impeccably balanced, thereby eliciting immense gratification.

Furthermore, the mixed greens that constituted the salad course were crisp and fresh, their flavors enhanced by a judicious application of dressing that avoided overpowering the palate. Likewise, the vegetables accompanying the entree were cooked to perfection, retaining their natural sweetness and firm texture without being overcooked or mushy.

For my main course, I requested a rare filet, which, upon its arrival, proved to be a masterful execution of the chef's craft, boasting a tender, juicy texture and a satisfying, deep red hue. While it would have been even more exceptional had it been served with a slightly greater quantity of blood, this minor shortcoming did not detract from the overall excellence of the dish.

Similarly, my spouse's selection of filet and crab was likewise impressively prepared, each component cooked to perfection and harmonizing beautifully with the other elements on the plate. Of particular note was the coffee, whose quality equaled that of the delectable creme brulee we sampled during a previous visit, constituting a welcome surprise given our past experience.

In conclusion, The Keg presents itself as a superlative alternative to more expensive establishments such as Ruth's Chris and Morton's, offering a dining experience that is every bit as satisfying while being more budget-friendly. Therefore, it is with great enthusiasm that I recommend this esteemed eatery to those seeking a sophisticated culinary adventure.

"An exceptional golf facility situated within the picturesque confines of Arizona State University's campus, featuring a state-of-the-art clubhouse that offers an extensive array of ASU merchandise and serves delectable, moderately priced meals during the daytime hours."

Located in Ocean Terminal this is a rather large branch of Clinton Cards with a fabulous range of cards, wrapping paper, stationary and gifts. I spent a lot longer than I should have done in here and picked up a few bargains along the way.

As an animal lover, I was delighted that they had a range of little compact mirrors, pencils, pens and key rings with animals on them. Everything in the very cute range was reduced to 99p so I snapped up a few of the little compacts.

I was hysterical when I noticed the most bizarre gift ever in the wedding section. It was a box saying "Congratulations on your Wedding Day" and inside was the cheapest looking bobble head black cat wearing a diamante collar and earrings. What? I don't know much about weddings and am not sure if this is some kind of tradition but I've certainly never heard of it before and it really was the most bizarre thing I've ever seen. I would love to see the look on the happy couples face when they open that up. Don't count on getting an invite to the Golden Anniversary party if you turn up to the wedding with such a gift. I urge everyone to go in to see it - it's hilarious!

Aside their odd choice of wedding gifts, this branch of Clinton Cards is well stocked, very well organised and the staff are friendly too.

During the diurnal hours, a most agreeable and tranquil ambiance permeates the establishment, complemented by an excellent beverage commonly referred to as coffee. In the evening, this atmosphere of relaxation is further enhanced by the presence of live musical performances or open-mic nights featuring local talent. Unfortunately, the location of this establishment within a commercial strip mall serves as a notable drawback.

Groupon led me in and I was real anxious to try it. I'd driven by it for years on the way to Charlotte and the curiosity led me to buy a Groupon for half off. I was very pleased. The food had a lot of flavor. I had the egg plant dish and it was the best I'd had. There spaghetti sauce was liken to an old family recipe. Their cheese bread complimented the meal beautifully. The atmosphere made it much better, it was a homey place with artsy designs and the staff were very welcoming and helpful. I'd love to go back soon, I'd say the food was very authentic just like the owners.

I have been eating here about once a week for about 2 years. The food is consistently very good, with large portions and good quality ingredients. When I moved from Henderson to Summerlin I was worried that I wouldn't find a Chinese take out anywhere as good as China A Go Go, but this comes pretty close. Some of my favorites include Singapore Noodles, War Wonton Soup, and Chicken w/broccoli. The only improvement I'd really like to see is them taking American Express (they only take Visa & MC), but I understand why they don't.

"While in Las Vegas, I found myself in dire need of both a pedicure and manicure, and thus, I ventured into this establishment sans appointment and waited merely ten minutes on a Thursday during the lunch hour. I opted for Jimmy's expertise in performing the pedicure, selecting the stone variety priced at forty-five dollars, yet, upon adding gel, the cost increased by twenty-five dollars. Additionally, I requested the ombre nail appearance, thereby incurring an additional five-dollar charge. Although the total cost may seem exorbitant, it's essential to note that such services are significantly more expensive in my native Hawaii. Tuyet competently executed the manicure, utilizing gel polish and incorporating an accent nail, resulting in a forty-dollar fee. Despite the steep price point, I deemed it a worthy investment for the desired aesthetic. In the event of a future visit to this location, I would undoubtedly return to this salon."

Pros: 24/7, service great, We were hungry so just about anything would have been good. I had the asian lettuce cups. Made to perfection. Hubby hada mushroom swiss angus burger with fries. He ate the whole thing! \n\nCons: A bit pricey.

"The caliber of the sushi served at this establishment is exceptional, boasting an unparalleled level of freshness and artisanal craftsmanship that has garnered widespread acclaim from gastronomes and aficionados alike. Furthermore, the attentive and responsive service proffered by the staff is of the highest order, fostering a welcoming ambiance that is conducive to an enjoyable dining experience for both singles and couples seeking a romantic evening out. However, it must be noted that the prices charged for the culinary offerings are somewhat elevated, which may prove to be a deterrent for some patrons who are budget-conscious or have certain expectations regarding value for money. Nonetheless, this venue remains a popular destination for those seeking a premium sushi experience, despite the absence of any particularly unique or innovative elements in the menu options."

"This eatery, specializing in Sino-culinary delights, boasts an unpretentious ambiance, yet offers a satisfying gastronomical experience, primarily due to the reasonable tariffs and delectable fare. Its proximity to my workplace renders it a frequent destination for a midday repast. Efficiency in service is paramount, as the staff strive to accommodate incoming patrons by expediting the departure of existing customers, thereby creating an environment not conducive to lingering; however, the palatable victuals and economical pricing facilitate a hasty exit."

How has Great Harvest escaped notice? It's a franchise, but....
