This place feels like a casual, local spot, with a friendly counter staff. They ply you with bakery samples when you walk in the door. Try one of the unusual breads, like Guinness-cheese, or jalapeno-cheese. Slather your chunk with an appropriate amount of soft butter or preserves.

In addition to delicious breads, rolls, cookies, and other sweets, they make great sandwiches for lunch. They offer usual suspects, like turkey, ham, and roast beef. The chicken salad was a bit iffy, but the club is tasty. Great Harvest goes a bit heavy on the red onion on most, so take some breath mints for afters.

A box lunch comes with chips, a large drink, and a dessert from the pastry case. Try a Savannah Bar. They are delicious oaty crumble bars, rich with butter, sugar and fruit like blueberries, apples, cranberries, or peaches. Because they dish up your sweet right after you order, you generally get to finish your dessert before your lunch arrives.

My only complaint is that the place can feel a bit disorganized at times. But they usually aren't terribly busy, so even during the lunch rush you can generally grab a table and a quick lunch.

We have had the pleasure of dining at this establishment on a previous occasion, specifically approximately three years ago, and we opted to return for a midday repast on this particular day. As we arrived promptly at 11 am, we found ourselves to be the sole patrons present, which we regarded as a unique and advantageous circumstance. The complimentary tortilla chips and salsa that were presented to us were quite satisfying, particularly the latter, which was imbued with a rich, smoky flavor due to its roasted nature. It is worth noting that our preferences tend towards Americanized Mexican cuisine that is served in generous portions and devoid of pretension or extravagance in terms of pricing. In this regard, the enchiladas we ordered were fulfilling and flavorsome, while my spouse's tacos were also of an acceptable quality. Overall, our experience at this venue was thoroughly enjoyable, primarily due to the reasonable cost, attentive service, and the fact that it is situated within the city of New York, which we find to be an inherently captivating destination.

This place is excellent! I have been here probably 8 times in the last three months and bad thing that has happened so far was that they only had white rice that day(one time, probably the third of fourth visit). 

As for the food, you can safely say that it's not the best but it is FAR from the worst. Everything I've eaten (currys, pad thai, phrik khing, hot and sour soup, sweet and sour pork, and more) was, to say the least, edible. The curry is spiced perfectly from my experience. The phrik khing's vegetables were fresh and crisp. Possibly the only dish I didn't really enjoy was the sweet and sour pork but I have come to expect sub par Chinese food from Thai, Korean, Japanese, and Vietnamese establishments. On the other end of the spectrum, the hot and sour soup is orgasmic. One of the most flavorful things I have ever had the privilege to put in my mouth. 

That being said, I give the food a 7/10. Although, if you factor in the competitive price, I might raise that to an 8.5/10. 

The last thing I wanna go over is the service. Every time I've been here it has been the same waitress who has always been polite and friendly while clearly doing her best to take care of my party. 

TL:DR fairly decent food at a pretty decent price. Also has super cute waitress.

"Despite our lack of prior arrangements, we were warmly received and accommodated with ease, a testament to the hosts' hospitable nature and willingness to cater to their patrons' needs. Our server, in particular, demonstrated exceptional attentiveness, proactively refilling my water glass without my having to request it even once. It is worth noting, however, that during our visit, there appeared to be a scarcity of female staff members, which may have been due to unforeseen circumstances or a scheduling anomaly. Nonetheless, the culinary offerings proved satisfying, with our server graciously providing recommendations from the menu. We opted for the portabella mushroom appetizer, followed by a delectable entree of fish, both of which met our expectations. While the prices may have leaned towards the higher end of the spectrum, the ambiance and quality of service made it an ideal setting for intimate social gatherings or romantic dates. We would certainly consider returning to this establishment in the future."

Made it back in time for a sushi indulgence over the weekend, and it proved to be a satisfactory culinary experience! The only component that did not meet my expectations was the so-called "crab mix," which was incorporated into numerous rolls and failed to resonate with my palate. However, I thoroughly enjoyed the spicy tuna and the spicy crunch rolls, which more than compensated for the disappointment caused by the aforementioned "crab mix." Notwithstanding the absence of happy hour pricing, we still managed to derive considerable pleasure from our dining excursion, departing the establishment in a state of satiety and contentment.

"Gourmet burgers and gastronomical dogs, accompanied by expertly grilled thin crust pizzas, an assortment of delectable sandwiches, and a plethora of additional culinary delights. The unparalleled creativity and innovation that Joe's Farm Grill brings to traditional dishes is truly remarkable, particularly when utilizing their own organic and locally sourced produce. Furthermore, the relaxed and welcoming ambiance only adds to the overall dining experience. For a comprehensive critique and visual representation, please refer to the following link: http://blog.phosyzzle.com/2011/03/02/joes-farm-grill/"

"Halted by this eatery for a nocturnal repast, I was taken aback by the gargantuan proportions of the dishes, with a single serving capable of satiating my hunger for two consecutive days. Opting for the skewer, I must admit that the beef exhibited a hint of desiccation, although it remained palatable. Furthermore, the Mai Thai I requested was presented in an oversized glass, yet its flavor was undeniably delectable. Additionally, the establishment boasts a breakfast menu available throughout the day, constituting a notable advantage."

"Satisfactory poultry-based shawarma, acquired the midday repast iteration which was, in my opinion, sensibly priced at an approximate cost of seven dollars and fifty cents. Notwithstanding the server's inadvertent substitution of carbohydrate-rich grains in lieu of the vegetable alternative, the culinary experience remained a worthwhile investment. Favorable appraisal regarding the pecuniary aspect; anticipating future luncheon visits."

Initially, it is imperative to note that there exist two distinct locations of the esteemed Lino's Pizzeria, and our family has had the pleasure of frequenting the establishment situated on Tenaya Drive for nearly a decade. Throughout this duration, we have developed a profound appreciation for their culinary offerings, particularly their delectable pizzas, which cater to our discerning tastes. My spouse, a native of New York, possesses a profound affinity for well-crafted dough, a quality that Lino's consistently delivers. Moreover, their Giardiniera sauce, an Italian condiment characterized by its piquant flavor profile, has become a personal favorite of mine. Our household places orders from Lino's with a frequency of several times per month, as their culinary excellence remains unparalleled in our opinions.

Grand just keeps getting better and better. Won't be long before it starts to get swarmed like Roosevelt, pushing all the artists and kewl shit further west. But in the meantime, places like The GAP exist (not sure it's legal to call it that?). Pizza places can be all the same, but these guys get creative. Brussel sprouts is their best, but I had some weird chicken thing (I think the chef was stoned, in a good way) and it was amazing when I had the drunchies (drunk munchies). Really looking forward to the music stuff they'll be doing in the future.

Things I would like to see:
Draft beers + growlers. Federal Pizza has a pretty damn good program going on they should implement.
Yummy Boba tea, great slush drinks, and cute servers. What's not to love? \n\nWell, it can get a little expensive for a college student, but prices are comparable to Starbucks ;) Go get some Boba!

"Hitherto, I have had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on a solitary occasion; however, I must confess that the personnel here exhibit a markedly greater degree of cordiality and warmth compared to their counterparts at other UPS Stores or FedEx/Kinko's locations that I have had the privilege of patronizing. The underlying factor contributing to this disparity in demeanor remains unclear, but whatever the reason, it is undeniable that these individuals derive palpable joy from their work, which, in turn, has fostered an environment that not only ensures my return to this specific venue for all future shipping needs but also serves as a testament to the exceptional quality of service that characterizes this facility. Furthermore, the convenience of its proximity to my domicile serves as an added benefit, rendering it the optimal choice for my shipping requirements."

To diverge momentarily from the more genuine Mexican establishments we have been frequenting of late, we opted to sample the culinary offerings of Salsa's, which tends towards an Americanized style of Mexican cuisine. This does not inherently render it inferior; rather, it simply presents a distinct departure from the norm, thereby catering to diverse palates. Consequently, those who crave an authentic experience may prefer to seek sustenance elsewhere.  
The interior of this particular Salsa's boasts an aesthetically pleasing ambiance, marred solely by the illumination. Positioned along the right flank of the eatery, a combination of ceiling fans and subdued lighting generates a bothersome stroboscopic effect that proved so distracting we were compelled to relocate. Upon doing so, no further issues arose.  
Our server exhibited exceptional proficiency, attending to our needs with celerity and efficiency. Glasses were consistently replenished, while edibles emerged from the kitchen in a timely fashion. Inquiring about recommendations is customary for me when visiting a novel dining establishment (novel in my experience, not necessarily recently established); thus, I posed a query to our waitperson, who graciously furnished guidance. This minor detail elicits praise, as indifference on the part of servers constitutes an unfortunate commonality.  
The fare itself delighted our taste buds, as fresh ingredients melded harmoniously with judiciously apportioned sauces. A steak chimichanga constituted my selection, and its quality ranked among the superior examples I have had the pleasure of consuming. For this variety of Mexican cuisine, enthusiastic endorsement is warranted; hence, an exploratory visit is strongly advocated.

I had Biblos with a large group of classmates (Around 30 of us) at the end of a very intense week of study. Glad to report that Biblos was a great choice to end such a wonderful week.

Biblo is a pretty large restaurant, it has 1 and a half floors, we took the "half floor" upstairs as the place was already packed downstairs.

With music in the background and its dimly lit ambiance, it has a fine-dining feel to it but its prices, while high, isn't outrageous. (Psst, I also heard that they have student discounts if you have your student ID with you)

A huge selection of food, all of which, sounds interesting. All of us had a hard time deciding. The poor staff had to keep coming back to us as we indecisively looked through the menu over and over again.

The staff were very friendly. When our professors needed to make some final announcements, the staff were kind enough to temporarily turn down the music until we were done.

The portions of food is rather large and it tasted great! 

I'd say it is a good place for groups!

We have had the occasion to visit this establishment on two separate occasions in recent months, each time with a different child and a distinct set of symptoms. Upon entering the facility, we were greeted by a welcoming staff who efficiently addressed our concerns. During our initial visit, we were faced with an unexpected situation when it became apparent that all of the examination rooms were currently occupied. However, the doctor promptly attended to our needs once they were made aware of the situation. The diagnosis provided was remarkably accurate, taking into account the unique characteristics of each patient. Additionally, we have availed ourselves of the radiological services offered here, specifically to determine whether a small bone in the hand had sustained a fracture. While the waiting area may lack a certain aesthetic appeal and the clientele may be diverse, we believe that the quality of care provided at this institution warrants enduring a brief 25-minute journey, even if it means bypassing other urgent care facilities along the way.

I've reviewed the Kohl's store located down in South Phoenix/Ahwatukee and seeing that Kohl's is a chain there isn't much difference between each store that I've found. 

But once again I have to admit that Kohl's usually has some pretty good sales going. And if you add in the discounts they send you in the mail (or email) if you are a credit card holder you can really get some great deals.

I'm always amazed how much stuff you can walk out with for the money you spend. Check out the clearance racks and sale signs throughout the store. 

The store was clean and well-stocked and checkout was a breeze. 

I tend to be a thrifty shopper and am usually pretty happy with the Kohl's shopping experience. Hopefully you'll be happy too.

As a self-proclaimed indolent individual, I opted to diverge from my customary Las Vegas indulgences and gastronomical pursuits by engaging in an active desert excursion for a change. Following a thorough examination of online reviews, my companion and I (both ardent devotees of fiscal parsimony) elected to befriend Sky Zone on Facebook, thereby securing a discounted admission rate of $3 and proceeding to investigate the venue forthwith.

Upon donning our specially designed lunar footwear and executing a requisite injury waiver, we embarked upon an unforgettable experience replete with boundless diversion. The entire facility, encompassing a vast expanse of trampolines partitioned into quadrants, afforded us and our associates an exclusive domain for frolicking, racing, and even attempting aerial acrobatics. Although dodgeball was available on the opposite end, participation was purely voluntary, allowing us to relish the sheer exhilaration of unrestricted jumping, competing with companions, or merely savoring the joy of unfettered movement. Such unbridled merriment, however, proved unexpectedly taxing, as we were compelled to take respites at brief intervals, owing to our sadly sedentary lifestyles. Subsequently, we determined that a shorter duration of thirty minutes would suffice for future visits, given our limited stamina.

As a self-professed adult with a juvenile proclivity for enjoyment, I must confess that the opportunity to abandon inhibitions and indulge in unadulterated joviality within Sky Zone's walls was nothing short of delightful. The atmosphere fostered an unparalleled sense of liberated euphoria, permitting me to momentarily relinquish my customary reserve and partake in an unabashed celebration of youthful vivacity.

Don't go on 1st Friday unless you want it to be super crowded!  Hipster vibe with good food and drinks on tap.  Slightly uptight staff.  No hard booze though.  Seating encourages canoodling couples or mixing with strangers.  Try the grilled cheese and tomato soup.  I know, it's expensive, but so yummy!  They have a pasta special, but I can' remember if it is on Wed or Thurs.  Come early, as they sell out.

My predilection for acquiring boba beverages is unequivocally satiated by this particular establishment, as it constitutes my go-to venue for procuring such consumables. Amongst their diverse offerings, my preferences gravitate towards the Honey Green Milk Tea and Thai Tea variants, which I unwaveringly esteem as my top picks. It is imperative to request a punch card, as it facilitates the accumulation of loyalty rewards, thereby enabling patrons to enjoy discounted or complimentary beverages subsequent to a specified number of purchases.

Went there with the parents and had a great time. It was crowded, but didn't feel too busy to where it was distracting, it had a good vibe. 

Our service was outstanding and is definitely why I would go back. We had a great waiter who made the experience enjoyable. After reading reviews, I knew we had to try the pulled pork sandwich which was just as delicious as everyone said. The big surprise of the night was the shrimp appetizer which was awesome. It was creamy, flavorful, and a great way to start a meal. Definitely would get it again. 

I was disappointed with the dessert menu. Nothing seemed to grab my attention and I was full enough from everything else. 

All in all we had a great time, great food, and great service and all agreed we would definitely return.

"My affection for Ginza and the concept of a sushi bar within a pseudo dining car is unwavering, as it exemplifies Japan's propensity for adopting and refining Western practices, much like the quintessential American chrome dining car that failed as a retro 50s diner. Sushi, by nature, is a communal and social experience, but the boisterous Japanese pop music at Ginza somewhat mitigates this aspect. Personally, I prefer the accompaniment of more subdued music or, at the very least, a volume that allows for effortless conversation. Perhaps I am an anomaly in this regard, but I unequivocally endorse the culinary offerings and commend the friendly and attentive service. If you seek a unique venue to commemorate a birthday, look no further than Ginza, as it truly is remarkable."

"I have had the pleasure of utilizing Sunset Park solely for the purpose of exercising my canine companion within its designated dog park areas. Located on the southern portion of the park, specifically on the Warm Springs side, there exist two separate enclosures for canines, catering to their respective size categories, namely, a spacious area for larger breeds and another for their smaller counterparts. These fenced-in zones provide ample opportunities for dogs to engage in vigorous physical activities, such as running and frolicking, unencumbered by spatial constraints. Additionally, the park thoughtfully provides amenities, including hoses for cleaning and replenishing water sources, as well as poop bags for responsible waste disposal. Furthermore, there are shaded areas, furnished with tables, allowing owners to comfortably observe their pets while taking a respite from the sun's rays. However, my experiences at this venue have been slightly tarnished by a subset of frequent patrons who seem to harbor an inflated sense of entitlement and behave in a manner suggestive of regal status. During my visits, I have noticed a dearth of considerate interactions between some dog owners, whereby they fail to acknowledge and respect personal boundaries, leading to instances of overzealous playfulness and unwanted interactions between their pets and mine. On one occasion, a regular patron made a comment that roughly translated to, 'If you don't relish boisterous dog play, then perhaps this isn't the ideal location for your pet.' Outside of these occasional encounters with assertive dog owners, my overall impression of Sunset Park remains favorable."

After numerous unsatisfactory sojourns at the Center City Hilton, I opted to explore alternative accommodations and discovered the Omni, which has become my preferred choice for lodging in the area. For those seeking more economical options, the Aloft, situated directly across the street, offers suitable amenities at a lower price point. Conversely, travelers seeking a more luxurious experience without the extravagant cost of the Ritz may find that the Omni strikes an ideal balance. Throughout my eight stays at the property, I have consistently received exceptional service from the front desk staff, enjoyed spotlessly clean rooms, and appreciated the convenience of satisfactory room service. Although my personal preference lies with the larger executive corner suites offering a picturesque view of the city's central hub, I cannot comment on the quality of the standard junior suites. Notably, the hotel's prime location allows for effortless walking distance to various dining establishments such as Chima, Ruths Chris, Pita Pit, and numerous other eateries, bars, entertainment venues, and recreational facilities situated near the epicenter. In fact, I have enthusiastically recommended this lodging to my kin visiting for my impending nuptials. My experiences at the Omni have been nothing short of delightful, making it my go-to destination for future stays in the area.

"Such an array of options!  I opted for the pennyworth with mung bean and grass jelly, while Mr. W selected a three-color dessert.  Both were utterly delectable~  Although I was eager to sample their snow, my satiation from dinner precluded me from partaking in any additional culinary indulgences.  Nonetheless, a nearby table was enjoying a substantial plate of it, and it appeared truly remarkable. \n\nThe service was extremely cordial, and I appreciated the diversity of choices they offered beyond the standard boba tea fare.  Without a doubt, I shall return!"

"Indubitably, an establishment meriting a rating of 41/2, as evidenced by my recent visit, during which I partook of their delectable cuisine, specifically a scallop roll enveloped in soy paper and embellished with a dollop of caviar, an indulgence that elicited utter amazement. Furthermore, I sampled an array of sashimi, featuring yellowtail, snow crab, Japanese halibut, albacore, and octopus, all of which were impeccably fresh and expertly presented. Additionally, I enjoyed a solitary piece of tuna nigiri and a bowl of savory miso soup, both of which further contributed to the overall epicurean experience. To complement these culinary delights, I indulged in a pair of martinis, accompanied by a shot of Deleon tequila, a beverage of unparalleled smoothness and uniqueness, albeit at a premium price. However, given the occasion, the expense was more than justified. Notably, the service was exceptional, with our server exhibiting consummate professionalism and offering judicious recommendations for other local eateries, thereby enhancing the overall dining experience."

My family and I have consistently derived immense pleasure from partaking of culinary delights at this esteemed establishment, whereupon the comestibles are invariably fresh and the personnel endearingly cordial. Nonetheless, it has come to our attention that a recurring anomaly pertaining to the accuracy of our orders transpires when opting for the convenience of takeout, which unfortunately diminishes our overall satisfaction.

"The fourth star is merely a token of appreciation for the establishment's ambient surroundings and the hospitable demeanor of its staff. Located within the newly-erected, trendy hotel in Las Vegas, this stylish bar boasts an extensive array of specialty cocktails, one of which, the Hot Mule, I had the pleasure of sampling. To my surprise, the drink was not only visually appealing but also possessed a rich, complex flavor profile that was both refreshing and satisfying. Although the alcohol content remained a mystery, the beverage's taste was undeniably enjoyable, allowing me to unwind and bask in the tranquil atmosphere of the bar for a brief interval. As I visited during a weekday, the patronage was sparse, consisting of merely a handful of individuals. However, I can infer that the venue likely transforms into a bustling hub of social activity on weekends, attracting a diverse clientele of hipsters and mature women seeking a vibrant nightlife experience. Nevertheless, during my visit, the bar exuded an aura of serenity and elegance, which was greatly appreciated."

We visited this establishment for an evening meal on the weekend and endured a delay of approximately one hour and fifteen minutes before being seated, during which time we had the convenience of registering our name and receiving a text notification when our table became available, affording us the flexibility to temporarily depart and indulge in a beverage at an alternative venue if desired. Fortuitously, space was available at the bar, allowing us to order a drink and partake in the delectable pesto fries appetizer while awaiting our turn. The pesto fries were scrumptious, and their exceptional quality motivated me to opt for the pesto pasta as my primary dish, a decision I am delighted to have made. The pasta sauce was additionally remarkably creamy, which greatly enhanced my enjoyment of it. My spouse selected the fish and chips, sampling a few bits of it as well, and found it to be superb, boasting a wonderfully crispy batter. Their tartar sauce was truly outstanding. My closest acquaintance chose their burger, which I did not taste due to my abstinence from beef consumption, but she reported it to be mouthwatering. I shall unquestionably revisit this establishment in the future.

"I am not expressing any dissatisfaction with the cost, as I was cognizant of the fact that the tariff was $40 per individual as of the previous Saturday evening.

There was an abundance of culinary options available; the meat selection was particularly impressive, featuring prime rib, beef Wellington, lamb chops, pork belly, and an array of other delectable cuts. Furthermore, the seafood offerings were diverse and included crab legs, prawns, sushi, caviar, ceviche, and numerous other aquatic delicacies. The variety of salads, asparagus, cheeses, cured meats, soups, olive breads, and other edibles was truly astounding, making it impossible for me to sample everything.

The assortment of sweet treats was equally impressive, boasting incredible cheesecake, macarons, lemon meringue, chocolate confections, ice cream, bread pudding, fresh fruit, and a plethora of other tantalizing desserts. The vast array of comestibles was truly staggering, and I must say that the majority of the servers were quite hospitable, with a special mention going to the gentleman who was skillfully cutting up the medium-rare beef and pork bellyâhe was particularly friendly and accommodating. However, one female server seemed somewhat put off when my companion politely requested that we clean the table, which still had remnants of food on it. Moreover, the man responsible for serving the beef Wellington exhibited a rather gruff demeanor and vocally reprimanded a coworker instead of allowing anyone to partake in his dish. To get his attention, I had to call out âexcuse meâ?multiple times. Additionally, the individual tasked with dispensing the caviar displayed a certain level of incivility, responding brusquely when I inquired whether I could sample the black caviar. His curt reply was, âUH, ITâS CALLED AMERICAN CAVIAR!â? which I found rather amusing, as I had never had caviar before and was unfamiliar with its various denominations.

In summary, despite a few minor drawbacks, the experience was generally enjoyable, and the cuisine was undoubtedly delicious. I was thoroughly satiated and cannot indulge in such rich fare regularly, so it was a welcome indulgence."
Had the mega meat pizza... It was pretty good. Usually take my kids here as it has a play area.

My husband and I love to entertain and also enjoy a bottle of wine or a couple beers together.  Total Wine offers domestic and International liquor.  Everything from beer, wine, vodka, soju, sangria, etc.  Prices range from fair/modest to expensive (depending what you are buying).

They also have a walk-in Humidor area with a nice selection of cigars (yep, I smoke a nice cigar with my hubby on occasion!)

On certain days they have a counter set up where you can sample wine, one day we were lucky enough to sample some wonderful tequila.  The representatives were knowledgeable and helpful.  No high pressure sales; "if you like, you buy"  if not, it is ok too!

There is an amazing variety, fair prices (you can get 10% discount for buying a case of wine), the staff is friendly and super helpful!

It is a great one-stop shop!  It is clean, uber-organized and if you don't find what you are looking for---the very knowledgeable staff is quick and very informative.

Total Wine is our TOP SPOT for stocking up on all our alcohol!  A MUST for entertaining and party planning!

Super pleased!

Great location in Old Town Scottsdale. Room was only $89 on Memorial Day weekend for a suite. They don't have room service, but they have a food menu: you call in your order. When it's ready, the call your room, and you go down and pick it up. The food was good!

"Capacious servings at remarkably affordable tariffs. Establishment maintains fastidious cleanliness and crispness. Personnel exhibit automaton-like demeanor, yet proficiently expeditious in their duties. Management accepts various forms of payment. However, be advised that premises shut promptly at 21:00 hours."

"I have an immense fondness for this establishment, as it seamlessly integrates various elements that I hold in high regard, specifically sandwiches, an Italian ambiance, an extensive wine selection, and a welcoming, relaxed environment. Were I to possess a market, I would unquestionably strive to replicate the unique qualities of this particular venue, if circumstances allowed. Notwithstanding my unwavering admiration, there is a single aspect that I would consider implementing differently in the future, specifically the utilization of advanced planning regarding orders, particularly when I am yearning for DeFalco's delectable offerings on a Saturday around midday, at which point I would opt to telephone my order in advance, given the widespread popularity of this eatery during the lunch hour."

I embarked upon an expedition to discover the premier fish fry venue in Madison and serendipitously encountered this establishment. Prior to my visit, it was advisable to be cognizant of the fact that reservations are not accepted and the premises tend to become overcrowded on Fridays, thereby necessitating a considerable waiting period. This cozy, local tavern boasts a substantial patronage and offers a diverse array of fish options for their Friday fish fry, encompassing both baked and fried variants of cod, perch, and walleye. I opted for the latter, which was utterly delectable. Furthermore, I found their garlic chili fries and homemade chili to be irresistible, resulting in an unfortunate yet humorous consequence involving a hypothetical wheelchair. Unquestionably, this eatery ranks among the superior fish fry destinations within the city limits, and I am eager to return. Notwithstanding, my sole grievance pertains to the absence of reservation facilities and the temporary suspension of carry-out services during Lent, owing to an influx of excessive patronage. Nonetheless, it is heartening to witness a business that flourishes to such an extent that it must decline some customers.

"I had an irrepressible desire to investigate and experience firsthand the essence of Arizona's vibrant social scene. Specifically, I yearned to witness a live performance, one that would showcase exceptional musical prowess and provide an atmosphere conducive to unencumbered merriment. My expectations were not only met but exceeded by a considerable margin, as the sonic offerings of the disc jockey in question were truly awe-inspiring, eliciting a sincere expression of gratitude and admiration. The ambiance of the venue itself was reminiscent of establishments found in my native locales, boasting an intimate dance floor, strategically positioned tables, and a canvas that served as a visual focal point. Furthermore, I was treated to a captivating performance by the talented ensemble known as Simple Citizens, hailing from Los Angeles and featuring a diverse instrumentation, including a trumpet player, which added a unique and engaging dimension to their sound. Of notable mention was the special pricing offered by the bar, with a nominal cover charge of $10 and drinks available at a mere quarter of the standard price prior to 11 pm, escalating to a still-reasonable $5 thereafter. Such information serves as a valuable resource for future visits to this enchanting state, compelling me to frequent this establishment with increased regularity."
Great service and friendly staff.  \nI had the tuna salad and the tuna was albacora fresh and the greens were the good kind and not just iceburg. \nI would recomend this place.

"I have had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say that my experiences have been largely positive, with a few minor exceptions. The traditional hotdog, adorned with an array of toppings, has been my go-to item on the menu. As an aficionado of this particular culinary delight, I have taken it upon myself to sample each and every regular dog available, and I must admit that I have enjoyed them for the most part. However, there have been isolated incidents wherein the presentation or taste has been slightly off-putting, leading me to deduct a star from my overall rating."

The food has a wonderful  blending of flavors.  Craig was our server and he was very attentive.  My husband has allergies and the kitchen was very careful on the ingredients in each dish.  It is  more than we normally pay for burgers - but these are gourmet, a real treat.  We would definitely come back.

When we arrived at this establishment today, it appeared to be a conventional pizzeria, albeit with a limited selection of pies, specifically a solitary pepperoni variety, which we found somewhat perplexing given the relatively early hour of our visit. Notwithstanding this anomaly, we were impressed by the welcoming ambiance of the interior, particularly in proximity to the boulder station, rendering it an ideal destination for a post-cinematic or pre-cinematic excursion. Furthermore, we were pleased to discover that the prices were reasonable and the slices were generously proportioned, thereby making it an appealing option for aficionados of pizza, such as myself, who can confidently endorse it.

The name of this place deserves 5 stars. Mayyybeeeee I'm a little immature, but it never stops making me giggle.\n\nGreat 24 hour pho spot in Vegas. You can always find either drunk or hungover vegas-goers here. Service is shitty and rude, but they are fast and efficient on bringing your food and bill out. They want you IN and OUT. no joke.

"The Arts Factory constitutes a most intriguing and captivating destination for those seeking to acquire exquisite works of art and assorted peculiarities. Beyond the conventional magnificent paintings and canvas creations, one can discover an array of diverse forms of artistic expression and amusing items. For instance, Hiptazmic Studio showcases an impressive array of upcycled and recycled adornments and decorative pieces, alongside unique artworks, t-shirts, engraved tags, patches, and other such novelties. Additionally, Happy Panda Toys boasts an extraordinary compilation of vinyl playthings, and enthusiasts can participate in trading sessions during special launch events. Furthermore, Hell Pop offers an impressive selection of comics and alternative books that cater to diverse interests and preferences. The Arts Factory presents a wide range of choices, ensuring that every visitor can find something that suits their tastes and inclinations. It is recommended to visit the establishment on First Fridays, as not only does the Arts Factory experience a lively atmosphere, but the surrounding area also hosts numerous booths and events that contribute to an enjoyable and enriching experience."

"An extraordinary assortment of brews, accompanied by delectable confections, specifically the rich Belgian chocolate pudding, elevates the culinary experience; however, the remaining fare falls somewhat short of expectations, yet the atmosphere remains convivial, particularly during the Monday night trivia sessions."
Only done take out here.  I have been impressed with the counter service and the food keeps us comeing back.

"My assessment of this establishment warrants a rating of four stars, taking into account the limited options available in Pittsburgh for Malaysian and Dim Sum cuisine; however, if situated in a more populous metropolitan area, my evaluation would likely be closer to three stars. My experiences at this venue have been dual, with a visit for lunch wherein I partook of one of their Malaysian noodle soup dishes, which proved satisfactory but lacked that je ne sais quoi quality; in addition, I indulged in their Dim Sum offerings on a Sunday, which yielded a pleasurable experience due to the extensive variety of choices and scrumptious flavors. Although the quality did not quite reach the standards I have encountered in cities such as Boston, Seattle, or NYC, I found it gratifying given the local context. My companion, who has resided in China for an extended period, concurred with my positive appraisal. I would unquestionably return to this eatery. The hospitality was commendable, and the tariffs were reasonable. The ambiance was welcoming, despite the somewhat dim lighting, and the outdoor seating area was available during favorable weather conditions, complemented by a fully-stocked bar with seating."

"My acquaintance and I opted to partake in an evening excursion to this establishment approximately thirty days prior. Upon our arrival, it became apparent that there were no visible parking facilities available, with the exception of an attendant-operated valet service positioned at the entrance. As such, I was compelled to utilize their valet amenity, which I must admit, I find somewhat unsettling, as I am accustomed to managing my own automotive parking needs gratis. Nonetheless, we proceeded to gain entry into the venue and secured a table in close proximity to the bar. The culinary offerings presented a unique fusion of Mexican and New Mexican flavors, which I must say, were truly delectable. Unfortunately, my memory fails me in regards to the specific dish I ordered, however, I distinctly recall enjoying it immensely. Additionally, our server graciously suggested a superb bottle of red wine that complemented our meal perfectly. The hospitality we received was indeed impressive, and while the prices may have been slightly elevated, the quality of the dining experience was undoubtedly worth the additional expense. In conclusion, I would highly recommend this establishment as an ideal setting for a romantic escapade."

"For an optimal dim sum experience at a reasonable cost, one must be willing to compromise in certain aspects. Firstly, the servers may not always be attentive or readily available, necessitating proactive measures to acquire their assistance. Additionally, the staff may exhibit signs of fatigue or irritability, potentially resulting in a less than cordial encounter. Furthermore, it is advisable to expedite the payment process by bringing your stamp card to the front counter, thereby avoiding an extended wait time. Notwithstanding these caveats, the establishment earns four stars due to the subjective nature of service quality in Chinese restaurants, which often deviates from Western standards."

Food was well done and well presented.  The grilled octopus was cooked just right. And the main dishes and dessert were quite good.  On the pricy end but was good for taking my wife there for her birthday dinner and a special evening.

Having been a resident of Las Vegas for an extended period of time, specifically eight years, and having become accustomed to the various amenities offered by the Suncoast, I opted to stay at this particular establishment due to its reasonable rates and reputation for being a well-maintained property. My decision proved to be a judicious one, as my recent overnight stay at the Suncoast was a thoroughly satisfactory experience.  

The Suncoast Hotel and Casino is widely recognized as an exceptional locals' casino, situated in the picturesque community of Summerlin. As a result of its affiliation with the Coast (Boyd) brand, the property offers competitive rates, making it an attractive option for those seeking a high-quality gaming and hospitality experience without the necessity of being in close proximity to the Las Vegas Strip.  

Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted by the friendly and efficient check-in staff, who demonstrated a keen focus on ensuring the comfort and satisfaction of their guests. The cleanliness of my room was impressive, surpassing my expectations and providing an atmosphere conducive to relaxation.  

As an enthusiast of gaming, I found the comps offered by the Suncoast to be generous and readily attainable, even for a casual player such as myself. The table games available were typical of most establishments, yet the dealers were personable and engaging, enhancing the overall gaming experience. While the poker room was somewhat underwhelming, particularly in comparison to the extensive facilities offered at the Orleans, the Boyd sportsbook remained a highlight, providing me with an enjoyable experience and fostering my anticipation for future visits, especially during the forthcoming football season.  

In conclusion, the Suncoast Hotel and Casino presents itself as an unparalleled value in Las Vegas, boasting a combination of affordability, excellent maintenance, and a commitment to ensuring the satisfaction of its patrons.

"A culinary experience of unparalleled quality, complemented by an ambiance that exudes a sense of vibrancy and vitality, characterizes the essence of this esteemed establishment. While the Key West Margaritaville may fall short in terms of its aesthetic appeal, this particular venue more than compensates for such deficiencies with an abundance of delectable fare and an atmosphere that effortlessly captures the essence of conviviality."

Have to judge on what I ordered...Shrimp Fried Rice... It was pretty d*^m good.   We ordered SFR with the extra shrimp & I was impressed with the amount of shrimp & the size of the order.  & they use real shrimp... not those fake baby shrimp.

"Oh Dollar Tree, you possess an extensive inventory of diverse items that cater to my desires and surpass my expectations. Your store offers an impressive array of products, ranging from festive holiday cards and coordinating tableware, to practical cleaning supplies and even sustenance for my culinary endeavors. The sheer scope of your offerings is truly remarkable, and I must commend you on your ability to accommodate my varied needs with such efficiency. However, I must deduct a star from my rating due to the challenges posed by the nearby driveway when attempting to execute a left turn. The experience was indeed daunting, but I am grateful to have emerged unscathed and able to share my thoughts on your establishment. Should you find yourself in need of supplies for a social gathering, seek out this store without hesitation. Similarly, if financial constraints are a concern, or if you have suddenly recalled a forgotten family member's birthday, Dollar Tree is an ideal destination. This venue boasts an eclectic selection that caters to a wide range of requirements. Nevertheless, it is essential to note that this establishment may not align with the preferences of those seeking a more refined experience. Rest assured, I hold your store in high regard and will continue to visit frequently, as it is the most convenient location for me."

Approximately 5-7 minutes from the renowned Las Vegas Strip, this establishment offers an engaging experience for families with children, lasting anywhere between 1-2 hours. While the museum primarily focuses on the historical aspects of nuclear testing and its impact on surrounding regions, rather than delving into the scientific intricacies of the atomic era, visitors can still glean a substantial amount of knowledge from the compact exhibition space. However, due to the limited scope of the museum's content, it is unlikely that patrons will feel compelled to revisit the attraction after their initial visit.
Inside the Planet Hollywood mall area, this location is ok. Not as friendly service as im used to but they do make a good coffee. Less hassle then the starbucks in planet hollywood casino.

"As a regional resident, I have not had the opportunity to experience the accommodations offered by this establishment, but I have frequented the premises for various activities and events. The maintenance of the facilities has consistently met my expectations, and the staff members I have encountered have demonstrated a commitment to providing excellent customer service. The culinary options available on the property have also been satisfying, particularly the recently introduced Zenshin, which has become a personal favorite. In addition to the dining options, the resort boasts a diverse range of entertainment options, including a bingo hall, bowling alley, and movie theater. Furthermore, I have attended several comedy performances and conventions hosted at the venue, which have proven to be enjoyable experiences. Overall, the resort offers a diverse array of activities and attractions, without the inconvenience of excessive crowding typically associated with the Las Vegas Strip."

This establishment has ascended to the pinnacle of my preferences among buffets situated on the Las Vegas Strip! My companion and I had the felicitous fortune of visiting on a Friday afternoon, and much to our astonishment, we managed to circumvent any protracted queuing. We promptly settled the pecuniary obligation of $32 per individual and gained instantaneous ingress into the culinary extravaganza. I was thoroughly enamored with the diverse array of gastronomical options, which were judiciously categorized and facilitated my navigational ease. My unwavering fondness was reserved for the delectable tacos, which I found to be remarkably analogous to those proffered by specialized taco establishments. Furthermore, I was pleasantly surprised by the exceptional quality of the hot and sour soup, which rivaled that of its Chinese restaurant counterparts, much to my delight! As we approached the conclusion of our repast (or perhaps the commencement of the evening meal service), an additional delicacy materialized in the form of succulent crab legs. My satiation was temporarily suspended, allowing me to relish these savory morsels. Notwithstanding the preceding enumeration of positive aspects, certain drawbacks did exist. Specifically, the Caesar salad was excessively dressed, thereby rendering it overly salted, while the prime rib suffered from an inverse problem - it was overcooked, resulting in an unfortunate desiccation. The assortment of sweets appeared visually appealing; however, my stomach capacity being exhausted, I elected to sample only a single scoop of blood orange sorbet. The proximity of the restroom facilities was a welcome convenience, located as they were in close proximity to the entrance. The quality of service we received was average, neither exceptionally remarkable nor conspicuously deficient. In spite of the few shortcomings, my eagerness to revisit this culinary emporium remains undiminished.

I tried this place about a month ago, and have been back at least 4 times since. So glad to finally find a Chinese food place near my house that I love. When I call in an order for pick-up, the food is ready within 10 minutes and reasonably priced. 

I've never eaten inside the restaurant myself, but it seems nice. There are always a couple waitresses busy keeping the customers happy. It's a small interior, with about 10 booths and 6 tables (which could be pushed together to accommodate a larger group). 

Great wall is in the small strip-mall just South of Walgreens (which is at Williams Field Rd). Also in the strip-mall is Sherwin Williams and Little Caesers
First time I had I fell in love !! Great good and great prices !! You really can't beat it!

We deliberately traversed along the Pennsylvania Turnpike with gastronomical yearnings for an extended period, merely due to our intense craving for Indian cuisine. Such actions were indeed perilous, as our tolerance for hunger pangs customarily leads to capitulation to a convenient sandwich at a roadside eatery. Upon entering Coriander India Grill, we were greeted by a hospitable host who promptly accommodated us in a cozy booth. Shortly thereafter, a platter of crunchy papads accompanied by the customary triangular receptacle containing chutneys arrived, temporarily alleviating our hypoglycemic state. Following a cursory examination of the menu, we opted for lamb vindaloo (graded at a fiery 10 on the Scoville scale) and palak paneer (rated a relatively mild 7 on the Scoville scale). Although we were intrigued by the prospect of savoring south Indian dosas, their rarity did not warrant the risk, given the prevalence of northern Indian fare in most establishments. The culinary offerings were delivered expediently, and their flavors were indeed delectable! The vindaloo lived up to its billing, unleashing a torrent of spicy heat that, admittedly, I should have anticipated. My previous experience with authentic Indian cuisine notwithstanding, I erred in estimating my capacity to handle such fervent zest. Conversely, my partner's palak paneer was sublimely rich and velvety. Our satiated visages and contented dispositions upon exiting the eatery bespoke our unwavering intention to revisit Coriander India Grill during future excursions to Pittsburgh.

"Une sÃ©lection de biÃ¨res extrÃªmement attrayante, qui reflÃ¨te avec pertinence la diversitÃ© de la production brassicole rÃ©gionale. Le menu, quant Ã  lui, prÃ©sente une variÃ©tÃ© de plats savoureux, mettant en valeur les ingrÃ©dients locaux et frais. MalgrÃ© l'absence de nourriture consommÃ©e, le potentiel gastronomique de ce lieu est indÃ©niable. L'expÃ©rience de dÃ©gustation de la sangria sur la terrasse, embellie par un environnement chaleureusement accueillant, a suscitÃ© chez nous un sentiment de satisfaction. Cependant, il convient de souligner que l'atmosphÃ¨re ambiante, bien que plaisante, souffrait d'un manque relatif de vitalitÃ©, particularly during the early afternoon hours; a minor shortcoming that could be effectively addressed through the judicious deployment of background music."

While the crustacean extremities may not be of optimal quality, the cost of $16.50 for local patrons to indulge in an unrestricted quantity of said appendages, in addition to delectable prime rib, sushi, clam chowder, a savory stir-fry of Chinese origin, and an exceptionally high-end gelato, renders any potential complaints inconsequential. I wholeheartedly endorse this particular buffet to any individual seeking to obtain an exceptional value for their monetary investment in the Las Vegas region, as I have personally visited numerous such establishments and found this one to be superior in both pricing and culinary offerings. However, it is advisable to arrive promptly at 5:30 p.m. or earlier to avoid an excessively prolonged queue.

"On my maiden visit to this establishment, I was taken aback by the seemingly exorbitant prices, however, upon partaking of their culinary offerings, I was pleasantly surprised by the delectable flavors and exceptional quality. Thus, I am inclined to return and sample their diverse menu items."

We indulged in a seated experience at the bar, whereupon the bartender manifested exceptional attentiveness towards us! We opted for the Lollipop Passion Goblet, an extravagant concoction that surpassed our expectations with its remarkable presentation and delectable flavor profile, rendering it a worthwhile expenditure of $36. The beverage's unique feature was the incorporation of dry ice, which, upon being poured by the bartender, produced a captivating fog effect. Reminiscent of a Midori Sour, the drink's taste was complemented by the inclusion of lollipops and a candy necklace, contributing to an unforgettable sensory encounter. Furthermore, we sampled their fries and fried macaroni and cheese, with the latter eliciting a favorable response, while the former was somewhat average in quality. We eagerly anticipate future visits to explore more of their extensive goblet selection and savor their culinary offerings!

Went here with my girlfriends for a late breakfast after a night of partying.\nThe french dip with truffle tator tots hit the spot and helped cure my semi-hangover.\nService was good and my coffee cup was constantly refilled!

"While awaiting the arrival of a public conveyance subsequent to disembarking from a railway carriage, I elected to avail myself of the opportunity to enter a commercial establishment specializing in the sale of various culinary items, specifically Princess Mall. (It is worth noting that the British populace appears to possess an affinity for conferring regal appellations upon various entities.) 

In light of the fact that I had not partaken of sustenance at a Spud U Like for a considerable duration, my curiosity was piqued upon espying said eatery within the confines of the aforementioned shopping center's food court. Thus, I opted to revive the tradition of indulging in a hearty potato-based meal, reminiscent of my halcyon days spent in Exeter, wherein I frequently engaged in the consumption of copious amounts of toppings atop a potato. 

The number of individuals participating in this culinary excursion tallied two, and, owing to my predilection for monotony, I selected the sour cream and chives option, whereas my companion, Sylvia, opted for baked beans. It must be acknowledged that the latter choice seemed somewhat anomalous, given Sylvia's Slovakian provenance, and the query arose as to whether she was familiar with the existence of baked beans, much less their preparation via culinary heat. (Is it truly accurate to describe the cooking process as 'baking'?) 

I elected to procure Meal A, comprising a topped-up potato and a beverage. However, my preference was for a coffee, thereby necessitating an additional payment of 40 pence. 

Both potatoes proved to be delectable! The attendant responsible for serving our repast exhibited commendable promptness and his demeanor was affable, pleasant, and engaging. This diversion served as a most agreeable prelude to boarding the vehicle transporting us to the aerodrome."

It is lovely little theater that offers a great movie experience. Never a crowd, theater is clean and the snacks are what you would expect - popcorn, candy and soda. Stop by Wine Expression before or after and have a great afternoon

It was my first visit.  All my co workers have been talking  about this place....with that said,  ..........walking up to this establishment is not impressive.  Please do not take a 1st date here.  All I have heard is about the expansion..and thank goodness!! 

This place is dark, the staff look like they are all on tour of some skating boarding ESPN tour  in town.

BUT!!!!

The staff  (who look like skateboarders) were great!  Each one of them so friendly, polite and very attentive. 
Beer selection-par none...excellent selection on tab.  
The expansion section is inviting for large groups...which was perfect for our work HH.
MENU- as my friend would say......UNBELIEVABLE!
I took home a Carne Asada concoction and it was sooooo good.  The calzone idea is great! When you can come up with creative stuffing you can't go wrong.  

Ambiance 3 ..too dark for me 
Staff  5+ -very friendly, attentive & polite
Food 5+- the calzone spin -UNBELIEVABLE...so good.  even take home.
Beer 5 -great selection on tab......can't get that everywhere.

We experienced exceptional hospitality, and the ambiance was enhanced by the captivating decor. Our culinary excursion began with an assortment of delectable pre-game bread, followed by a succulent bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin that showcased the chef's proficiency in the kitchen. Additionally, our dining experience was complemented by a flavorsome lobster tail, which was relished by my spouse. The sweet corn and polenta, along with the savory bacon and Yukon gold gratin, offered a delightful contrast of tastes and textures. Furthermore, the menu boasted an array of inventive dishes, including the forbidden rice, which added to the allure of this gastronomic gem. To complete our meal, we indulged in a wine list curated by a knowledgeable waitstaff, further enhancing the overall epicurean journey. Lastly, the mashed potatoes served as a satisfying conclusion to our delectable adventure. Overall, this unassuming eatery offered a remarkable dining experience that invoked memories of our visit to Elements at the Sanctuary, making it a hidden treasure worthy of exploration.

"An establishment that excels in all aspects, offering an impressive culinary experience, exceptional customer service, and an ambiance that exudes sophistication and refinement. My previous encounters with French cuisine have been limited, but I have found that it is often characterized by meager portions. However, this restaurant defies that convention, as evidenced by the generous serving sizes of their dishes, particularly the steak. The quality of the food is also worthy of praise, with each bite showcasing the chef's dedication to culinary artistry. The complementary sides, including hand-cut fries and freshly baked French bread, further enhance the dining experience. For those who prefer alfresco seating, the outdoor area offers a romantic atmosphere and stunning views of the surrounding area. Overall, I would rate this restaurant 4.5 stars, a truly exceptional rating that reflects the high standards they have set for themselves."

"An exceptional venue for leisurely socializing. Cordial hospitality and delectable cuisine. My personal preference is the BLT&E, boasting an abundance of flavor, a harmonious balance of ingredients, and a tantalizing hint of uniqueness."

"An exceptional lodging experience, characterized by meticulously maintained facilities and an impressive array of amenities, culminated in a highly satisfactory stay, albeit with a solitary caveat pertaining to the quality of the fare served at the hotel's carnival buffet, which, despite its purported 'world-class' status, failed to meet expectations, particularly in regards to the congealed macaroni and cheese, as well as the aged sushi offerings, resulting in a questionable value proposition for the price point of $32.00; however, apart from this isolated shortcoming, the overall experience was thoroughly enjoyable, rendering the establishment a prime candidate for future visits."

I love shopping here because they have a large variety of clothes to shop through. AND they're CHEAP! I can get 6-10 pieces of clothing for around $100-120. Downside, they're not the best quality. 

Fair warning: They do not accept any type of returns on dresses. You also only get exchanges or store credit when you purchase anything. I think as long as you know this, it's fair. I try on everything before I buy it anyways. If you don't like to try things on, then you probably would like to stay away. 

Otherwise, this place is great shopping for people who are on a budget. It's great for teenagers up to early 30's I would say. I have found some very trendy outfits and so not so attractive. But to each their own! The place is very organize and they stock clothing pretty often. 

The customer service isn't superior, but the girls are always willing to help, IF you ask them.

The ambiance of this culinary establishment may prompt you to reconsider your dining choice due to its conspicuous transformation from a Yoshi's/Kyoto Bowl style venue, but I strongly advise you to disregard such reservations. Instead, immerse yourself in the boisterous dance tunes and explore the intriguing menu offerings.

Upon perusing the menu, we opted for the Salmon Lover, Delish, Eel Cucumber, and Sixty Nine rolls. To our delight, each dish proved to be not only delectable but also characterized by diverse textures and an elevated level of creativity relative to the standard sushi restaurant fare. The Salmon Lover, in particular, merits a mandatory trial, owing to its sublime taste and inventive presentation.

Incidentally, I must mention that my culinary preferences are limited by an avocado allergy, which typically leads me to opt for nigiri over rolls upon visiting a new establishment. However, the nigiri options at this restaurant seemed somewhat pricey, and the fascinating variety of rolls motivated me to inquire whether omitting avocado would pose any issues. Much to my relief, the accommodating waitstaff assured me that no problems would arise, and my meal arrived completely free of allergens.

"We have had the pleasure of frequenting this establishment on numerous occasions, but our most recent visit proved to be a distinct departure from the customary level of service we have grown accustomed to. Our group of three individuals had the misfortune of enduring an extended wait time, despite possessing reservations for 8:45 pm. In fact, we did not secure seating until nearly 10 pm, which we found to be utterly unacceptable. Furthermore, our interactions with the hostesses were marked by brusque and perfunctory behavior, while the wait staff displayed an egregious lack of attentiveness in addressing our needs, including the neglectful omission of refreshing our beverages in a timely manner. However, we must commend the bartenders for their courteous demeanor and the exceptional service provided by the busser, Isaac, who demonstrated remarkable proficiency in resolving the issues that had plagued our dining experience. Indeed, his efforts were so impressive that we opted to reward the restaurant with a four-star review, despite our initial inclination to assign a rating of only one star. Notably, Isaac's dedication and commitment to customer satisfaction served as a testament to his exceptional work ethic and dedication to ensuring an optimal dining experience for patrons. Additionally, our server Mark, a seasoned veteran in the industry, exhibited a similar level of professionalism and attention to detail, further solidifying our positive impression of the restaurant. While there is always room for improvement, we must acknowledge that the efforts of Isaac and Mark significantly mitigated our dissatisfaction and restored our faith in the establishment's capacity to deliver quality service."

"An exceptional happy hour experience awaits those who arrive prior to 6 pm, allowing them to capitalize on the venue's remarkable 'island time' menu, which includes delectable cocktails such as grapefruit basil martinis, mojitos, and margaritas. Our group of four thoroughly enjoyed these beverages, and the atmosphere was further enhanced by the presence of delightful appetizers, including the highly recommended ahi tuna poke and fish tacos. However, our gluten-free companion faced some challenges in finding suitable dining options, ultimately settling for a salad despite the underwhelming selection of gluten-free entrees. Nonetheless, everyone relished their meals, and the ambiance was truly captivating."

"I recently had the pleasure of discovering an exceptional new venue in Las Vegas, conveniently located directly on the renowned Strip. The sophisticated and refined ambiance of this establishment effectively simulates the charming atmosphere of Paris, creating a truly immersive dining experience that extends beyond the palate. The delectable cuisine and exquisite wine selection, complemented by impeccable service, contribute to an unforgettable indulgence that will undoubtedly leave a lasting impression on even the most discerning patron."

This place is the bombay digity!

Located on Sahara and Decatur, this small restaurant will give you a cultured taste of India.

The place is small and very CLEAN! which is a must in my restaurant world..

I was greeted by a very nice helpful waitress who took the time to explain their menu and the pronunciation of each dish.

I ordered the Spinach Paneer. I'm a huge fan of spinach, and this put me into cloud 9.. The dish consisted of spinach and tofu, and some type of sauce.. im really  clueless when it comes to indian food, i just ask what's in it and i eat it!
haha!

Also along with the paneer i had the Garlic Naan, It's good to have with your paneers they compliment each other.

For dessert I had the Keer, which was some sort of rice pudding with berries on top very delish as well!

Samosa is also vegetarian/vegan friendly which is what drawn me to the place, me being a transitional vegetarian/vegan, i was curious what options i had in an indian restaurant .

Overall i was satisfied with the service and the food, they also have lunch specials during lunch time, i did not even bother to look at that, but will give it a try when I go back!

I engage in gaming activities at the Bellagio approximately six times per annum, and it has become evident to me that the quality of service is contingent upon the shift schedule. Specifically, the morning shift, spanning from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM, is characterized by exceptional management, with Calvin, the shift manager, leading by example. The staff members, including dealers, chip runners, custodial personnel, and supervisors, exhibit a commendable work ethic and dedication to providing excellent customer service during this time frame. In stark contrast, the 6:00 PM to 2:00 AM shift is noticeably inferior, with front-line personnel displaying an air of self-importance and a lackadaisical approach to initiating games in a timely manner, particularly in the low-limit game format. Although there are a select few exceptions, such as seasoned employee Timmy, and the 2:00 AM to 10:00 AM team, the prevalent attitude among staff members at the Bellagio seems to be centered around instructing patrons on how to cater to their preferences, rather than prioritizing customer satisfaction. This reversal of focus is, in my opinion, detrimental to fostering a positive gaming environment.

Bold colors and one-of-a-kind tops that will make you stand out. Reasonable prices, and some funky jewelry. They've also got some classic pieces, like the awesome black Fall jacket that I fell in love with - definitely the kind of piece to add to your wardrobe that you will get lots of use out of, and under $100. \n\nThe girls who work here are friendly, and they've got a decent size sale section in the back. I saw some great summer finds - go get 'em ladies!

Sam Fox restaurant.  Its the combo of a play-yard (ping pong and cornhole - no not that kind) and drinks, sometimes a band, and good peeps.  Good place to go hang out.  Fun lively atmosphere, etc.  Parking you should plan on valet due to good size crowds (even on sunday).  I cannot comment on the food much as I have only had a few appetizers, which were good.

We have had the pleasure of dining at LaVecchia's on multiple occasions, and this review marks our maiden attempt at sharing our experiences with others. Complimentary parking is conveniently located in the Hearst Tower, and upon validation by LaVecchia's, it transforms into a gratis amenity. A leisurely stroll or rapid conveyance downwards culminates in an atmospheric ambiance replete with business-oriented individuals and discerning clientele, further enhanced by the proximate presence of RiRa, Luce, and an aesthetically pleasing courtyard. Reservations can be made with minimal effort, rendering accessibility to LaVecchia's relatively straightforward. Upon arrival, seating arrangements have been efficiently orchestrated, even during periods of high demand, thereby minimizing delays. The attentive wait staff has consistently displayed commendable punctuality in providing beverages, thus precluding extended waiting periods. While the appetizers have occasionally exhibited excessive saltiness, the primary entree offerings have consistently impressed, warranting our repeated patronage. Indeed, LaVecchia's has proven itself worthy of numerous return visits, despite the abundance of alternative dining establishments within the Queen City area.

Miss the 2.99 special but figured I would give them another try since don tortacos breakfast burrito seems to be getting smaller and smaller. May go here now. Still wish there salsa was a little thicker and had more heat less vinegar taste.

"No laments here! We visited this establishment on a soggy and dismal day last week, a day when one wouldn't necessarily yearn for frozen yogurt, yet we felt compelled to acquire some regardless. 

Upon entering, I selected the snickerdoodle and peanut butter flavors, opting to augment them further with an additional topping of andies mints. The yogurt presented itself with an optimal consistency and temperature, striking a balance between being neither excessively creamy nor overly runny. 

The ambiance, while perhaps a tad kitschy, featured an adequate amount of seating for a yogurt shop, which was a welcome surprise. Furthermore, I must commend them for openly displaying the caloric content of their products, despite the fact that it might be perceived as somewhat unsightly. 

In conclusion, our experience at this venue was quite pleasant, boasting a well-maintained environment, cordial staff, and a generally satisfying frozen yogurt experience. We shall undoubtedly return when we find ourselves in the vicinity once again."

"My spouse and I both opted for the Chili Cheese Dog, and our taste buds were thoroughly gratified by its culinary excellence. The hot dog was cooked to perfection, possessing a delightful snap when bitten into, and the chili was apportioned in such a manner that it did not overpower the flavor of the frankfurter, thereby allowing us to consume it with our hands without any difficulty. However, I must admit that I would have preferred a different type of cheese, specifically shredded cheese, instead of the Kraft singles that were provided. Despite this minor shortcoming, the Chili Cheese Dog proved to be an utterly delectable and satisfying snack, particularly given its convenient location on the strip."

First things first, I don't have a car. So I'm a captive audience for County Market, which is the closest store to my apartment. County Market has a good selection, and I rarely if ever have trouble finding things. It was funny how at the beginning of the school year certain items were just GONE, but I attribute that to people coming back and everyone needing soy sauce, ketchup, etc. However, I went there the other day and there was only one sort of tofu, which my friend informed me was not the best type. This is a small quibble, though, and I'm sure it happens in other stores.\n\nFor me the only thing I don't like about County Market is the state of produce. Often times I've picked up fruit or veggies and they've been close to going bad or already there. Or I'll buy bananas and they'll be so green I can't eat them for a week. I don't mind going through fruits and veggies and finding good ones, but if there aren't any good that makes it a but difficult. In general, I like this place and I'll continue to come back.

Dropped in for a coffee to go...it's damn good coffee!  It tasted familiar and I asked if they roasted their beans or ordered it from somewhere in Canada and the barista let me know the beans I was having was from 49th Parallel in Vancouver!  So Vancourites, if you're missing your awesome coffee from home you should drop by here.

I also ordered a scone which was also delicious and was on my way.  I'm not to sure about the amenities at the shop but it's a cool little space but I think the people watching might be at a minimum unless something is happening at the convention center since it's off a smaller street in Old MTL.

Oh yeah - staff was really friendly

Fresh seafood everyday. We ordered some oysters asked for them to be shucked and mosey on over to the watering hole for delicious beers and wine. \nAll the fresh meats seafood and salads here are delicious. Grab some food and hang out with a beer or wine. Great people watching. \nEmployees are super friendly and helpful. One of the best grocery stores around and hey there is even a bar :)

We just stayed at the Monte Carlo and we wanted to do a nice steak dinner for Saturday night.  Being 6 dudes, we were not disappointed.  They gave us 2 for 1 drink specials and sat us at a great table.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is really nice, only bad this is it is in open view of the casino floor.  Monte Carlo isn't the classiest hotel on the strip, so takes away a little bit of the steak experience when you look out at smokey gamblers and big screen TVs.  But I digress...

The steak was excellent.  They have a 120 oz steak for 6 on the menu, so of course we got it.  Came out as an excellent Mound of Meat presentation, but totally classy.  Cooked to perfection as any expensive steakhouse should do it.  Came with sides and dipping sauces, both excellent additions to the meal.

Staff was friendly and efficient, which is always appreciated.  They gave us free entry into Brand "after hours" as the lounge portion turns into a club at night.  We rolled in there after midnight, and it was not a hot spot.

Bottom line:  Great steakhouse, bad nightclub.  Only in Vegas.

"In conclusion, the encounter was generally satisfactory, as I acquired a standard manicure and pedicure for a reasonable price of $35. However, an upgrade to gel was suggested, which did not evoke a sense of obligation to accept. The personnel were proficient, yet their communication skills were somewhat impaired due to a linguistic barrier. Upon entering the establishment, one cannot help but notice the overpowering odor of chemicals, which may be bothersome for individuals with heightened sensitivity to smells or certain health conditions. Additionally, the absence of a designated cashier resulted in minor inconvenience. Nonetheless, this facility offers efficient services at an affordable price, delivering a passable manicure and pedicure experience."
Great food!! Small & limited seating if outdoor patio not open. But worth the wait! Clean food, vegan, vegetarian options ! Great flavor! Pho soup yummy & fresh rolls! I will be back!

Trump hotel didn't disappoint. We were greeted with kind employees and that continued all week. The room was very nice, clean and spacious. Shower was huge. 

I dropped 1 star because of the uncomfortable pillows and the train whistle early morning but neither took away from the experience. 

Pool was nice but get there early for a lounge chair. 

Did not try the restaurants but did try the muffins and fruit at the coffee stand and they were great. 

We didn't mind the lack of casino as this led to a much quieter and smoke free lobby. I would surely return.

This location of the famous Madison Original Pancake House is much less busy, well hidden behind nearby hotel.  Staff is very nice, efficient & professional.  More parking at this location than the other (which was all construction & traffic when we tried to go).  Great quality food!  Lots of favorites listed in other reviews.  We haven't had anything bad, try whatever you'd like!\n\nThe red neon sign may or may not be lit up, it's about 1/2 way down the strip mall.
Gorgeous hotel! Didn't stay here but did you know Carlos from the food channel has a bakery here?!?! WHAT WHAT?!?! Yummerz. Be prepared for 1+ hour long wait though.
It's at least open till 9:30, amazing in this \"24 hour\" town and it tastes great.  Can't beat a 7.95 dinner special with drink, egg roll and soup.  If they deliver to UNLV, it's a five.

"Satisfactory midday repasts at reasonable tariffs. NOT THE TWO AMERICANS ANY LONGER. PRESENTLY KNOWN AS ROCKY POINT TAVERN. My personal preference was inclined towards it. $2 pints of Corona beer and tacos. Visually appealing interior design."

We query our existence and affiliations, pondering profoundly, "Are we truly ourselves, or merely an amalgamation of external influences?" Perhaps, it is only when we immerse ourselves in unfamiliar environments that we can genuinely comprehend our inherent nature. For instance, if I were to embark on a culinary excursion to Philadelphia, I would aspire to savor the quintessential flavors of a traditional cheese steak. Ideally, the harmonious balance of peppers and onions would complement the rich, velvety texture of the steak, all enveloped within a golden, crispy bun. Such gastronomic delights would evoke a sense of nostalgia, transporting me to a realm where the simplicity of life is cherished. Moreover, the pizza, freshly prepared and hand-tossed, would boast generous slices, satisfying my hunger and cravings. However, Spinelli's extends beyond the conventional confines of a restaurant, offering an array of appetizers, salads, desserts, Stromboli, and assorted sandwiches. Although currently sans brew, the promise of its impending arrival elicits anticipation. Notably, the mac and cheese bites merit consideration as a delectable appetizer option. In conclusion, Spinelli's exudes an air of authenticity, tranquility, and unpretentiousness, beckoning patrons to partake in a genuine dining experience.
Fantastic!  Clean, fairly priced, great service and delicious food - you could not ask for more than that in a restaurant!

"Linda is utterly remarkable! My quest for an exceptional nail technician to enhance my engagement photos led me to her doorstep, albeit serendipitously. Coincidentally, she had recently relocated to Salon Boutique, thereby affording me the opportunity to secure an appointment without much difficulty. Upon our initial encounter, Linda exuded warmth and exhibited an effortless charm, rendering conversation remarkably fluid. Subsequent to that auspicious meeting in early March, I have remained steadfast in my allegiance to her expertise, as she unwaveringly ensures that her clients depart her salon thoroughly contented. It is palpable that Linda's proficiency and dedication are genuinely unparalleled, and thus, I consider myself truly fortunate to have stumbled upon such an exceptional talent! Patrons seeking top-notch gel, acrylic, refill, manicure, pedicure, shellac, or other related services would be well-advised to seek out Linda's expertise, as she additionally provides a complimentary arm and hand massage, further enhancing the overall experience."

At first glance, Outside Inn appeared to be a run-of-the-mill drinking establishment, devoid of any distinguishing features that might set it apart from its contemporaries. However, upon closer inspection, certain aspects of its ambiance captured my attention and piqued my curiosity. The name, in particular, struck me as somewhat amusing and playful, which served as an auspicious harbinger of the pleasant surprises that awaited me within.

Upon entering the premises, I was immediately taken by the rustic, woody aesthetic that permeated the interior design.
