The liberal use of exposed wooden "log" beams and the overall "woodsey" motif lent a warm, welcoming atmosphere to the space, evoking the sense of a cozy cabin nestled deep within a dense forest. Although the bar area itself was somewhat dimly lit, the abundance of televisions (albeit none of them particularly large) scattered throughout the room ensured that patrons could easily follow their favorite sporting events or news programs while enjoying a refreshing beverage.

In contrast, the dining area, though relatively diminutive in size, exuded a certain charm thanks to its subdued color scheme and judicious deployment of supple, vinyl booths. While I would have preferred a bit more exposed wood adorning the walls to complement the existing decor, the strategic employment of these booths helped to create an intimate, convivial setting that fostered a sense of community among patrons.

My culinary expectations were thoroughly exceeded by the delectable fare presented before me. The sweet potato fries, in particular, delighted my taste buds with their unexpected burst of flavor and satisfying crunch, while the prime rib proved itself to be a veritable gastronomic revelation, boasting a tenderness and richness of flavor that eclipsed that of many other establishments in the surrounding area. Although the tariffs associated with these delights were slightly elevated above the norm, the extensive selection of draft beers available helped to assuage any pecuniary concerns.

The attentive, cordial service I received during my visit only further enhanced my overall satisfaction, leaving me feeling content and satiated. In conclusion, I would highly recommend Outside Inn to anyone seeking a relaxed, congenial environment in which to enjoy a few pints and savor some exceptional prime rib. Its unassuming faÃ§ade belies a veritable treasure trove of gustatory delights and hospitable ambiance, making it an ideal destination for those seeking solace from the stresses of everyday life.

I got a piece of red velvet cake. The frosting is so rich and creamy with a very buttery finish and LOTS of cream cheese. The cake is tasty but dry. Good thing there was lots of amazing frosting to cover that flaw up. The place looked like a trendy spot you would find in NYC with prices to match. The staff was super friendly though.

You have to understand what this place is in order to get the full enjoyment of it. Is it 

My group of friends had a great time, and in the end, didn't mind coughing up the $17 just to get in the door. They dress you up in a parka and Uggs, and give you gloves for your glass. You then drop off all of your electronics and other belongings in a locker, and walk into a refrigerated room set at 50 degrees before progressing to the bar itself. 

Everything is truly made of ice, from the tables and benches, to the chandeliers, even the glasses themselves! I really enjoyed it for the novelty.

"When it comes to this establishment, the two words that are imperative to remember are 'Moscow mule.' Disregard any other information; those two words encapsulate the essence of the experience. While the jukebox may be temperamental, and the beer selection, though adequate, pales in comparison to nearby alternatives, the culinary offerings, though satisfactory, do not warrant repeat visits. However, the Moscow mules, crafted with either cucumber-infused vodka or a mint-flavored variety, are truly exceptional, making them the primary draw for return visits. Furthermore, the bartenders, who are courteous and knowledgeable, contribute significantly to the ambiance, ensuring that patrons receive attentive and hospitable service. In conclusion, while the food and beer selections may not be the primary focus, the delectable Moscow mules and excellent bartenders make this venue well worth a visit."

Considering the first reviewer, I wouldn't recommend taking their services from a hotel.

However, they do offer shuttle service from the airport. You prepay, so there is no way the driver can hammer you for more money.  Just look for signs at baggage claim that say "Airport Shuttles" or something like that.

There are actually two separate companies.  This one was a bit more expensive, but the other one only took cash.  And I forgot to get cash before leaving for Vegas.  So I had to go with this one so I can charge it.

Use the airport shuttles, it's cheaper. I think it was $6 or so per person to the hotel.  Much cheaper than a cab.  They have the prices posted outside so you can check it out when you arrive.

Surely, this poultry dish is not deep-fried? That was the query I posed to the cashier, as the chicken appeared to possess the characteristic crispiness and savory flavor associated with fried chicken, albeit lacking the telltale golden-brown hue. However, I was informed that it was broasted, a culinary technique unfamiliar to me, which seemingly implies that the chicken is cooked employing a method that is healthier and more nutritious than the conventional deep-frying process. Moreover, this establishment offers an array of delectable treats, including milkshakes, malts, a self-serve yogurt bar, sandwiches, and, of course, the renowned Dole whip. For those who relish the idea of a leisurely excursion, a visit to Boulder City can be a pleasant experience, complete with picturesque scenery. Nevertheless, for those who prefer to avoid the town proper, this eatery is situated on the outskirts, rendering it easily accessible without the necessity of entering the city. Additionally, a drive-thru service is available, although patrons are advised to exercise patience, as each item is meticulously prepared to order, thus ensuring an unparalleled level of quality and freshness. This humble abode, once a modest shack across the street, has since been transformed into a full-fledged edifice, a testament to its enduring popularity and success. BC boasts an abundance of undiscovered gems, and this particular establishment is not to be overlooked. A visit to this restaurant is sure to leave a lasting impression, and skipping it would be a genuine loss.

"It is a Chipotle, thus one can anticipate a predictable culinary experience, which, in essence, aligns with the restaurant's brand identity. Children tend to enjoy the menu options, while my spouse can indulge in relatively health-conscious selections. My personal opinion regarding Chipotle's quality as a Mexican eatery may be perceived as somewhat ambivalent, however, I unquestionably relish their tortilla chips, guacamole, and porcine offerings. It is essential to monitor the portioning of proteins, particularly during periods of high customer influx, as staff may display a propensity to parsimoniousness regarding the meat allocation."

"My recent visit to this establishment elicited an unprecedented level of euphoria, reminiscent of my previous excursion to the iconic Disneyland theme park. Upon entry, I was immediately struck by the captivating ambiance, replete with aquatic exhibits, a picturesque waterfall, and remarkably lifelike taxidermied creatures. My fervent desire to explore every nook and cranny of the premises led me to spend an uninterrupted duration of two hours within its confines. However, my otherwise delightful experience was momentarily marred by a disagreeable encounter with the attendant at the confectionery stand, whose demeanor was incongruous with the overall convivial atmosphere. Notwithstanding, the palpable appeal of the edible wares served as a sufficient compensation for the aforementioned unpleasantness. While the prices of the items sold here are undoubtedly exorbitant and well beyond my financial means, I nevertheless indulged in the purchase of a few novelty items and look forward to future visits."

"I have consistently savored the culinary offerings and regarded them as exceptional in quality. However, the service has been subpar, largely attributable to the emphasis placed on recruiting nearby university students as staff. During one particular visit, we made reservations and were promptly seated by the hostess, who attempted to accommodate us at a table despite our preference for a booth. We politely requested to be seated at a booth, but our request was met with resistance, leading to an impasse that persisted for several exchanges. Ultimately, we threatened to vacate the premises, which precipitated the hostess's reluctant acquiescence to our request. Nevertheless, her subsequent behavior bordered on theatrics, as she melodramatically escorted us to a booth before departing abruptly. This anomalous episode serves as a caveat to management regarding the potential drawbacks of relying heavily on student labor."

Once I find something I like, I usually stay with it. This place is no exception. I've been coming here for over a year now.  I love coming here for my monthly gel manicure. As much as customers they get, it is amazing the staffs remember repeat customers.  One of them asked me for things happened a few months ago.

Friendly staffs are easy to talk to and they know how to pamper you really well.
I am looking forward to my next monthly therapeutic with them.

I managed to fortuitously secure a living space that is conveniently located within walking distance of virtually all essential amenities, including what is arguably the preeminent ski and snowboard equipment retailer in the region. Ski Pro boasts an impressive inventory that surpasses even the most well-stocked ski shops in Colorado, and their focus on promoting sales and offering discounts is evident in the substantial markdowns they offer on various items. Case in point: I recently purchased a ski suit for my child that had been originally priced at $175, but was available for the significantly reduced price of $59. Although the selection of skis and snowboards may not be as extensive as some other specialty stores, it is nevertheless quite comprehensive and caters to a wide range of winter sports enthusiasts. Furthermore, the store's proximity to the Biltmore is an added convenience.

The quality of customer service at Ski Pro is relatively average for establishments of this nature, with staff members exhibiting a level of friendliness and attentiveness that is adequate without being overly obsequious. Considering the laid-back atmosphere that permeates such leisure-oriented businesses, it would be unreasonable to expect excessively cheerful and solicitous demeanors from employees. Instead, they maintain a relaxed yet competent attitude that aligns with the overall ambiance of the store. While they may not display the same level of enthusiasm as workers in more formal settings, they are at least cordial and welcoming, which is a refreshing change from the sometimes surly and aloof demeanor encountered among ski shop employees in certain parts of Colorado. Consequently, I recommend paying a visit to Ski Pro and adopting a carefree attitude when interacting with the staff.

Never had a bad meal at any location...  The ground beef hummus is the best hummus I've had in my life!  Tonight I tried the coconut shrimp for the first time and I ate the whole thing!   It was outstanding!

The only reason they are losing a star is because we got there around 8:30, they closed at 9:30 and we could feel them trying to get out soon.  At about 9:00 the entire staff of 3 sat down to eat a meal in the restaurant in front of customers.  Our waitress was still very nice and attentive so I don't want to complain about service, but it was a little off-setting.  Could they not have waited another 30 minutes until the restaurant was closed or go in the back and take a few bites?  Not very professional at all and made it feel like we were a burden.

I definitely want to reiterate that despite the hiccup, our service was good and the food was still excellent... Would not keep me from returning by any means or recommending it to friends and family!

If I were to have the opportunity to procure a single beverage, either a coffee or a chocolate milkshake, I would unhesitatingly opt for the latter from Courier Cafe, despite its antiquated ambiance characterized by aged carpeting, elderly waitstaff, and vintage cutlery. The allure of a rich, velvety milkshake that defies suction through a straw and arrives accompanied by a surplus in a metallic mixing vessel is simply too enticing to resist, even on a frigid winter day. Indeed, any discerning devotee of such indulgences would assuredly follow suit and venture forth to partake in this revered establishment's offerings.

"I have a penchant for this establishment! Although it may not be a quintessential five-star burger joint, it boasts an impressive array of attributes that warrant its classification as a formidable culinary destination. The utilization of premium quality meat is a testament to the eatery's commitment to serving its clientele with the finest fare. Furthermore, the proprietors have adopted an innovative approach by extending an invitation to patrons to exercise their creativity in tailoring their burgers to their exacting specifications. This tantalizing feature allows individuals to assume a sense of agency in the preparation of their meals, fostering a unique dining experience that is both engaging and satisfying. 

The ambiance within the restaurant exudes a nostalgic charm, reminiscent of bygone eras, while the musical selections played during my visit were quite agreeable, save for a solitary Morrissey tune that momentarily threatened to undermine my dining experience; however, I successfully mitigated its impact by diverting my attention elsewhere. Although the theme of the establishment may not conform to the conventional definition of a '50s dinner, it remains an intriguing venue worthy of exploration. 

In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly opt for the two-thirds burger, thereby affording myself the opportunity to indulge in a delectable medley of toppings tailored to my discerning taste."

Originally, I harbored skepticism regarding my decision to dine at this establishment, primarily due to the seemingly gimmicky nature of its name. However, upon partaking in their culinary offerings, specifically their delectable noodle soups, my initial reservations were promptly dispelled, as the quality of the fare served was truly exceptional. During my visit, the interior of the eatery appeared bustling, with patrons eagerly awaiting their turns to savor the flavors of the menu items. Although the pace of the service was somewhat hastened, it did not significantly impact my dining experience, as I was solely seeking a rapid, satisfying repast. Consequently, I intend to return to this venue in the future, with the aim of sampling their diverse array of dishes.

"A ubiquitous sentiment permeates the discourse surrounding this establishment, whereby the culinary offerings, while undeniably satisfactory, are eclipsed by the truly exceptional ambiance, which transcends the mundane and enters the realm of the sublime; an experiential venue par excellence, where the tangible aspects of the dining experience, though hardly negligible, pale in comparison to the overall atmosphere, rendering it an obligatory pilgrimage for gastronomes and revelers alike, despite its slightly inconvenient location."

I take immense pleasure in engaging in recreational activities at Tuscany, which happens to be one of the more recently established golf courses in the city of Las Vegas. My maiden visit to Tuscany - the clubhouse was situated within a makeshift structure that resembled a quonset hut or a tent. They have since upgraded their facilities to include a stunning clubhouse and restaurant. Initially, the club encountered some difficulties in cultivating grass in this particular region of Vegas, which is known for its arid climate. Subsequently, the management opted to seek assistance from the team at Rhodes Ranch, who took over the course's maintenance and transformed it into a thriving and lush landscape. Rhodes Ranch serves as the "sister" course, and players can frequently avail themselves of exceptional package deals for playing both courses. The layout of the course is meticulously designed, featuring an abundance of sand traps strategically positioned to accommodate my driving distance. Additionally, there are sufficient water hazards scattered throughout the course to accommodate errant shots. The course meanders past a magnificent stone clock tower and boasts expansive fairways. The underlying theme of the course revolves around wine and vineyards, rendering it distinctive and unique. In my opinion, this course offers exceptional value for the price paid. Although it requires a slightly longer drive compared to some of the Summerlin courses, the experience is truly remarkable and well worth the extra effort.

I have had the pleasure of visiting Trifecta on multiple occasions, and each time, I have been impressed by the exceptional caliber of artists showcased. The staff members have consistently demonstrated a profound knowledge of the pieces on display, eagerly engaging in insightful discussions regarding the various works of art. Notably, a significant portion of the pieces available for purchase have fallen within a price range that is accessible to art enthusiasts who do not possess an extensive collection or substantial financial resources. This aspect of Trifecta's offerings stands out as particularly refreshing, given the tendency of some art venues to prioritize exorbitant prices over the cultivation of a broader appreciation for the arts.  

My most recent visit to Trifecta coincided with the unveiling of a photography exhibition featuring images captured in Las Vegas and Nevada, which complemented the Focus on Nevada spread in the current issue of Desert Companion. Notably, one of my closest acquaintances, Anthony M., was selected as a participant in the contest associated with the event. As a steadfast supporter of my friends' creative endeavors, I felt compelled to attend and experience the exhibition firsthand.  

Despite Trifecta's relatively modest dimensions, I have been consistently impressed by the exceptional quality of their past events, which have included food and beverage services tailored to enhance the overall experience. In light of these observations, I wholeheartedly endorse immersing oneself in the artistic ambiance of the Arts Factory, dedicating sufficient time to explore its diverse offerings, and culminating the excursion with a visit to Trifecta. By doing so, one can foster a deeper appreciation for the burgeoning cultural landscape that permeates this vibrant street. To those who may harbor reservations regarding the accessibility of art, I implore you to dispel your doubts and embrace the opportunity to discover the richness of Trifecta's collection with an open mind and a curious gaze.

"The expansive outdoor seating area, characterized by its perpetual occupancy, necessitates an early arrival to secure a coveted spot. The protracted queue, however, is more than justified by the delectable offerings, particularly the recently introduced 'porchetta' sandwich, which elicits nostalgic memories of home-cooked meals lovingly prepared by one's mother. Moreover, the establishment's welcoming ambiance extends to canine patrons, as evidenced by the thoughtful provision of water for furry friends. Such considerate touches contribute to an overall pleasant dining experience."

I have had the pleasure of visiting Chandelier on multiple occasions, and I must say that the ambiance is truly captivating. Upon entering the establishment, I would recommend ascending to the second level, which is nestled between the first and third levels, and ordering the Lemon Verbena beverage, which is not listed on the menu. However, be prepared to pay an additional fee of a few dollars per drink to receive an augmented quantity of floral garnishes for each member of your group. Once you have consumed the beverage, you will notice that the flower, which should not be ingested, will initiate a peculiar foaming phenomenon within your oral cavity, creating the sensation of a miniature fountain. This unique experience can be quite amusing, especially when shared with a group of companions. In fact, I recall a previous visit to Chandelier with a group of five individuals, during which my companion presented me with one of these distinctive beverages, resulting in my unintentional assault on him. Subsequently, I felt compelled to reciprocate this gesture by treating my associates to a similar experience during a subsequent visit to Cosmo with a Bachelorette party. The reactions of my friends were nothing short of priceless, making the expenditure of $23 for the drink and three additional flowers seem trivial in comparison. Notwithstanding the occasional poorly crafted cocktail and the occasional discourteous demeanor exhibited by the bartenders towards female patrons, Chandelier remains a vibrant and popular destination, even in the early hours of the morning.

"An establishment boasting an exceptional ambiance, a diverse and delectable menu, impressive hospitality, and an extensive selection of brews, but hampered by limited parking facilities. Suitable for those seeking a vibrant setting, this venue, dubbed a'social house,' delivers an environment conducive to socializing, replete with numerous televisions for viewing sporting events. A recommendation for individuals desiring a lively experience."

"The culinary experience was exceptional, with the crab cakes being the most delectable and flavorful that I have had the pleasure of consuming. The methodical preparation involved a light breading at the base of the crab cake, thereby preserving the natural juiciness and richness of the seafood. The taste was sublime, with none of the usual heavy sauces overpowering the delicate flavors of the crab. Our dining experience has been consistent, with every staff member, from the initial greeting to the final farewell, displaying exceptional hospitality. However, the only drawback was the excessive noise levels, which seemed to be a deliberate strategy to accommodate a high volume of customers in a short period, thereby creating an atmosphere akin to a bustling eatery, where patrons are encouraged to consume their meals quickly and vacate the premises."

"The culinary experience afforded to us at this establishment was nothing short of a gastronomical revelation, with the piquant spices employed in the preparation of the dishes serving as the defining characteristic that elevated the fare beyond the realm of the mundane. Our unanticipated arrival at an advanced hour did not deter the accommodating staff from extending their warm hospitality, as they demonstrated a profound commitment to ensuring our satisfaction through their solicitous demeanor and judicious recommendations when queried. My unassuming potato and beef entrÃ©e, complemented by a tangy dipping sauce of extraordinary flavor and piquancy, proved to be the epicurean highlight of the evening, prompting me to liberally pour its contents over my meal, while my spouse, whose gustatory preferences apparently diverged from my own, expressed a somewhat more tepid assessment of the culinary offerings, with a rating of three stars, whereas my own evaluation, taking into account the exceptional quality of the sauce, merited a four-star designation."

Although our initial plans to attend the Pirates game were thwarted due to the event's capacity, Bill and I opted to alter our evening's agenda to include a delectable dining experience and an exciting foray into gambling, which led us to choose the Tilted Kilt as our destination.  

Firstly, it is worth mentioning that for those who are of the female gender and harbor insecurities regarding their significant other's surroundings, this establishment may not be the most suitable choice, as the waitstaff consists of scantily-clad and physically attractive young women. Nonetheless, despite the potential for discomfort, the staff members were unwaveringly kind and accommodating towards us. Personally, I remained unfazed by the ambiance, allowing me to thoroughly enjoy the time spent with my partner. The venue itself boasts numerous televisions scattered throughout, enabling us to keep abreast of the baseball game's progression, even though we were unable to attend it in person.  

Regarding the culinary offerings, my assessment is that they surpassed expectations, particularly in regards to my selection, the fried chicken salad. The generous portion size, coupled with the freshness of the romaine lettuce and the pleasing tanginess of the honey mustard dressing, made for a satisfying dining experience. The sole drawback pertaining to my meal was the inclusion of mandarin oranges, which did not align with my personal preferences. In contrast, Bill's Irish Stew elicited his unequivocal approval.  

Based on my previous statements, it is evident that I would not hesitate to revisit the Tilted Kilt at a future date. While the prices may lean towards the higher end of the spectrum, I believe that the establishment possesses sufficient appeal to flourish in Pittsburgh, specifically within the North Side region.

Found this culinary establishment due to its proximity to my place of employment, and I must say that I thoroughly enjoy dining here. In fact, I would relish the opportunity to partake in their delectable offerings on a daily basis, particularly for lunch, but unfortunately, my financial constraints prohibit me from doing so. Nonetheless, I have had the pleasure of indulging in their all-you-can-eat sushi option ($20) for dinner, which I might add, has never failed to impress. The sushi is consistently fresh and of superior quality, and the staff members are always cordial and welcoming. Moreover, the sheer variety of rolls available is truly astounding, with each one boasting unique flavors and ingredients that tantalize the taste buds. Furthermore, the complimentary fruit provided is a thoughtful gesture that adds an extra layer of elegance to the overall dining experience, making one feel truly special and valued. In conclusion, I highly recommend paying a visit to this exceptional eatery, as I am confident that you will derive immense satisfaction from doing so.

I was grinning so hard when I finally arrived at this establishment, not merely due to the respite it provided from the frigid temperature outside, but also because it was a stark contrast to the vivid descriptions depicted in the Yelp reviews (which included terms such as "crackhouse," "employees who cannot speak English," "filthy," and "so pungent it could render one unconscious," among others). My smile was not just a result of the relief, but also the satisfaction of having proven the negative reviews wrong. After deliberating over whether or not to visit this store (with the intention of purchasing Tom Kha Gai), I was delighted to discover that it was, in fact, A TOTALLY TYPICAL ASIAN GROCERY STORE, reminiscent of Chicago Food Corp. on Kimball or Brwyn Mawr Fresh Market. It was almost comical to reflect on the divergence between the reviews and the reality, as I was processing my purchase. The expectation of encountering an unpleasant environment was utterly misguided, and it was quite amusing to consider the disparity between the reviews and the actual experience. While this store may have its drawbacks, including the limitation of payment methods (cash and check only, with an additional fee for card usage), cramped space, and a layer of dust, it more than makes up for it with its diverse selection of items catering to the needs of those seeking to prepare pungent Asian cuisine. They boast an extensive array of exotic sweets, alongside the essential ingredients such as nuoc mam, chili oil, and fresh lemongrass.

Thrift shops and superlatives naturally don't mix too well together, but this is the oldest charity shop in Scotland.  That fact alone is pretty impressive and so is the collection of donated book available in here, amidst the usual charity shop mainstays.\n\nI managed to spot popular classics such as Catch 22, Great Expectations and a huge pile of Goosebumps (remember those!) all at the expected dirt cheap price.

Placed a to go order and the loopy girl taking it royally messed it up. But the manager brought out my correct order really quickly. Additionally, he let me keep the food that she had erroneously given me. Then he offered to refund the entire meal back onto my credit card. Way to go with great customer service!

During my tenure at Shirts and Things, it was customary to procure lunch from this establishment on an intermittent basis. Upon placing an order, I would consistently opt for the bread bowl soup, specifying that half of the contents should be comprised of potato and the remaining half, a judicious blend of broccoli and cheese. This particular configuration proved to be an exceptional combination, as the bread itself possessed notable quality. Furthermore, I would routinely order the Gobbler, a culinary masterpiece reminiscent of Thanksgiving, boasting turkey, cranberry sauce, and stuffing situated upon a bed of marble rye bread. The delivery process appeared efficient; however, the prices were slightly elevated, with each soup and bread or sandwich costing approximately $7, a sum deemed questionable by my standards.

Customer service is terrific. Everyone was so nice and accommodating. Everything is clean and organized. I love the way a lady in there did my eyebrows. I believe she is the owner. She's really precise and I love that. I recently came and got a pedicure and it felt kinda rushed. The foot scrub wasn't all that great, hence the one star removal but everything else is great. Definitely give this place a try.

This culinary experience was utterly delectable. Our decision to dine at this establishment was rather impromptu, as we were lodging at the MGM Grand and opted not to venture far afield onto the strip. We were gratified that our hasty decision yielded such satisfying results. The fare is presented in generous proportions, ideal for sharing amongst a group, and we found that four individuals could comfortably consume five dishes without feeling overly satiated. Particularly noteworthy were the lo mein and orange chicken offerings, which garnered unanimous praise from our foursome. 
  The ambiance of the restaurant boasts a convivial charm, yet maintains an undertone of intimacy. To maximize your dining experience, it is advisable to request a table removed from the entrance, thereby minimizing the intrusion of extraneous noise emanating from the adjacent food court. 
  Although not explicitly listed on the beverage menu, the restaurant offers a selection of reasonably priced beers. Following an afternoon of indulging in overpriced poolside cocktails, these 12-dollar, 36-ounce brews provided a welcome respite for our parched palates. 
  In conclusion, a visit to this eatery is unequivocally recommended.

Great Service, Clean Flavors, Big Menu


Wendy's Noodle Cafe has just become my favorite place called "Wendys."  Sorry other Wendys; even though you're the spicy chicken mecca, I've found another.

Everything we ordered was spectacular, and the friendly service sealed the deal, Wendy's is fantastic.  

Our Order:

Pot Stickers - Perfect crisp on the dumpling and delicious pork/scallion stuffing.  Best Potsticker I've had in Las Vegas.


Beef Short Ribs - Wendy's take on Kalbi - The beef had a nice sear on it while not being dry.  Not as good as Kalbi at many Korean spots, but still a very good appetizer.

Shredded Chicken w/ Vermicelli (noodle soup) - DELICIOUS combination of cilantro, kaffir Lime, and Chili.  This satisfying yet light soup is like your mom's chicken noodle soup with a passport. 

Malaysian Fried Rice - Served with chicken wings and squid balls.  The rice was really nice, tasting of subtle garlic, onion, turmeric, and lime.  It was moist without being mushy, and very wholesome.  The chicken wings were good not great, and the squid balls were forgettable.  The rice itself is a definite order though.


Make sure your tongue's passport is up-to-date, because it's time for your tastebuds to see the world.

"Although I cannot profess to have sampled every pancake within the nation's borders or even a sufficient quantity to establish a robust statistical foundation, I must concede that the pancakes under examination compared favorably to those I might prepare in my own domicile, an observation that admittedly astonished me.  My culinary exploration also encompassed the venue's celebrated corned beef hash, alas, the quality of which did not quite live up to my expectations, perhaps due to its reliance on canned corned beef.  

The harmonious fusion of the eatery's ambiance, steeped in history as a seasoned casino in the city's core, and the delectable pancakes transformed the dining experience into a truly satisfying breakfast excursion. Were it not for the unremarkable quality of the coffee, which regrettably conformed to institutional standards despite the thoughtful accompaniment of a half-and-half pitcher, I would unhesitatingly confer upon the establishment a perfect five-star rating.  

The display case housing an assortment of pies piqued my interest, as several fellow patrons have attested, and I look forward to savoring one of these delectable pastries during a future visit. Additionally, the restaurant offers various breakfast specials, such as a pancake and bacon sandwich ensemble, which may pique the interest of discerning gastronomes.  

In regard to parking, those who seek to avoid monetary exchanges may find the options somewhat limited. However, the valet lot adjacent to the casino provides a convenient solution, albeit at a modest cost of fifty cents for the initial hour, with gratuities customarily exceeding that amount for those who wish to demonstrate their appreciation for the service."

"Indulged in an excessive quantity of cheesecake during National Cheesecake Day at this establishment, which offered half-priced portions of their delectable offerings, resulting in an abbreviated waiting period despite the high volume of patrons. My taste buds were particularly tantalized by the Godiva chocolate variety, eliciting an enthusiastic response of utter amazement; unwavering devotees of chocolate would undoubtedly find this selection appealing. The staff exhibited commendable levels of cordiality, efficiency, and attentiveness, ensuring a satisfying experience for all customers. Kudos to the cheesecake aficionados for their culinary prowess and hospitable demeanor; I eagerly anticipate my next visit."

"I procured a Groupon for this establishment, which encompassed a comprehensive examination, radiographs, whitening trays, and a prophylactic cleaning. Upon arriving at the facility, I was cordially received by the administrative personnel, whose demeanor was characterized by amiability and congeniality. The waiting area was spacious and well-appointed, featuring an array of periodicals and audio-visual entertainment. 
During the initial visit, I was informed that the scheduling of my cleaning and trays would need to be postponed to a subsequent day due to the high volume of patients. Although mildly vexing, I acknowledged that unforeseen circumstances can occasionally arise in healthcare settings. 
Upon my return on the designated day, I underwent a thorough cleaning procedure, during which I experienced a profound sense of tranquility, thanks to the skilled and gentle ministrations of the dental hygienist. The atmosphere in the office was noticeably more serene than during my previous visit, with a marked decrease in patient traffic. The staff members continued to display their characteristic warmth and friendliness. 
Subsequent to the cleaning, another pleasant and affable employee took me back to create impressions for my whitening trays. 
In conclusion, I am thoroughly satisfied with the services rendered at this establishment, and I intend to return next week for the repair of a small cavity."

My corporation customarily reserved me a seat on United Airlines on a monthly basis when I embarked on business trips, thereby establishing them as my final resort while traversing the skies. Their performance has been relatively consistent, punctual, and hospitable, with a negligible incidence of baggage misplacement, in contrast to Southwest Airlines, which experienced a solitary mishap in this regard, and Delta, whose blunders necessitated a prolonged rectification period of twenty-one days. Consequently, I would confer upon them a rating of four stars.

"Lobby-ya burgers are an absolute culinary delight, a veritable gastronomical explosion that transcends the mundane and enters the realm of the sublime. The delectable aroma wafting from the kitchen serves as a harbinger of the epicurean experience that awaits the patron. The gentleman in front of me was effusive in his praise of the establishment's offerings, extolling the virtues of the burger with such fervor that it would have been impolitic to decline the recommendation. Upon partaking of the burger, I found that the gentleman's laudatory remarks were by no means hyperbolic, for the freshness of the bun, the crunchiness of the pickles and lettuce, and the juiciness of the patty combined to create a flavor profile that was nothing short of extraordinary. The fries, with their tantalizing crinkle cut and irresistible taste, served as the perfect complement to the burger, their pipping hot temperature only adding to their allure. In conclusion, my dining experience at Lobby-ya burgers was nothing short of exceptional, and I would highly recommend this eatery to any individual seeking a truly satisfying culinary experience."

Anytime I am craving my grandmother's cooking, I grab something from Rose Tea to take home. I highly recommend the beef pancake roll and their house special rice cakes. You can't go wrong with anything on their menu and their bubble tea is the best I've had in Pittsburgh!

We indulged in a culinary excursion at this eatery during our sojourn in Las Vegas, accompanied by a coterie of eight individuals.  The hospitality proffered by the staff was indeed commendable, as they exhibited an acute attention to detail and a congenial demeanor.

My personal gastronomical selection was the chicken kiev, which boasted a satisfying crispness on its exterior and an unctuous juiciness within.  Unfortunately, the cranberry cabbage salad that accompanied my entree did not quite live up to my expectations, as its flavors did not tantalize my palate to the extent that I had anticipated; I would have preferred the vibrant hue and presumably more robust taste of red cabbage, as sampled by my fellow diners.

The porcine offerings of our group were somewhat disappointing, as they lacked the succulence that one might optimistically expect from such a dish.  However, the steak proved to be a satisfactory alternative.  In a moment of culinary capriciousness, I elected to substitute the customary fries accompanying my entree with mashed potatoes, which, while undoubtedly delicious, left me wistfully yearning for the crispy, golden allure of their fried counterparts.

Our collective gastronomical odyssey continued with an assortment of appetizers, including the ubiquitous cabbage rolls, herring, and a visually stunning vegetable platter.  While the former elicited mixed reviews from our group, with some members expressing unbridled enthusiasm and others, like myself, remaining relatively unimpressed, the herring, with its refreshing lack of oiliness and subtle flavor, proved to be an unmitigated delight.  Furthermore, our server's recommendation of the herring over the salmon proved to be a veritable stroke of genius.  The vegetable platter, artfully arranged and bursting with freshness, further showcased the culinary prowess of the establishment.  Lastly, the assorted desserts we sampled served as a sweet finale to our delectable journey.

In conclusion, while the food at this restaurant was certainly above average, the exceptional quality of the service and the eminently reasonable prices truly elevated our dining experience to a level worthy of unqualified praise.  Alas, our departure from the premises was marred by an unfortunate encounter with a solicitous individual seeking a pecuniary loan, thereby imbuing our otherwise pleasant outing with a tinge of discomfort.

"Winner-Winner - Chicken Dinner\n\nI emerged victorious, securing a triumphant victory; my gaming experience at the establishment was thoroughly enjoyable, as the ambiance was pleasant and the staff were cordial. My exploits at the blackjack table proved to be particularly fruitful, yielding a substantial profit. I am eager to return and redeem my remaining chip, with the expectation of further success."

This place was packed on Friday night! Every table was full of happy people getting their kbbq on! It smelt amazing from the get go and we were excited to eat some good Korean food. 

We got the daeji bulgogi and the seafood tofu soup. The tofu soup was just the right spice and warmed our bellies. The meat came out sizzling and tasted sweet and spicy. I wished that the meat was cooked a little longer because I like a little char, but still yummy! The only downside was the side dishes. There were only a few that I liked: kimchi, seaweed and the fish cakes. The others were not as exciting like cole slaw and stuff. Not a huge deal though. 

I was still really happy with the food and would come back again!

Located within the heart of cosmopolitan, patrons may capitalize on OpenTable's reservation services to secure a table at this esteemed eatery. Upon entering the establishment, we were escorted to a prime location near the perimeter of the dining area, boasting breathtaking vistas. The culinary offerings we sampled included the delectable roasted bone marrow, served with an ample portion of shredded pork, as well as their daily special: a mouthwatering combination of crispy fried pork cutlet, eggs, and an additional component...accompanied by a succulent pork shank. Initially, the singular bone marrow arrived with a generous helping of shredded pork, rendering it a relatively pricey yet plentiful option. The appetizer du jour, an unparalleled pork cutlet, proved to be an impressive introduction to our meal, although its seasoning could have been more judicious. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the colossal pork shank remained a highlight, yielding tender morsels that effortlessly detached from the substantial bone. To complement our repast, the restaurant offered a unique cocktail special, infused with effervescent elements and presenting a pleasing flavor profile. Our attentive server exhibited proficiency in navigating the menu's intricacies, providing sound guidance and fostering a welcoming atmosphere. Following a satisfying dining experience, we departed with a complimentary cosmo bag containing our surplus fare, eager to revisit this gastronomic haven in the future.

"My dining experience at this esteemed establishment was truly remarkable, and indeed, it ranks among the most unforgettable culinary adventures I have had the pleasure of indulging in. The meticulously curated wine pairings complemented the elaborate tasting menu perfectly, and the exceptional quality of the service we received was utterly flawless. Furthermore, we had the distinct privilege of sharing our dining experience with none other than the distinguished former Secretary of State, Madeleine Albright, who was partaking in a copious amount of red wine, which was conspicuously poured into a decorative decanter, while the remainder of the table opted for a crisp white wine. Suffice it to say, the opportunity to engage in a convivial evening with such an eminent figure undoubtedly enhanced the already extraordinary ambiance of the restaurant. However, a word of caution regarding the initial amuse-bouche: it consisted of a peculiar lobster gelÃ©e/foam, which, regrettably, did not possess the characteristic flavor profile of fresh lobster. In fact, numerous patrons expressed their dissatisfaction with this particular item, and yet, it continued to be presented. Consequently, I felt compelled to consume an additional generous portion of wine. Nonetheless, the remaining courses of the tasting menu were executed to perfection and boasted exceptional flavors."

"This eatery exudes an ambiance of refined sophistication, which is further complemented by the delectable culinary offerings. My filet, cooked to a perfect medium rare, was indeed a gastronomic delight, while my spouse's critique of his medium-well prepared cut being lacking in flavor can be attributed to his personal taste. The asparagus accompaniment, albeit slightly diminutive in size, was nevertheless adequately prepared, whereas the baked potato was cooked to perfection. The assorted bread selection provided by the establishment was undoubtedly a pleasant surprise, adding to the already convivial atmosphere. Although the French onion soup exhibited a subtle yet discernible dominance of fresh herbs, the overall taste was satisfactory. A diverse array of wines is available, but the prices are somewhat prohibitive, making one nostalgic for the erstwhile practice of bringing one's own bottle. The attentive and courteous service, combined with the secluded booths, created a comfortable dining experience, allowing for effortless conversation. While the steak undeniably lived up to expectations, the cost of $33.00 per plate may be considered somewhat prohibitive."

Pretty good pizza!  Thin crispy crust that's both crispy and has good chew. Tasty sauce with a hint of kick.  Good toppings, too.\n\nIt's a great choice if you're staying on the Strip and don't want to pay obscene room service rates for questionable pizza.  Our pizza was delivered to us at our south-strip hotel at no extra charge by a very friendly driver.

Top of the Mornin'

Popped in over the weekend while looking for a place to eat, our group wanted to eat at Capo's but we didn't know you have to make reservations in advanced, cause it sells out. Our group sneaked in this quite retreat and enjoyed our time away from the hustle and buss ell of Vegas. 

The atmosphere is very chill, and relaxing. We talked with some other tourist and had a friendly conversation.  We ordered a fish and chip happy hour snack for $2.99 and was happy with the food quality. Our bartender lady was nice and recommended a great place for Italian food.

Whenever I travel, I like to find an Ethiopian restaurant. It's usually in a part of town one wouldn't experience whilst staying in the business district. And it's usually an eatery, run by a husband and wife team, that's friendly to solo eaters, as I sometimes am.
On top of all that, Ethiopian food is HONEST--it's meat and veggies in straight-up yummy sauces, good for your body and mind!

Here in Tempe, Lalibela is a good example of that down-home mom-and-pop cooking, Eth-style.

It's also a great spot to bring your friends and family. When you do, try the sampler platters; they're the best way to eat Ethiopian, emphasizing the communal nature of the feast (eaten with hands, not flatware).

The teas are delicious too.

"It is suffice to state that my culinary experience at this establishment was thoroughly enjoyable, with the premier attraction being the mango cream ale, which had recently become available and of which I consumed an appreciable quantity of 23 ounces. The delectable beverage aside, the expansive menu offered by this eatery is quite impressive, and the hospitality we received during our visit was of exceptional quality. Furthermore, my companion's beef burrito was of such satisfying proportions that they were able to devour the entire dish. It is evident that this venue is a popular destination, as evidenced by the fact that we secured the final table on a Tuesday evening at 8:30 PM. Moreover, the interior design of the restaurant afforded a most agreeable ambiance, which was further enhanced by the capacious nature of the dining area."
Delicious and well-priced slices. Definitely going to marry the garlic knots one day. It's pretty packed on the weekends, especially after Alive After Five, but the service is quick.

This particular recreational area is a preferred destination for my two-year-old child, owing to its unique feature of integrated slides that are seamlessly incorporated into the topography of the terrain, complemented by cutting-edge playground facilities and an ingenious water-based entertainment system that serves as an ideal amenity during periods of elevated temperature. Notably, the maintenance and upkeep of this park are undertaken by the Henderson Parks and Recreation Department, which boasts a proficient track record in managing such green spaces, and this specific location stands out as one of the most exceptional within their network, thereby warranting an unhesitant four-star rating.

I ordered the Harvest Chopped Salad and Banana, Espresso, Pistachio, and Date Muffin. The salad had the best combination of fresh fruits, creamy goat cheese, and dressing. I would not complain if I ate one of those every day! The muffin was so delicious, what a combination of flavors! The only down side for me is that it was quite pricey. Don't get me wrong, the food was mouth-watering, but I wouldn't want to spend that much money on a regular basis.

As you walk down the hall you can smell this place from a mile away. I have yet to have a bad meal there! I would totally suggest trying to get a seat on the patio overlooking the fountains. Great meal and a great view... it would be a great spot to propose... just saying

If you are seeking to socialize or convene a gathering of individuals who have yet to experience the charms of Tempe, then Casey's would be an ideal location to facilitate such an occasion. Not only does Casey's offer an extensive array of potent potables, but their culinary offerings also surpass the quality of the typical bar fare. However, the true attractions of Casey's reside in the ambiance and the hospitality of its staff. Situated within the vibrant downtown area, the establishment exudes a palpable energy, as patrons engage in lively banter and convivial interactions. It is worth noting, though, that the doormen may exhibit a somewhat unpolished demeanor, so it is advisable to refrain from attempting entry after consuming alcoholic beverages beforehand. Furthermore, an exploration of the upstairs area may also be worthwhile, provided you can manage to evade the vigilance of the wait staff. Rumor has it that this particular space harbors a certain paranormal quality.

My inaugural indulgence in boba transpired at a Far Eastern market situated in the Western Valley; subsequent to that encounter, I have discovered several establishments in proximity to my abode that proffer this delectable beverage.  Boba Tea House holds a special place in my heart as my preferred destination for satiating my cravings for this delightful concoction.
 They boast an extensive array of flavors, which afford patrons the latitude to experiment with various combinations; however, I tend to adhere to familiar territory and opt for a Lychee Snow accompanied by boba.
 My experiences at Boba Tea House have been consistently impressive, save for the fact that I do not feel entirely at ease lingering on the premises.  It is not uncommon for individuals above the age of 18 to find themselves amidst a sea of youthful patrons, which may engender a sense of discomfort.  Notwithstanding, I remain undeterred in my pursuit of this delectable beverage and shall persist in frequenting Boba Tea House to sate my yearnings for boba.

We recently held our wedding reception at the Bentley Projects.  It was an unexpected, stylish place to hold a wedding reception, which is exactly what we were looking for.  

The gallery is large and spacious and absolutely stunning at night.  The lighting is perfect and what better backdrop for photos than original art pieces?  

The art is contemporary, from artists all over the country.  Unfortunately, I could not afford any of there pieces...pretty pricey.  Ahhh...maybe someday. 

The bookstore no longer exists, but the restaurant, City Bakery, is a perfect stop for lunch and then head over to the gallery to check out the exhibit.  They are also open late for First Friday's.

"I thoroughly enjoyed this particular buffet experience! Immediately upon entering, we made a beeline for the seafood section, whereupon my culinary curiosity was piqued by the sight of the delectable King Alaskan Crab, which had been thoughtfully cracked and prepared for our convenience. My gastronomical enthusiasm was further heightened by the sheer quality of the dish, leading me to surmise that it was indeed the most scrumptious item available. My unbridled passion for comestibles was evidenced by the fact that I had the pleasure of consuming several plates worth of victuals, including crab cakes, salmon, chicken, and lamb shiskabobs (the latter of which were merely average), in addition to hummus and pita (which I found to be subpar), dolmas, sushi, won tons (which were surprisingly tasty), dim sum (likewise enjoyable), and a duo of dessert plates. Of these, the chocolate-covered strawberries truly captured my fancy. Regrettably, my carnivorous companion's assessment of the steak was less than favorable; however, this did not detract from my overall satisfaction with the establishment. Given the opportunity, I would unquestionably return, albeit with a more voracious appetite. Furthermore, we unwittingly consumed a rather unpleasant strawberry daquiri en route to Planet Hollywood, which unfortunately satiated our hunger and rendered us somewhat less inclined to indulge in further gastronomic exploration."

Our Sunday night plans turned out lamer than expected, and RA's reverse happy hour saved the evening! All dressed up on a Sunday evening with nowhere special to go? Ra will do!

Sunday nights they 'transform' the bar in to the 'Flying Fish Lounge.' A DJ sets up right around 8pm in the corner of the bar and the beats stay bumping til close. Though the beats are nothing out of this world, it just spice up the bar area, but doesn't cause too much commotion in the restaurant area...

Drinks & food at RA are overpriced regularly, but as mentioned, for HH, you can't complain. The prices range from $2-$7 for both drinks & sushi specials. Big rolls like the amazing Las Vegas Roll & probably the shrimp tempura are $7, basic rolls like spicy tuna are $4, & I think the nigri is $3.. Hot sake - $1, Big Kirin beers are only like $3, & their mix drinks range, but are never that impressive.

That night I ordered two rolls (the toosty maki is always a winner if you like eel sauce) & some yummy Albacore appetizer and my tab was $19. My girlfriend ordered dessert, and it looked amazing! An asian spin on the banana split, it was served like a tempura sushi roll, but instead was fried ice cream smothered in chocolate sauce, whipped cream, strawberries, etc. looked amazing!

Oh Ra, you may be a chain but I'm glad to have you close.

My maiden visit to this establishment was characterized by an absence of elevated expectations, yet it culminated in a remarkably positive experience. The sandwich I procured, specifically a submarine variety, possessed dimensions that were truly formidable, rendering it a Herculean task to consume in its entirety. Despite my initial skepticism regarding my ability to complete the task, the delectability of the aforementioned sub rendered it impossible to relinquish my grasp upon it, compelling me to persevere and ultimately vanquish the formidable foe that it presented. Furthermore, I was delighted to discover that this eatery boasts an expansive area designated for the parking of vehicles, located in the rear sector of the premises, thereby facilitating accessibility for patrons. Additionally, a diminutive purveyor of bagels, situated in close proximity to the main establishment, offers an array of delectable treats that complement the primary fare offered by this dining establishment.
this place is hard to find, but when you get there it's worth it, had the link, brisket, rib combo, was great.

I have had the pleasure of dining at this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions, both during the luncheon and dinner hours, and I must say that the culinary offerings have consistently impressed me with their freshness and quality, regardless of the time of day. The staff has always been cordial and helpful, providing exceptional service that enhances the overall dining experience. In accordance with the standard AYCE sushi protocol, certain guidelines apply, such as no sharing with non-AYCE guests, a policy against wasting rice, and a limited time frame of approximately one hour to indulge in the delectable offerings. Among my personal preferences are the Crab roll, 911, Friday 13th v Jason, Spider roll, Spiderman, Cowgirl, Japanese lasagna, and numerous others that I highly recommend. Due to its modest size, this restaurant may experience a high volume of patrons during peak evening hours, potentially resulting in a wait for seating. However, the excellent service persistently maintains a superior level, as they can only accommodate a finite number of customers at any given time. If you're unable to secure a table, consider ordering takeout, as the sushi is prepared fresh upon ordering, in contrast to the pre-made, refrigerated sushi often found at other establishments, such as RA.

"Indulged in an edible indulgence with my miniature companion at an establishment purporting to specialize in delectable baked goods; however, our gastronomical excursion proved to be somewhat disappointing due to an absence of suitable seating arrangements, which precluded us from partaking of our delicious treats on the premises (a solitary, diminutive table did little to alleviate this inconvenience). Perused the menu and discovered a palette of flavors that, while not unremarkable, failed to elicit an overwhelming sense of enthusiasm: red velvet, chocolate, birthday cake, yellow cake, Oreo, German chocolate, and peanut butter cup. All items were pre-prepared, thus eliminating the possibility of customization. Notwithstanding, the cupcakes boasted an agreeable texture, replete with a copious amount of sugary icing. My personal preference leaned toward the chocolate variety, although a faint bitterness tempered my enjoyment. Further dissatisfaction ensued upon discovering an utter lack of potables (a simple glass of water would have sufficed during sweltering summer days). In conclusion, while the cupcakes proved satisfactory, they fell short of exceptional quality. Nevertheless, the business is likely to flourish given its advantageous location."

It required a considerable amount of time to complete the process of obtaining a new tire, approximately one and a half hours, during which the employees were diligently working at their maximum capacity. Furthermore, I was impressed by the fact that the staff member at the counter did not attempt to persuade me to purchase the costliest tires available, instead, he provided me with sound advice, suggesting that a more affordable option was, in fact, superior to the priciest selection.

My offspring procured the Pechuga ala Plancha, which was utterly phenomenal. My female progeny had a quesadilla that she thoroughly enjoyed. The flesh in my tacos was delectable, yet somewhat desiccated, rendering them slightly arduous to consume. My alcoholic beverage and supplementary guacamole were also quite palatable. \n\nI have been a resident of Madison for over a dozen years and was previously unaware of this establishment's existence in this secluded location. I shall unquestionably return.

"Unexpectedly superior in quality, the brisket boasted an impressive depth of flavor and succulent texture that thoroughly impressed my palate. In contrast, the ribs were merely adequate, failing to live up to my expectations. Despite this, I would not advocate for dining at this establishment, as the meat requires a certain level of manual dexterity and a willingness to relinquish one's inhibitions regarding neatness. However, the macaroni and cheese presented a delightfully creamy consistency. Although the dishes lacked the desired temperature, I did not hold high hopes for their thermal properties. Ultimately, while the experience proved satisfying, the cost was somewhat prohibitive."

I'd read about Pop's in LV Weekly awhile ago and when the Groupon for this place popped up, we seized the opportunity and ventured over to Decatur to check it out.  I was surprised to discover it was an outdoor establishment with no indoor seating, and wasn't sure what to expect since the place doesn't look like much at first glance. \n\nBut looks can be deceiving, and I was VERY impressed with the food -- everything is made to order, so even though we sat outside in the 60 degree evening to eat our phillies at one of the tables, the food was piping hot.  I liked that they had a few options for cheese since I'm not a cheese whiz fan, so I got provolone instead with peppers and onions and it was delish.  My boyfriend got the same and we shared the crunchy fried green beans with marinara sauce, which were very good.  Portions were pretty big so you definitely get a lot of food for your money.  I'd definitely go here again!

This establishment was emphatically endorsed to me, and as an American, my ignorance led me to unwittingly saunter into the premises on a Friday evening, subsequent to indulging in libations and hors d'oeuvres with a coterie of acquaintances. To my utter astonishment, I discovered an unoccupied stool at the bar, nestled between a locally-based individual donning a cycling helmet and a dapper gentleman clad in a meticulously tailored suit. In contrast, my attire consisted of a pair of abbreviated trousers and a casual shirt (a characteristic exemplifying the unsophisticated nature of American tourists when it comes to vacation attire).

The hospitality proffered by the staff was indeed meritorious, as bartenders, steeped in tradition, dispensed finely crafted vintages and offered recommendations for culinary delights with consummate skill. This eatery exuded an air of authenticity, boasting time-honored traditions, a well-curated selection of comestibles, and an ambiance that harmoniously complemented the gastronomic experience. Personally, I opted for a glass of red wine, accompanied by the duck confit salad â?a departure from my customary preferences, yet one that did not disappoint. The fowl was lavished with flavorful seasonings, the flesh was succulent, the greens were fresh (noteworthy, given the late summer season), and the equilibrium achieved between the piquant and sweet elements of the greens and the rich meat was nothing short of culinary virtuosity.

In conclusion, this particular salad warrants repetition, although the menu harbors numerous other delectable options deserving exploration upon future visits to this esteemed establishment.

"Consequently, I believe I have arrived at a comprehensive understanding of the situation: Stoney's offers an economical and enjoyable dining experience, particularly during football games, with a diverse selection of tacos and beverages available at reasonable prices. However, it is essential to note that the quality of the food, service, and overall value may not meet expectations, especially when compared to other establishments in the area. Furthermore, while the atmosphere may be suitable for casual gatherings or social events, it may not be the most ideal setting for a formal dining experience. Nonetheless, I would not hesitate to visit Stoney's again, perhaps on a Monday afternoon, when the ambiance is more relaxed, and the prices are still affordable, allowing me to indulge in their modestly priced menu options while enjoying a few drinks."

I go here mostly for the izakaya feel and less for the food.  I used to frequent izakayas on a weekly basis when I lived in Japan and sometimes I just want to feel nostalgic so I swing by Ichiza. 

The food is about as good as an average run of the mill izakaya found anywhere in Japan.  I have a feeling most of the 5 star reviews on here are coming from people who have never ate at a finer izakaya in Japan.  The selection could be a bit better, I would prefer an all Japanese kitchen staff, though their wait staff is all Japanese.  

So for the food, 3 stars.

For the kind and welcoming staff, 5 stars.  Ambiance and izakaya feel get 4 stars.

Don't come here expecting an amazing Japanese food adventure.  Come here with friends expecting some cold beer, lively chatter, and friendly service!

"We thoroughly relished our morning repast at this eatery, reveling in its welcoming ambiance while savoring an assortment of delectable breakfast fare, including a particularly scrumptious iteration of the \"Biker's Dream\" sandwich, accompanied by an expertly crafted espresso beverage. Moreover, we were delightfully surprised to discover that this establishment offers an array of alcohol-infused coffee concoctions, rendering it an ideal destination for future caffeine-seeking excursions to Madison. However, we would be remiss if we did not suggest that the proprietors consider undertaking a thorough cleaning or replacement of the premises' carpeting, in order to elevate the overall atmosphere to a level commensurate with the quality of the culinary offerings."

During my recent sojourn in Las Vegas, I opted to lodge at this establishment, and while it may not have been the most extravagant abode, it proved to be a satisfactory temporary dwelling. Despite the unfavorable critiques I perused prior to my stay, I decided to take a chance and was ultimately gratified by my decision. The lodging itself presented no remarkable features, yet our chamber was adequately sanitized upon our arrival, and parking posed no significant obstacle. Although locating a parking space may require some additional time upon returning in the evening, the process of checking in and out was uncomplicated and efficient. Considering their reasonably priced rates, I would not hesitate to return to this hotel in the future.

Stonecreek is a nice place to play, and the price is fair.  I do like the layout.  Fun but not gimmicky.  The scenery is nice, too.

I will have to agree with others about the ball vacuum (aka creek) running right through the middle of the course.  

The staff also seemed nice enough when I was there.  I'm not sure what others were complaining about.  Overall, it's a decent place to play, and its location makes it ideal if you're meeting people from the other side of town.

Great food, fast, friendly service, lots to eat and very reasonably priced. Hot and sour soup is spicy but not so hot that you can't taste the ingredients. The Family combination (for two @ $11.95/person) of soup, egg roll and crab puff appetizers, mildly seasoned broccoli chicken and spicy Mongolian beef plus rice was enough for two people plus leftovers to take home for tomorrow's lunch.

This gastronomical establishment boasts an extensive array of delectable sushi options, all of which are meticulously crafted to order, ensuring an unparalleled freshness and quality. Furthermore, the menu showcases an impressive diversity, catering to a wide range of palates and preferences. The prompt and attentive service only enhances the dining experience, making it a truly exceptional culinary adventure. While the rolls are undoubtedly the stars of the show, other notable delights include the savory baked mussels and Ahi Poki, both of which are capable of eliciting an unrelenting craving. Although a prolonged waiting period may occasionally be encountered, the ensuing satisfaction unequivocally justifies the delay. In light of its merits, an expansion of this eatery would be a judicious decision, allowing a greater number of patrons to partake in the culinary splendor that is Sushi Mon.

"I decided to indulge in a frozen dessert and entered the establishment, whereupon I was pleasantly taken aback by the exceptional caliber of the product; specifically, the rich, velvety texture and burst of flavors that exploded in my mouth with each bite left me utterly satisfied, and the prompt and attentive demeanor exhibited by the staff further enhanced my overall experience, rendering it truly delightful."

"Optimize your visitation experience by prioritizing the libational ambiance rather than the culinary offerings, as the latter may not conform to gastronomical expectations. An expansive outdoor area, replete with multiple televisions and cornhole facilities, serves as an idyllic setting for social gatherings. Restrict your interior presence to the necessities, such as utilizing the lavatory facilities, as the indoor space may not be aesthetically arresting. Partake in the trivia festivities on Wednesday evenings at 8 pm for an enjoyable diversion, complemented by reasonable beverage prices (draughts at $3) and burger specials, albeit the latter may not be a gustatory highlight. Anticipate difficulties in parking, but alternative options exist across the street. In summary, this venue offers a convivial atmosphere for liquid refreshment, yet do not anticipate a delectable repast."

"I have had the pleasure of frequenting this establishment on numerous occasions during my formative years, specifically during my high school tenure. The fond memories I have accumulated here are largely attributed to the delectable subs and, as I recall, a satisfactory soup selection as well. The French fries served here are undoubtedly among the most exceptional I have had the pleasure of consuming, and the inclusion of sweet potato fries as an alternative is indeed a thoughtful gesture. 

As I have matured and my visits to this eatery have become less frequent (owing to my departure from Pittsburgh for academic pursuits), my thoughts have begun to dwell on certain aspects of the dining experience offered here. Specifically, I have wondered whether vegetarian options are available, and I must admit that the practice of charging for refills of soft drinks has struck me as somewhat peculiar. Furthermore, I have noticed that nearly every component of the meals served here, including the fries, meat, and even the bread, appears to be imbued with a noticeable amount of grease. While the absence of debit card acceptance may present a minor inconvenience, the proximity of two banks in opposite directions mitigates this issue to a certain extent. 

In summary, while not perfect, this restaurant remains a respectable choice, boasting an array of palatable subs that continue to attract a predominantly youthful clientele. Were I to assign a rating, I would lean towards a 3.5-star assessment, albeit restricted by the limitations of the available rating system."

Since my daughter's gastronomical inclinations lean towards the culinary delights of sushi, this establishment has transpired into a recurrent destination for our family unit. Our patronage of this edifice has spanned two annual cycles, and we have developed an unwavering affection for its hospitable ambiance and delectable fare. The staff members exhibit a congenial demeanor, which contributes to the overall pleasant dining experience. The periodic presentation of special offerings elicits an element of surprise, further enhancing our epicurean indulgence. Notwithstanding the hour, we can rely upon expeditious service that facilitates our satisfaction of cravings for sushi.

If you derive pleasure from ambulating outdoors and engaging in retail therapy, then Town Square is the optimal destination for you. This scenic locale boasts an array of apparel stores and specialized boutiques, as well as a cinema, watering holes, lounges, and eateries, thereby offering a diverse assortment of activities catering to various interests and preferences. Its proximity to major transportation arteries ensures that accessing this hub of commercial activity is a straightforward endeavor, and abundant parking facilities encircling the perimeter render it a convenient and practical experience for visitors. My personal experiences at Town Square have been primarily centered around patronizing the expansive Whole Foods market, which ranks among the most sizable in the vicinity, and periodically indulging in the delectable cuisine served at Texas de Brasil. In conclusion, Town Square is an exceptional venue for indulging in gastronomical delights, imbibing beverages, and acquiring goods, and I unhesitatingly endorse paying a visit to this captivating location.

"My infatuation with Taco Y Taco's culinary offerings had already reached an unprecedented level, and I was under the impression that it couldn't possibly be surpassed. However, with the introduction of this new establishment, I was unequivocally mistaken. It has undoubtedly improved, providing a novel and elevated dining experience. While maintaining the identical format as its predecessor, this eatery boasts an upgraded interior design replete with a stylish bar, thereby enhancing the overall ambiance. 

The ordering process remains unchanged, with separate stations designated for specific types of meat. The restaurant still offers its renowned salsa bar and menu items, which fills me with immense delight. My steadfast preference for al pastor remains unwavering, although I am resolved to venture out and sample their other delectable options during my subsequent visit. The elote continues to be an indispensable component of my dining experience. 

Although I would greatly appreciate a location closer to my residence, I shall continue to make the journey to their Trop and Eastern establishments until such a time when my wish is fulfilled."

The arena is super convenient if you're staying in the hotel, but it's really cold, and the ushers don't let you go down to your seats during all parts of the game. You're supposed to wait until a \"pause.\" It's not the theater, so I don't see why they're so strict about this. It's not like you're really going to disturb the nacho-munching spectators who are drunkenly yelling at the players. Seriously. Also, the lines for the bathroom and food were fairly packed.

"Gourmet burgers, an epicurean delight, boasting unconventional pairings, tantalized my taste buds (specifically, the Rising Sun burger, which I had the pleasure of savoring, and a sample of my companion's Gold Standard).  Artisanal steak fries, possessing a delightful texture, characterized by a fluffy interior and a satisfying crunch on the exterior, complemented the delectable patties.  An extensive array of artisan brews further enhanced the dining experience. \n\nDespite the exorbitant prices ubiquitous in Las Vegas, the cost, including gratuity, for a gastronomic adventure consisting of premium burgers and specialty beverages, proved to be a reasonable $27 per individual."

"I experience a profound sense of longing for Katz's, and I am unapologetic about this sentiment. The minuscule, grimy spoon provided a palliative to my hangover-induced affliction on a sluggish Sunday morning. Postino, however, has transformed the aged edifice into an impressive establishment through its resourceful adaptation of construction materials. The unconventional application of building components manifests itself in an aesthetically pleasing manner, such as the red trusses that serve purely ornamental purposes. Although the cost may be slightly elevated, it is advisable to allocate your financial resources towards experiencing the delightful offerings of Postino. To optimize your visit, consider providing your contact information, registering for their email list, taking advantage of happy hour, and capitalizing on special evenings (Tuesdays and Thursdays are particularly well-attended). If your party consists of three or more individuals, prepare to endure a brief delay. However, the wait is justified by the delectable goat cheese and roasted red pepper bruschetta, accompanied by a refreshing glass of sparkling wine. The outdoor seating area, despite its proximity to the parking lot, exudes an air of charm. Additionally, the friendly valets are available to assist you, unless the time falls outside the parameters of reasonably late or early. Patrons of Postino tend to adorn themselves in stylish attire, contributing to an atmosphere of opulence. Embrace this ambiance by donning your fashionable footwear, such as Sam Edelman keyhole peeptoes, and savoring a generous glass of robust red wine with subtle hints of bologna in its flavor profile."

"This eatery formerly bore the name Rainbow Pho, up until the moment when one of its servers opted to procure the entire establishment, thereby prompting a shift in its nomenclature. Pho Annie boasts an impressive array of delectable options, catering to diverse palates by offering both pho and grilled meats, such as pork chops, for patrons to relish. Conveniently situated on the western side of town, it caters specifically to the culinary inclinations of those residing in that locality, affectionately referred to as 'west side peepz.' Upon entering, my companion and I opted to sample their Chicken Pho, while I supplemented my order with a serving of grilled lamb chops accompanied by rice and a fried egg. To initiate our dining experience, we indulged in fresh Vietnamese wraps as an appetizer. Our culinary creations were truly sublime, and the hospitality we received was warm and welcoming, as the staff greeted us with a smile and acknowledged us as regular patrons, rendering our visit an thoroughly enjoyable one and leaving us without any significant cause for complaint."

"Upon recent discovery of this culinary establishment, situated conveniently proximate to my workplace, I have had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable offerings on multiple occasions. Specifically, their jalapeno cilantro hummus has captured my palate's attention, with its ingenious fusion of flavors creating a truly singular gustatory experience. However, my enthusiasm for this eatery is not without qualification, as I find their policy of charging for additional pita bread to be somewhat vexing. It is my belief that such an practice may potentially evoke feelings of discontent among patrons, analogous to the sensation of disappointment depicted in certain advertisements where an individual, having anticipated a particular indulgence, is instead met with an unforeseen obstacle. Be that as it may, my overall assessment of this venue remains favorable, as I have enjoyed their gyros and, in particular, their guava lemonade, which has proven to be a veritable oasis of refreshment. Thus, I would unhesitatingly recommend this restaurant to those seeking a satisfying dining experience."
Pizza at this second location was very good.  Almost as good as downtown?  In a big shopping center so parking is easy.  Late Sat afternoon it was almost empty so no wait.

We indulged in a pre-concert repast at Steak 44 on a Wednesday evening, and despite the throngs of patrons that converged upon the establishment, we were accommodated at a cozy two-person table situated proximate to the hearth and the bar. We initiated our culinary excursion with an order of calamari, whose generous proportions and lack of greasiness rendered it an auspicious commencement to our meal.
