My better half opted for the filet, which arrived on a sizzling hot plate, its tenderness and flavor eliciting unwavering approbation from my taste buds. Meanwhile, I relished the scallops, their succulence and freshness uncompromised by any trace of mediocrity. In addition, we shared a portion of baked creamed spinach, its richness and savory essence proving a worthy complement to our main courses. Although the baked potatoes fell somewhat short of our expectations in terms of magnitude, their quality remained undiminished, with each spud boasting a satisfying texture and flavor profile. Furthermore, our server, Matthew, exhibited exceptional proficiency and hospitality throughout our dining experience, ensuring that our needs were met with alacrity and grace. Suffice it to say, we shall indeed revisit this gastronomic haven in the future.

```
Spectacular location for perusing high-end items. The sales associates exhibited remarkable benevolence, and their dedication to providing exceptional customer service was truly commendable. Without hesitation, I would enthusiastically endorse this establishment for both purchasing and selling luxury goods.
```

The text is: "I love this store! They have a great selection of unique and stylish pieces. The staff is always friendly and helpful."

The modified text is:

```
This retail establishment has captured my affection due to its impressive array of distinctive and fashionable items. The sales personnel consistently display cordiality and helpfulness, fostering a welcoming atmosphere that greatly enhances the shopping experience. Unquestionably, I harbor immense fondness for this store.
```

The atmosphere in Brass Monkey is better than any other pub I've been to in Edinburgh! I usually come here after a morning of classes or an exam and chill out in their 'secret' back room of mattresses and cushions.  Although sleeping is not allowed it's extremely tempting to just doze off with a pint.  The food is also great and I would definitely recommend their sandwiches which go well with the reasonably priced drinks.\nThe front room, however, has the brilliant atmosphere I was referring to.  It's small with very few tables and so isn't cluttered.  If you're in there early you can grab a table with your mates and settle down for a heavy session in the midst of the bustling environment which the pub offers.  The problem, however, is that if can't find anywhere to sit then you're forced to stand which is fine, but it can just feel a bit cramped and pointless.  \nBrass Monkey is a cosy and affordable alternative to the larger and more conventional pubs in Edinburgh.  Worth a visit no matter the occassion.

"The initial experience at this establishment was satisfactory, with the culinary offerings being of considerable quality, specifically the pho, which was skillfully prepared and the broth was flavorful. However, the customer service left much to be desired, as I had to physically rise from my seat to request both the bill and a to-go container. It would have been more preferable to have the option to place an order and make payment in advance, thereby ensuring a swifter and more efficient process, especially considering the fact that there was only a single individual handling the cash register and attending to various tasks, thus detracting from the overall customer experience typically associated with a sit-down restaurant. Notwithstanding, I shall return and recommend this venue to others."

"An exceptional value for a pristine automobile; this establishment offers a pragmatic and unpretentious experience. There is neither a throng of patrons awaiting their turn to have their vehicles cleansed, nor any salesperson endeavoring to peddle supplementary services such as a novel windshield or a $100 detailing package. Instead, the staff merely inquires about your preferences and facilitates your passage through the lavation process. It is crucial to note that if your vehicle is equipped with a metallic antenna, it is imperative to detach it prior to entry into the wash. Personally, I had opted for the $2 wash previously, but upon upgrading to the $5 wash recently, I was pleasantly startled by the discovery that my wheels had been thoroughly cleansed when I stooped to wipe them clean - a perk not typically associated with the $2 wash. Furthermore, complimentary vacuum stations are available for all clientele. For those who are willing to invest a few additional moments in self-service cleaning and tidying up their dashboard, the outcome is a superior wash comparable to, or even surpassing, that offered by full-service car washes at a cost of $20. Typically, there is either no queue or a brief wait for individuals seeking to avail themselves of the car wash facilities. Generally, the entire process takes between 15 to 20 minutes from start to finish."

Too bad the chips and salsa are so darn good because we filled up so badly we could hardly eat our meal. The food was still tasty, however: I had the chicken mole, DH had the chingalingas, and the kids each tried a mexican choice off the kids' meals. Our server, Sara, was awesome - she offered to switch out one of the kid's meals when he complained about it being too spicy. For the record, he ate it all and said it was delicious. \n\nWe've eaten there before and decided the best place to fully enjoy this restaurant's fabulous atmosphere is out on the patio so go when the weather is just warm enough to dine al fresco and when it isn't crowded with a private party.

"This particular airport experience stands out as one of the most expedient and productive encounters I have had the pleasure of experiencing, boasting an impressively efficient check-in and security process that has been optimized to an extraordinary degree through the judicious integration of cutting-edge technology and innovative design. The absence of a queue at the check-in counter and the brief duration of the security screening process, which clocked in at a mere five minutes, served to further enhance the overall sense of seamlessness and convenience that permeated the entirety of our time spent within the terminal. Moreover, the generous provision of complimentary Wi-Fi access for a period of two hours served as the proverbial cherry on top, allowing passengers like ourselves to enjoy a leisurely breakfast while awaiting our flight in a state of utmost comfort and relaxation."

"The culinary offerings were delectable, savory, and fresh; however, the portions were diminutive and the prices were somewhat prohibitive, yet still worth the indulgence. Our server exhibited forgetfulness towards the conclusion of our dining experience. Throughout most of the meal, the waitstaff demonstrated attentiveness and each server who delivered our courses was well-versed in their knowledge of the menu. We sampled the grilled scallops, fried squid, spicy tuna, glazed ribs, and salmon nigiri; the spicy tuna and glazed ribs, particularly when complemented with a squeeze of lime juice, were the standouts. Unfortunately, an error in billing resulted in a charge of $366 being applied to my card, rather than the expected $149 for the evening's repast. Despite this inconvenience, I would still consider returning due to the exceptional quality of the cuisine."

So I enjoy places like this.  We went here for lunch and although it was slow we were not greeted at the door and pointed in any direction.  We kind of wandered around and checked out the selection for a minute before someone told us we could sit wherever we liked.  It was $9.99 for lunch which I thought was a little steep for a place like this but it was nice with big booths.  I made myself some broccoli chicken with onions and mushrooms and then used the recipe off the wall to make a mongolian sauce for my stir fry.   The weak point of this place is they don't have a lot of sauces.  I've been to some similar places that have a much better sauce selection.  The people were nice and the food was great though.

"WTF is a dueling piano bar?! Step in here and find out...but I can tell ya it's a strangely high amount of fun. Heading back to our rooms after a late-night meeting, we got dragged into this place by one of our amped-up coworkers (luvyaBrit!!!), and eventually ended up with our tushies in a big comfy seat around a table while we laughed ourselves silly at the dueling piano players. If you are not into the whole seedy LV bar scene, check this place out as it's mellow yet fun and honestly the sing along and raunchy humor is right up my alley. Not so keen on....the cranky waitress who kept asking us if we wanted drinks....and eventually told us in a snotty ass voice that there is a two drink minimum per person, since that is why they don't charge admission. Well, maybe tell us that when we sit down instead of just giving us attitude for 15 minutes? Not rocket science. Oh and you can order bottled water as a 'drink'...stay hydrated in Vegas right. Loved...the pleather snakeskin bluey green pants that the skinny chick dueling piano gal was wearing, and she rocked them too!"

"Although I have not had the misfortune of encountering any issues with Cox thus far, I shall proceed by initiating my installation process; the technicians were not only cordial but also demonstrated remarkable efficiency in their work, completing all tasks expeditiously and accurately, prior to bidding me adieu; I contacted their customer service department on a Thursday, and owing to my residence being a newly-constructed property, it was necessary for them to dispatch an individual to assess the development's suitability for their services, which was accomplished the following day; subsequently, my appointment was scheduled for two days thereafter, culminating in a seamless, hassle-free experience; currently, I am enjoying a stable internet connection, and my high-definition television is functioning optimally, with customer service interactions having been satisfactory, thereby leading me to harbor a positive sentiment towards the services I have received."

"The plethora of fresh produce options and delectable sandwich offerings are truly unparalleled, but unfortunately, the sluggishness of the deli counter during peak lunch hours can be a tad frustrating for patrons eagerly awaiting their turn to savor the culinary delights."

"HAZE epitomizes the quintessential nightlife experience, and it's imperative to secure a table prior to indulging in the merriment, as this diminutive yet pulsating venue adheres stringently to the principle of limited capacity. The musical offerings at HAZE are truly exceptional, with Thursday evenings serving as the optimal time to partake in the revelry, courtesy of the establishment's esteemed industry night. The luminosity within the premises is utterly captivating, and those who elect to enhance their sensory perception via certain substances will undoubtedly relish the visual spectacle presented here. Furthermore, the performances by the resident go-go dancers/models are characterized by their elaborate attire, which contributes significantly to the overall ambiance of the venue. Ultimately, HAZE manifests as a microcosmic rave, wherein the PLUR (Peace, Love, Unity, and Respect) ethos permeates the atmosphere."

First off all, this is not really an eat-in place. Know that your going for the food not the atmosphere.\n\nThey're serve easily the best pad thai in KW, they're portions are big and they're fast and inexpensive.

"A culinary escapade that transcends the limitations of linguistic expression, rendering any attempt at articulating its splendor an exercise in futility, reminiscent of the preceding review's sentiment. An unassuming, bucolic abode nestled within a diminutive park, fostering an atmosphere of rural seclusion while being mere meters away from the bustling city center. Our dining area was situated in close proximity to the kitchen, affording us an unobstructed view of the two youthful culinary artists diligently preparing the delectable fare. The hospitality of the serving staff was warm and inviting. Each course was thoughtfully paired with a wine selection that complemented the flavors and textures of the dishes, creating a harmonious symphony of taste and aroma. The ingredients, sourced locally and freshly procured, were expertly incorporated into each plate, resulting in a culinary masterclass that defied any notion of a traditional'meal.' The convivial ambiance facilitated a most enjoyable evening, shared with a dear companion, and the only minor inconvenience encountered was negotiating the compact exit, which, though presenting a brief challenge, did not detract from the overall pleasure of the dining experience. When in Edinburgh, a visit to this gastronomic haven is imperative."
Windsor is one of my favorite happy hour places. The drinks are great! I love the #89! So yummy! The foods good, too. Nothing super fancy, amazing kale salad.

Another solid 4 stars for this place.  Yeah it is dead, but that's one of the things I like about it.  I love coming here and relaxing and listening to the off-beat jazz or satellite music they have.  It is so much different than the "busy" atmosphere of Pin Kaow.  And way cheaper too.

I also love the $5.00 lunch special!  I think a lot of the reviews who say it takes forever to eat are really, really hungry.  I'm in and out of here in 30-45 minutes.  

Come and enjoy it!  All the curries and soups I've had here are really good!  Support Silverado Ranch businesses :)

"Premium quality coffee and espresso are served here, complemented by the courteous demeanor of the staff. Moreover, the incorporation of draft beers into the menu has elevated the overall experience to an unprecedented level, which I ardently hope will become the standard for future coffee shops. My enthusiasm for this establishment is unequivocal, as it has earned exceptional ratings due to the aforementioned factors. Nonetheless, I must express my reservations regarding the predominantly youthful clientele, whose prolonged occupation of the limited seating area can be somewhat disconcerting. It is my preference to frequent establishments that cater to a more mature demographic, such as those in the mid-career to older age range. Additionally, parking can be a challenge at times, although this is hardly unexpected given the location."

"A pleasant shopping experience awaits those who seek fresh produce and delectable edibles at this establishment, but be prepared to assume the responsibilities of both cashier and bagger, as the automated system may occasionally malfunction, necessitating the assistance of an attendant. Furthermore, patrons can enroll in the Fresh and Easy Card program on-site to enjoy additional savings. It is worth mentioning that a new location is set to open in the near future on Fort Apache, offering an expanded selection of products and services."

I remember coming here when it was New York New York, the vibe is just as great. The patio makes 5801 perfect spot for late night drinks on a gorgeous summer night.\n\nThe bartenders are wonderful and so are the patrons. I have yet to make it out for bingo but it's definitely on my to do list!

This eatery boasts an unparalleled culinary experience, with their delectable cheesesteaks being the paramount attraction. Upon entering the establishment, I was immediately struck by the aroma of expertly cooked meat and freshly baked bread, which served as a harbinger of the gastronomical delight that was to follow. The texture of the bread was optimally balanced between softness and firmness, thereby creating the perfect vessel for the savory steak and abundant toppings that adorned it. Furthermore, the menu offered an array of options, allowing patrons to customize their cheesesteak according to their individual preferences, including various types of cheese, vegetables, and sauces. My personal preference involves ordering the steak 'wit' provolone, peppers, and onions, as it affords me the opportunity to sample the full gamut of flavors that this dish has to offer. In conclusion, my craving for a genuine Philly-style cheesesteak was more than satisfied by this exceptional establishment, and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a truly satisfying dining experience.

I had a little trouble with the website but when I called the guy who answered was extremely helpful. Menu is hard to find on the website (it's above the brunch menu) but once you find it go get the Om burger. So delicious! I got it with the kale chips and it was a good decision. I can't wait to try more from Fern. Next time I will go and sit down because the atmosphere is awesome.

"Having partaken in culinary indulgences at this establishment on two separate occasions in the past year, I must confess that my gastronomical expectations were not only met but indeed surpassed by the delectable offerings presented before me. From the initial assortment of appetizers to the principal courses and finally, the sweet conclusions, each dish showcased an unwavering commitment to quality and flavor. Furthermore, the wine list boasted an impressive array of selections sure to satisfy even the most discerning oenophile. However, it is worth noting that 5Church has acquired a reputation as a venue where the city's trendy denizens congregate to display their meticulously curated aesthetics, resulting in an ambiance that some might describe as affected or pretentious. The waitstaff, in particular, seem to embody this self-conscious hipster ethos, their attire and demeanor bordering on caricature. Nevertheless, if one can overlook these superficial distractions, the edible delights available at this eatery are undeniably worthy of consideration for those seeking a satisfying dining experience in the heart of Charlotte."

Ordered to go. Asked for cold veggies on the side. Did not dissappoint. Got our burgers home, thirty seconds in the microwave and it was as if they had just come off of the grill. Yum!\n\nGot the fries. Really tasty, but kind of frustrating. They are so thin. You have to grab four in order to get any ketchup to stick to them.

Upon entering the premises, one cannot help but be immediately struck by the olfactory sensation that permeates the atmosphere, which is none other than MGM's signature scent that exudes an unparalleled sense of luxury and sophistication. Our accommodations in the Grand Tower were nothing short of exceptional, boasting an impeccable level of tidiness and an aesthetically pleasing ambiance that was further complemented by the modern and well-maintained bathroom facilities. It is imperative to note, however, that any attempts to remove the beverages stored in the refrigeration unit, even for the purpose of capturing a photographic image, must be avoided at all costs, lest one risk triggering the timer embedded within the appliance. Notwithstanding this minor caveat, our stay was, on the whole, a truly enjoyable and memorable experience, thanks in no small part to the warmth and hospitality displayed by Jason during the checkout process.

"As a neophyte to the culinary delights of Pittsburgh, I was eager to indulge in an exceptional iteration of pierogies, and thus, I opted to sample the traditional potato and sauerkraut variant, in addition to the pizza pierogies, which were highly recommended by the proprietor. Furthermore, I decided to share a Reuben-like sandwich, whose name escapes me at present, with my dining companion. While the pierogies were undoubtedly palatable, I must admit that I was slightly disappointed in their overall quality, as they failed to meet the exceedingly high expectations I had established in my mind. Notwithstanding, I must commend the establishment for its commitment to utilizing premium ingredients and its dedication to crafting its own corned beef, an aspect that truly resonated with me during my conversation with the owner."

"An exceptional diminutive music emporium, whereupon I could effortlessly while away sixty minutes immersed in a meticulous examination of their novel and pre-owned inventory, followed by an additional sixty minutes engaging in an in-depth exploration of their diverse auditory stations, and ultimately conclude my sojourn with a further thirty minutes dedicated to discovering an array of minuscule, neon-hued adhesives that herald impending regional performances."

I was pleasantly surprised to find a wide selection of drinks at a good price here.  The strawberry banana was great but the milk tea was just not my cup of tea.  The service is fast and friendly, I got my drink in probably less than two minutes of ordering and the portions are good for the price.  

It's interesting the location of this place considering it's so far from Chinatown and in an area you wouldn't think of people liking boba.  I was even more astounded when about a group of 10 teens all crowded the place as I was leaving.

I would say 5 stars for anyone in Vegas, but it falls short compared to some places in San Francisco, so 4 stars to me.
Had a great dinner last night for restaurant week. Filet was great, the added lobster was a bit over done but still tasty. Service was terrific! Way to go Ruth Chris staff

"Dexter's provided an unexpectedly delightful experience during a recent Friday fish fry excursion. The ambiance of the establishment exuded a welcoming and convivial charm, characteristic of a well-frequented neighborhood bar. The diversity of their beer selection was impressive, with a rotation of distinctive and eclectic offerings, including a particularly memorable Lagunitas Hairy Eyeball. The culinary prowess of the fish dishes was remarkable, with both the cod and walleye options boasting a masterful balance of flavors and textures. Notably, the batter was applied with a deft touch, yielding a golden-brown crispness that complemented the tenderness of the fish without overpowering it. Furthermore, the waffle and brew fries accompanying the meal were cooked to a satisfying crisps, adding a delightful contrast in texture to the dish. Remarkably, even after consuming a considerable quantity of deep-fried cuisine, I did not experience any unpleasant aftereffects. A sincere expression of gratitude is extended to the staff at Dexter's for their role in facilitating my continued adherence to Catholic dietary practices. \n\nIt would be remiss not to acknowledge the exceptional quality of the service provided by the establishment. Following an unfortunate incident where our position in line was usurped, the staff graciously apologized and presented us with a complimentary spinach and artichoke dip appetizer, demonstrating their commitment to ensuring a positive dining experience for their patrons."

"Assuming that the culinary offerings are of an equal standard to the hospitality we have received thus far, I am inclined to believe that this establishment will become a personal favorite of mine. Furthermore, my dining companion and I opted to be seated at one of the elevated tables situated within the bar area, whereupon Terry, our attentive server, promptly presented us with an array of delectable options from which to choose."

"The Blue Parrot, an eatery nestled within the picturesque confines of Stockbridge, boasts an unconventional charm that permeates its culinary offerings and ambiance alike. My recent visit afforded me the opportunity to indulge in their delectable chicken and cashew chimichanga, a veritable cornucopia of juicy poultry, complemented by an accompanying broth that showcased the establishment's dedication to gastronomic excellence. Although service proved somewhat lacking in terms of attentiveness and responsiveness, the venue's unique conversion of cellar space into restrooms engendered a sense of novelty that, while potentially polarizing, undoubtedly enhances the overall dining experience. In conclusion, my foray into the realm of the Blue Parrot yielded a favorable impression, owing to the dual virtues of its savory fare and eclectic atmosphere; such that, should the craving for Mexican cuisine arise, I would unhesitatingly opt to return."

"An exceptional venue for indulging in libations during the evening hours, garnering a rating of four stars due to the inconsistent nature of the service, yet the culinary offerings have consistently met expectations."

Pinky's garners four stars from this reviewer due to the fact that the cuisine is of an acceptable quality, the ambiance is thoroughly enjoyed, and an array of plant-based options are available, albeit not explicitly indicated on the primary menu. It is advisable to query the servers for the covert vegan menu, which contains an assortment of tofu dishes not listed on the standard bill of fare. On a previous visit, the waitstaff, having recognized this patron's predilection for vegan fare, presented a delectable tofu creation not featured on the regular menu, courtesy of the kitchen. Additionally, the establishment's chili, characterized by its robust flavor and spicy kick, is highly recommended (and, notably, vegan). Be prepared to experience a delay in seating, as the venue tends to attract a sizable crowd promptly at noon. Patrons can select from an array of satisfactory beverages, and the indoor/outdoor patio area is quite inviting. In conclusion, Pinky's offers a pleasant setting for socializing and enjoying a meal.

"Whoa indeed...meat in a sushi roll?!?! It seems almost oxymoronic, doesn't it?!?! Yet, there it was, staring me in the face, daring me to question its validity...the 'Lamb-Burgushi' roll, if you will. And let me tell you, it was nothing short of a gastronomical revolution, a true culinary epiphany that left me in a state of utter disbelief and wonder. I mean, who would have thought to combine the rich, savory flavors of lamb with the delicate, subtle nuances of sushi?!?! It was truly a match made in culinary heaven, a symphony of flavors that danced on my palate with grace and finesse. And the presentation, my goodness, it was a work of art, a masterclass in plating and garnishing that would make even the most discerning chef weep with envy. But, alas, my dear friend, the experience was not without its drawbacks. The ambiance, while certainly energetic and vibrant, bordered on the excessive, with the cacophony of sounds threatening to overwhelm my senses at times. But, all things considered, it was a minor quibble, a fleeting inconvenience that did little to diminish the overall enjoyment of my dining experience. In conclusion, I must say that the 'Lamb-Burgushi' roll at [Restaurant Name] is an absolute must-try for any adventurous foodie looking to broaden their culinary horizons. Just be sure to bring your appetite, and perhaps a pair of earplugs, just in case."

"Savor the delectable Thai culinary experience that caters to your palate's craving for piquancy, ensuring an unparalleled gastronomic satisfaction during each dining excursion. My numerous layovers at PHX have afforded me the opportunity to partake in the restaurant's offerings on multiple occasions, and I must say, the culinary prowess of Pom and Austin has consistently surpassed my expectations. The fiery flaming soup is an absolute must-try, its bold flavors tantalizing my taste buds and leaving me in a state of epicurean nirvana. My penchant for culinary exploration has led me to sample a diverse array of dishes during each visit, and I must confess, the precision with which the flavors and spices are balanced is nothing short of remarkable. For an unforgettable dining experience, entrust Pom with your preferences, whether it be seafood, poultry, or red meat, and allow her to curate a meal worthy of a social media post. Indulge in the exquisite delights that this eatery has to offer, and relish the memories that they create."

I deliberated on visiting this attraction solely due to its reputation as a tourist hotspot, but ultimately opted to experience it firsthand. Subsequently, I thoroughly enjoyed capturing photographic memories and engaging in playful poses alongside the lifelike wax figurines of renowned celebrities. In an effort to avoid the throngs of visitors typically associated with peak hours, I elected to visit during the week; however, the area surrounding the Michael Jackson figure remained somewhat congested, as patrons eagerly awaited their turn to don the iconic 'Smooth Criminal' attire for photo opportunities. Every wax sculpture bore an uncanny resemblance to the actual celebrity, with some exhibiting such striking similarities that it was almost unsettling. Throughout the venue, staff members endeavored to persuade guests to purchase copies of their photographs, which, while unnecessary for individuals equipped with cameras or high-quality mobile devices, proved to be a minor inconvenience. The sole figure that failed to meet my expectations was that of Cameron Diaz, whose likeness appeared marginally enhanced in comparison to her real-life appearance. Furthermore, the Tupac Shakur figure reportedly featured bullet wounds on its chest, a detail potentially considered superfluous given that neither John F. Kennedy nor Martin Luther King Jr.'s wax counterparts displayed comparable injuries. NOTE: Admission fees total $30 per person, though discounts can be obtained through various means, such as collecting a coupon book at the Monorail, snagging a 50% off coupon from a street promoter, or searching for online offers prior to arriving in Las Vegas. After checking the attraction's Yelp page and discovering no special deals, I became aware that numerous coupons and promotions exist, rendering full-price admission unnecessary.

"I arrived at this establishment last evening during my business-related travels, having conducted prior research on Yelp to uncover hidden gems that might have otherwise escaped my notice. The positive reviews did not disappoint, as the culinary offerings at this venue were truly exceptional. The Emerald Curry, recommended by the staff as their premier curry dish, lived up to its billing, boasting an impressive array of fresh vegetables and a flavor profile that struck the perfect balance between richness and spice. The servings were generous, the prices reasonable, and the ambiance tranquil, making for a highly satisfying dining experience. I would enthusiastically endorse this restaurant to anyone seeking authentic Thai cuisine in a welcoming setting, and I look forward to returning on future visits to the area."

I find myself vacillating between a rating of three and four stars in regards to the Red Squirrel, yet due to its affiliation with the esteemed Holyrood 9a establishments, I shall confer upon it the coveted four-star designation. My ambivalence stems from a cursory visit to the premises, during which I rendezvoused with my significant other for a brief libational interlude prior to proceeding elsewhere.

Situated in the heart of Edinburgh's financial district and Lothian Road, the bar was teeming with patrons on a Friday evening, ostensibly attesting to its enduring popularity among businesspeople and perhaps underscoring a dearth of comparable drinking establishments in the vicinity. Notwithstanding its relatively diminutive stature compared to neighboring watering holes, the Red Squirrel boasts delectable burgers, as evidenced by the tantalizing aroma and sight of those devoured by a nearby couple, in addition to an impressive array of Innis & Gunn beverages, which happen to be my beverage of choice.

While the Red Squirrel exudes an aura of hipness and its Holyrood 9a association ensures scrumptious burgers, a certain je ne sais quoi pertaining to its location fails to impel me to return with alacrity. Thus, I shall bestow upon it a rating of four stars, primarily owing to its convenience as a meeting spot for my partner, who works mere steps away, while harboring reservations concerning its overall appeal in contrast to other 9a venues.

This eatery is situated on the Strip side of the Palazzo, thus, taking advantage of the pleasant climate (a balmy 85 degrees Fahrenheit with abundant sunshine), we opted to be seated on the patio. As some individuals have pointed out, there are instances when one might prefer to dine indoors; however, the ambiance was surprisingly enjoyable for late May. My parents are residents of Las Vegas, and I have had the privilege of witnessing the Strip numerous times; nevertheless, the panorama from Morel's onto the Strip was truly breathtaking. I would highly advocate selecting a table on the patio for an optimal dining experience.

The service we received was satisfactory, and our server was meticulous in his attention to detail and exceptionally knowledgeable about the menu offerings. Acting on his fervent recommendation, we decided to sample the French onion soup, which proved to be a delectable and richly flavored culinary delight. My steak arrived shortly thereafter, and it was cooked to perfection, boasting the ideal level of juiciness. While I thoroughly relished every bite of my steak, I couldn't help but feel a twinge of regret for not opting for the macaroni and cheese, as it supposedly exceeded expectations and was utterly delectable, according to the accounts of others.

"This culinary establishment represents the sole location where I opt to acquire Pad Thai, as their Chicken Pad Thai manifests exceptional quality, surpassing my expectations and rendering it a personal favorite. Despite sampling similar dishes at various other eateries, including those that boast authentic Thai cuisine, none have been able to parallel the superior taste and presentation offered by Pei Wei's rendition of this popular dish."

"Prodigious bagels possessing a subtle essence of eastern charm, albeit slightly diminutive in stature and exhibiting minor signs of wear and tear, elicit profound satisfaction. Particularly enamored with the Sunflower variety, the secret to their delectability remains somewhat enigmatic, yet unquestionably tantalizing."

I visited this establishment on two separate occasions during a single week, once for an evening meal and a subsequent time to partake in the nocturnal revelry at the club. Upon my initial visit for dinner, I would have rated this venue three stars, as the ambiance was pleasant, the service was satisfactory, and the cuisine was adequate, albeit unremarkable. However, my second visit to the club on a Wednesday evening proved to be a vastly superior experience. Despite the fact that many other clubs in the area were relatively quiet, this particular establishment was bustling with activity, boasting a vibrant atmosphere that was complemented by attentive servers who ensured that our needs were consistently met. The beverages were also quite palatable, although I must admit that the fact that I didn't have to pay for them myself may have slightly enhanced their flavor. All things considered, I would unquestionably return to this venue if I were to find myself in Las Vegas once again. Nonetheless, I might opt to explore alternative dining options prior to my next visit, as my previous experience with the restaurant left something to be desired. As a final note, I would advise potential patrons to exercise caution when utilizing the Roman-style sinks located in the hallway, as while they may be conveniently turned on for guests, they are unfortunately not stocked with paper towels for drying one's hands afterwards.

The chefs here may not have attended Le Cordon Bleu but make no mistake: the food is tasty, cheap, and comes out quick. The best part about this place is its status as neighborhood landmark and its extremely amiable staff. You feel like a regular in this place the first time you walk through the door. If you want to resist the invasion of franchises like McDonalds, Subway, etc, spend your hard earned money here. support these guys!

"An undiscovered treasure! We unwittingly stumbled upon this obscure location after partaking in a meal at Chino Bandito, its adjacent establishment. This unassuming popcorn purveyor boasts an array of flavors, graciously offering samples for patrons to indulge in. Seasonal varieties are also available, adding to the excitement. However, our enthusiasm was temporarily dampened when we tried the Cake Batter flavor and found it lacking in authentic cake batter essence, the overpowering influence of Cold Stone's ice cream flavor being the likely culprit. 

Despite this minor setback, we capitalized on the baker's dozen promotion, acquiring thirteen small snack-sized bags for a mere $11, a considerable bargain considering the standard price of $1 per bag. The accommodating staff even offered to create a custom bag of a flavor not readily available in the smaller size. 

Their assortment of flavors extends beyond their online offerings, including such delectable options as Churro, Bacon & Cheese, Cookies & CrÃ¨me, Coconut, PB & Chocolate, Cherry Chocolate, and Candy Bar. The store's inventory also features an array of charming tins and gift ideas, making it an excellent alternative for those seeking unique presents instead of the traditional gift card."
I wanted to see a black pig, but all they had was a pink one... Dx I still liked seeing the animals though :)

"Upon arriving in Las Vegas subsequent to a prolonged automotive journey, I opted to visit this establishment on a Friday evening, capitalizing on the opportunity to avoid the throngs of people typically associated with peak hours. My strategy proved effective, as I was able to procure a prime position at the forefront of the queue, thereby enabling me to promptly place my order for a personalized pizza. The eatery operates under a unique concept, wherein patrons can create their own individualized pizza by selecting an unlimited number of toppings, all for a fixed price. Additionally, a diverse array of sauces is available for customers to choose from. The staff members manning the counter exhibited remarkable cordiality and were eager to offer assistance with any queries or concerns that arose. 

As for the culinary experience itself, I must say that it was quite satisfying. I opted for the meat lovers variant, augmenting it with jalapenos for an additional burst of flavor. The pizza was crafted employing an exceptionally thin crust, which yielded a delightfully crunchy texture upon consumption. Furthermore, I added a subtle drizzle of garlic to the periphery of the crust, thus enhancing its inherent flavor. The freshness of the toppings was undeniable, and the combination of ingredients blended together harmoniously. 

Based on my positive experience, I would unhesitatingly recommend this venue to my acquaintances and loved ones seeking a convenient and delectable pizza destination."

Great customer service but I had to explain my order 3x. How hard is it to punch in a number 1 spicy with mac and cheese? They also came out to sweep the floor during my visit. I would normally praise them for being clean but the girl kept putting her backside near and once on my table. I would have appreciated it normally but she was didnt have the backside to pull that off LOL.

The biscuits had a honey glaze I don't remember from the 90s but was still pleasantly refreshing. 

The spicy chicken had my nose running always a plus. The mac and cheese was great. Would have been nice to have a piece of corn on the cob but all in all a good experience

As noted in previous reviews, Trader Joe's has a large variety of specialty, hard to find, and/or natural/organic items. I do enjoy walking the aisles to find new and interesting products. The specialty ravioli is one of my favorites as well as the all natural desserts. However, what other reviews failed to mention was the natural cleaning products. The main reason I stop at Trader Joe's is for the chlorine free paper products and natural cleaing products especially the laundry detergent. Chlorine free/recycled paper products seem to be hard to find in the stores. Giant Eagle Market District used to carry some Seventh Generation paper products but they haven't had any for well over a year. Before Trader Joe's, if I had to order all of my paper products online to be delivered. Now, I can find good quality, chlorine free, recycled paper towels, napkins and toilet paper for a great value at a local store. Their laundry detergent is also less expensive than the other name brands like Seventh Generation or Method but it works just as well. Yay Trader Joe's for helping me keep my family healthy and clean with less toxins!

"This culinary establishment is of exceptional quality, possessing an ambiance reminiscent of the illustrious city of New York, and is conveniently located in close proximity to our humble abode, thus rendering it an ideal destination for a delectable dining experience. My spouse and I have had the pleasure of partaking in their gastronomical offerings on multiple occasions, and we have been consistently impressed by the superior quality of the fare and the exceptional level of service proffered by the staff."

"The culinary offerings were of an exceptionally high quality, a sentiment that was echoed by my companion and I as we relished every bite of our meal. Furthermore, the hospitality we received was also commendable, as the staff exhibited a proficiency in their duties that was truly impressive. Additionally, the cost of the alcoholic beverage we consumed, specifically the lager, was astonishingly reasonable, almost to the point of being inconceivable. As for the menu items we sampled, they were akin to a gastronomical odyssey, with each dish more delectable than the last. For instance, the Teutonic-style potato strips we ordered were imbued with a rich, complex flavor profile that was simply sublime, while the humongous pretzel we shared was nothing short of a gastronomical tour de force, its sheer size and succulent texture making it a veritable feast for the senses."

"Endearingly cherish the culinary experience offered by The Greene House, particularly during their Sunday promotion featuring a fifty percent discount on bottles of wine. The delectable fish and chips dish is utterly sublime, eliciting an unwavering craving that transcends mortality. Moreover, the vast majority of appetizers on their menu boast an exceptional level of gastronomical excellence."

"It is truly unfortunate that there isn't a Whole Foods Market located in close proximity to our current residence in Surprise, Arizona, as their offerings of organic and natural products align with our personal preferences and dietary requirements. However, we were pleasantly surprised to discover that a local establishment offered comparable quality and variety at a significantly lower cost. Specifically, we purchased a whole grilled chicken, a large fresh fruit salad, and an extensive vegetable juice consisting of beets, carrots, apples, and celery, all for a total of sixteen dollars, which is remarkably reasonable considering the substantial savings compared to the equivalent items at Whole Foods, which would have amounted to at least thirty dollars. While there are obvious differences between the two establishments, we were pleased to find a convenient and affordable option for a healthy meal."

"I have an immense fondness for this shopping center, boasting a plethora of luxurious retail establishments that cater to my discerning tastes. My financial constraints were of little consequence during my visit, as I found myself indulging in a spree of unbridled consumerism, culminating in an unexpected dent in my fiscal reserves. (smiling emoticon) Nordstrom's, in particular, merits high praise for their exceptional customer service, which greatly enhanced my shopping experience."

I know this isn't the best farmers market. I know it isn't deserve 5 stars. I know they need more local. I know it is weird to see bananas. I get all of that. BUT THIS PLACE IS SO EASY AND STILL CHEAPER THAN A GROCERY STORE. But, yay, it would rock if they stepped up the local produce section.

They have delicious local heirloom tomatoes. That are almost always fresh and perfect.

THE FLOWERS. There is a lady who sales the most beautiful fresh cut flowers. Bring extra cash and buy yourself, your girl, your mom some. Absolutely stunning flowers.

I arranged a meeting with Dr. Tognacci subsequent to receiving a glowing endorsement from a trusted acquaintance. Prior to this encounter, I had experienced unsatisfactory interactions with various medical professionals, which rendered me exceedingly cautious about seeking assistance from yet another practitioner. However, upon engaging with Dr. Tognacci, I was pleasantly surprised by his unwavering dedication to addressing my diverse concerns. Unlike some of his peers who seemingly adhered to a strict schedule, Dr. Tognacci adopted a distinctly different approach. He accorded me the necessary time to voice my apprehensions and displayed a remarkable willingness to delve into exhaustive research, ensuring that each query was adequately addressed. Throughout our conversation, I was struck by his unhurried demeanor and unwavering commitment to fostering a collaborative atmosphere. He demonstrated a genuine interest in my well-being, treating me as an equal partner in the decision-making process. Upon conclusion of our consultation, Dr. Tognacci ensured that I possessed the requisite prescriptions and an ample supply of samples. My sincere gratitude towards him stems from the fact that he has successfully alleviated my anxieties and provided me with a renewed sense of hope. It is my fervent belief that such exceptional standards of service merit unreserved endorsement.

"This diminutive eatery, accommodating a mere twenty patrons, boasts an impressive culinary prowess and exceptional presentation. The atmosphere is subdued, with minimal fanfare, while the music, though slightly too loud, does not detract from the overall dining experience. The sashimi of beef in ponzu sauce is a brilliant entrÃ©e, and the miso-glazed cod is absolutely exquisite. I eagerly anticipate my return visit to sample the main courses and various table d'hÃ´te offerings."

There will always be a place in my heart for The Orchard. As the first place we went to for a drink when we moved into the area five years ago, I've always made The Orchard one of our regular watering holes. The staff are friendly, the prices are reasonable, and although I've not sampled the food menu extensively, what I have had has been very tasty.

What I really like about The Orchard is the atmosphere. There's a mix of regulars who tend to take up residence at the bar and will always offer a tale or two to those who wander in, looking for a place to satisfy their thirst. There's also a great mix of ages, which I find really refreshing as some bars seem to have an unspoken age policy, but that's not the case in The Orchard.

I can't talk about the food in too much detail, but I have had the steak pie, which was delicious, and often my friends and I order chips whilst we work our way through our drinks. The chips are great, not thin and oily, but fat and fluffy.

I will always champion The Orchard, especially on a hot day, when you can sit outside and watch the world go by.

"An extensive and delectable array of culinary offerings, presented in a format conducive to expeditious consumption during the midday hours, characterizes the lunch menu at this establishment. However, it appears that the quality of service provided by the staff can be somewhat unpredictable and variable, with instances of both proficient and lackadaisical performance having been observed. Notably, a singular member of the waiting staff, Jamie by name, seems to have been instrumental in attracting a considerable portion of the clientele, her exceptional level of professionalism and dedication to ensuring an optimal dining experience for patrons being a significant factor in the restaurant's success."

Very good burger & fries.  The meat is brought in fresh everyday, so I was told. Lady behind the counter sold me on a piece of peach pie. She said the fruit pies are made fresh daily. This place reminds me of an old school diner from back in the day. Think I will try the hash browns next visit. They looked really good and crisp.

"First-time patrons, I indulged my nuclear family (spouse and three female progeny) in an inaugural visit to this esteemed eatery, and we thoroughly relished the culinary experience. The half-priced happy hour hors d'oeuvres (ribs, edamame, and spring rolls) were delectable, and the dinner selections were equally impressive, accompanied by exceptional hospitality. Our financial investment for this gastronomical indulgence totaled slightly over one hundred dollars, which, considering the quality of the fare and the attentive service, constitutes an excellent value. Following a weeklong sojourn in Scottsdale, I can confidently attest that this establishment offers a superior dining experience at a reasonable price point. We would unquestionably return to partake in the epicurean delights offered by this restaurant."

We found Casa Don Juan by accident looking for hangover food/drinks off of the Vegas strip.  We got very lucky landing here!  The chips/salsa/beans that come to the table free are so good, so was the bloody Mary and the pineapple pina colada.  \n\nIt has great outdoor seating which we sat at to enjoy the sun, inside the restaurant was pretty cold at the time.  My sister had the chicken fajitas and the portion size was huge, and she loved them.  I had a platter with pork tamales YUM! a beef taco that was ok and a fried pablano pepper stuffed with cheese also very good.  We ate everything and it did help cure the hangover.  Definitely tasted like authentic Mexican you can only get on the West coast.

Loved the place! If your a little group it's awesome to have your own lounge especially for a friends birthday! The bottles of alcohol weren't that expensive. The fact that its intimate gives the chance for everyone to sing and not be shy! I am definitely going to go back.

"I have never experienced a subpar dining experience at any of the establishments or regions I have patronized, whereupon my culinary exploits have been consistently satisfying across the board. Despite my lack of affinity for beer, I find myself drawn to the delectable offerings of this particular eatery, wherein I routinely opt for the unvarying staple of "Mac and Cheese," bereft of poultry, and accompanied by a passable house salad for the nominal sum of $7.99, as depicted in the accompanying visuals. It is my conviction that one cannot go awry with this selection, as it constitutes a copious repast suitable for sharing between two individuals. Furthermore, I have sampled their assorted sandwiches, such as the "Brewers Club," whose attributes are also showcased in the aforementioned illustrations. Additionally, I have partaken of their Chicken Fried steak, served with an appetizing portion of white cheddar mashed potatoes. In conclusion, the confluence of palatable victuals and a tranquil ambiance renders this venue an agreeable destination, thereby warranting a rating of three and a half stars."

"The culinary experience afforded by the consumption of the chicken (ckn) was indeed gratifying, with the poultry exhibiting an impressive juiciness and flavor that was enhanced by its freshness. Furthermore, the cost of procuring this delectable fare was eminently reasonable, with the price of $17 for a whole chicken accompanied by two sizable side dishes constituting a veritable bargain. Moreover, the spacious interior of the establishment, coupled with the hospitable demeanor of the staff, contributed to a convivial ambiance that greatly enhanced the overall dining experience."

"My most recent visit to this establishment culminated in the acquisition of their delectable garlic parmesan wings, which thoroughly satiated my gustatory desires with their profound flavor and succulent texture. Notably, the olfactory sensation aroused by the aroma emanating from the recently prepared grease accentuated the overall dining experience. Furthermore, I must extend my gratitude to the management for their considerate provision of the celery, which was presented in a separate receptacle from the wings, thereby enabling me to relish each component of the dish unhindered. My appreciation is further amplified by the fact that they seemingly took cognizance of my feedback, manifesting their commitment to providing an exceptional dining experience for their clientele."

"An abundance of noodles that transcends comprehension, pho broth, Sriracha bottles of enormous proportions, and an assortment of eccentric canned beverages, including those with flavors reminiscent of ginger and'spongy grass juice,' in addition to chewy candies, animated feline figurines, vibrant playthings, and a dazzling display of butchery. Parking may present a challenge, but one can circumvent this issue by securing a parking spot on either side of the edifice. Of late, the vegetable section appears somewhat diminished, yet my affection for this establishment remains unwavering. Moreover, it is advisable to accumulate a minimum of $10 worth of comestibles for a speedy repast or preserved duck eggs, lest one encounter difficulties in utilizing credit or debit cards."

This marked the culmination of my six-day birthday extravaganza, and I couldn't have been more ecstatic to spend the evening surrounded by such exceptional companions! The ambiance of the establishment was utterly captivating, and the delectable fare served was of unparalleled quality. Two of my four dining associates opted for the sausage and peppers, and their effusive praise would suggest that the dish was imbued with a satisfying degree of piquancy. My remaining two companions and I selected the Chicken Marsala and Chicken Piccata, respectively, and we devoured every morsel with unbridled relish. The bread, too, was a sublime accompaniment to our meals. The hospitality of the wait staff was truly commendable, and their dedication to ensuring our satisfaction was evident in the meticulous attention they devoted to our needs. As the clock struck 8:15, the musical entertainment began, signaling the start of an extraordinary spectacle that we were privileged to witness. I must confess that I find the art of people-watching to be an immensely enjoyable pastime, and this occasion proved to be no exception. In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly bestow upon the culinary offerings a rating of four stars, owing to the exceptional quality of both the victuals and the service proffered by the wait staff. Moreover, whether you elect to partake in the terpsichorean delights of the dance floor or merely observe the proceedings, the experience promises to be nothing short of delightful.

"A remarkable culinary experience, characterized by an exceptional sandwich, was unfortunately marred by a perceived grimness on the part of the female staff member responsible for processing our payment; however, it is worth noting that this individual did take the time to apply a fresh coat of lipstick prior to interacting with us, which, while not necessarily mitigating her seemingly unfriendly demeanor, did serve to enhance her overall appearance, thereby creating a somewhat paradoxical impression; nevertheless, it would be inaccurate and unfair to imply that the quality of the sandwiches or the service provided by the remaining staff members was in any way compromised."

I had the veggie mushroom soup, which they served with a fresh pretzel roll. It was soooo yummy . However if you are going there for lunch, call your order in as they are extremely busy. You may be late punching back in from lunch, like I was. I waited 20 minutes for soup that was already cooked! Other than the wait time, I was pleased with what ordered except the jelly & PB brioche. I would have bathed in the soup if given that opportunity.

Awesome place for breakfast!   We got there around 9:00am and it was busy but they sat us immediarely.  I had the veggie omlette with home fries, delicious and huge.   If you're into Bloody Mary's, try theirs.   Its only $9, it's made fresh and it was really good.

"The welcoming lobby boasts captivating mosaics embellishing the floor, evidencing a substantial financial investment. A spectacular light display illuminates the imposing waterfall during the evening hours, accessible for viewing from either the bar or the SW Steakhouse restaurant; however, seating is essential for optimal visibility. The staff members exhibit warmth and helpfulness, ensuring a pleasant experience for guests. Although situated away from the central hub of activity on the strip, the location may present either an advantage or disadvantage, depending on individual preferences and requirements."

What??? There's been a Krispy Kreme Donut Shop at Dobson and Main for two weeks and I didn't know about it?? I immediately canceled my errand on University and pulled into the Safeway parking lot. I've been craving a cream filled donut for weeks! But I thought the closest one was at Superstition Springs and I hadn't gotten out that far this trip. Okay, now to enjoy....

"Having visited the recently established Fiesta Mall In N Out Burger in Mesa on several occasions and expressing profound disappointment with the culinary offerings, particularly the unpalatable and soggy french fries, I opted to sample the fare at this particular establishment in AJ, thereby granting it an opportunity to redeem itself in my estimation. As luck would have it, the hour of our arrival coincided with the peak lunchtime period, which customarily translates into an influx of patrons and an ensuing state of affairs characterized by crowding and prolonged waiting periods. However, much to our delight, the duration of our sojourn in the extensive drive-through queue was surprisingly brief, barely exceeding five minutes, despite the presence of a sizeable assemblage of individuals partaking of their meals alfresco and an appreciable number of vehicles awaiting their turns in the adjacent parking area. Furthermore, the gastronomic experience itself proved to be a gratifying and satisfying endeavor, as the fries were expertly prepared, exhibiting a delightful crispiness and freshness that complemented the flavorful and generously proportioned burger, which was further enhanced by the richness of a decadent chocolate shake. The overall quality of the service was also noteworthy, as the staff demonstrated a commendable level of efficiency and attentiveness, ensuring that our visit was marked by an atmosphere of welcoming hospitality and unpretentious geniality."

Network has been my go-to place for alignments for several years now.  I am generally pleased with the work that they do, and I feel their prices are fair. Customer service varies, as there has been a different person at the counter everytime I've been there. Good, honest shop; I'll be back in the future.

Yummy toasted sandwiches. Had turkey and chedder on whole wheat. They were out of the broccoli cheddar soup which I was super bummed about. Maybe next time. The great thing is they deliver! I live right in the neighborhood so its nice for a change.

Not being a popcorn connoisseur I can't say I know what truly constitutes good popcorn and great popcorn. However, Popped has some darn good caramel corn. The place is priced appropriately and they have a crazy variety of flavors. I've had them on a few different occasions and try to select a new flavor every time. What I like is that you don't have to eat all of it at once, the popcorn stays pretty fresh as long as you keep it sealed. \n\nI'll definitely be back for more - because as you know, once you Pop, you can't stop.

This place was priced very well.  I would rate the massage average, as the pressure was not deep pressure as requested, but it was very relaxing and I felt good afterwards.  Therapists were very friendly and the ambience was great.  They used some great aromatherapy techniques.

"The staff's proficiency in customer service could benefit from enhancement (i.e., acknowledging patrons upon entrance, expressing gratitude for orders, et cetera). Conversely, the culinary offerings were quite satisfactory. I opted for the #2 combination (Philly Steak, fries, and soda for $7.99), which proved to be an adequate portion size for a midday repast and boasted exceptional flavor. Although I am not particularly fond of steak fries, their utilization did not detract significantly from my dining experience. However, I would have appreciated a more copious serving of fries, as the quantity provided seemed incongruous with the sandwich. Notwithstanding this minor shortcoming, my overall assessment of the establishment remains positive, and I anticipate future visits, given its proximity to my place of employment."

"What an intriguing idea! Not ice cream, not a slush, but rather a snow...or snoh, if you will. Select your preferred flavor of snow, a topping, and a glaze (essentially a subtle drizzle) to crown it all. The menu boasts an impressive array of innovative options without being overwhelming, allowing novice patrons to sample the establishment's offerings without feeling daunted by an excess of choices. The flavors available are truly inventive; think taro-flavored ice or mogi toppings, complemented by a condensed milk glaze. The ambiance is modern and sleek, reminiscent of contemporary IKEA decor, which this writer happens to admire. Upon sampling the wares, one cannot help but be impressed by the sheer ingenuity of the frozen concoction. While the toppings and glaze could benefit from a slightly more generous application, the end result is undeniably delectable and uniquely refreshing. In short, a most satisfying experience!"

I had a gratifying experience during my visit to this establishment last night, despite the fact that I was obligated to pay a cover charge of 10 dollars, which I found somewhat disagreeable. However, my friend was displaying some artwork, and I was eager to observe it. The atmosphere within the venue was characterized by a diverse assortment of individuals, ranging from hippie women who appeared to be under the influence of hallucinogenic substances, to metal enthusiasts who exhibited a pronounced tendency to clench their jaws, and even ravers who seemed to be in a state of euphoria induced by electronic music. It was truly fascinating to witness such a varied gathering of people interacting harmoniously. Furthermore, the bartender, who was ostensibly inebriated, served drinks at a price that I considered reasonable, thereby partially compensating for the initial financial burden imposed by the cover charge. During my time there, I encountered several pleasant individuals, was exposed to some captivating musical selections, and even derived amusement from the performance of a band playing a rendition of War Pigs, albeit unexpectedly.

They executed a remarkable interior renovation, transforming the establishment into a contemporary and inviting venue. Previously, this location housed Native New Yorker for an extended period, and subsequently, several other businesses occupied the space. Discovering this hidden gem was undoubtedly a delightful experience.

The breakfast selection, albeit limited, adheres to the philosophy of quality over quantity, as each dish is meticulously prepared and presented. We had the pleasure of sampling their Stuffed French Toast, Chaquillias, and Eggs Tuscano, and we were thoroughly impressed by the explosion of flavors and the reasonable price point of $7 per plate. The generous portion sizes further enhanced our satisfaction.

However, our visit was not without its imperfections. Specifically, the hostess could benefit from heightened awareness and a warm demeanor towards incoming patrons. A concerted effort towards creating a welcoming ambiance would greatly enhance the overall experience.

Our server, on the other hand, exhibited commendable friendliness and attentiveness, despite the bustling atmosphere. Although there was a delay in the delivery of our food, the quality and presentation made the brief wait more than acceptable.

Given its proximity to Sun City West, it was unsurprising that the clientele consisted predominantly of an older demographic. Nonetheless, we eagerly anticipate exploring their lunch and dinner offerings and revisiting their exceptional breakfast menu.

We really like the atmosphere here! My Hangover Hash was top notch but my wife's spicy tofu tacos were extremely bland and she didn't eat half of it. The service was top notch as well! FYI their fries are awesome!

I'd say it's a pretty good place for a grec buffet.

You can have variety choices. Ambience is quiet nice. They offer private bar drink. I went to this place with my friends few times. Most of their foods are good and tasty. ( I like a lot their ice cream ). The best is they have halal meat for my muslin friends. They can enjoy with us too.

Few foods are not likely we'll done or too salty. 

Variety price dépend on date.
After reading all posted reviews can't wait to try this place out.  I am a very picky eater so stand by for my review after a taste the food from Pita Kitchen Grill.

A nice little hidden away place in Gilbert\n Gf and I went there for breakfast and it was surprisingly good. I had the pancakes and meat ( sausage) and the gf had breakfast tacos (eggs, vegs, and ham). It was all good and the best part was apple fritters....it has a sugary cover to it and the inside is very soft. \nThis place gets packed so be ready to wait. Price range is moderate for what you get. Also....watch out for el scorpio....sting is muchos owie.

"Gastronomical excellence. An eatery that exudes an authentic, indigenous ambiance, sans the ostentatious trappings of an upscale establishment, yet still maintaining a certain je ne sais quoi that is unmistakably characteristic of its environs. Not surprisingly, given its geographic provenance. Partook in a culinary excursion during the celebrated Mad-Craft-Beer-Week, accompanied by my better half, and we both relished the flavorsome fish, our gustatory sensibilities satiated by its delectable taste."

I attended the Day of the Dead festival over the weekend, which, regrettably, proved to be somewhat of a disappointment; nevertheless, my visit to the museum was quite captivating. I had the opportunity to explore the Cotton Fields to Skyscrapers exhibition, which offered an intriguing examination of the transformations that have occurred in Charlotte and its surrounding areas since the Civil War. As someone who has an ardent fascination with history, I found the interactive approach employed in the exhibit to be particularly engaging. The extensive nature of the display allowed me to fully immerse myself in the various eras being represented, thereby enhancing my understanding of the subject matter. Unfortunately, the Day of the Dead exhibit did not live up to my expectations, as I arrived after the depletion of sugar skulls and was unable to witness the traditional dances or observe elaborate altars. Despite this letdown, I did appreciate the complimentary museum admission, which ultimately made the excursion worthwhile.

"Victor Hugo constitutes a quaint, continental deli located on the periphery of the Meadows in Edinburgh, thereby facilitating ease of access for university students during their transit to and from academic sessions, as well as serving as an idyllic setting for a leisurely visit during the summer months, given its proximity to the Meadows. 

The establishment boasts an impressive array of freshly fabricated bread, complemented by an assortment of delectable sandwiches and cakes prepared daily. Additionally, a diverse selection of meats and cheeses is showcased at the counter, evoking considerable temptation. Of particular note is the exceptional quality of their chocolate brownie, possessing an irresistible allure that renders it a frequent treat for yours truly, often savored during morning hours in conjunction with a refreshing fruit salad. Although the fare is undeniably scrumptious, a slight drawback lies in the somewhat elevated pricing.

In response to patron demand, Victor Hugo now offers the convenience of hampers, allowing customers to handpick their preferred edibles, subsequently assembled and delivered by the shop's staff. The interior of the deli features seating arrangements, supplemented by outdoor tables and chairs, thereby providing a charming atmosphere to relax and observe the lively spectacle unfolding on the Meadows during favorable weather conditions."

As a denizen of Matthews, my cardiac organ will forever remain devoted to the Royal Cafe and Creperie; however, Hazelnuts does proffer some delectable crepes. Located in the central district of uptown Charlotte, accessibility to Hazelnuts may prove challenging, unless one works in the downtown area and chooses to traverse the distance by foot; alternatively, patrons may opt to utilize the limited side-street parking facilities available (it is advisable to hone one's parallel parking abilities prior to attempting to secure a parking spot). The eatery itself is situated within the lobby of a structure, thereby ensuring a constant influx of pedestrians; the interior design exudes an aura of contemporary cleanliness, characterized by pristine white walls, striking blackboards, and strategically positioned wooden accents. The menu boasts an array of crepes suitable for breakfast, savory meals, and desserts; however, it is likely that the accommodating staff will accommodate special requests and tailor the crepes according to individual preferences. Following the placement of an order, a brief interval of approximately five to ten minutes (dependent on the length of the queue) transpires before the culinary masterpiece is presented to the patron. Thus far, I have had the pleasure of indulging in the Maple Dream, an ingenious fusion of both savory and sweet elements, encompassing eggs, bacon, and maple syrup; additionally, I have sampled the Basil Pesto Chicken, an exemplary midday option. In conclusion, Hazelnuts presents itself as a superlative breakfast or lunch venue for those finding themselves in the downtown vicinity, despite the absence of elaborate table settings, as the culinary offerings take precedence.

This is really a 3.5 but I rounded up because the staff is so friendly. Its hard to stay in a penthouse suite at the bellagio and then staying at any other penthouse suite and not let that influence my review. 

We stayed in the penthouse suite, it was about half the size of the bellagio's. Yes, I realize that the Vdara is about half the price of the Bellagio, but I digress. 

The hotel is new and clean. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The room is clean and modern. I love the fact that they have a full sized refrigerator for booze and left overs. The bed is relatively comfortable, the windows are really dirty. 

Overall, its really good for the price. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, stick with Bellagio or Wynn. I probably wouldn't stay again.

This course possesses a profound sense of ownership over me, an inherent quality that transcends my personal preferences and inclinations. Notwithstanding, it is indeed a remarkable municipal golf course, one that I have had the privilege of experiencing and can confidently attest to its exceptional nature. The layout presents a formidable challenge, one that tends to favor the player who exhibits precision and accuracy, rather than relying solely on brute force and unrestrained drive. Strategically placed holes afford breathtaking vistas, particularly the hole located on the back nine, which features a picturesque shot through an aperture in a dense forest, descending three levels onto a green situated approximately 200 yards away. I shall unquestionably revisit this meticulously maintained, challenging course, eager to once again partake in the stimulating experience it offers.

I have invariably desired to enter and explore this establishment at diverse localities, but have yet to fulfill such aspirations. Today, I transited past the premises and opted to seize the opportunity to indulge in my long-standing curiosity. The ambient temperature exteriorly was 111 degrees Fahrenheit, which rendered the air-conditioned interior of the store a refreshing respite. The sales associates were remarkably courteous, affording me unrestricted latitude to peruse the merchandise unhindered, while simultaneously remaining readily available to address any queries or requests I might have had. My purchases encompassed a solitary article of clothing, specifically a black cotton top embellished with lavender-hued sequined roses on its anterior aspect, which I acquired at a discounted price of 20% subsequent to completing an application for a credit card. The store manager graciously extended an invitation for me to return within a week, during which time I could purchase the second item that had captured my attention at the same reduced price. This experience served as a testament to the fact that this business places a high premium on customer satisfaction, not solely due to the financial incentive extended to me, but also as a result of the exceptional quality of service I received throughout my visit. Consequentially, I shall strive to frequent this establishment on future excursions to this town, despite my limited predilection for shopping attire.

"This venue offered an exceptionally enjoyable experience, boasting an atmosphere that was utterly conducive to merriment and social interaction. In the company of my dearest relatives and acquaintances, I had the pleasure of partaking in various recreational activities, the sum of which culminated in an utterly delightful outing. While the culinary offerings did not necessarily constitute a gastronomic expedition, they were by no means the primary focus of our visit; rather, they served as a satisfying complement to the multitude of attractions and diversions available at this establishment. Suffice it to say, we are eagerly anticipating our next visit, which promises to be yet another occasion for unadulterated enjoyment and conviviality."

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of exceptional quality, with a particular emphasis on freshness and flavor. My personal experience with their vegetarian sandwich was nothing short of remarkable, as it exceeded my expectations in terms of taste and satisfaction. The trout sandwich I sampled during my visit was also quite impressive, and the aroma emanating from their soup and baked goods was simply enticing. However, it is worth noting that this venue tends to be extremely popular, resulting in a high volume of patrons and a unique semi-table-service system that may take some getting used to. Despite these logistical challenges, I would still highly recommend this eatery for a satisfying midday repast, particularly for those seeking a lighter dining experience. While my personal preference may lean towards Le Cartet, there is no denying the exceptional quality and value offered by this restaurant."

First pho experience surpassed expectations, with an average rating of 3.5 accurately reflecting its quality. Upon entering the establishment, my companions and I opted for three distinct bowls, which we relished collectively. I personally selected the vegan pho, which was abundant in vegetables and noodles, while also boasting remarkable flavor. Additionally, I chose to sample the tofu nuggets, primarily to maintain a straight countenance while placing the order. To my surprise, they were quite palatable, as was the accompanying sauce. My acquaintance opted for crab rangoon, a dish ubiquitous in many eateries, but priced at an exorbitant $8 within these premises. The server's demeanor was brisk, and he failed to solicit beverage preferences, instead delivering water unprompted. This hasty approach resulted in the rapid arrival of our cuisine, which precluded any potential grievances. Furthermore, no offer of dessert was extended, as the check materialized without warning. An enigmatic aspect of our visit involved the subtle background melodies of house music, which persisted throughout our stay, eliciting puzzlement rather than annoyance. Ultimately, we attributed this peculiarity to the atmosphere of Las Vegas in the late hours of the night.

"My sentiments towards this establishment are profoundly positive. Admittedly, my experiences have been limited to the morning hours, but it is widely acknowledged that the inaugural meal of the day holds paramount significance. Every culinary creation I have sampled at Pesto Prima has ascended to the pinnacle of my preferences. The Prima Breakfast Sandwich, in particular, is a gustatory masterpiece that harmoniously unites an array of ingredients, resulting in a symphony of flavors that delight my taste buds. Furthermore, its generous proportions ensure that even a single serving satiates my hunger. The Chai Tea, expertly crafted by the proprietors themselves, is an elixir worthy of the highest praise. Its rich, complex essence tantalizes my palate, making it an unparalleled delight in the locality. In addition, my recent venture into their Java Mocha Blast, a beverage replete with nutritious properties, transcended my expectations. A silky texture and enchanting flavors have secured its place among my favorite indulgences. Lamentably, the sole drawback of this otherwise exceptional eatery lies in its weekend hiatus, precluding the possibility of partaking in its delectable offerings on Sundays. My fervent desire is to eventually relish their midday fare, thereby completing the culinary experience."

One of the few places in Pittsburgh with authentic latino drinks! For that crowded from wall-to-wall experience, hit them up on a weekend night. I enjoyed the tacos by day, and the fact that they actually make REAL caiprinha's here, even when it's snowing outside. Now that's an oxymoron that I love: caiprinha's in the snow..... Only in Pittsburgh!

"Amicable hospitality, delectable cuisine, and an aesthetically pleasing ambiance.  I have a predilection for thermal sensations and this establishment consistently delivers an exceptional dining experience that fulfills my expectations.  Consequently, I shall frequent this venue with regularity."

St. Francis emerges as the unequivocal victor in the culinary contest for the finest French fries in all of Phoenix, with its sibling establishment at the Downtown Public Market boasting an identical formula yet failing to measure up. St. Francis maintains its status as a beloved brunch venue (complete with exceptional live music commencing at 10:30 am on Sundays), while concurrently delivering an impressive dining experience come nightfall. The level of service exhibited by the staff is persistently superior, complemented by the consistent excellence of the cuisine. For a truly satisfying breakfast, consider opting for the sandwich sans the mayo-sauce (let us dispense with the pretense and acknowledge that mayonnaise has no place on a morning meal). The flatbread pizzas and burgers served during the evening hours are equally deserving of praise. Furthermore, the happy hour offerings at this establishment are noteworthy and warrant mention. Although the bar area may be modest in size, securing one of the alfresco stools will ensure a prolonged and enjoyable experience.
