"Comparable to, and indeed surpassing the scope and grandeur of, festivals celebrated in other regions of the nation, this particular event boasts an unparalleled level of excellence, owing to its unique and privileged location. The acquisition of art pieces directly from the hands of the creators themselves, be they artists or artisans, serves to imbue the process with a profound sense of significance and personal connection, allowing patrons to form a deeper appreciation for the works on display. Moreover, certain artisans possess an uncanny ability to embody the essence of their creations, their appearance and demeanor mirroring the very same qualities that define their artistic output."

"On my most recent visits, I have observed a marked improvement in the quality of service and attention to detail, prompting me to offer a commendation. Upon entering the establishment, I was presented with a steaming cup of hot tea, which was replenished promptly upon nearing empty. Additionally, I have noticed a significant enhancement in the cleanliness of the premises over the past year, particularly in comparison to my initial visits several years ago. I appreciate these minor yet noteworthy improvements and wish to acknowledge them. Furthermore, I was quite taken by the flavorful chicken porridge ($6.95), which was served at an optimal temperature, allowing for the chicken to be cooked to perfection and infused with a delicate freshness. The judicious inclusion of ginger, expertly shaved into fine slivers, complemented by the crunch of green onion, cilantro, and shallots, resulted in a harmonious balance of flavors. This dish has secured a place among my preferred choices for a nourishing, comforting meal, especially during periods of indisposition. Gradually, this eatery has earned its place as my go-to destination for a satisfying late-night soup experience."

We thoroughly enjoy this establishment. 
  If you opt for an early evening repast, it is suitable for juveniles, as they possess adequate seating arrangements for young children. 
  Their culinary offerings are of superior quality, their servers are prompt, and their employees are both courteous and hospitable, making it a genuine hidden treasure. 
  We have a particular fondness for their Thai green curry (though an increased quantity of rice would be appreciated), and we highly recommend their sampling appetizer platter (absolutely delectable!).

I am thoroughly enamored with this quaint, diminutive nail salon, as it diverges from the conventional, cookie-cutter nail studio; it boasts an immaculate atmosphere that exudes serenity, which, in tandem with the salon's unconventional nature, has captivated my attention and patronage. My penchant for natural, unadulterated nails has been unwavering, yet, in light of recent difficulties with my nails' fragility, I opted to venture beyond my comfort zone and indulge in gel tips, which, according to the astute recommendation of the youthful attendant, would persist for a fortnight. Alas, these aspirations were quickly thwarted, as the gel tips began to separate from my natural nails a mere six days subsequent to their application, prompting my return to the salon. Undeterred by my unexpected return, the skilled artisan, with her adept touch and proficiency in nail enhancements, rectified the issue by employing a durable gel substance, sans posing any interrogatories or expressing the slightest incredulity towards my premature return. Her meticulous approach and dedication to her craft culminated in a natural, refined appearance of my nails, which, in turn, engendered my unreserved satisfaction.

I consider myself incredibly fortunate to have had the opportunity to indulge in a culinary experience at the Cracked truck, situated within the Food truck Oasis at the renowned Bonnaroo festival. My affinity for a flawlessly prepared egg is unwavering, and I knew instinctively that my taste buds would be delighted by a dining establishment that elevates this modest ingredient to center stage. Following my natural inclination, I opted for the Goy Vey, an amalgamation of bacon, hard salami, hash brown, and a fried egg, complemented by a sweet and spicy cream cheese spread on a crispy ciabatta roll. The resulting flavor profile was nothing short of magnificent, and it stands as a testament to the chef's skill that this breakfast-for-dinner offering transcended the ordinary. While the hash brown's texture may have been slightly lacking in substance, the overall quality of the dish remained undiminished, thanks in no small part to the cream cheese's subtle balance of sweetness and piquancy.

I had the sensation that I was situated on the set of a softcore pornographic production. Two females were dancing behind these screens, which were illuminated by blue and red lights, thereby creating an ambiance that was highly conducive to relaxation in a lounge bar setting. Although it was somewhat crowded, the gathering of individuals present did possess a certain je ne sais quoi that made it an appropriate venue for socializing with acquaintances prior to embarking upon nocturnal adventures. It was not a location that encouraged ogling, but rather an establishment where one could unwind and enjoy the company of others while partaking in libations, albeit at a cost that was slightly prohibitive, as the combination of redbull and vodka amounted to a total of eighteen dollars, which was indeed a tad steep.

"Abandon the standard continental breakfast and instead opt for the delectable eggs benedict, boasting a velvety, subtly tangy sauce atop a delicate, flaky croissant. The coffee, unadulterated by any additives, was of such exceptional quality that it rivaled even the most fastidious palates. The service, a testament to the city's renowned hospitality, was impeccable and attentive, creating an ambiance conducive to leisurely conversation among the trio of ladies gathered the morning after a night of indulgent bar hopping, passionate encounters, and lively discussion."

"The predicament pertaining to sandwiches is that a six-inch iteration is insufficient, whereas a twelve-inch version is excessive...humorously so! Anyway, a seven-point-five inch rendition proves ideal, and a fifteen-inch partition of said sandwich manifests itself as a judicious decision, as evidenced by Cousins' implementation thereof. Furthermore, the subs possess an undeniable delectability, while the customer service maintains a superior quality. The proprietor exhibits a remarkable level of friendliness, as he not only recognizes repeat patrons but also displays a genuine interest in their culinary preferences and orders. Consequently, we derive immense pleasure from patronizing this small business establishment and indulging in its scrumptious offerings."

Really nice attendant. She was such a doll. Bonus - They don't charge to try on wigs! Found two great wigs for under $70 (total charge). \n\nLots of trashy looking isles in here, but it's a beauty supply store ;) -1 star for the awkward lines at the front desk.

"This culinary establishment undoubtedly offers the most exceptional gastronomical experience within the central business district, boasting an impressive array of innovative, delectable dishes, a tranquil ambiance, and reasonable tariffs. Following a comprehensive exploration of approximately half of the menu offerings, I have derived immense satisfaction from the vast majority of my selections, with the sole exception being the mildly piquant red curried noodles and vegetables, which failed to meet my expectations regarding spiciness. Nonetheless, the gypsy stew, with its rich, hearty flavors, has effectively satiated my craving for a truly satisfying dining experience, evoking images of a celestial paradise where comfort food reigns supreme."

Hidden vegan item bursting with flavor that even the most zealous carnivore could endure: Whole Grain Tuscan Linguine sans cream topped with tofu. Giggity. \n\nIf you've not had the pleasure of sinking your chompers into their Ride Krispy Treat, you're not living life to the fullest. I'm convinced the generous wedge of ooey gooey marshmallowy goodness is straight out of an angelic bake sale recipe book. I don't want the secret - I just want them to never stop - ever.

Last Friday, I partook in a nocturnal gathering of females at this establishment, wherein I was not particularly enthused by the notion of gratuity-included parking attendance; however, I have come to recognize that such amenities are de rigueur in this metropolitan area, especially when seeking gastronomical indulgences.  

Upon entering the edifice, I found the ambiance to be rather charming, with a diverse bill of fare and an impressive array of potent potables. The tartlet featuring chÃ¨vre was quite palatable, provided one possesses a penchant for the tangy, pungent flavor of goat cheese. The culinary offerings, while not exceptional, were satisfactory, with my vegetable flatbread pizza requiring a bit more seasoning to attain true gustatory delight. Our table also sampled the cheesecake au jar and the stout cake, both of which garnered unanimous approval from our group (although, as a discerning devotee of chocolate cake, I maintain high standards in this regard). 

Throughout the evening, our server exhibited exceptional proficiency, save for a brief moment of curtness regarding a misunderstanding with payment methods, which was swiftly resolved. In conclusion, I shall indeed revisit this dining establishment, as its attributes outweigh any minor drawbacks.

"While in the vicinity, visiting an acquaintance, I opted to procure a salad at this establishment and was thoroughly impressed! My fondness for a well-crafted salad adorned with aquatic protein rendered me pleasantly surprised by their employment of freshly grilled salmon, rather than the customary pre-cooked, cold variety often found at hasty eateries (such as Panera). The brief delay in preparation time was more than compensated by the heightened culinary experience! Furthermore, I elected to consume my salad off-premises, but my attention was drawn to their offering of fermented beverages and an outdoor seating area."

"Excellent culinary experience characterized by delectable melodies, gastronomical delights, and exceptional hospitality. My previous visit to the Greater Phoenix region included a memorable dining excursion to this establishment. We opted for al fresco seating to capitalize on the balmy evening ambiance, and were immediately captivated by the eclectic and spirited musical accompaniment that harmoniously complemented our dining experience without overpowering conversation. As the evening drew to a close, our server demonstrated remarkable attentiveness and wit, ensuring an unparalleled level of customer satisfaction. The fare itself proved to be a veritable feast for the senses; a garden salad, generously portioned and bursting with flavorful greens, preceded a magnificently crafted pizza showcasing an array of savory toppings artfully arranged upon a wafer-thin crust. However, as we ventured towards the pie's center, we noted a slight diminution in crispiness, leading us to surmise that a brief additional period of culinary indulgence would have enhanced our enjoyment. Nonetheless, Grimaldi's offered an unforgettable epicurean adventure that warrants unequivocal recommendation to any individual fortunate enough to find themselves within proximity."

"Upon embarking on my maiden visit, I must confess that my expectations were not entirely met, as I encountered an ambiance that fell short of my preferences. Specifically, I felt subjected to an unsettling gaze during the ordering process, which somewhat marred my experience. Additionally, the absence of my preferred beverage further contributed to my disappointment. Notwithstanding, I acknowledge that this establishment enjoys immense popularity among patrons, and I must admit that it boasts an impressive array of beverages and reasonably comfortable seating. However, my overall satisfaction remained limited, warranting a rating of four stars, relative to other local breweries I have had the pleasure of visiting."

"I indulged in a luxurious sojourn at the Flamingo, whereupon I experienced a gradual progression of satisfaction, precipitated by an initial state of ambivalence. Following a prompt and efficient check-in process, during which we were warmly received by a courteous and competent front desk attendant, we proceeded to our assigned accommodations. However, upon entering our fourth-floor abode, I was taken aback by the unanticipated presence of an unsightly air unit, which marred the otherwise picturesque view. In response, I expedited a call to guest services, who graciously arranged for our transfer to a superior room on the eighteenth floor, at no additional cost. This alternate lodging offered a marked improvement in both aesthetics and comfort, featuring plush beds, expansive vistas of the pool, and an enhanced sense of tranquility, further enhanced by the inclusion of a modern flat-screen television. Additionally, I derived great pleasure from the novel experience of showering while simultaneously enjoying television programming in the bathroom. In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly consider returning to this establishment, given its reasonable rates and prime location."

They took part of France and plopped it in the middle of Vegas..including the very blue sky with wispy clouds that almost seemed to move as you made your way through streets of Paris. Lots of shops and typical mall prices.

"Utterly exquisite culinary experience. We indulged in the delectable chicken satay, savory dried beef, and flavorsome pad cashew nut. My palate was thoroughly satiated by the scrumptious offerings, rendering me insatiable for more. The hospitable staff members exhibited remarkable cordiality and affability. However, a minor drawback occurred when we attempted to place a delivery order beyond the stipulated time frame, and we were informed that while the restaurant accepted our request, we needed to contact an alternative delivery service. Unfortunately, the latter declared they were unavailable, leaving us in a state of flux with no successful outcome."

"Indulge in a romantic escapade, and allow me to suggest an ideal venue for such an occasion. none other than the esteemed Cajun Queen, nestled within a picturesque, historic edifice on 7th Street. Upon arrival, we were ushered into the sunlit rear compartment, only to find ourselves amidst a boisterous gathering of revelers celebrating a ladies' holiday soiree. The cacophony of sound was almost deafening, prompting us to seek alternative accommodations. Our request was met with a peculiar response, as we were informed that the remaining dining areas were fully occupied, with the sole exception being the rooftop patio. Astonished by the revelation of this hidden gem, we opted to ascend to this unexplored territory. The balmy temperature in December rendered the outdoor setting an idyllic retreat, enhanced by the melodic strains of vintage Christmas tunes, a dazzling display of illumination, and a breathtaking panorama. Our culinary excursion began with a half portion of fried oysters, which arrived in a golden-brown, crispy state, accompanied by a rich, creamy Ranch dressing. For our main courses, we selected the etouffee, my companion opting for the crawfish variation, while I preferred a vegetarian rendition. Although both dishes required a pinch of salt, pepper, and a dash of hot sauce to elevate their flavors, they proved satisfying after a bit of judicious seasoning. Incidentally, I must confess that their vegetable etouffee, when savored on a previous visit, was nothing short of sublime, necessitating no embellishments whatsoever. In conclusion, let us resolve to seek out this rooftop haven whenever the weather permits, ensuring future visits to this beloved eatery are suffused with an air of exclusivity and delight."

"ENCHANTED by the Old Sugar Distillery for potations. I relish the horchata, or indeed any concoction incorporating their honey liqueur. One can also acquire bottles of their liqueur, which harmonizes magnificently with any beverage at home. I sense that it's a somewhat clandestine venue, as many of my acquaintances are unfamiliar with it, yet one particular comrade avows its excellence. Alas, they cease operations at 10pm (which he maintains is the apogee....perplexing, no?), precluding prolonged revelry on the premises. However, it lies in close proximity to other intriguing and less-frequented watering holes, such as the Brass Ring. \n\nI do not take pleasure in the dim ambiance, despite its proximity to Washington Boulevard...occasionally, I hasten my pace when walking solo from my vehicle."

"We embarked upon a culinary excursion on a Saturday morning, which yielded an unexpected yet auspicious outcome; the venue was teeming with patrons, a circumstance that augured well for the quality of the fare. Notwithstanding the throngs of people, our party of three was attended to with alacrity, as we were seated within a mere ten-minute interval. My gastronomic inclinations led me to opt for the Eggs Maximilian, a dish that featured chorizo, an ingredient whose piquant flavor I find particularly appealing. The portion size was generous, to say the least, as I felt satiated for the balance of the day, having been thoroughly nourished by the multifaceted composition of the dish, which boasted an array of flavors and textures that left nothing wanting. The service we received was brisk and affable, as our servers were assiduous in their efforts to ensure that our beverages remained at least half full at all times. In conclusion, based on the quality of our experience, we shall unquestionably return to this establishment in the future."

"My preferred lodging establishment when visiting Las Vegas is strategically situated in the central portion of the renowned Strip, thereby offering unparalleled convenience and accessibility to an array of attractions and amenities. Additionally, the accommodations feature exceptionally comfortable sleeping surfaces, which contribute significantly to a restful and rejuvenating slumber. Furthermore, this particular hotel offers a more economical alternative compared to neighboring establishments while maintaining a markedly superior level of quality and cleanliness compared to nearby budget-friendly options. During my most recent stay, I was gratuitously upgraded and subsequently received a courtesy telephone call from the hotel's staff inquiring about a set of misplaced keys, which I had assumed were irretrievable. To my utter astonishment, they expedited the retrieval process by shipping the aforementioned items back to me forthwith, sans requesting any form of compensation or remuneration. It is with great anticipation that I eagerly look forward to returning to this esteemed establishment during the upcoming New Year's celebrations."

I spent the majority of my weekend here for the NASCAR races. 
Now this review is extremely biased... 
I was treated to suite parking, which is as close as you can get. 
I watched the races from the suites, including food and drinks. 
I received passes to the Octane suite, which is a 5 star restaurant and bar at the track, by invitation only. 
So, yes, I really like this place!! 
The grounds were kept as clean as possible considering the amount of people in attendance. The PIR staff were very friendly and helpful. 
A few of the security guards were a little blurry about where some things were, but friendly all the same. 
It is amazing how many people camp at the track for the weekend. 
Next time I'm going to watch the shopping cart races in the "town". 
This was my virgin voyage to a NASCAR event and I must say I was pleasantly surprised and would gladly go again...

"As an individual whose predilection for cigars is not particularly pronounced, I do, however, derive pleasure from indulging in one accompanied by a robust beverage on occasion. Recently, I had the opportunity to experience this establishment, and my initial impression was overwhelmingly favorable. 

The ambiance, characterized by an harmonious blend of leather chairs, sofas, love seats, and strategically positioned bar stools, exuded an aura of warmth and comfort, creating an ideal setting for a tranquil respite. The judicious incorporation of rich wood accents and tasteful table settings further contributed to the overall sense of refinement that permeated the space. 

While my exposure to the edible offerings was limited, owing to my abbreviated duration on the premises, I must confess that my cursory assessment of the comestibles, potables, and cigars available led me to classify them as satisfactory. A subsequent visit, which I eagerly anticipate, will afford me the opportunity to more thoroughly evaluate the culinary aspects of this venue. Until then, I remain optimistic about the prospect of returning in the near future."

Papilio served great food, has a cosy atmosphere and friendly staff enthusiastic about their job and proud of their restaurant.  

We ordered the marinated olives to enjoy with the house wine and beer - we had been given the head's up that the Calzone Ripieno would take 15-20 minutes as it is such a thick folded pizza.  It was well worth the wait.  Generously stuffed with mozarella, spicy sausage, ham, mushrooms and tomatoes, it was a perfect match to the Italian beer and red wine.  

We also ordered the Gnocchi Al Gorgonzola e Spinaci which is as good as I have ever tasted.  I would go back to Papilio for the Gnocchi alone.  

To finish we had a double expresso each and were given a small bowl of bite sized ameretto biscottis.  They were so good that we cheekily asked for a few more and the waiter generously filled another bowl for us.  

When we arrived for lunch, there was a family group of 14 people that were comfortably accommodated so it seems to be a great place for couples, families and groups.  

Our total was just under £40 for three drinks, starter, two mains and two coffees which was well worth it.  We will definitely be returning to Papilio.

"Beer Mugs capable of inducing cranial fractures, confirm. Teutonic ensemble featuring an accordion, affirmative. Hostesses donning traditional Dirndl attire, emphasizing their proficiency in managing superior thoracic assets, indeed. Expansive dining area with oversized tables and benches, present. Patrons engaging in shot-downing rituals while standing on furniture, fueled by the rhythmic chanting of the band, were abundant at HofbrÃ¤uhaus. \n\nOur culinary experience encompassed a vast array of delectable offerings, commencing with a soft pretzel appetizer accompanied by a rich, potentially lethal bier cheese sauce, which threatened to surpass the limits of our gastronomical capacities. For my primary course, I opted for the Wiener Schnitzel, complemented by a medley of steamed vegetables and a side of German potato salad. The pork cutlet was cooked to perfection, boasting a delightful synchronization of juiciness and crispiness, rendering it suitable for consumption over two meals. The potato salad displayed a pleasing equilibrium of spices, with a subtle application of mustard and mayonnaise, distinguishing it from conventional picnic potato salads. Consuming both my meal and beverage presented a formidable challenge, but, as a vacationing individual, I felt compelled to indulge excessively."

"On multiple previous occasions, I have partaken of culinary offerings at this establishment, when it was known as Pink Pepper, yet I had never availed myself of the lunchtime buffet until a few days ago. Upon indulging in the diverse array of dishes, I discovered that while each item possessed an impressive depth of flavor, a notable absence of piquancy was evident throughout. It is understandable that the restaurant strives to cater to the broadest possible audience by tempering the spiciness of their creations, but as an ardent devotee of Thai cuisine, I typically expect my dishes to arrive already imbued with a sufficient degree of fiery zest. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, I would unhesitatingly return to sample further selections from their menu, which I did on several subsequent occasions. In addition, the Thai tea served at this eatery ranks among the most delectable I have ever had the pleasure of savoring, prompting me to procure a takeout order of the beverage to protract the enjoyment of its rich, velvety excellence as long as feasible. The hospitality displayed by the staff was also exceptional, leaving me eager to revisit the premises forthwith."

This eatery bears an uncanny resemblance to its sibling establishment, The Cheesecake Factory, with a strikingly analogous ambiance and culinary offerings that cater to an extensive array of gastronomical inclinations. My fondness for the menu's copious variety and generous portion sizes, capable of satiating the hunger of a small community, has led to numerous opportunities for relishing delectable leftovers.

On each visit, I take pleasure in exploring novel epicurean options, such as the BBQ Asian Pork Tacos, whose flavorsome excellence I highly recommend. Despite the vast dimensions of this dining establishment and the consistent throngs of patrons, the quality of service remains impressively efficient, albeit occasionally challenging to secure optimal attention from the overburdened staff.

While the cacophony of sounds within can be overwhelming at times, the advantage of extended operating hours and a prime location within the Venetian complex renders this venue an accommodating choice for those seeking a satisfying dining experience well into the night.

This establishment serves as an excellent supplement to the surrounding vicinity, providing an additional venue for social gatherings and culinary exploration. I am delighted to have discovered this charming eatery, boasting an intriguing menu and an impressive selection of wines. Upon visiting, I was pleasantly surprised to learn that they produce their own wines on site, some of which demonstrate remarkable quality. Furthermore, I was astounded to find Four Graces Pinot Noir among their offerings, as it happens to be my latest discovery from Oregon and a new favorite of mine. It's truly remarkable that they carry it, given the limited production at the small winery in Oregon. My dining experience was thoroughly enjoyable, particularly the Shallot marmalade bruschetta, which showcased exceptional flavor. The salmon roll was also quite satisfying. Notably, on Mondays, they offer a special promotion featuring a chef's choice pizza paired with a bottle of their wine for a mere $20. During my visit with my spouse for Happy Hour, we indulged in their delectable sliders, which further enhanced our positive impression of the restaurant. Overall, this venue offers an excellent setting for relaxation and enjoyment, complete with a well-stocked bar that caters to diverse tastes.

4 stars in the summer on the terrasse and well, lower when not. But really, what a lovely hidden spot. If you've never been here before you'll doubt you're on the right track, but yes, past Foufounes and all the grit and graffiti and closed doors of this bit of St Catherine, up what feels like a dead end alley, and through a small barely marked door and you;re there. A regular old pub that opens onto an completely enclosed terrasse with ivy-covered stone walls stretching up the floors above you towards the sky, lots of seating, wooden benches, high-school era tunes, friendly easy going service, a perfect place to forget how old you are and what time it is and just enjoy. This will help you enjoy the food too which is not bad, but not good pub delivery from a nearby joint. \n\nInside is fine, just a cozyish pub with the occasional good open mic night.

I got Jamerica takeout and it was REALLY messy but SO worth it. The mango run chicken was enormous and everything I could have asked for. Each element was flavorful and satisfying on their own but together they were magical. \nThe shop is decorated with photos and letters and seems like a chill place to have a quick meal.

"The Phoenix Roadrunner Park Farmers Market presents an exceptional opportunity to acquire a diverse array of fresh produce and locally manufactured goods. The vendors primarily consist of approximately forty percent produce, thirty percent local food products, fifteen percent fresh food and beverages, and fifteen percent miscellaneous items. If your primary focus is on procuring produce, it can be challenging to maintain fiscal discipline in light of the numerous other exceptional local edibles available. To optimize your experience, it is recommended that you avoid the parking lot adjacent to the market and instead opt for parking along 36th Street, which enables a leisurely stroll through the park. Some of this writer's preferred products at the market include fresh chili peppers, fresh herbs, distinctive fruits and vegetables, local dairy items, and tamales."

My girlfriend collects robot toys and one of my best friends is a Spawn fanatic so I decided to take a look around. Although there weren't many robots there was plenty more of everything else you can imagine when it comes to toys, McFarlane created or not.\n\nThey had a small, but vital comic archive for the Spawn fan and they offered hard-to-find or unique toys of all genres. Plenty to choose from and even the imports weren't devastatingly expensive. This franchise specialty store can be appreciated by anyone who collects and even for those of us that want to take a look around. Pretty entertaining as a time killer for the masses or a Mecca for the few. I walked out empty-handed, but with a curious smile on my face, my friend on the other hand was pleased with the fare he found to support his hobby.

"The value proposition of this establishment is undeniable, particularly for those who relish the prospect of indulging in an assortment of delectable comestibles at a relatively modest cost. Despite harboring reservations regarding the veracity of the ingredients comprising their 'bucko nuggets,' the opportunity to acquire a diverse array of beverages, hot dogs, nuggets, fries, nachos, ice cream, and packaged cotton candy for a total expenditure of approximately $10 remains an enticing proposition, indeed."

"Committed to a south rim excursion, which initiated at a sluggish pace, boarding a bus that conveyed us to the Miracle Mile, followed by a brief interlude for refreshments, specifically a Danish pastry and either coffee or water, prior to transferring onto an alternative bus. The process required some time to become streamlined. Made brief halts at a rest area adjacent to the dam, situated in Kingman, Arizona, and subsequently enjoyed a moderately satisfying meal in Williams, Arizona. The south rim presented a considerable distance to traverse, necessitating multiple stops at the canyon, each lasting approximately an hour, before embarking on the return journey, with an additional halt in Kingman, Arizona. It is crucial to prepare appropriately for the prolonged south rim venture. Our chauffeur, Tommy, demonstrated exceptional skill and offered comprehensive insights throughout the expedition, concluding around 9:30 pm."

"Culinary delights are utterly remarkable, with tuna tacos being an exemplary illustration of such gastronomical excellence. However, it is advisable to temper one's expectations regarding the promptness of service, as the establishment's focus on creating delectable dishes takes precedence over expediency. Despite this, the duration of time spent waiting is undoubtedly compensated by the exceptional quality of the food."

"Culinary delights abound at this esteemed establishment, specializing in Middle Eastern cuisine. As a Briton with Lebanese ancestry, I have had the privilege of indulging in a diverse array of delectable dishes, each with its unique flavors and textures. My gastronomical journey has led me to this venue, which I highly recommend for its authentic and tantalizing fare. Kudos to the chef and staff for their dedication to excellence!!"

Went to zoo lights for the first time and can definitely see how great it is for kids! Went on a Thursday night and it was Packed! The whole zoo is lit up and it is fun to walk around. Admission is $10/adult. FYI most the animals are asleep so don't get your hopes up!
I really liked it. The food was good, the place was clean and the service was nice. I'll definitely come back.

"My sojourn at this establishment has encompassed dual purposes: an overnight stay and a nuptial celebration. The lodging's aesthetic appeal surpassed my expectations, boasting a harmonious color palette of ivory, gold, and navy blue, which was a refreshing departure from the ubiquitous utilization of garish hues commonly associated with hospitality venues. The sleeping quarters were also exceptionally comfortable, with a bed that rivaled the comfort of my own domicile. The overall cleanliness of the premises was evident, and the staff exhibited amicability during both check-in and check-out processes. However, the sonic permeability of the walls proved to be a significant drawback, as we were regaled with an impromptu serenade of nocturnal revelry at 3 a.m., courtesy of inebriated patrons in the adjacent corridors. In contrast, the wedding reception hosted on these premises was a resounding success, with a vigilant server expeditiously addressing a liquid mishap involving a companion, and the majority of the service staff demonstrating commendable attentiveness, save for a minor entree confusion that was promptly rectified upon our request."

You've got to sit in the patio out back. I'm in Texas and have access to all types of great Mexican food. This place holds its own. Beer was cold, food was fresh, chips and salsa were good. I'd go back and I don't say that about too many places.

Ben has graced this establishment with his esteemed presence on multiple occasions, primarily for the purpose of partaking in the delectable offerings served during the midday repast. The diminutive nature of the commercial complex in which this eatery is situated, coupled with the limited availability of parking spaces, may pose a challenge for those seeking to indulge in the culinary delights available within. Notwithstanding these potential obstacles, we have consistently opted for the slender variety of pizza, which has invariably proven to be of exceptional quality. A single large portion typically suffices to satiate the hunger of two individuals, although it is imperative to exercise restraint and resist the temptation to overindulge, lest one's gluttonous tendencies prevail.

My boyfriend and I were passing through Vegas on Valentines Day and decided to stay the night. We found a new/updated room at Gold Coast on hotels.com for $30!! 

I actually liked that it was off the strip. Since we were driving, it was less stressful not having to drive with a million people crossing the street and not being able to find parking entrances off the strip. 

The room was completely updated, modern and super nice. New bed, new furniture and the bathrooms were cute. No tub, but an awesome stand up shower with a huge shower head! 

What I liked the very most about this hotel was the parking was easy to find and the check-in was close to the parking structure, our room was easy to find and we didn't have to deal with SO many people in the casino (since they were all older people and no drunken retards from the strip). ANNNNNND the casino didn't even smell of cigarette smoke, what? Unheard of.

The only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because the check-in agents were so annoying! There were 4 people behind the desk (only 2 were seemingly working) and 1 person in front of us, but it took them 20 minutes to get us.

Wow, talk about a total surprise.

For the most part, I tend to think of breweries as strictly beer, not food. However, this place is the total exception. The atmosphere is great. Very open and inviting and has a fun warehouse feel to it. We sat down and were immediately given menus for both food and drink. 

The drinks were good. Nothing that really stood out but still good beer that I would go back and try again (and try some of the other kinds as well). However, the food was phenomenal. They go outside the box (soup in test tubes) and have incredible flat breads. The only bummer we ran into is that they don't serve all of their menu items during lunch, which meant I didn't get to try the shrimp and cotton candy skewers (which had been hyped up to me). 

Can't wait to come back to Charlotte so i can try entirely different things (especially the cotton candy)!

"Portions are enormous, rivalling those served on platters, and the prices on their menu are incredibly affordable, making it an excellent choice for families seeking comfort food in a shared setting."

"Despite the fact that I possessed a Groupon for this particular establishment, I must admit that my expectations were surpassed by the culinary experience offered here. While the supplementary dishes were merely adequate, the pork ribs themselves were cooked to perfection, boasting an optimal tenderness that stopped short of complete disintegration from the bone. Furthermore, the flavorful sauce accompanying the ribs was abundant and of superior quality. Based on my satisfaction with this meal, I would unhesitatingly endorse this restaurant to any individual seeking genuinely delectable ribs within the Phoenix area (a task that, regrettably, proves challenging to accomplish)."

"Dr. Hsueh is a remarkably skilled, meticulous, and compassionate optometrist who ensures that her patients comprehend each step of the examination process, courteously soliciting their queries and concerns throughout. I greatly appreciate such personalized attention to detail. 

Following the determination of my prescription, I had the pleasure of collaborating with JR (or perhaps RJ?), a highly competent and amiable optician who assisted me in selecting an appropriate frame. His exceptional customer service and proficiency were truly commendable. 

I am exceedingly gratified to have discovered this optical facility, as it appears that I have found a highly capable and trustworthy eye care professional in Dr. Hsueh. I fervently hope that this review will serve as a valuable endorsement, inspiring others to entrust their ocular health to her expert care."

At nine o'clock in the evening, if your sole craving is for an assortment of delectable sweets, then a visit to Centotre is certainly in order. Upon our arrival, the proprietor extended a warm welcome, replete with exuberant Italian gesticulations, making us feel privileged from the outset. He efficiently orchestrated the preparation of a table for our party of four and ensured that we were all comfortably seated.

The menu presented an abundance of mouth-watering possibilities, but a minor drawback emerged when the waitstaff mistakenly delivered a dish identical to the one my sister had declined. Despite her initial reluctance, she thoroughly enjoyed the culinary delight, albeit with a tinge of disappointment. My spouse, however, savored the affogato with unbridled enthusiasm, prompting me to offer a playful quip regarding the beverage's name. (Wink-wink).

During our sojourn, my sister was captivated by the novel approach employed by the establishment to educate patrons about the Italian language while they occupied the restroom. Although it required a brief excursion to fully appreciate its humor and utility, I assure you that it was undoubtedly engaging and practical.

Regrettably, the exceptional attention we received during the early stages of our visit was not mirrored in the closing moments of our evening, as we encountered considerable difficulty in locating a server to settle our bill. This delay proved mildly vexing, particularly given our satiated and fatigued state. Nonetheless, we ultimately resolved the financial aspect and I concurred with my spouse that a future visit, motivated solely by the allure of their scrumptious desserts, was indeed warranted.

The first time I went here years ago, I did not like it. I would not recommend their pasta dishes. However, the pizza's, salads, and sandwiches are all fantastic. The pozookies are one of the best desserts around! Service is always good, atmosphere is great! The Santa Fe salad and the Italian chopped salad are great choices and huge.

"Was it the visages of Mario Moreno, popularly known as Cantinflas, that embellished the walls or the culinary offerings that left an indelible mark on my gastronomical experience? Uncertain, yet I experienced unadulterated euphoria within the confines of this eatery. The generous serving sizes, reminiscent of 'abuelita's' copious portions, nearly surpassed my capacity to consume, but the delectability of each dish precluded any possibility of disappointment. Our party relished the Tamales Oaxaquenos and the Four Traditional Moles, with both options showcasing unparalleled culinary mastery. Additionally, the Horchata and pineapple soda quenched our thirst, leaving us utterly satisfied. However, a few drawbacks marred an otherwise exceptional dining experience, including inconsistent service and an overzealous individual soliciting donations. Despite these minor inconveniences, I would unhesitatingly return to Casa Reyna and enthusiastically endorse it to fellow gourmands."

I have had the pleasure of dining at Famous Dave's a mere ten times, yet my fondness for their culinary offerings knows no bounds. The service has consistently met my expectations and I must commend them for their adeptness in creating a welcoming ambiance. I highly recommend registering for their electronic missives, as they often contain exclusive promotions and discounts.

My affinity for their corn bread cannot be overstated; it's a sublime fusion of sweetness and perfection, leaving me yearning for an indefinite supply. Alas, my craving for their delectable victuals often results in an inflated total, with a recent excursion costing a considerable sum of $70 for two main courses, refreshments, and a sizable hors d'oeuvre. However, the abundance of leftovers generously compensates for the financial investment.

In conclusion, I must draw attention to the invaluable role played by the paper towels positioned atop each table. Their absorbency and versatility prove indispensable in mitigating the aftermath of an excessive BBQ sauce consumption, ensuring that both personal hygiene and dignity remain intact.

"This gastronomical indulgence, perching atop the hierarchy of my culinary experiences within the city limits of Las Vegas, rivals the supreme pizza I had the pleasure of consuming within the picturesque confines of downtown Disney. Notwithstanding the sluggish pace of their service, which seems to be an inherent trait shared by numerous establishments within the city's culinary landscape, this delectable delight undoubtedly merits a trial run, and I might just find myself partaking in a second helping prior to my departure from this gastronomic wonderland."

I stumbled upon this culinary gem quite serendipitously, as it is nestled within a nondescript strip mall under a rather unobtrusive signage. The ambiance and concept bear an uncanny resemblance to Chipotle, boasting a similar build-your-own format but elevating it to a gastronomic experience that truly astounded me. Only the freshest ingredients are employed, which is palpable in each bite, and the menu offers healthier alternatives, a welcome departure from the usual fast food fare. The staff members are invariably affable and courteous, fostering an environment that encourages frequent returns. The chicken is, without a doubt, my preferred choice, but the menu also showcases shrimp, steak, carnitas, and a vegetarian option. Furthermore, this eatery is locally owned and operated, contributing to the community's economic vitality.

I wanted to try this place when I was in Austin, but did not get the chance. My husband and I visited this restaurant at 2 pm on a Saturday, so it was busy but not packed. We each ordered a burger and a beer and shared an order of queso fries. For those who like queso fries the way they are made in Austin, I would not recommend this dish. The cheese sauce is served on the side of the fries. It was very good - just not exactly what I expected. The burgers were delicious - definitely the best in the area. I love the draft beer selection, as this is one of the only places in Arizona that serves a large variety of Arizona-brewed beers. Great place to try  a new bev and I will definitely be coming back. 

I'll admit, the ordering system is a bit confusing for Arizonans (you place your entire order and pay at the counter, then they bring out your food), but they do have servers for each table if you forget to order something or need another beverage. They offer self-service all-natural sodas (yay, sugar cane), so you definitely will never need to wait for a soft drink refill.

In all, two filling burgers, two local drafts and a large order of queso fries ran about $37. I've paid way more for food and drink of a lesser quality.

Armed with a voucher for an indulgent burger meal, Anita and I were not disheartened by the prospect of partaking in such a delectable offering. The burgers, typically served during the daytime hours, were graciously made available for our evening repast by the accommodating staff at Rick's, a chic boutique hotel boasting a contemporary yet inviting ambiance in its reception, bar, and dining areas, replete with warm hues and textures. Our voucher featured Innis & Gunn as the preferred beverage option, but alas, it was unavailable, prompting us to select the Grolsch swing-top alternative, which we found quite satisfactory. The burgers, generously proportioned and bursting with flavorful fillings, were cooked to perfection, while the fries, slender and crispy, complemented the meal nicely. We thoroughly enjoyed the culinary experience and would enthusiastically endorse it, although the price point, ranging from approximately \u00a310 to \u00a313 for a single burger, might justify a minor deduction in stars. The service we received throughout our visit was attentive, efficient, and pleasing, earning high praise and making us eager to return.

Virgin America gates not far from security check in. Plenty of seating and eateries nearby. Flying in on a Sunday and out on a Thursday the place wasn't crowded so it made fpr a pleasant travelling. Vegas vibe throughout the airport including slot machines in the baggage claim area.
"Although I am not particularly fond of Ramen, I must admit that this establishment serves truly delectable dishes, my son's pork belly bowl being a prime example; he relished every bite."

"Gastronomical haven! Extremely delighted by the culinary offerings. The oxtail chili cheese fries possess an unparalleled flavor profile, rendering them an absolute delight for the taste buds. The black and green burger, with its incorporation of bleu cheese and pineapple ketchup, constitutes a gustatory experience that is simply unmatched in terms of sheer enjoyment and satisfaction."

I really like bar food, almost too much, and it's something I probably need help with. I can mostly thank some great spots in my home town, but locally, Zipps can be blamed for my progression.\n\nTheir burgers are consistently hot and flavorful, and the focaccias for the most part are good...even if they're just wraps. But in my book, their wings are my favorite in town. More specifically the golden medium wings have tremendous spicy/sweet balance. And their happy hour specials are some of the best deals anywhere. Anywhere!!!

This gambling establishment, as you might anticipate, primarily caters to an elderly clientele. They boast an extensive array of slot machines and video poker terminals, as well as what is arguably the most expansive bingo hall ever conceived. 
  Upon meeting my parents at this casino on a Wednesday at noon, I observed that I was merely one of a select few individuals within the 21-30-year-old age bracket present. Nonetheless, the majority of the croupiers were relatively youthful. A notable advantage of this venue is that the predominantly senior demographic results in the minimum bet for blackjack being lowered to a mere $2, thereby providing an ideal opportunity to refine one's 21-playing abilities without incurring significant financial loss. I opted to participate in a game at a $5 table and managed to walk away with some winnings. It is worth noting that I failed to notice a craps table, and the roulette wheel was automated, which I found rather peculiar. 
  Although the younger player demographic likely converges on weekends, leading to a higher number of unoccupied tables, this casino does not possess an abundance of gaming tables overall. 
  In conclusion, this casino is undoubtedly worthy of a visit, and its location on tribal land only adds to its allure. However, drivers should exercise caution when traveling to and from the casino, as the Beeline Highway is closely monitored by the Arizona State Police for speeding violations.

My husband and I just ate at this restaurant tonight and it was delicious.  We got hummus for an appetizer and each had the gyro sandwich. He got his with steak fries and I got a side salad. Everything was great. The side salad was exceptional. \n\nThe restaurant is located in a shopping center. The decor is dated, however, it's not quite a dive. The location and decor are the only reasons I didn't give it 5 stars. But the food and owners are great. I will definitely be going back soon.

"Recently, we had the pleasure of partaking in a midday repast at this esteemed establishment, and our expectations were thoroughly exceeded. Despite the throngs of patrons and the somewhat arduous process of securing a parking spot, we were able to secure a table with relative expediency. The ambiance of the restaurant was reminiscent of a quintessential dive, complete with the melodic strains of 50's music emanating from the radio (a delightful touch, we must say). The culinary offerings were quite impressive, particularly the Lamb Burger, which we found to be a veritable gustatory delight. Our spouse opted for one of the Hot Dogs, which was enshrouded in a rich, velvety blanket of Chili and Pimento Cheese; their effusive praise for this delectable dish was palpable. It is worth noting that, despite our unwavering satisfaction with our own meal, we couldn't help but experience a pang of gastronomic envy upon beholding the tantalizing Hot Dog arrayed before us. Suffice it to say, we would unhesitatingly return to this eatery in the future."

I have been to Brio multiple times and we always leave satisfied. They have cheap lunch specials which are always tasty. Last time I ordered a chop salad and a flatbread for like $7 and I had left-overs!\n\nFor dinner they have great pastas and meat dishes. I also love their panini's and salad combo. They also have weekday specials with $5 martini's on wednesdays!

"Commencing my assessment, I must aver that my appraisal shall diverge from the norm. We attended Graze for the Frozen Assets benefit soiree in support of Clean Lakes Alliance, whereupon the eatery underwent a metamorphosis to accommodate this grandiose themed gathering. The atmosphere was rather convivial, fostering an air of joviality among the patrons. Graze catered the affair, and their delectable hors d'oeuvres garnered unanimous approbation from the attendees. The venue was bursting at the seams with revelers, as evidenced by the copious number of individuals we engaged in conversation, all of whom expressed immense satisfaction with both the location and Graze's hospitable nature as host."

Upon our return to Scottsdale, we decided to partake in the establishment's inaugural happy hour, which, much to our delight, boasted an array of reasonably-priced sushi and sake. However, our euphoria was somewhat mitigated by the cacophonous ambiance, which seemed to be redolent of a nightclub, thereby creating an incongruous atmosphere that was further exacerbated by the waitstaff's risquÃ© attire, reminiscent as it was of the sartorial choices commonly associated with college bars.

We indulged in a culinary escapade on a Saturday and were compelled to experience a brief period of waiting, during which we partook of a beverage at the bar. Everyone's demeanor was incredibly cordial and the comestibles were of exceptional quality. We opted for the lunch special and were satiated by its generous portion size. Furthermore, as a result of our utilization of Yelp, we became cognizant of a promotion whereby expending $40.00 would grant us a discount of $10.00, thereby rendering the entire experience even more worthwhile. As individuals hailing from the NY/CT area, we felt grateful to have stumbled upon an excellent Chinese eatery. My personal preference was the shrimp and orange dish, which I found to be utterly delectable. In contrast, Jay's selection of mongolian beef was slightly too salty for my taste, although he seemed to enjoy it. Lastly, the hot and sour soup we sampled was truly remarkable.

The gastronomical experience associated with the consumption of the $29 Kobe Burger was utterly remarkable, possessing an unparalleled level of excellence that rendered it a veritable culinary masterpiece, thereby justifying its cost and warranting a wholehearted endorsement; furthermore, the quality of service provided by the restaurant's staff was commendable, characterized by a high degree of proficiency, cordiality, and attentiveness, which significantly contributed to the overall satisfaction of the dining experience, and lastly, the individual named Matt extended his unequivocal approbation towards the culinary establishment, expressing his unwavering recommendation for the burger in question.

"Indubitably, it is a minuscule, cramped, and somewhat decrepit coffee bar that could be classified as a ghetto establishment, but the chai served therein cannot be surpassed in terms of quality. The 'barista,' who appears to be the sole proprietor and operator of this diminutive drinkery, seems to be preoccupied with the meticulous preparation of a single cup of coffee at a time, thereby neglecting to acknowledge the presence of any other patrons. Consequently, the waiting period for obtaining a cup of coffee may be prolonged beyond the norm. However, if you possess sufficient leisure time, specifically ranging from 10 to 15 minutes, it may be advisable to procure your coffee 'to go,' as the experience may not necessarily be regrettable."

"The recent establishment of a novel Stingray venue at Scottsdale Quarter has contributed positively to the progressive growth of eateries within North Scottsdale. Featuring an innovative design, the bar area boasts entire walls that can be effortlessly slid open, effectively integrating the outdoor ambiance into the indoor space. The interior design exudes an air of refinement and sophistication, while the immaculate cleanliness of the premises serves as a testament to its relatively recent opening. Upon visiting this establishment, I enjoyed a satisfying lunch experience, highlighted by my customary order of the lunch sashimi combination. Priced at $15, the sashimi combo at Stingray is marginally higher in cost compared to the identical dish offered at RA, situated across the street in Kierland. However, the inclusion of a complementary cucumber salad and the richer, more flavorful miso soup at Stingray constituted a notable difference. While both restaurants offer a comparable quantity of fish, the shorter and thicker slices of fish at Stingray facilitate easier manipulation with chopsticks. Additionally, the spaciousness of the bar area, extending profoundly from front to back, allows patrons ample room for their personal belongings and creates a sense of relaxation, without the sensation of being overly intrusive upon the bartender's workspace. The service provided by the staff was adequate and cordial, fostering an atmosphere conducive to a pleasurable dining experience. Based on my positive encounter, I would unquestionably consider revisiting this establishment in the future."

"Prior to attending this particular Cirque du Soleil production, I had yet to experience the captivating nature of their performances, and thus, my anticipation was palpable. Upon entering the auditorium, my initial reaction to our seating arrangement was one of mild disappointment, as our seats were located at quite a distance from the stage. However, my concerns were quickly alleviated, as the elevated position afforded a comprehensive view of the elaborate set design, which bore a striking resemblance to the fictional city of Midgar from the popular role-playing game Final Fantasy VII. The attendants, adorned in attire reminiscent of a fusion between Tim Burton's signature gothic style and the wizarding world of Harry Potter, added to the enchanting ambiance. The show itself was a visual feast, with a dynamic set that incorporated a rotating platform, which moved with mechanical precision in various directions, allowing for an engaging and easily followable narrative. Furthermore, the artistic influence of the production was evident in the stylish clothing available for purchase at the gift shop, which, if I had unlimited financial resources, would have been a welcome addition to my wardrobe."

"China Ginger serves as our preferred eatery for the delectable Lemon Chicken dish, boasting a masterful blend of tenderness and flavor. The poultry is delicately breaded, allowing the natural juiciness of the meat to take center stage, while the lemony sauce provides a delightful accompaniment without overwhelming the palate. The ambiance of the establishment exudes serenity, with soothing melodies playing in the background and an attentive staff who are diligent in their efforts to ensure a comfortable dining experience. Their courteous demeanor and prompt responsiveness to customer inquiries only add to the allure of this venue, making it an optimal setting for a first date or any social engagement where stimulating conversation is desired."

I always get the fish tacos with sweet potato fries. Best in town. I really haven't had better fish tacos anywhere else despite my many failed attempts. They have a decent brunch buffet but you literally won't be able to eat for 3 days, it is an insane amount of food and you get full just looking at it all!

"These exemplary, mass-produced brownies possess an unparalleled quality, boasting a consistently tantalizing texture and moisture level across a diverse array of flavors and styles. The establishment's retail space is rather minimalistic, comprising merely a counter displaying an assortment of delectable brownies. It is not a traditional setting for indulging in elaborate desserts; instead, patrons visit the premises, sample a variety of flavors, and subsequently choose the desired quantity of brownies to purchase. The primary emphasis of this enterprise lies in bulk sales and catering to customers through their thriving mail-order operation."

"The gastronomical experience at this establishment is of superior quality, particularly for special occasions, as it offers a unique and flavorful interpretation of traditional Southwestern cuisine, diverging from the customary Mexican fare. Furthermore, the venue boasts an impressive selection of tequilas and artfully crafted cocktails, contributing to an atmosphere conducive to indulgence and enjoyment."

"Fat Tuesday, a veritable haven for hedonistic indulgence, serves as our de facto destination of choice whenever we find ourselves within the confines of Las Vegas's effervescent city limits. To initiate the day's festivities, we ritualistically partake in the establishment's signature 190 Octane cocktail, augmented by an obligatory shot; a practice that, through trial and error, has led us to adopt the pragmatic approach of opening the cap subsequent to a cup sip, thereby facilitating the uniform blending of the two components. By doing so, we ensure that the climax of our beverage consumption culminates in a delightful surprise, wherein a complete shot materializes as the crowning glory of our libation. The cost, while admittedly steep, proves more than justified in light of the exceptional quality and unwavering reliability of the establishment's offerings, which never fail to provide the requisite impetus for our alcohol-fueled escapades in Sin City."

"Like the majority of delicatessens, Peckhams exerts a peculiar influence on my sensibilities, arousing an acute yearning for its gastronomical offerings whenever I approach its entrance, yet, upon entering the establishment, I frequently experience a sense of disappointment due to the lack of edibles that genuinely appeal to my taste buds or justify the inconvenience of preparation. Notwithstanding this inconsistency, Peckhams remains a ubiquitous chain of delis, boasting an extensive array of locations across regions with relatively low levels of unemployment, featuring an assortment of products such as cous cous, olives, artisanal bread, pastries, and imported alcoholic beverages, thereby conforming to a predictable and familiar template."

We arrived at this establishment last evening due to a promotional offer from restaurant.com, specifically a fifty percent discount on bottles of wine on Mondays; however, upon perusing the minute details of the coupon, it became apparent that the stipulation for its usage was not feasible for us to redeem it. Despite this minor setback, we opted to remain and partake in the culinary delights offered by this eatery. The interior design and ambiance of the restaurant evoked a sense of nostalgia, reminiscent of quaint establishments found along the eastern seaboard of New York, characterized by exposed brick walls and dim lighting, creating a romantic atmosphere conducive to intimate gatherings. Although the tables were positioned in close proximity to one another, the setting remained tolerable and did not compromise our dining experience. It is worth noting that this venue may not be suitable for families with young children, as the menu options and price points cater more towards adult patrons. Our server provided attentive and efficient service, ensuring that our dining experience was pleasant and hassle-free. Both my companion and I ordered the chicken Gorgonzola dish, which we found to be quite satisfying and flavorful. In conclusion, despite the initial disappointment regarding the coupon, we thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would consider returning in the future.

"The recently renovated Mood Lounge, nestled within a former cactus garden in the northern region of KA, boasts an enchanting ambiance, replete with a picturesque clearing surrounded by sparse pine trees. The interior design exudes elegance, offering ample seating options for patrons to unwind and indulge in refreshing beverages. My visit to this establishment, however, was marred by a series of unfortunate events, beginning with a miscommunication between the bartender and a neighboring table, which resulted in a prolonged delay in receiving my order. I was on the verge of departing when, after a grueling 35-minute wait, a Tequila Sunrise finally materialized before me, albeit in a long drink glass. Although the composition of the cocktail seemed appropriate, the barkeep's apparent lack of comprehension of English and the nuances of the Sunrise recipe led to an uninspired concoction, characterized by several ice cubes floating aimlessly in a homogeneous orange mixture. Disappointing, to say the least. Thus, while the location itself merits a perfect five stars, the service and cocktail quality unfortunately earn only a single star in my assessment."

"Indulge in a bygone era of sophistication and luxury with an evening at this quintessential Las Vegas Steakhouse, reminiscent of the fabled Rat Pack era. Savor premium quality steaks, complemented by robust cocktails and exceptional service that exudes a keen understanding of your every desire. On prior occasions, I have had the pleasure of indulging in their delectable bone-in ribeye and filet mignon offerings; however, my personal inclination favors the latter for its unparalleled tenderness and rich flavor profile."

"Upon approaching this refurbished Phoenix establishment, an individual cannot help but be struck by the welcoming and sophisticated ambiance that permeates the space. The intimate bar area, strategically positioned between the culinary domain and the outdoor seating area, offers an idyllic setting in which to savor a meticulously crafted beverage such as the seasonal Great Divide Wild Raspberry Ale, whose subtle amber hues and authentic raspberry essence imbue it with a distinctive character. As a self-proclaimed gourmand with a particular penchant for dairy products, the grilled cheese sandwich, endorsed by multiple staff members and renowned within local foodie circles, proved to be an irresistible choice. When paired with the day's soup special (a rich and creamy cheesy chicken enchilada variety), the resulting flavor profile achieved a truly transcendent level of gastronomic satisfaction."

Went for a tour which was incredibly packed with daycares since it is the summer but the workers handled it lovely. Pay the $10 to make a chocolate pizza, it is worth it. The chocolate is amazing and there is a large selection to choose from!

I have had the privilege of visiting this esteemed veterinary facility on multiple occasions, accompanied by my feline companion, who, despite his diminutive stature, possesses the fierce demeanor and temperament of a tiger. Upon arrival, I was greeted by the friendly and accommodating staff, who exhibited great solicitude towards both myself and my beloved pet. During one particularly memorable visit, Dr. Brown took the time to engage in a thorough and detailed consultation with me, endeavoring to determine whether my cat was suffering from pneumonia or asthma. She presented me with various options and carefully expounded upon both the advantages and disadvantages associated with each potential course of action. Throughout the entire process, I was made to feel entirely at ease, thanks to the staff's considerate and empathetic demeanor. Moreover, they generously provided me with several complimentary samples designed to facilitate my cat's ingestion of medication. My sincere gratitude is extended to the team at Piper Glen Animal Hospital for their efforts in alleviating my anxiety and ensuring the well-being of my furry companion.

"We had the pleasure of partaking in a delectable luncheon at this esteemed establishment on a Tuesday, and while the ambiance was somewhat hectic due to an influx of patrons seeking to satiate their midday cravings, the culinary offerings were undoubtedly exceptional. Although the pace of service was slightly sluggish, likely attributable to the sheer volume of orders that needed to be fulfilled, we found the overall dining experience to be thoroughly enjoyable. In fact, we would unhesitatingly recommend this venue as one of the premier destinations for sushi enthusiasts in Madison, boasting an impressive array of expertly crafted dishes that are sure to delight even the most discerning palates. Furthermore, the setting itself exudes an air of elegance and intimacy, making it an ideal location for a romantic outing or special occasion. Our personal favorite was the salmon with mango, a truly inspired fusion of flavors and textures that left us in a state of gastronomic nirvana. Needless to say, we eagerly anticipate our next visit, when we can indulge in more of their culinary masterpieces."

"The Shark Reef is an ideal location to escape the hustle and bustle of the busy crowds and avid gamblers, offering a unique experience to immerse oneself in an 'underwater' adventure. Having visited the attraction on two separate occasions, I have come to appreciate the diverse array of marine life showcased, including manta rays, octopuses, various species of sharks, and an assortment of fish. Additionally, the presence of a crocodile and other reptiles in the initial exhibits adds to the overall appeal of the aquarium. Located at the southern end of the Las Vegas Strip within Mandalay Bay, the Shark Reef features two walk-through tunnels, providing visitors with an immersive experience. It is worth noting that a member of the staff is stationed at the interactive manta ray exhibit to educate guests on the proper way to interact with these magnificent creatures, as it appears that repetitive guidance is necessary to ensure the safety and well-being of both humans and animals."
Great fast Asian food. Place was packed during lunch. Everything was fresh and flavorful. I like that combos are so cheap and cone with fresh potstickers.

"Mert's proffer an exceptional dining experience, specializing in delectable soul food. Upon visiting the establishment with a companion last week, we observed a brief delay in the presentation of the cornbread, attributed to its freshness and piquant temperature straight from the kitchen. Although not particularly fond of cornbread, the application of butter transforms it into a culinary masterpiece. Our attentive server enthusiastically endorsed the ribs, prompting us to order them accompanied by the yardbird, mac and cheese, and greens. The result was a resounding success, with the ribs boasting a tender, fall-off-the-bone texture, while the yardbird and mac and cheese showcased unparalleled quality. The greens, rich in flavor, ranked among the best sampled in North Carolina. To conclude our meal, we opted for the peach cobbler, which, though satisfactory, did not quite meet expectations, fostering a desire for additional chocolate-based dessert options. Notwithstanding, we would unquestionably return to Mert's for future dining excursions."

"My spouse's parents expressed their gratitude by treating us to a dining experience at this establishment, which has been on my culinary bucket list for quite some time. Upon arrival, we were immediately struck by the breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding landscape, which provided an idyllic backdrop for some pre-dinner photography, particularly during the golden hour. Following a brief descent down the slide, we were seated at a strategically located table that afforded us an unobstructed view of the scenery, much to our delight. We initiated our gastronomical journey by sampling the venue's signature appetizers, specifically the rattlesnake and cactus fries, which, while unconventional, were undoubtedly memorable. However, their uniqueness did not necessarily translate into repeated orders from our party. My companion opted for the barbecue chicken, which garnered high praise, while his parents selected pork chops and prime rib. The piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance, in my humble opinion, was the exceptional cowboy beans, which outshone all others I have had the pleasure of savoring. The satisfaction of our palates was further complemented by the reasonable prices of the beer, served in generously proportioned mason jar pitchers. The crowning touch to our dining experience was the complimentary cotton candy proffered at the conclusion of our repast. This eatery is eminently suitable for family gatherings and offers a well-stocked bar for the enjoyment of adult patrons. If you reside in Phoenix or are merely visiting, it would be remiss of you not to include this culinary gem on your itinerary. Lastly, please extend a warm greeting to Horney the Bull, the establishment's beloved mascot."

This establishment constitutes one of my preferred Italian eateries within the city limits of Las Vegas, as it embodies an antiquated ambiance reminiscent of the bygone era of Las Vegas's storied past, replete with undertones of organized crime, which, despite its campy nature, manages to function remarkably well.

Several salient aspects regarding this culinary destination warrant mentioning prior to delving into its gastronomical offerings. Located south of the famed Las Vegas Strip, this venue primarily caters to local patrons, thus making it a veritable gem for those seeking an authentic experience untainted by the glitz and glamour associated with tourist hotspots. Furthermore, it is advisable to secure a reservation in advance, given the eatery's propensity to attract sizable crowds, and be prepared to expend a sum ranging from $15 to $30 per individual (excluding beverages), as the portions are generous and the quality of the cuisine is consistently high.

On numerous occasions, I have had the pleasure of partaking in the delectable fare served at this establishment, and I must confess that the service has always been exceptional, with both large and small gatherings receiving attentive and proficient attention from the staff.

The difficulty in singling out a specific dish as a recommendation stems from the fact that each item on the menu has consistently impressed my taste buds. However, I feel compelled to steer your attention towards the garlic knots, which, while seemingly unremarkable, transcend the realm of ordinary breadsticks by an order of magnitude. These delectable morsels are capable of eliciting such intense delight that a return visit would be motivated solely by their presence on the menu. Rest assured that the culinary offerings will not disappoint; they are, in point of fact, quite excellent!

This quaint eatery exudes an endearing charm, nestled within the opulent Paris Hotel, boasting an extensive array of ornate confectionaries that tantalize the taste buds with their delectable flavors and meticulous presentations. Patrons can indulge in a diverse selection of savory pastries, expertly brewed coffee, and delectable sandwiches, making it an ideal venue for a leisurely luncheon or a casual afternoon repast while in Las Vegas, without incurring an exorbitant expense. A modest Americano and a Prosciutto sandwich, both served on a crusty baguette, total approximately $11. Additionally, this enchanting establishment offers an assortment of souvenirs in the rear of their shop, including cups, cookbooks, aprons, and other Paris-themed items that contribute to its irresistible appeal.

We procured last-minute tickets during the inaugural weekend of Zarkana, a production that unequivocally upheld the fundamental tenets of Cirque du Soleil, boasting (1) elaborate costumes that could readily serve as the source of envy for any festive gathering come Halloween; (2) remarkable physical feats executed by a dynamic ensemble with unbridled energy; and (3) a narrative thread that, despite one's best efforts to comprehend, ultimately proved to be somewhat perplexing. In summary, a spectacular performance offering a temporary respite from the pecuniary draining effects of casino gaming for a couple of hours.

Besides an array of pungent ovum quips, Eggspectations offers a diverse selection of morning repasts, encompassing eggs benedict, omelets, sugar shack, and various non-ovum-based culinary options, such as hamburgers and pasta. While it cannot be considered a singular venue for brunch, it boasts reasonable prices and a pleasant ambiance. On my most recent visit, I had the pleasure of savoring their Eggs Florentine, which proved to be exceptionally delectable. For further perusal, the menu can be found at the following web address: http://www.eggspectation.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/Menu_MTL_EN.pdf.

"Dined at this establishment on the final evening of my sojourn to Charlotte, and my culinary experience was quite satisfactory, as the fare provided by the kitchen was of considerable quality, and the hospitality extended by the staff was indeed cordial and welcoming; the ambiance of the venue itself was also quite pleasant, boasting an array of televisions for the viewing pleasure of patrons, which happened to be broadcasting a Sunday night football game during my visit. Furthermore, the portions served were generous in size, prompting me to opt for the pulled pork plate designed for a single individual, which was accompanied by two sides of my choosing - macaroni and cheese, as well as fried okra, both of which were delectable and left a lasting impression upon my palate. Notably, the dining area featured numerous booths, contributing to the overall convivial atmosphere of the restaurant."

"A contemporary yet laid-back gastropub that showcases refined British cuisine within a vibrant and welcoming ambiance, complemented by the presentation of global sporting spectacles. The focal point of the eatery consists of an impressive bar adorned with an assortment of beer taps and a backdrop reminiscent of quintessential British telephone booths. 

In the company of a sizable gathering, we relished each and every dish we sampled: enhanced eggs, English ale onion soup, shepherd's pie, a medley of sausages, fish and chips, gastropub burger, butternut squash soup, pork and duck rillettes, beef cheek sandwich, and their delectable roasted jidori chicken. Every offering was meticulously prepared and bursting with flavor, leaving us utterly perplexed as to which dish was the most enjoyable (although it's worth mentioning that both the fish and chips and shepherd's pie were among the finest we've had the pleasure of indulging in to date). 

Furthermore, the prices were reasonable, provided that one possesses the Caesar's rewards card to unlock the more advantageous pricing on the menu. Our server was attentive and courteous, contributing to an overall pleasant experience. We shall undoubtedly return to this establishment in the future."

Still on a quest for the absolute BEST donut, so far, even with my unpleasant drive-thru experience last Thursday (another story for a different day), Arizona Donut Co. in Tempe is at the top of my list.

The ladies here were very friendly, solely what my rating is based off of (even got a free sample of Chai tea w/Boba). The donuts, on the other hand, were JUST ok; they get a whole 2 stars at best.

I tried an old-fashioned glaze and a glaze twist, half of which is sitting in a bag on the counter.  I don't care to taste the oil that the donuts were fried in. Let alone, see it through the dough. Doubt I return for donuts however; there is a slim chance I might try their boba drinks (the guy in line said they're really good here).

Best all you can eat sushi place in town!!! I come here all the time!! Amazing!!! The seared tuna is out of this world!!! If your a local they have a stamp card and after 9 purchases you get one free!!!!
Visiting with my parents and they were pretty indecisive tonight. We ended up at vida and they my parents were super please with the food

"There exist establishments that specialize in the culinary delights of pizza, while others proffer a product that merely resembles this delectable dish (Pizza Hut, Domino's, et al.). Brooklyn V's unquestionably falls within the former categorization, offering authentic pizza that rivals its counterparts in both taste and quality. Upon entering the eatery, we opted to initiate our gastronomic excursion with their signature garlic knots, which proved to be an excellent choice. These tantalizing tidbits boasted a delightful marriage of flavors, with the rich, velvety marinara sauce serving as the perfect accompaniment.
