Subsequently, we elected to sample their 14-inch white pizza, augmenting it with an assortment of toppings including pepperoni, onions, and garlic. The foundation of this dish, the crust, exhibited a remarkable balance of lightness and crunchiness, a truly commendable attribute. However, the pizza itself presented a slight inconsistency in texture, manifesting as a subtle sogginess. Notwithstanding this minor flaw, the overall taste remained satisfying, rendering it a suitable option for those seeking a genuine pizza experience. A consideration of the cost reveals a somewhat elevated price point relative to establishments peddling a similar product. Nonetheless, when factoring in the superior quality of the cuisine, a comparison to eateries serving authentic pizza renders the pricing at Brooklyn V's eminently reasonable."

Upon checking in several hours ago, I was warmly received by an accommodating and hospitable receptionist who provided me with a spacious room located on the first floor. However, I expressed my preference for an alternative accommodation situated on either the second or third floor, to which the receptionist graciously informed me that none were currently available for the present day, but assured me that I would be able to occupy a new room by the following day. I must say, the quality of service I received thus far has been quite satisfactory and I am eager to continually assess and provide updates on the service quality over the course of my stay.

"Folk music revelries ensue with unbridled enthusiasm within the confines of this establishment, as management appears nonplussed by the throngs of patrons who converge upon the premises, culminating in an impromptu ceilidh of sorts. Indeed, this venue has earned its stripes as a veritable Edinburgh institution, attracting an array of talented performers who showcase their musical prowess; suffice it to say, if a folk artist is slated to perform at the nearby Liquid Rooms, rest assured that the ensuing celebration shall transpire here. Alas, Sandy Bells has fallen victim to the constraints of the smoking ban, whereupon the erstwhile ubiquitous cloud of smoke served to mask the pungent aroma that now permeates the atmosphere. Heed my counsel and indulge in a few ales or beers, thereby mitigating the impact of your olfactory sensibilities and allowing you to partake in the merriment unencumbered."

"Zaba's Fresh Mex is an eatery that offers delectable and nutritious options for those seeking a quick bite. My initial visit to this establishment was prompted by a Groupon, which I redeemed over a year ago. However, due to the lack of promotional offers and discounts, it took me an extended period to return and indulge in their fare at full price. Upon my recent visit, I observed that the prices charged by Zaba's are somewhat steep for a fast-food restaurant, with my chicken salad and generously-proportioned shrimp burrito totaling approximately $17. Notwithstanding the cost, both items were impressively sized and satisfying, with my companion and I sharing them and still having leftovers. While the shrimp was cooked to perfection, the chicken had a slightly stale taste, perhaps indicating that it had been stored for an extended period. The assortment of fresh ingredients available for customization, reminiscent of Subway's model, boasts an array of healthy and flavorful options such as sweet potatoes, black beans, fajita mix, and brown rice, with the latter being my personal favorite. In summary, my experience at Zaba's was pleasurable, leaving me feeling content and satisfied, albeit wishing they offered some form of financial incentives or discounts to enhance the overall value proposition for patrons."

"An exceptional dining establishment offering delectable morning repasts, ensuring a perpetual influx of patrons, thereby necessitating a brief waiting period, approximately ten minutes, prior to being seated; however, the culinary delights, including scrumptious scones, both sweet and savory varieties, and quiches, expertly prepared with an assortment of ingredients, readily compensate for the delay. For those desiring solely baked goods, a nearby pastry shop, located a short distance away, offers an array of delectable treats, thus obviating the need to queue. Additionally, innovative dishes such as pigs in a blanket, featuring sausages encased in pancakes, and macaroni and cheese pancakes complemented by andouille sausage, contribute to the eatery's appeal. Furthermore, the speedy eggwich, a straightforward yet satisfying option, caters to customers seeking a simpler breakfast experience. Lastly, the grits served with sausage patties on the side have become my latest culinary infatuation, providing an optimal blend of flavors and textures, leaving me feeling satiated and delighted, with an added bonus of leftovers for future enjoyment."

Growing up, the Greenland Supermarket was a Lucky's, and little bit later an Albertson's. However, just like everything else on Spring Mountain between Rainbow and Decatur, I barely recognize it anymore. Chinatown is getting quite epic. 

This is a review of the food court:

In the Greenland Supermarket food court, there are various culinary establishments that offer an array of international cuisines. Specifically, there is a Hawaiian eatery, a sushi bar, two Korean food stalls, a tofu-based casserole vendor (which I am hesitant to try due to its unappealing description), and a coffee shop that serves Boba but frequently runs out of stock. 

While I wish the Hawaiian restaurant served lumpia and Portuguese donuts, the spam musubi was quite delectable. The sushi bar offers reasonably priced options, with two nigiri available for $1.99, amounting to ten nigiri for $10. Additionally, I decided to venture out and sample Korean cuisine for the first time at this location, merely for the sake of novelty. I had a kim-chee and meat-filled bun, which has a unique flavor profile that requires some acclimation. Although it tastes good initially, the aftertaste is somewhat peculiar. 

In conclusion, my dining experience at this food court was generally satisfying. While I would appreciate a broader range of options (perhaps a Vietnamese booth or additional selections at the Hawaiian eatery), I will undoubtedly return.

"Mmmm!  Yet another update for Sesame Inn!  I was going over to the Byham after work last night for the Richard Thompson concert and I had a considerable amount of time to kill before the show.  I'm talking about two and a half hours here.  So since I was dining alone and I had a preference for Chinese cuisine, I headed up to Station Square for some more Sesame Inn. \n\nMy culinary inclinations aren't particularly adventurous when it comes to Chinese fare.  The egg rolls here are truly exceptional.  The shrimp with pea pods is a commendable selection if one favors the fundamentals.  One unfortunate aspect of Chinese cuisine, besides the fact that it can leave one feeling rather bloated approximately an hour after consumption, is that the servings are often excessively generous.  It would be beneficial if they offered smaller, lunch-sized portions for dinner.  Fortunately, I was able to stop by my office afterwards and store the surplus victuals in my refrigerator.  Leftovers for dinner tonight!"

"This quaint eatery exudes an endearing familial ambiance, reminiscent of a small, homespun establishment lovingly managed by a dedicated matriarch and patriarch. The culinary offerings are undoubtedly fresh, assiduously prepared, and presented with a generous portion size. While my personal preference for chickpea dip inclines towards a more pronounced garlic flavor profile, it would be unjust to censure their rendition, given the need to accommodate diverse palates. The Babajanoush, an Armenian eggplant-based dip, showcases a laudable attention to detail in its preparation, manifesting a velvety texture and a judicious blend of quality ingredients, all suffused with an unmistakable sense of national pride and time-honored domestic techniques. Furthermore, the pita bread, radiating warmth and softness, is served in copious amounts, complementing the dishes without overpowering them. Lastly, the tabbouleh salad embodies a harmonious symphony of flavors and textures, deftly balancing the richness of olive oil, the vibrant freshness of cilantro, the juiciness of tomatoes, and the nutty essence of bulgur, collectively yielding a satisfying and well-rounded gustatory experience."

I have been going to Thrive/Fresche for awhile now and LOVE the bowls!  However I do not enjoy eating there at all, the place smells heavily of bleach or some chemical but is not clean??  Especially all the seating, it is stained and looks very dirty. I understand they can not control customers that make a mess but they really need to take more pride in cleaning promptly and replacing items that get destroyed.  Sitting outside is also a no go as it smells of trash. I am sure there is a dumpster near by that is probably out of their control.  With that said my recommendation would be to get your bowl to go and call ahead to avoid the wait. ENJOY!

"Information: Admission pricing varies according to age group and showtime, with adult evening shows costing $10.00, adult Friday and Saturday shows after 6 pm costing $10.50, child (1-11) and senior (62+) shows costing $7.00, adult matinee shows before 6 pm costing $8.00, and early bird 1st matinee showtime (7 days a week) costing $7.00. This particular cinema is the preferred choice of my parents, despite the proximity of two other theaters to their residence, likely due to factors such as minimal crowding, reasonable pricing, comfortable seating, efficient service, and available discount combos at the concession stand, offering a modest reduction in price ranging from $0.50 to $0.75.

Tips: Consider signing up for the Cinemark weekly email newsletter to receive occasional coupons and promotions. Seniors can enjoy $4 movies on Mondays through Fridays before 4 pm. Additionally, student discounts are available."

"The accommodations offered exceptional value, given the prime location.  The guest quarters were remarkably expansive, and the hospitality of the staff was truly commendable.  Based on recommendations gleaned from tripadvisor.com, we opted for a room in the North tower, purportedly refurbished to a more contemporary standard.  Aesthetically, the bathroom cabinetry exhibited minor cosmetic deterioration, manifested in the form of peeling paint.  Otherwise, our sojourn was utterly enjoyable, and I would not hesitate to consider this establishment for future lodging needs."

"My familiarity with St Leonard's Land is limited to the context of sitting for my first and second year exams within its expansive halls, thereby rendering it a less than ideal location in my personal preferences. However, in comparison to other exam venues, the spacious nature of the building, replete with numerous small staircases leading to secluded gymnasiums and rooms, does confer a certain degree of uniqueness upon it. My experience in the primary hall was particularly noteworthy, as I was struck by its impressive capacity to accommodate a substantial number of tables and chairs simultaneously. In contrast, the smaller gymnasium in which I took my exam the following year, while still possessing a respectable size, exhibited signs of wear and tear, including scuffed floors, outdated decor, and grimy windows. Nevertheless, the presence of strategically positioned curtains served to effectively mitigate any potential echoes, thereby creating an environment conducive to concentration."

"In order to provide an accurate assessment of Stoney N40, it is imperative to consider both aspects of the establishment, namely, the restaurant and bar, as well as the nightclub and dance hall. By doing so, one can arrive at a comprehensive evaluation of the venue. In this case, the food and service merit a rating of four stars, while the club and dance hall component falls short of that standard, garnering a rating of three stars. It is worth mentioning that Stoney N40 boasts a smoke-free environment, which constitutes a significant advantage. Furthermore, when compared to Revolver, Stoney N40 emerges as the preferred choice due to its superior features.

An examination of the positive aspects reveals that the culinary offerings and service at Stoney N40 are truly exceptional. The bartenders have consistently demonstrated a commitment to excellence, ensuring that each dining experience is memorable. Notably, they have accommodated requests for menu modifications with ease. In fact, the quality of the food rivals that of renowned establishments such as Famous Dave's and Mesquite BBQ. Additionally, the welcoming ambiance and attentive service create a distinctly superior experience compared to franchised restaurants. So much so, that Stoney N40 has become a regular destination for us. Any individual who fails to appreciate the delectable cuisine offered here simply lacks familiarity with genuine BBQ flavors. However, it is essential for Stoney N40 to increase its promotional efforts to reach a broader audience.

Regrettably, the nightclub and dance hall segment of Stoney N40 falls short of expectations. In direct competition with Revolver, Stoney N40 has adopted a questionable strategy of interspersing club music with country tunes. The result is a disjointed atmosphere that fails to resonate with this writer. Unfortunately, this approach attracts a diverse clientele, comprising both country enthusiasts and fans of contemporary pop culture. While the patrons generally coexist harmoniously, the incongruous musical selection detracts significantly from the overall experience. To enhance the appeal of the establishment, the installation of gaming machines at the bar would be a judicious move, potentially drawing in additional patrons and boosting revenue. Such a change could enable Stoney N40 to refocus on its core strengths and reclaim its rightful status as a preeminent country bar."

Wary of a place where I can order alfredo pasta, burgers, carne asada burritos, and cheesecake from the same place - was this to be a jack of all trades and master of none?

Kudos on the burgers being cooked to order, where you can specify from rare to well-done. I'm a medium-rare and he's a medium, and they were accurately cooked.

The burger meat was a little bland, and it seems like they use a frozen beef patty based on the shape. They offer a lot of ways to dress it up to make up for this. We got a fried egg on one, and sauteed mushrooms on the other.

Veggies were crisp, bun was buttered and soft. 

Fries were salty and tasted best when completely coated in ketchup. 

Pickle was dill-icious, which is a joke I'm pretty sure has never been told before.

My guy's fruit punch was completely watered down by the time it arrived. I would recommend getting all drinks no ice and adding ice when you're ready to enjoy the drinks.

Also, ordered an iced coffee. Standard, passable coffee. Pretty cool that it's delivered.

Bottom line: Menu is expansive. Burger and fries were average. Delivery is fairly priced and quick.

I love the Original Pancake House, but I always hated going to the SouthPark location because it's always insanely busy, usually has a long wait and the tables are incredibly close together.  This location is much more comfortable and has a little more room to sprawl.  We got there around 8:30 on a Sunday morning and left just as it was starting to get busy.  Delicious pancakes, cheery atmosphere and quick service gets my vote every time!

"Ambient interior and delectable cuisine. Visited during the initial week, securing a first-come, first-served table in the bar area. No gluten-free options were available on the menu; however, the staff accommodated our dietary requirements by presenting an inventive and scrumptious alternative. Anticipating a return visit to experience the evolution of the menu and the resolution of any minor launch difficulties. In conclusion, highly recommend this establishment, but it is advisable to book a reservation in advance or arrive promptly for a walk-in table."

"Indubitably, the most exceptional smorgasbord I have had the pleasure of indulging in, boasting an extensive array of culinary options that catered to my palate's every whim. The delectable fare not only tantalized my taste buds but also satiated my hunger, rendering it an unparalleled gastronomic experience. To fully appreciate the diverse offerings, it is imperative to arrive with a healthy appetite, allowing one to sample a modicum of each dish. Although the prices may be slightly elevated, the quality of the cuisine renders it a worthwhile investment for those seeking a truly satisfying repast."

"Aria boasts an innovative culinary hotspot that exudes an ambiance of sophisticated elegance, complemented by a fastidious attention to detail in its gastronomic offerings and an erudite approach to customer service. This establishment has had the privilege of hosting yours truly on multiple occasions, and each visit has consistently presented an opportunity to immerse oneself in an atmosphere characterized by a convivial assemblage of discerning patrons and an unwavering commitment to creating a welcoming environment ideal for prefacing a nocturnal excursion to a nightclub or theatrical performance. It is my fervent recommendation that you acquaint yourself with John Venegas, an individual possessing an unparalleled proficiency in cultivating a rapport with clientele that is at once both warmly personable and uncompromisingly professional."

"Indulged in a culinary experience featuring a dairy-based pie today, and my gastronomical expectations were thoroughly satiated by the delectable fare provided by this esteemed eatery. The gustatory sensations elicited by the artisanal pizza were complemented by the hospitable and efficient manner in which it was served, thereby creating a veritable epicurean delight that I would unhesitatingly recommend to any individual harboring a yearning for a scrumptious pizza. Furthermore, the salads proffered by this gastronomic establishment were likewise impressive in their flavorful composition and generous portioning, thus further substantiating the merits of this venue as a prime destination for discerning diners."

What a fun place to spend the night! Sure drinks are expensive but the people are super awesome and friendly here! I wanted to have some fun on a Friday night and stopped by here because it looked like a fun time and I wasn't disappointed. 

The inside is pretty small and there's lots of people crammed in so it ends up being pretty hot which is even worse when you're dancing. I walked up to one of the bars and told the bartender to surprise me. I ended up with something called an electric lemonade which was delicious! It took a little bit to get the bartender's attention but they were really busy so I can't really blame him, and a group of people pulled me into their conversation while I was waiting so I didn't even notice. I've been in clubs/bars before but I've never had so many people walk up to me and just strike up random conversations, I even got invited onto the balcony with the fire pit which was reserved for a private party and was told to take advantage of the bottle service while I was there. Hurray for Grey Goose and Red Bull!

Kazba thanks for showing me a fun time. Between the friendly people(Even the bouncers are cool!), awesome DJ, and cool cocktails I'm impressed.

The phenomenal assemblage of acts, featuring individuals who execute feats that are utterly awe-inspiring, left me in a state of utter bewilderment, as my cognitive faculties struggled to comprehend the intricacies of the narrative being unfolded before my very eyes. Despite my inability to fully appreciate the intricate nuances of the plot, I was able to grasp the fundamental essence of the production, which served as the primary draw for my attendance. In conclusion, I must say that the overall experience was indeed gratifying.

"A delightful, secluded gem nestled on the northern periphery of the city, evoking a sense of nostalgia reminiscent of the cinematic masterpiece 'Swingers.' A diverse array of potent potables, each with an island-inspired moniker, graces the menu. While video poker and slot machines are available at the bar, complimentary beverages are only extended to those who invest a minimum of $20 and wager the maximum number of credits. An antiquated jukebox, stocked with vintage tunes, adds to the ambiance. To optimize your experience, arrive promptly and secure a seat at the bar or in the rear of the lounge, as the central tables are somewhat uncomfortable and resemble children's play furniture. The bartenders exhibit warmth and proficiency in their service, fostering an atmosphere conducive to a pleasurable encounter. I eagerly anticipate my next visit to this enchanting establishment."

Food: Amazing... had the bone in Rib eye... ridiculously good!
Price: expensive, but it IS Vegas.  That's why I give it 4 stars.
Ambiance: nice, but not overly done.
Service: waiters and staff were superb! 

Overall: I highly recommend it if you're looking for an amazing steak and don't mind paying a premium.

"A secluded, unpretentious sushi establishment offering an all-you-can-eat option at a reasonable tariff, with a caveat that restricts patrons to a solitary serving of uni and amaebi each, as well as a single portion of toro when available. Despite its arid surroundings, this eatery boasts impressive tempura and fresh seafood, making it a worthwhile destination for gastronomes seeking a culinary experience that surpasses their expectations."

This is our go to place for Chinese food everytime we go to the airport.  The first time we went the service was terrible, but the great food brought us back.  

We visited the Palace again last night and it was 100% better.  We had a gentlemen as our server and he was humorous and very tentative to our party's needs.  We ordered our food and 5 minutes later we had all four dishes in front of us (fresh and not pre-made).  My personal favorite is Szechwan chicken.  However, everything we had was great.  The food is very good quality Chinese food and it isn't overly greasy.  I love Chinese food, but it doesn't always love me back (if you know what i mean)!   The ambiance is very nice and the noise level is very tolerable. 

When you check-in using the yelp app it says you will receive a free dessert - but they don't honor it for some reason.

We enjoyed the grand opening at the Summerlin location. The place looks great and the staff was great. We enjoyed the evening and almost everything. However, the bar-be-que shrimp was a disappointment. Four medium out of shell overcooked shrimp with hard rice. Lets do this classic dish correctly. Use large in shell shrimp and rethink the sauce. Missing the garlic.

"I have a penchant for this particular establishment due to its proximity to my domicile and its extensive selection of high-quality beverages, specifically beer. However, I must admit that the service here can be somewhat inconsistent and, on occasion, disappointing."

"Upon culminating a quest to identify an edible establishment that offers delivery services, I chanced upon this eatery and decided to partake in their gastronomical offerings. Following a fifty-minute wait, which seemed interminable due to my advanced state of pregnancy, I relished the delectable flavors of the California club sandwich, accompanied by a rich, velvety gooey ball. The former dish proved to be an unmitigated success, while the latter indulgence elicited such unbridled enthusiasm that I felt compelled to savor each morsel in silence, precluding any possibility of sharing it with my six-year-old offspring until she became cognizant of my possession of a sweet treat. The quality of the victuals was such that I envision repeated visits to satiate my cravings for the aforementioned gooey delight. Although I cannot comment on the ambiance of the restaurant proper, the efficiency of the delivery service during peak hours left much to be desired. Nonetheless, my inaugural experience with this establishment has kindled a desire for future patronage."

"I possess a profound fondness for Lai Lai's culinary offerings, however, my significant other does not share my enthusiasm, citing an absence of piquancy despite her request for an additional quantity of red chili oil, which she deems insufficient. My personal taste preferences do not lean towards fiery sensations, which likely contributes to my appreciation for this establishment, as their sweet sauce is truly delectable. \n\nTheir noodles are unparalleled in quality compared to any other Mongolian restaurant in the Valley, and the staff member responsible for serving patrons exhibits exceptional kindness and a welcoming demeanor, creating the illusion that she recognizes me on each visit. Unfortunately, the pineapple portions they serve are excessively generous, making it arduous to locate satisfactory pineapple dishes in Phoenix. Furthermore, the prices charged at Lai Lai's are somewhat steep, and they have adopted a strict policy regarding leftovers, only permitting to-go orders to be priced based on the weight of the food."

A luxurious lodging establishment, characterized by an elevated level of refinement and sophistication, boasting superior quality dining establishments, accommodations, service, and other amenities, yet, regrettably, they have a tendency to engage in exorbitant pricing practices, capitalizing on their guests' financial resources to the utmost extent possible.

The standard guest rooms, while marginally more sumptuous than those found at a typical four-star hotel located along the Las Vegas Strip, are essentially comparable in terms of dimensions, rendering them unsuitable for accommodating large groups of individuals; therefore, it would be more practical and cost-effective to reserve a suite at a less prestigious hotel, if you intend to host numerous guests.

Notwithstanding, this opulent hotel offers a plethora of opportunities for indulging in extravagant expenditures, providing an optimal environment for those who possess the financial means to indulge in lavish spending.

"An exceptional eatery that offers an optimal environment for indulging in delectable dumplings. The venue's diminutive size, accommodating up to five individuals, fosters an intimate ambiance conducive to relishing flavorsome fare. Upon entering, patrons may experience a brief delay due to the establishment's popularity, yet the cordial staff expedites orders with remarkable efficiency. The menu presents a straightforward selection, ranging from $5 to $9 for fifteen dumplings, and salads priced at a mere $1 to $1.50. Following the recommendation of the affable server, I sampled the wasabi salad, which delighted my taste buds with its piquant zest. Subsequently, I indulged in beef and onion dumplings, shrimp, pork, and coriander dumplings, with the latter emerging as the most scrumptious variant I have had the pleasure of consuming. The brief waiting period, approximating five to ten minutes, merely heightened my anticipation for the culinary delights to follow. Unquestionably, this restaurant merits a return visit, as it serves genuine dumplings, unaccompanied by extraneous options such as fried rice or sushi found at other establishments. This review aims to provide valuable insight; feedback regarding its helpfulness would be greatly appreciated."

"My captivation with this exhibition is unequivocal, as the meticulously arranged human remains, coupled with the various bodily systems, serve as a pinnacle of edification. As an individual whose aversion to scientific disciplines was pronounced during their academic tenure, I find this manifestation of science to be simultaneously engaging and enlightening. 

The unobstructed visibility of the arterial and venous networks, juxtaposed against the partial dissolution of the remaining tissue, is nothing short of extraordinary. Such an exemplary presentation profoundly enhances one's comprehension of the intricate interconnectedness of these complex biological structures. 

I would enthusiastically endorse this exhibit to any and all interested parties. Furthermore, in light of MGM Resorts' temporary promotion, whereby three attractions can be experienced for the sum of $54, the opportunity to incorporate both this exhibit and the CSI Experience at the MGM Grand into a single visit, thereby maximizing one's exposure to diverse forms of cognitive stimulation while minimizing financial expenditure, is indeed a most advantageous proposition."

The Orleans Hotel consistently get s high ratings in Las Vegas as the best hotel for your dollar value.
I would totally agree.
The rooms are large and comfortable.
The pool is nice and provides an equal balance of sun and shade.
They have some good bars, good places to eat.
The hotel just opened a TGI Fridays and it is generally packed.
They have a bowling center and 18 theater complex on the upper floors.
You can always sneak into an extra feature if you are so inclined.
I usually am inclined to do so ......

I have stayed at the Orleans for their slot tournament during the past two years.....
99 dollars for three nights and entry into the tournament.
Right now I am 0 for 4 in winning anything !!
But I'll try again in July ....

The only drawback I can find about this hotel and casino is that it is off the strip on Tropicana Ave.
However, the Seamless Gentlemans club is just across the street.

You can do a lot worse in Vegas than the Orleans
Especially when you factor in what you are paying to stay there ....

While I may not be an ardent devotee of Mexican cuisine, my spouse is, and thus, I find myself evaluating this establishment, as she regularly dispatches me to this particular neighborhood. During our visit in June, she indulged in their offerings twice within the same week, and I have returned thereon multiple occasions subsequent to our relocation. Her preference is the Burrito enchilada style, accompanied by green sauce and a medley of rice and beans. Allow me to assure you that upon procurement of this culinary delight, the food is contained in a vessel that maintains its thermal properties for a minimum of three hoursâand I stress, people, it remains piping hot. The menu boasts merely five options, which I shall post forthwith, and you shall observe that the cost of this authentic Mexican fare is indeed considerable. Notwithstanding, this local haunt attracts a diverse clientele who convene daily for luncheon. It is worth mentioning that the establishment operates until approximately 4 pm, at which point it becomes uninhabitedâa phenomenon I found quite amusing. Thus, if one is willing to venture into this specific neighborhood in pursuit of genuine Mexican cuisine, they shall discover that the expenditure of eight dollars shall provide them with an unparalleled gastronomical experience, according to my spouse's esteemed opinion. Bon appÃ©tit, my associates!

"My excitement knew no bounds upon arriving at this establishment, as I had been eagerly anticipating the indulgence in their delectable offerings for quite some time. The velvety texture and rich flavor profile of the custard did not disappoint, earning it a well-deserved perfect score of five. However, my enthusiasm was somewhat tempered by my lukewarm reception of the icee, which failed to resonate with my taste buds in the same manner as its creamy counterpart. Despite this minor setback, I remained determined to sample a variety of flavors, including lemon, lime, cherry, chocolate chip, strawberry-mango, and cucumber melon. Upon doing so, I discovered that the latter two options were the most palatable to my sensibilities, thereby solidifying my conviction that a successful visit can be assured if one adheres to the practice of judicious flavor selection."

Love this place! Only reasons it's getting 4 stars instead of 5: the calamari appetizer was very small, maybe 7 or 8 rings, and they don't have soda water. Otherwise the place is a great value. Nice atmosphere, friendly and attentive service and super tasty hibachi dinner for the price of lunch? Yes please!

My boyfriend has a timeshare here so we stayed in a one bedroom suite.  It was my first time in Vegas and I liked that this hotel was off the strip.  They do not have a casino but I do not gamble.  I know what you are thinking...why come to Vegas and not gamble?  I decided to visit Vegas for the ambiance.  This hotel was perfect for that.  Our one bedroom suite was comfortable and it had a living room area with a large flat screen TV,  a large kitchen with a microwave and refrigerator, and a huge bathroom.  We also had a nice view of Las Vegas.  I recommend this hotel if you are not a party animal and just want to take in the sights.

"My maiden encounter at this establishment was admittedly unpleasant, but subsequent interactions have led me to recognize the exceptional quality of service and cuisine offered by this organization. Following an initial disappointment, we were pampered with lavish hospitality during our subsequent visit, indulging in an exquisite culinary experience that rivals any other Mexican fare I have had the pleasure of sampling. While the prices may be perceived as somewhat elevated, it is important to acknowledge that the cost is commensurate with the superior quality of the dishes served, and thus, it is reasonable to expect such pricing in a free market economy."

"Upon entering the establishment, I observed that the inventory of cupcake flavors appeared to be somewhat depleted, which, given the proximity to the closing time, did not come as a surprise. However, I was promptly reassured by the friendly staff that, despite their absence from the display case, a plethora of flavors (specifically, those denoted by a small circular symbol adjacent to their name on the menu) remained readily available in the kitchen, and could be quickly prepared upon request. Thus, the perceived shortage was effectively mitigated, much to my delight. Furthermore, my visit was further enhanced by the generous offer of a complimentary red velvet cupcake, contingent upon my mentioning a specific phrase,'sugar rush,' which I discovered through following the shop's official Twitter account (@sprinklescupcks). Additionally, I must commend the bakery on its charming website design and commitment to offering seasonal flavors tailored to various holidays and celebrations throughout the year, including Passover, Cinco de Mayo, and Mother's Day this month. In fact, I am eagerly anticipating a return visit this weekend to indulge in their delectable Key Lime cupcakes."

We thoroughly enjoyed our luncheon at this establishment, and our culinary experiences were nothing short of exceptional. Our party relished their respective dishes, but the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance was undoubtedly the delectable dessert we shared. Specifically, the gargantuan layered chocolate cake with its remarkably moist texture left us all in a state of utter amazement. However, it was the sublime frosting that truly elevated our taste buds to new heights; it was akin to savoring the richness of fudge from Disney World or Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory, both renowned for their mastery of all things chocolate. Such an indulgence was almost too fantastic to believe, leading me to question my own memory at times, wondering whether such a delightful encounter could possibly have been mere fantasy. Nonetheless, I assure you, dear reader, that this eatery is genuinely worthy of your patronage, boasting a truly impressive array of culinary delights.

So surprised how great the service is at a fast food kinda joint. The place is nice and roomy and well decorated. Lots of stuff on the wall to read while you waiting on your food. And the Caniac, YUM! Perfect amount. Something about their dipping sauce... its good stuff.

The sweet tea is too sweet for my taste, so I mix it with half unsweetened tea. Then I heard about the lemonade and wow, it was delish! Even when all the ice melted, well, while it was still cold, it was good.

You better believe I will be back all the time :) And they got a drive thru.. perfect!

"The aforementioned retail establishment serves as the focal point of my unwavering dedication, evoking nostalgic memories of my formative years, during which I frequently visited said premises in the company of my peers, indulging in leisurely activities such as perusing novel merchandise and consuming refreshing beverages. This particular branch, having remained operational for an extended period, boasts an impressive array of amenities, including an expansive parking area, numerous shopping options, and a dedicated eatery, albeit lacking a certain renowned coffee franchise, as previously alluded to by another patron. While it does not qualify as a comprehensive grocery store, it does offer a limited selection of edibles and refrigerated items for convenience. Furthermore, its setting within the Silverado Ranch community contributes to its reputation as a secure and well-maintained shopping destination, in contrast to certain other retail chains."

We had a phenomenal experience at this esteemed eatery, characterized by exceptional service proffered by a delightful waitress who exhibited a profound knowledge of the menu and its intricacies, which greatly enhanced our culinary journey. My filet was cooked to perfection, boasting a tender texture and a delightful medium-rare consistency that was complemented by the delectable dressing of the accompanying greens. My spouse had the pleasure of indulging in the beer-brined chicken wings, which were expertly paired with an avocado sauce and a Caesar salad, resulting in a gustatory symphony that elicited effusive praise from him, particularly regarding the crispy pig's ear crackles that graced the salad, elevating it to a pinnacle of flavor and texture. However, our satisfaction was slightly marred by the roasted cauliflower side dish, which, unfortunately, did not live up to our expectations due to its lack of warmth and divergence from the description on the menu. Nevertheless, we were impressed by the whimsical decor adorning the restrooms, which contributed to the overall convivial ambiance of the dining area, further enhanced by the thoughtful gesture of providing warm towels after the meal, a subtle yet effective touch that reinforced our sense of well-being and contentment.

"The salmon offerings at this sushi establishment are utterly delectable and tantalizing, boasting an unparalleled quality that is simply TO DIE FOR. The Salmon Kama, Salmon sashimi, and I Love Salmon Roll are all sublime creations that will indulge your taste buds in a symphony of flavors and textures. The kama, with its satisfying crunch on the exterior and luscious, velvety interior, is a true gastronomic masterpiece. The divine sashimi, with its melt-in-your-mouth tenderness, is a culinary experience like no other. And the salmon rolls, for those who crave a more traditional sushi experience, are also quite palatable. However, it must be noted that the non-salmon sushi options at this establishment fall somewhat short of the mark, with the seaweed salad lacking a certain je ne sais quoi in terms of seasoning. Nevertheless, any dish that has been subjected to the culinary wizardry of frying is bound to please even the most discerning palate, with the soft shell crab and tempura being prime examples of this. Furthermore, patrons can enjoy an all-you-can-eat option for the reasonable sum of $20, with the added bonus of half-off happy hour specials available during most hours of the day. Additionally, this establishment has listings on restaurant.com, providing further incentive for gourmands to partake in the epicurean delights offered here."

"Indubitably, my visual perception was confronted with an unanticipated exposure of an individual's posterior region protruding from their athletic attire, which was devoid of any underlying garments, ostensibly due to an oversight in their laundry routine; however, such unexpected occurrences are inherently assimilated into the realm of adventure. 

My personal aversion towards operating a motor vehicle within urban areas (indeed, I harbor a profound dislike for driving in general) renders this alternative mode of transportation an utterly delightful experience. The vehicles were spotless, and our waiting time for a cart was brief and infrequent, as they arrived with remarkable regularity. Throughout our excursion, we did not encounter any difficulties or interruptions, and it is worth mentioning that the tram halted merely thrice, at most, during our entire journey, which spanned from the concluding portion of the track in Mesa and back to the central district of Phoenix. Furthermore, we availed ourselves of the opportunity to embark and disembark from the tram on three separate occasions, without witnessing any authorized personnel engaged in ticket inspections, even when the vehicle was filled to capacity with standing passengers. 

My anticipation is heightened in eager expectation of the forthcoming month, when this transportation system will operate until the late hours of 2 am, thereby enabling us to explore and experience an array of establishments and locales within both downtown Phoenix and the central district of the city, with unrestricted freedom and convenience."

"My culinary excursion to this esteemed eatery occurred on a previous occasion, specifically for the purpose of partaking in their midday repast, and I must say that my expectations were not only met but indeed surpassed, particularly with regards to their chopped salad, which garnered such effusive praise from various patrons that I felt compelled to sample it for myself, and I must confess that it was truly a gastronomic masterpiece, possessing the qualities of an upscale public house, albeit at a cost that could be deemed somewhat prohibitive; nonetheless, I would unhesitatingly return to indulge in this delectable salad."

I have an equal fondness for this location, or perhaps a marginal preference for it over the Los Feliz venue. The musical offerings on the jukebox were quite satisfactory, and indeed superior to the sonic ambiance that permeated the atmosphere of the Beauty Bar on the adjacent premises. On weekend evenings, specifically Fridays and Saturdays, a convivial throng would congregate, yet I was able to secure a snug seating arrangement, albeit in close proximity to an amorous couple whose intimate activities were tantamount to engaging in sexual intercourse on the furniture. Despite my discomfort, I couldn't help but be mildly diverted by the young man's ingratiating gestures.

I found myself woefully unprepared for the opulent environment I was about to enter, clad in attire that was glaringly inappropriate for the refined atmosphere that awaited me. My preconceived notions of a quaint, bucolic setting were promptly dispelled by the sleek, modern edifice that housed the Wine Loft, its exterior offering no hint of the sophisticated charm that lay within. Upon crossing the threshold, I was struck by an overwhelming sense of awe, the sumptuous decor eliciting a spontaneous exclamation of surprise from my lips.

The interior design, characterized by rich, dark hues and masculine undertones, was complemented by contemporary furnishings in black, creating an enveloping ambiance that fostered an air of intimacy and romance. Subdued lighting further contributed to the alluring environment, inviting patrons to indulge in a glass of fine wine while basking in the seductive atmosphere, ideal for making a lasting impression on a prospective paramour or simply savoring the melodic accompaniment. Understated yet mature, the Wine Loft's essence was an intoxicating blend of elegance and sensuality.

Holy Yummy!!' The Wagu Beef Sliders were out of this world! The pork belly was so good as were the mashed potatoes and our Filef. The atmosphere was super cool, the music was AWESOME!!! The only reason I didn't give it a 5 was because our server was super terrific but the assistant servers were a little weird...other than that, great great time and a must go if you are in Vegas!

The restaurant has great food and tons of sweet desserts to choose from.  If you are staying at Paris Casino, this is a good alternative option for breakfast or lunch.  The candy store that is connected to the restaurant is a typical candy store with little sweet treats everywhere.  If you are a Total Rewards members for the Harrah's casinos, you can use your comp points in both the restaurant and the candy store.

"Pho Da Lat presented itself as an optimal venue for an unplanned luncheon excursion on a Saturday afternoon, given the serendipitous confluence of having an hour or so to kill with a companion and the relatively sparse patronage at 2 pm, thereby affording us an opportunity to indulge in a leisurely culinary experience without the burden of an excessive wait or the need to rush through our meal. Upon entering the establishment, we were promptly escorted to a table and furnished with menus, allowing us sufficient time to peruse the offerings and formulate any queries we might have had in our minds prior to placing our orders. When we ultimately opted to sample the quail appetizer and individually interrogate the menu for our primary selections, the staff responded by proffering samples of the dishes in question, an accommodation that struck me as particularly considerate. My fellow diner and I engaged in a colloquy regarding the relative merits of the various spicy, flavorful options, which culminated in my decision to partake of the lemongrass chili chicken, as it was recommended by our server. Unfortunately, our food arrived and our initial course was inadvertently overlooked, although the portions proved to be generous and satisfying, precluding the necessity of completing the entirety of the meal. The seasoning achieved a satisfactory balance of piquancy, and both my companion and I appeared to derive pleasure from our repast at Pho Da Lat. Suffice it to say, I harbor an eagerness to revisit this eatery, as several dishes pique my curiosity and warrant further exploration, a sentiment that bodes well for a high rating and future return visits; furthermore, the prospect of sampling the extensive selection of 40+ wines advertised by the establishment only serves to heighten my anticipation."

"What you say? A hot pot all for myself? Yeah! 

I had the lamb hot pot and my partner had the beef hot pot ($9.99 each). The lamb broth had a tangy, acetic flavor profile, which I rather enjoyed, while the beef broth possessed a rich, savory essence. Both came with an assortment of ingredients including tofu, crab sticks, tofu skin, mushrooms, a fish ball (containing pork), bok choy, carrots, tomatoes (which contributed to an optimal broth flavor), and their respective meats (thinly sliced). We supplemented our order with fish balls ($1.50) and noodles ($1.50), splitting them equitably between us, as well as selecting a spicy level of four. 

The broths exhibited remarkable flavor and depth, allowing us to regulate the intensity of heat by adjusting the flame beneath, if desired. 

As first-time patrons, we received assistance from the proprietor, who graciously explained the process and offered useful guidance, much to our appreciation. She also demonstrated the various sauces available and even offered to create a unique blend for us. Intrigued, I opted for a mixture of green onion, cilantro, and garlic oil, while my partner favored a combination of garlic oil and Chinese BBQ sauce. 

Tip: To avoid discomfort, it's advisable to remove the cooked ingredients from the pot and allow them to cool slightly before consuming. 

Although we regret not visiting sooner, we are now eager to return and explore more of their offerings, including the skewers they provide."

I really like this Olive Garden location so close to home for me.  After a very disappointing experience at a different location (see my review of the Olive Garden on Centennial), I came here and received the best service.  I was seated right away.  My drink came out right away.  My soup came out fast and hot.  The Chicken Marsala was delicious and perfectly cooked.  I ordered a dessert to go which my server comped after hearing about my woes at the other location.  I told her that was very unneccessary and I mean that most sincerely.  I would have had no issues paying for my dessert but it was nice of her to care.  This is certainly my go to OG.

"Sunday brunch at 3 pm! Indeed, I am an ardent devotee of such gastronomical indulgences! If only this culinary haven was not tucked away in a secluded corner of a building in Civic Center, I would have had the pleasure of discovering it much earlier! As fate would have it, we arrived fashionably late for a leisurely breakfast, and we savored each delectable morsel of our repast! 

-Freshly squeezed orange juice - indeed, not from a bottle or a can, the unadulterated flavor is palpable, thus necessitating a copious glass! (The medium size, reminiscent of the water glass that graces your table, is a suitable alternative.) 

-Original French Toast - a culinary masterpiece! The simplicity of this dish belies its profound appeal, satiating my hunger without extraneous embellishments. 

-Banana Nut Pancakes - my personal favorite! These fluffy, golden pancakes harbored fragments of succulent bananas and crunchy pecans, all tantalizingly enrobed in a rich maple syrup glaze. In an inspired pairing, I complemented my pancakes with a seared/fried (?) prosciutto, marrying salty and sweet flavors in a delightful harmony! Might I be able to partake in this gustatory nirvana once more tomorrow? 

-Soup of the day - Chili - verily, this steaming cup of chili possessed a spirited zest! 

The hospitality we received was of the highest quality, as our server graciously refrained from hurrying us, despite our tardy arrival mere hours before their 4 pm closing time. My only quibble lay in the omission of a caveat regarding the generous portion sizes. Both the French Toast and Pancakes presented formidable platters, capable of satiating even the most voracious appetites. Thus, I implore future patrons to consider sharing their plates, lest they risk being overwhelmed by the bountiful offerings."

"Burgers of considerable quality!  This establishment boasts a unique concept of 'custom-built' burgers, wherein patrons are afforded the opportunity to select each component of their burger, ranging from the type of meat, bun, cheese, toppings, and sauce, thereby allowing them to create a culinary masterpiece tailored to their precise preferences.  Furthermore, the prices charged for these delectable burgers, while somewhat elevated, are commensurate with the superior quality of the ingredients employed in their preparation, thus making them worthwhile for those seeking a satisfying dining experience that transcends the mundane fast-food fare commonly found elsewhere.  It is unfortunate, however, that the cost of indulging in such gastronomic delights can be somewhat prohibitive, as the total expense for a meal for two, inclusive of two burgers, a shared small fry, and beverages, can exceed $20, which may be perceived as excessive by some individuals.  Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the ability to craft distinctive and flavorful burger combinations that are unavailable at other establishments renders this eatery an appealing destination for those seeking a memorable dining experience.  Indeed, the quality of the food and the novelty of the concept justify the cost, and I would unhesitatingly revisit this establishment in the future, were I to find myself in the vicinity.  Moreover, I wish such establishments were more widespread, as their absence in certain regions limits the opportunities for culinary exploration and enjoyment."

I love firebirds and eat here often, they have one of the best hamburgers around if you are willing to pay the $$ also addicted to their house salad... great specials during the week and the bar area is a nice place to relax, especially when its cold and the fireplace is going.

"I elected to halt my culinary excursion at this establishment, primarily due to the fact that the ambiance appeared to be congenial and welcoming, and I must say that my expectations were not only met but indeed surpassed, as the staff proffered their services with alacrity and affability, and the comestibles presented themselves as being freshly prepared and devoid of excessive oiliness, thereby leading me to experience a state of satisfaction which rendered me inclined to revisit this venue in the future."

I had bought a early 90s 4runner on the cheap, knowing it needed some work.  Among other things, it had one hell of an exhaust leak from the rusted out cat.  Advance was able to weld in a replacement that fit my budget and did the work while I waited.  They're my go-to for all things exhaust related now.

I have driven by this location numerous times and would try to remind myself to go there when out with friends, but just never seemed to get around to it...until last week!  This location serves up the same great food as the other locations, but isn't as busy.  I will definitely come back.  

If you are looking for the atmosphere of the one on Central, you won't find it.  It's more like the one in Mesa, but even toned down a bit compared to that one.

Go for the food!!!  The service was great and everyone is just as friendly so what are you waiting for?  Get in there and eat some food!

"Like the majority of culinary offerings within this particular urban setting, I would categorize it as 'Pittsburgh good,' a qualitative assessment that acknowledges its relatively superior quality within the local gastronomic landscape, while recognizing that it may not necessarily meet the elevated standards of more discerning consumers in other cities. However, it is worth noting that the pho served at this establishment is, in fact, the most satisfactory in town, a distinction that, while perhaps not constituting effusive praise, remains noteworthy in light of the generally mediocre quality of similar dishes available elsewhere in Pittsburgh. It is also relevant to mention that my exposure to other pho places within the city has been limited to only two instances, both of which were regrettably subpar, thereby rendering my endorsement of this particular eatery somewhat relative to my admittedly meager frame of reference."

Guess what?  I'm a guy and I can sew a button back on and sew a small, albeit ugly, patch on torn fabric.  But that's it, I cant needlepoint or anything.

I had a few items to be repaired and one item to get hemmed. Good prices, $5 per repair, and $10 for the hemming.

Very nice work done by a couple of friendly ladies.

"Papa Murphys is unequivocally my preferred chain pizza establishment in Las Vegas, boasting an unparalleled quality of culinary excellence. The DeLite crust, with its remarkable ability to reheat, is unquestionably the superior choice, particularly when compared to the thicker, more conventional crust options. Upon entering the establishment, customers are presented with a diverse array of toppings from which to select, all of which are consistently fresh and flavorful. The sauce, too, is a highlight, possessing a rich, tangy flavor that complements the assortment of toppings admirably. To maximize your dining experience, I recommend perusing their website for any available coupons prior to visiting, as they frequently offer special promotions, including discounts on the coveted DeLite crust. Although calling ahead to place your order is an option, it is worth noting that the wait time is typically quite brief, making it unnecessary to do so. Unfortunately, the primary drawback to this otherwise exceptional eatery is their occasional lack of certain ingredients, such as the DeLite crust itself, bacon, and various other toppings. However, if you are seeking a delicious, affordable pizza that you can prepare yourself, Papa Murphys remains an excellent choice."

"Feeling an unwavering inclination towards culinary exploration on a Saturday morning, I opted to diverge from my customary route to the market and experience something novel by visiting Chez Boris, a venue that had piqued my curiosity throughout the summer months. Located within Montreal's vibrant Mile End district, specifically on Park Avenue between Laurier and Fairmount, this eatery specializes in delectable doughnuts, offering them at a reasonable price of 75 cents apiece. Upon entering the establishment, I was immediately struck by the diverse array of coatings available for their freshly prepared, made-to-order doughnuts. Opting for a trio of doughnuts, I selected two sugar-coated and one cinnamon-coated variety, along with a raspberry-coated doughnut to round out my order. Each doughnut boasted a satisfying crunch on the exterior, complemented by a delightfully fluffy interior, thereby fulfilling my expectations for an idyllic doughnut experience. If you seek a brief respite from the mundane and crave a sweet treat that transcends the ordinary, Chez Boris is an absolute must-visit destination. Moreover, the utilization of a Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES) as a card holder only serves to enhance the charm of this captivating eatery. In conclusion, I assure you that paying a visit to Chez Boris will undoubtedly satiate your yearning for a unique gastronomic adventure."

I recently had the pleasure of partaking in a delectable repast at Logan's Roadhouse, accompanied by a fellow gastronome who had not yet had the privilege of dining at this esteemed establishment. Our culinary excursion took place in the early afternoon, thereby affording us the opportunity to indulge in a leisurely luncheon without the burden of excessive crowding.  

The hospitality we received was of the highest quality, with our server displaying consummate proficiency in her duties and ensuring that our glasses were perpetually replenished with an array of refreshing beverages. However, it was the sublime dinner rolls that truly captured our attention and left an indelible impression upon our palates. Indeed, they were nothing short of extraordinary, their heavenly flavor and texture evoking feelings of pure bliss and contentment.  

My dining companion and I both opted for the delectable pork chop, which was skillfully prepared to achieve maximum tenderness and juiciness. Furthermore, the sweet potato fries that accompanied our meals were enhanced by the judicious application of cinnamon and butter, creating a delightful harmony of flavors that complemented our main courses perfectly. To maintain a sense of balance and equilibrium, I elected to include a serving of expertly cooked broccoli within my meal, thus rounding out the ensemble with a healthy and nutritious component.  

Ultimately, the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance of our dining experience arrived in the form of our companion's generous offer to cover the cost of our repast, graciously bestowed upon us like a cherry atop a sundae. It was a magnanimous gesture that served as a fitting conclusion to a truly satisfying and enjoyable meal, made all the more memorable by the captivating ambiance and exceptional service that characterizes Logan's Roadhouse.

I'm not giving a 5-star just because I have yet to taste any of their boba drinks. But I did try their Deli Manjoo that were so addicting and delicious! The owners had brought over a few samples for our work near by to try and we have been hooked! 

Just today, I went by to get the Deli Manjoos but their machine was broken (BUT THEY ARE IN PROCESS OF FIXING IT ASAP!!!!!!) so I got myself a combination chicken and lamb baguette sandwich and it was so delicious!!!!!!!!  

The (new) owners were such sweethearts and so kind! They are always so welcoming and always smiling :) I will definitely go back, even if I'm not working or just near by!

On a Tuesday evening, I found myself with an unanticipated hiatus of approximately one and a half hours while awaiting the arrival of an individual at the aerodrome. Seizing the opportunity to indulge in a culinary escapade, I opted to visit the revamped establishment formerly known as Old Pewter Rose. As fortune would have it, the venue was bustling with patrons, and in light of my time constraints, the accommodating staff proffered us a table situated adjacent to the kitchen, providing an unobstructed view of the culinary artisans at work. This unique dining experience, reminiscent of a Chef's table, was dubbed something distinct by the eatery.  

The dual delight of savoring delectable fare and observing its preparation elevated the encounter to an unforgettable level. Positioned directly in front of the line cooks and chefs, my dining companion and I relished the opportunity to witness the creation of each dish. Our server, cognizant of our gastronomic inclinations, recommended the flavorsome nutty fried chicken, presented alongside sweet potato mash and asparagus. The tantalizing aroma wafting from the plate prompted us to devour its contents with alacrity, leaving naught but an empty dish. Furthermore, we were treated to a heavenly, fluffy roll whose quality was assured by a rigorous approval process, as indicated by a sign stationed within the kitchen. This fastidious attention to detail undoubtedly contributed to the sublime, doughy excellence that graces my palate even now.  

In conclusion, my excursion to this refurbished edifice proved to be a truly satisfying adventure, heightened by the friendly service, scrumptious victuals, and welcoming ambiance. Without hesitation, I shall return to partake in further explorations of the menu, boasting an array of enticing options that regretfully remained unexplored during my initial visit.

"Indulged in a delectable luncheon repast at this establishment today in the company of my spouse, opting for the vegetarian spring rolls accompanied by the piquant sweet chili and plum sauce, which proved to be an astute gastronomical choice. The ambiance of the eatery itself was somewhat dimly lit, yet intriguing; the hospitable waiting staff member exhibited remarkable efficiency in dispatching our culinary selections in a timely manner. We elected to partake in the chicken phad thai, requesting a moderate level of spiciness and an additional serving of peanuts. While I experienced a modicum of disappointment owing to the relative absence of pungency, the dish, on the whole, proved to be quite satisfying. We augmented the flavor by incorporating a few red chilies and adjusting the seasoning to our individual preferences. Extremely palatable, indeed. As a native of the Seattle region, I have had the privilege of sampling a variety of exceptional Thai cuisine, and this particular experience ranks among the most enjoyable thus far in my quest for the quintessential phad thai. I would unquestionably consider returning to this venue, while maintaining a steadfast optimism that even more superlative culinary experiences await my discovery."

Came here with a bunch of friends (Group of 5) for breakfast. Luckily we came before the place got busy. Two of us ordered the iced tea. It was just okay. Watered down and not a lot of tea flavor.

For main course I had the Cowboy Omelette with cinnabun pancakes. I also tried the carrot, red velvet, and wheat pancakes. Ranked from most to least favorite: Cinnabun, Carrot, Red Velvet, then Wheat.

The cinnabun pancakes was flavorful and not overly sweet. I would highly recommend this pancake. The carrot pancake was good but couldn't taste the carrot flavor. It was very mild and it basically looked like the wheat pancake but a little sweeter. The red velvet was fairly dry and the melted sugar overpowered the red velvet. 

The cowboy omelette was okay. The eggs were overcooked but there were lots of ingredients in it. I would have preferred the eggs to be a little more watery and the vegetables a little less overcooked. The fried potatoes were okay. It was not overly salty and not burnt at all.

Overall, I would give this place 3.5 stars. This place is good for breakfast and I would come back here again. Portion size was excellent. They do give a lot for breakfast. Unfortunately, it just missed the mark on certain things. Service was excellent. Pancakes here are excellent. Next time I'll try their french toast and another egg dish to test.

"Ambience-wise, the establishment exudes an aura of laid-back sophistication, with an upscale atmosphere that permeates every aspect of its decor. However, the tariff for entry into the subterranean level may be perceived as somewhat prohibitive by certain patrons, despite the fact that it ostensibly includes some form of compensatory value in the form of quality amenities and services."

I have been a resident of the surrounding area for an extensive period of time and have had a strong desire to partake in a culinary excursion to this establishment for quite some time. In light of this, I decided to treat a close acquaintance to a celebratory dinner at this venue last week. Upon arriving, we were greeted by an accommodating hostess who showed us to our table in a prompt and efficient manner. Our server, who was attentive and knowledgeable, presented us with menus and offered recommendations when asked. It is worth mentioning that the service we received throughout the evening was of a high caliber. When we discovered that the bottle of wine we had selected was unavailable, our server graciously offered a suitable alternative at the same price, which we greatly appreciated.  

The initial course of our meal, consisting of corn cakes accompanied by pulled pork, proved to be the standout dish of the evening. The flavors and textures were expertly balanced, making for a truly satisfying experience. Additionally, the Arcadia Salad we ordered was also quite palatable. However, as a native of New Mexico with a deep affection for green chile, I must admit that the green chile Mac n Cheese fell slightly short of my expectations. Although the ribs were cooked to an acceptable level of tenderness, they failed to meet the standard of falling off the bone, which was a minor disappointment.  

In terms of the ambiance, we found the spaciousness and open layout of the restaurant to be quite pleasing. However, we did find the musical selection to be somewhat discordant with the overall atmosphere. While I understand that music is a subjective matter, I firmly believe that it plays a crucial role in establishing a truly exceptional dining environment. In this case, the music seemed incongruous with the restaurant's ambiance, and I cannot help but feel that a more avant-garde or sophisticated musical selection would better complement the atmosphere.  

Despite these minor drawbacks, I remain a proponent of this establishment and commend its efforts to create a unique and enjoyable dining experience.
I had the cheese pizza and zeppole, both were very good. The service was friendly, but not fantastic. Definitely worth the time to visit.

Burger Bar presents an innovative culinary experience, courtesy of Chef Hubert Keller's visionary conceptualization. Patrons are invited to create their ideal burger by selecting from an array of premium meats, including buffalo, lamb, angus, and kobe. Furthermore, they may choose their preferred temperature and an abundance of toppings. Of note is the extravagant Rossini burger, priced at $60, boasting Australian Kobe-style Wagyu beef, sautÃ©ed foie gras, and shaved truffles on an onion bun, complemented by a rich black truffle sauce. However, we recommend eschewing this option in favor of building a custom burger with identical ingredients, sans black truffles, resulting in a significantly lower price point of $30. This modification allows for a more balanced flavor profile, as the potency of the truffle sauce might overpower the delicate umami of the foie gras. An alternative to enhance the dining experience is to pair the burger with a selection of sauces from their extensive collection, featuring unique varieties such as spicy ketchup and truffle mayo. Without a doubt, Burger Bar offers a truly exceptional culinary adventure, with the possibility of indulging in the most delectable burger one has ever had, albeit at a considerable cost. Thus, it is highly recommended to partake in this gastronomic journey and relish the unparalleled flavors presented by Burger Bar.

I came with friends 3 times before we were able to get in without waiting an hour. The line is out the door and taxis are shuttling tourists from the strip non-stop.\n\nFood was good, don't get me wrong. But waiting an hour for a burger? The food wasn't anything that blew my mind, but it was good. French fries were very good, I enjoyed them more than my burger.

"It is time to bring this review to a close...LOL...We visited this establishment on its inaugural day, and while there was a delay in being seated, it was not excessively prolonged. The hostess efficiently utilized an iPad to check us in and subsequently sent a text message informing us of our table's readiness. Throughout our dining experience, the service we received was remarkably warm, professional, and courteous. However, let us proceed to the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance â?the cuisine! I opted for the Hells Kitchen burger, which was replete with flavor and possessed a spirited, piquant quality that left me utterly enamored. Indeed, I have discovered my new preferred culinary indulgence! As an individual who frequently visits Las Vegas every other weekend, I shall assuredly return to this eatery when it is less crowded."

My husband and I ate here while on a business trip and just loved everything about it.  Before 9 I though AJ Maxwell in New York had the best  steak and seafood.  My salmon was the best prepared salmon I have EVER had in my life in a restaurant.  My husband loved his steak.

My lobster mash potatoes was amazing.  The complimentary sample dish sent out was fabulous (can't remember what is was called). 

The crowd was a fun mix of the hip and young, older and chic, entertainment and sports crowd and after hours business type.  Music was nice and loud.

The prices were a bit high, but I would spend all over again because the service was great and the food was yummy!

"My affinity for dining at Buffalo Wild Wings (BWW) is unwavering, primarily due to their exceptional value proposition, which includes the offer of two dollar Stella Artois on Thursdays and scrumptious, genuinely spicy chicken wings. Without a doubt, the quality of the food and beverages served at this establishment justifies the cost. Moreover, the interior layout of BWW features numerous seating options, all of which provide an excellent vantage point for viewing a television, thereby ensuring that patrons can enjoy sports games or other televised events while savoring their meals. Additionally, my previous experiences with the service staff at this location have been overwhelmingly positive, although it is worth noting that the pace of service can sometimes be leisurely, rather than expedient."

"Optimize your culinary experience by indulging in the delectable sesame chicken or savory mixed vegetables complemented with a crispy fried tofu, and consider requesting an additional dash of piquancy to enhance the flavors; furthermore, take advantage of the hospitable nature of the establishment's proprietors, who will assiduously ensure that your dining experience is nothing short of exceptional."

"Caution to those unfamiliar with the locality: I am currently stationed at Mandalay Bay and opted to procure a pizza and an order of garlic knots via telephonic means from Biaggio's. It is worth noting that no explicit mention was made regarding any potential delivery fee, yet a $6.00 surcharge designated as a 'Strip Delivery Charge' was incorporated into the total upon the arrival of the culinary items. Furthermore, the establishment failed to include the aforementioned garlic knots in the delivery. However, it is worth acknowledging that the pizza itself was of superior quality. 
 UPDATE: Following the posting of my assessment, I received a telephonic communication from Biaggio's expressing regret for the issues I encountered and offering to rectify the situation by eliminating all associated costs. Despite my insistence that they compensate me for the consumable items I received, they adamantly refused. Kudos to Biaggio's for their exceptional customer service and dedication to ensuring client satisfaction! As a direct result of their commendable efforts, I have chosen to upgrade my original three-star rating to reflect my sincere appreciation. Indeed, I have become a fervent devotee of this laudable enterprise."

"Gastronomical indulgence characterized by an unparalleled culinary experience, marked by a subtle harmony of flavors, textures, and presentation, transcending the mundane and ascending to the realm of the sublime, wherein lies the quintessence of a refined dining adventure, precipitated by an unwavering commitment to excellence in both the preparation and service of delectable victuals, yet slightly tainted by an excessive reliance on sodium chloride, thereby imparting a faintly briny essence to certain dishes, which, though not necessarily detrimental to the overall enjoyment of the meal, may benefit from a judicious incorporation of alternative, naturally occurring seasonings, such as herbs and spices, to enhance the intrinsic flavors of the cuisine, while simultaneously ensuring that each dish is presented with an eye-catching aesthetic appeal, carefully arranged to tantalize the senses and evoke a sense of wonder and delight, and lastly, though not without some minor imperfections, such as the occasional presence of gristle in certain cuts of meat, the overall quality of the fare remains undiminished, warranting a subsequent exploration of the menu's offerings, with a view towards sample a diverse array of dishes, and thus, formulating a comprehensive assessment of the gastronomic prowess of this esteemed establishment."

I had the privilege of visiting the Gold & Silver Pawn Shop yesterday in the company of a colleague, and we arrived around 4:30 pm. Much to our delight, there was no queue to gain entry, and the atmosphere within the establishment was not chaotic or overcrowded, thereby enabling us to thoroughly absorb the ambiance and engage in conversation with the employees. Our visit proved to be particularly educational, as we gained insight into the intricacies of the show's production and were informed that had we arrived earlier, we could have potentially been selected as extras for the day's filming. It is worth noting that the gentlemen who work at the shop are typically present from Monday to Friday, between the hours of 9 am and 3 pm. However, they tend to remain in the rear of the building, thus avoiding the throngs of enthusiastic spectators who frequent the shop daily. For those aspiring to appear on television, it is crucial to possess an item of sufficient interest to warrant its display on the program, as well as the charm and persuasiveness necessary to navigate the show's rigorous selection process. Alternatively, arriving early enough to serve as an extra on a day when filming is taking place can also prove rewarding. Although the shop offered various tourist-oriented items, I felt no shame in acquiring a Pawn Stars t-shirt, and I derived immense satisfaction from doing so. The shop itself was not particularly extensive, yet I found the assortment of memorabilia to be captivating, and I was further entertained by the staff's recounting of anecdotes regarding the acquisition of specific items, which mirrored the experience of watching the program from the comfort of my own home. Ultimately, I would wholeheartedly endorse this excursion to any devotee of Pawn Stars.

"Savor the rich flavors of our delectable pizzas at Good Pizza for Arizona, where we offer an unparalleled lunch experience, comprising two generous slices and a refreshing beverage, all for the unbeatable price of $5, inclusive of tax. If you're seeking exceptional pizza in the Scottsdale vicinity, do drop by and indulge in a culinary adventure that will leave you utterly satisfied."

We indulged in a delectable dining experience at Bouchon, located within the luxurious Venetian hotel. Previously, we had only encountered the petite Bouchon to-go bakery on the lower level; thus, we were pleasantly surprised to discover an expansive restaurant situated on the upper floor of the establishment. Our visit transpired during the luncheon hour, and we relished the opportunity to sample their culinary offerings. Specifically, we opted for the flavorsome smoked salmon accompanied by cream cheese and chives, nestled within a crispy bread roll. The incorporation of capers amidst the sandwich elevated its flavor profile, rendering it an unforgettable gustatory experience. It is worth mentioning that smoked salmon is not typically a preference of mine, yet I felt compelled to venture beyond my customary choices and was ultimately delighted by the dish's excellence. An image of the scrumptious sandwich can be observed here: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rcaPajgKOJC2vo_l3xa42A?userid=OhFp0SPP5udI9EccfpzQ_g. Additionally, my fellow diners enjoyed the pork belly special, which was artfully presented and drew comparisons to the Bouchon location in Napa, according to my acquaintance who has had the pleasure of dining there. A visual representation of the pork belly dish can be found here: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/rcaPajgKOJC2vo_l3xa42A?select=CrbIl0aP3b-AFMtoK2Vv5w. It is worth noting that this eatery warrants a subsequent visit to indulge in one of their more extravagant entrees, as the quality of their cuisine is truly exceptional (and not merely confined to their convenient to-go bakery selections). Unfortunately, I failed to sample their renowned macarons, which, according to hearsay, are truly delectable.

"DELISH!! Extremely delectable and scrumptious! We were utterly delighted to discover this quaint and captivating eatery. As numerous patrons have astutely observed, indeed, it vastly supersedes the establishment situated across the thoroughfare. The hospitality we received was of an exceptionally high caliber, and the aquatic delicacies we indulged in were truly flavorful and gratifying. We shall unquestionably return to partake in their culinary offerings once again!!"

I arrived at this establishment with the intention of procuring some of my preferred pastries, specifically those of the Cinnabon variety, as it had come to my attention that such items were available for purchase at this location, thereby obviating the necessity of visiting a shopping mall in order to obtain them. As a former employee of Cinnabon, I possess firsthand knowledge of the distinctive flavor profile associated with their cinnamon rolls, and thus, I was eager to determine whether the quality of the aforementioned pastries would meet my elevated standards. Unfortunately, upon sampling the rolls in question, I was disappointed to discover that they fell short of my expectations, which, I must admit, may have been unreasonably high due to my previous association with the brand.
