In light of this experience, I cannot help but wonder if Schlotzsky's, the parent company of Cinnabon, might consider implementing a recruitment strategy aimed at securing personnel who specialize in the preparation of Cinnabon products, thereby ensuring that each item is crafted with the utmost care and attention to detail, thereby meeting, if not surpassing, the expectations of discerning patrons such as myself.

Nice las vegas club.. If your a chick you get to get in for free and free drinks before 12:30pm.. And guys like us get to pay $30 to get in and struggle at the bar trying to purchase a drink past all the chicks trying to get their free drinks... Lol over all the club is small and tight when filled to capacity.

During our recent sojourn in Charlotte, my spouse and I were seeking establishments that offered plant-based culinary options, and we were pleased to discover that this quaint eatery was conveniently located near the highway. Despite its diminutive size, the restaurant boasts an impressive menu featuring an array of delectable dishes, all of which are crafted from scratch using fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Furthermore, the proprietors have considerately provided an abundance of gluten-free options, ensuring that patrons with dietary restrictions can enjoy their meals without concern. Although there was a brief delay before being seated, the approximate 15-minute wait was more than compensated for by the exceptional quality of the cuisine. Additionally, despite the limited seating capacity, we were fortunate enough to be accommodated indoors, as the lunch rush had subsided by the time of our visit. Unfortunately, the absence of a public restroom facility was a minor drawback, but this did not detract from our overall satisfaction with the dining experience.

"Culinary excellence and an exceptionally hospitable team are the hallmarks of this esteemed establishment, which, despite its advanced age, has been fastidiously maintained to ensure a spotless and welcoming ambiance for patrons seeking a bygone era gaming experience that exudes tradition and refinement."

"It has been an absolute delight to collaborate with such a proficient and accommodating team, as they have consistently displayed a remarkable level of efficiency and cordiality in their work, thereby ensuring that my various projects have been completed with utmost satisfaction; however, it is worth mentioning that my association with them has been primarily confined to personal endeavors, including the creation of stickers and postcards, while also availing their printing services for photographs."

Really loved Ishi when they were at the old location, because it was cozy and always full. Since they moved they have a bigger place, had to cut costs on certain items but the sushi and hibachi is good and not too expensive. Saki bombs are cun there!

I missed the Lobster and Steak Day. It moved from Monday MNF to Thursdays. Its Kinda a cool spot to watch MNF. Staff are nice. Food honestly is really good. The Dj Wouldn't play Digital Undergrounds \"Freaks Of the Industry,\" said it was to slow for time. Free Parking.

I have a propensity to visit this establishment prior to attending Pittsburgh Penguins games or concerts. The beverages served here are truly remarkable, as is the culinary fare offered. However, it is occasionally challenging to capture the attention of the bartender, necessitating a physical search for their whereabouts. Notwithstanding this minor inconvenience, I find this venue to be an enjoyable and hip destination for pre- or post-event socializing at Consol Energy Center.

"RICE OF SUPERIOR QUALITY! My culinary inclinations lean more towards Persian cuisine, however, the kafta proffered by this establishment is indeed delectable. The rice, a celestial delight, is of such exceptional quality that I customarily request an additional portion. Furthermore, their pita bread, freshly prepared upon my arrival, is a sublime indulgence. The hospitality extended by the staff is also worthy of commendation, as it is both cordial and attentive."

"AZ88 embodies the quintessential contemporary dining establishment, boasting an ambiance that is at once captivating and sophisticated, with a distinctive dÃ©cor and lighting scheme that seamlessly complements its upscale surroundings in Scottsdale. The expansive menu offers an impressive array of culinary options, catering to diverse tastes and preferences, while the competitive pricing belies the high-end quality and presentation of the dishes. Our dining experience was further enhanced by the attentive service and convivial atmosphere, augmented by the unconventional yet ingenious design elements incorporated into the restrooms. Notwithstanding the occasional optical illusion created by the ubiquitous mirrors, our group's collective verdict was that the fare was undeniably delectable, making AZ88 an unquestionable recommendation for those seeking a memorable epicurean adventure."

"Upon perusing culinary critique by Guy Fieri on his televised program, 'Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives,' we opted to sample the fare at this establishment and formulate our own opinion. Upon arriving, we observed a queue of approximately thirty patrons, yet the efficiency of the service rendered the wait time negligible. Following our order, we were presented with a paging device, and within a fifteen-minute interval, we were served an abundance of delectable, freshly prepared cuisine, accompanied by ample seating both indoors and outdoors. Our morning repast consisted of pancakes of considerable proportions, augmented by homemade sausage and potato fries, and further complemented by refreshing house-made lemonade and cheesecake. An excellent dining experience, indeed; we eagerly anticipate our return."

"Upon initial observation, the exterior appearance of the establishment may seem unremarkable, but upon entering, one is greeted by a cozy, intimate Greek diner, offering an array of culinary options that blend traditional Mediterranean flavors with contemporary American preferences, such as the innovative buffalo chicken gyro, which harmoniously marries the spicy kick of buffalo sauce with the classic savory taste of gyro meat, thereby creating a unique gastronomic experience; additionally, the menu boasts an assortment of other delectable items, including stuffed cabbage, potato pierogies, and halushki, all at extremely affordable prices, with the total cost of our meal barely surpassing $10, making it an excellent choice for those seeking a satisfying and economical dining option, and lastly, it must be noted that the traditional gyro options are also available, each with its own distinctive twist, and, interestingly, ice cream is also offered, though regretfully, due to the abundance of food consumed during the meal, we were unable to partake in this sweet treat."

I had the privilege of partaking in a matrimonial celebration at this esteemed venue, and I must say, it proved to be an exceptional setting for a formal dinner gathering. Needless to say, the ambiance of the facility was utterly captivating, and the hospitality of the staff was nothing short of cordial. The culinary offerings were indeed satisfactory, and the layout of the premises was meticulously designed to accommodate an occasion of this nature, providing ample space for numerous large dining tables and a spacious dance floor. The beverage stations were maintained with utmost diligence, ensuring their continuous operation throughout the event. The newlyweds were visibly delighted, and the guests thoroughly enjoyed themselves.

The expended an incredible afternoon at the Phoenix zoo, reveling in the optimal atmospheric conditions and the relatively diminutive number of visitors, which allowed for a more intimate and tranquil experience, as the animals, seemingly oblivious to our presence, slumbered peacefully, albeit with a few exceptions, such as the ones that were fortuitously snoozing in plain sight, thereby affording us the opportunity to observe and appreciate their natural beauty. Notwithstanding the somewhat exorbitant prices of the supplementary amenities, the visit was, on the whole, a thoroughly enjoyable and rejuvenating way to spend time outdoors, basking in the glorious autumnal weather.

"An exceptionally satisfying culinary experience was had, characterized by an impressively attentive and hospitable wait staff, even on a traditionally busy Saturday evening. My dinner, consisting of a delectable beef burgundy, was thoroughly enjoyable and of superior quality. However, my fiancÃ©'s steak, despite being returned to the kitchen for further cooking, remained somewhat undercooked, thereby warranting a minor deduction in rating. Nonetheless, it was still of considerable taste and texture, and did not detract from the overall pleasure of the dining experience. This establishment struck me as an ideal venue for romantic dates or special occasions, offering an atmosphere conducive to such celebratory events."

Never in my life have I seen this much memorabilia in one place. It's like walking through Gene Summons' office if he were an M&M.

So many things from dolls-candy machines and bottles-toys and of course lots and lots of the small flat chocolate circles we all know as M&M's.

This is a must see for tourist who love chocolate. There are so many things to see. Not just to buy but to look at. Simply amazing.

I had a ball. Or several hundred flat chocolate circles.

"R n R boasts an aesthetically pleasing ambiance, replete with captivating architectural elements that precursively seduce one's senses, rendering the culinary experience tantalizing even before entry. This eatery offers two levels of indoor and alfresco seating, ensuring a versatile dining environment that accommodates diverse preferences. Additionally, the establishment employs numerous servers and bartenders, contributing to a vibrant atmosphere enhanced by melodious tunes, particularly during Saturday and Sunday afternoons when the volume is amplified (a feature that I personally relish). 

The diversity of their offerings extends beyond the cuisine, encompassing an extensive selection of appetizers that cater to various tastes. While the essence of their fare can be characterized as fundamentally American with subtle nuances, each dish is imbued with inventive twists that set them apart from more conventional counterparts. My personal experiences have consistently proven satisfying, with highlights including the delectable 'animal fries,' mouthwatering nachos, and savory sliders. In fact, every item I have sampled thus far has met or surpassed expectations. Although prices may fall within the medium range relative to neighboring high-end establishments such as Herb Box and Bandera, the generous portion sizes justify the cost. Whether dining indoors or enjoying the fresh air on either level of the inviting outdoor patios, the tasteful adornment of the venue contributes to a pleasant atmosphere that fosters a sense of contentment. Overall, I hold R n R in high esteem, and my intentions include revisiting this delightful setting in the future."

A phenomenal eatery within the Las Vegas vicinity, offering delectable morning repasts and an exceptional patronage experience, complemented by a Yelp check-in promotion, resulting in an overall gratifying visit. However, it is advisable to anticipate a delay in entry during weekends due to the establishment's popularity among patrons.

"Take advantage of our tantalizing Tuesday offerings, where cinematic experiences can be savored for a mere $1! Additionally, our thrifty Thursdays boast a bargain price of $1.50 for an alternative day of entertainment. While the seats may not recline, the nominal fee renders this detail inconsequential. Considering a budget-friendly outing with a significant other? Look no further than our humble abode."

Ahhhh L'Appartement! J'y deviendrais locataire demain matin...J'y suis retourner pour une 3i\u00e8me fois et l'exp\u00e9rience y fut une encore tr\u00e8s agr\u00e9able. L'ambiance est d\u00e9contract\u00e9 sans \u00eatre trop bruyante, les fen\u00eatres y laissait entrer une lumi\u00e8re chaleureuse et le service, encore une fois imp\u00e9ccable et sympathique. Le menus est simple mais tr\u00e8s bien ex\u00e9cut\u00e9 et les prix fort attrayants. D\u00e9finitivement une adresse a ajouter \u00e0 son carnet! On signe o\u00f9?

It's easy to see why this small eatery is so popular: the food is inexpensive and tasty, the servings are more than ample, and the range of choices run the gamut of popular Asian cooking styes: Chinese, Japanese, Thai, Mongolian. It's great to be able to order tonkatsu, pad thai, and General Tsao all in one place. While the place could use more light and perhaps a bit of touching up, you come here for the inexpensive, delicious food and not for the decor. I noticed while dining here that they have a very brisk take-out business so don't be surprised if there's a bit of a delay in getting your food if you dine here at peak hours.

"Exceedingly satisfactory, it is. The palatable quality of the stone crab did not quite live up to my previous experience with the authentic version in Miami, and my steak was slightly too saline for my liking. Nonetheless, the culinary satisfaction of our group of eight individuals was generally quite high."

"A truly remarkable establishment, catering to both juveniles and adults alike, boasting an impressive expanse of facilities, staff exhibiting authentic cordiality, and an overall spotless ambiance. My granddaughter has consistently enjoyed herself during our visits, capitalizing on the diverse array of activities available. Occasionally, promotional offers are presented, rendering the experience more affordable. However, our dissatisfaction lies with the food and beverage services, specifically the yogurt bar, which occupies a significant portion of the snack bar. The yogurt itself was improperly prepared, resulting in an unpleasantly tart taste, while the accompanying toppings were stale and lacking in freshness. A suggestion would be to adhere to offering bottled water and pizza, which are adequate, rather than attempting to provide an extensive variety of snacks."

"An exceptional abode for temporary residency. My recent sojourn at this esteemed establishment has led me to conclude that it is, indeed, the optimal lodging I have had the pleasure of experiencing since my previous venture to Las Vegas for professional purposes. The expansive dimensions of the accommodations are reminiscent of a suite, rather than a traditional hotel room, thus providing an unparalleled level of comfort and convenience. Furthermore, I must commend the absence of any discernible odor of smoke within both the guest quarters and the gaming facility itself. However, I must note that a faint whistling sound emanating from the window did momentarily create an eerie ambiance akin to a haunted house soundtrack."

"The Brunch Buffet presents an exceptional culinary experience, boasting a vast array of delectable dishes that cater to diverse tastes and dietary preferences. While the service may be somewhat inconsistent, the quality of the fare more than compensates for this minor drawback. When compared to other buffets, the Brunch Buffet stands out as truly remarkable; however, it is essential to manage expectations and recognize that it falls short of the exceptionally high standards set by fine dining establishments where each dish is meticulously prepared to order. Embrace the spirit of indulgence, relinquish any sartorial constraints, and savor the moment, allowing the rich flavors to transport you to a state of gastronomic nirvana."

tucked away in a little corner waaaaay away from the strip (just off asian central on spring mountain) we found this cute little bakery. they don't have an extensive selection of breads, but what they do carry is definitely freshly baked and fluffy and light and soft. their roll cakes are also pretty dang good, annnnd they have japanese castella (honey roll) and puddings.

"Gastronomical excellence and an ambiance of elegance! A substantial tariff, indeed, yet commensurate with the lofty standards one might anticipate in a city such as Las Vegas, particularly when situated upon the famed Strip. 

The hospitality of our servers was of an exceptionally high caliber, as they exhibited profound consideration towards my companion's dietary restrictions, which included an aversion to both gluten and dairy products. Such thoughtfulness is not always encountered among the multitude of establishments that claim to cater to the needs of those with specific culinary requirements. 

The presentation of the cuisine was aesthetically pleasing, while the variety of teas available was impressively diverse and unexpectedly extensive, transcending the customary solitary option commonly offered by the majority of dining establishments."

The pleasure we experienced during our recent visit to St. Francis was truly remarkable, and the exceptional quality of the service we received significantly contributed to our enjoyment. The captivating architectural elements of this esteemed establishment are undoubtedly a sight to behold, and we highly recommend requesting a guided tour to fully appreciate their intricate details. Anticipating our next visit, we eagerly look forward to indulging in the expanded menu offerings and extended operating hours. However, we must caution that the cost may be somewhat prohibitive.

The wife and I got a room here for fifty or so dollars a night on Priceline and really enjoyed ourselves. Our room had a sliding glass door facing the pool, a very nice pool, and we could just walk out of our room straight into the water... nice. Our room was nice with a comfy bed and modern design, plus there's no parking fee and it right by Scottsdale Fashion. I would have no problem staying here again for a little getaway, I would always prefer Valley Ho, but if the money isn't there this is my second choice for sure.

I like this airport. I've been stuck here many a-times between domestic and international layovers.  The layout is pretty easy to understand - you do have to walk a lot between terminals so wear comfy shoes and have good wheels on your suitcase.  Most if not all the terminals are connected via walking so you don't need to catch a shuttle. However this means you are walking a lot - as I said above.

The main hub area that connects a lot of the terminals together has a good selection of restaurants.  I've hung out there a few times - once during my layover in 2005 from Nicaragua where I watched the Superbowl at a Chili's or something similar.  There are definitely a few vegan options around for food.

There are some good stores for shopping too if you have more time to kill after that first or second Bloody Mary.

It's not the best airport but it's pretty good as far as navigation, food quality and choices, and cleanliness goes.

"Although it may not necessarily qualify as the most exceptional barbecue experience I have had the pleasure of indulging in, considering that I reside in San Francisco, where there is an unfortunate scarcity of genuinely delectable barbecue establishments, this particular venue manages to satisfy my cravings quite effectively. The generous proportions of the meals, the flavorsome quality of the culinary offerings, the hospitable nature of the staff, and the reasonable pricing all contribute to creating a welcoming ambiance that is reminiscent of a traditional, down-home barbecue setting, thereby making it an establishment worth visiting for anyone seeking a casual, satisfying dining experience in Las Vegas."
Really comfortable seating! And you can bring in delicious wood fired pizza from Five50 Pizza Bar that right around the corner.

"There were a few culinary offerings on the menu that possessed a certain degree of gastronomic merit, while others were merely adequate, but the beverages, particularly those containing vodka and pomegranate, were undeniably exceptional. The kimchi fried rice was palatable, albeit somewhat comparable in flavor and price to a similar dish available at Ichiza. Considering the establishment's reputation for serving high-quality fare, my expectations regarding the overall gustatory experience were admittedly higher. Notwithstanding, the salmon I ordered did feature a delectable miso glaze, but its cost seemed slightly disproportionate to its actual value."

"Upon entering this establishment, I was immediately struck by its stark contrast to the Scottsdale norm. Gone were the pretentious hostesses and sleek modern decor, replaced by a diminutive tiki bar adorned with garish neon beer signs that cast an eerie glow upon the reeded wall coverings. Instead of the ubiquitous break-beat/techno that has become synonymous with sushi bars thanks to Ra and Stingray, Ichiban opted for a decidedly more questionable musical selection, featuring an assortment of cringe-worthy '80s tunes that would have been better suited to a VH1 "Awesomely Bad" marathon. \n\nDespite this dubious start, the sushi itself proved to be a delightful surprise, boasting imaginative and innovative creations that incorporated everything from jalapenos to Mexican tortillas into their specialty rolls. My personal favorite was the Chimichanga roll, essentially a Philly roll augmented with avocado and then promptly deep-fried, which unfortunately threatened to clog my arteries with each bite. Fortunately, a generous happy hour policy offered $4 Cali rolls and affordable sake daily from 5-7 pm, making the experience slightly less financially ruinous for those who timed their arrival appropriately. Furthermore, patrons seated at the bar were treated to an amusing spectacle, courtesy of the owner's personal preparation of each specialty roll and his penchant for theatrics. Alas, tardiness carried a penalty, as those arriving after 7 pm faced a significantly less "happy" financial outcome. Ultimately, the musical selection, while admittedly nostalgia-inducing, fell just shy of earning a coveted fifth star."

"I partook of a delectable repast at this establishment on the preceding Saturday, and my culinary experience was utterly satisfactory. Although I possess only a cursory familiarity with Filipino cuisine, I found the flavors to be remarkably palatable and the prices to be eminently reasonable. This cozy eatery, with its limited seating capacity, maintains a brisk carry-out trade, which attests to its popularity among local gastronomes. My own gustatory explorations encompassed the savory goat and chicken dishes, served with a side of rice, as well as an assortment of other delights, such as skewers of potatoes lavishly coated in brown sugar and several pieces of succulent squid. Upon reflection, I would unhesitatingly endorse a visit to this venue for any individual finding themselves in the vicinity."

The occasion of my twenty-first birthday was commemorated by a visit to a luxurious resort, whereupon I was indulged with an upgrade to a palatial forum tower suite situated on the twenty-third floor, affording a panoramic view of the pool area. The opulent accommodations featured two lavish bathrooms, each boasting a separate entrance leading to a dual showerhead showering facility, in addition to a capacious tub, an abundance of mirrors, and ample closet space. The aesthetically pleasing chamber, conveniently located within walking distance of several premier hotels, served as the setting for an unforgettable experience.

"The waiting period in the anterior waiting area is appreciably shorter compared to the primary, comprehensive spine clinic located just around the corner within the medical complex. 

The most advantageous feature of this surgical establishment is the brief duration preceding the preoperative surgical process. The wait time is considerably shorter, which constitutes a refreshing change. 

Furthermore, it is a surgical medical facility that adheres to standard procedures commonly implemented in typical surgery centers, instilling a sense of comfort and security in patients under the care of seasoned nurses and surgical personnel at all times. 

To mitigate the tedium associated with waiting, cinematic presentations are offered to ensure that both patients and their companions remain entertained and engaged throughout the experience. 

Overall, this facility warrants a rating of four stars."

Very cool place downtown in CityScape, love the idea, not your dad's bowling alley full of sweaty old men playing in league's. This is definitely built more around the lounge concept than bowling lanes. A great place to have a b-day party with friends, they have huge screens at the end of each lane that were playing college football games when we went. They stocked local brew from Four Peaks which is awesome.\n\nThe downside is the service wasn't the best but this is a new location so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt that they will figure it out. Other than that we highly recommend checking it out, once CityScape is done it's gonna be great to hangout downtown.

I have had the pleasure of frequenting Culinary Dropout on a regular basis, with a minimum of one visit per month, and often times more frequently, ever since its inception at the Yard. My affinity for the culinary offerings here is unwavering, as I take great delight in savoring a variety of dishes, specifically including, but not limited to, the delectable bistro steak, the flavorsome Korean style steak, the succulent salmon, the mouthwatering meatloaf, and the tender, fall-off-the-bone ribs. Additionally, I must commend the eatery on its judicious selection of libations, featuring an array of fine beers and wines that pair perfectly with the meals.

I ate at Tratorria del Lupo in Mandalay a year or so ago and loved it.  I had the Ragu ala Bolgnese which was a delight. Just the right mix of meat and tomato and pasta make the dish a rich and satisfying meal.  We paired our meal with Bellinis - a peachy/sparkling wine mix that is light and refreshing!  The restaurant has a classic Italian decor, but the best part is the an open patio within Mandalay's restaurant row (inside).  Sit on the patio for great people watching!  We spent a couple hours on a Friday night watching increasingly intoxicated clubbers wobble along walkways and make to the trendy clubs that are nearby.  It was bit on the pricey side, but a worthwhile experience for your tastebuds!

Convenient to ASU, friendly service, simple warm ambiance, and pretty decent Thai food. I've had AMAZING spicy Pad Thai here and then the next time it was only so-so, so the consistency is a bit hard to predict. I really like that they offer different levels of spiciness for their menu options (personally, medium doesn't seem spicy at all to me). I enjoy the fried tofu with sweet and spicy sauce, the papaya salad (order it spicy!), the Pad Prik King (green beans, carrots and lemon leaves stir-fried with your protein of choice), and either the Pad Thai or the Pad Woon Sen (glass noodles). Service has always been extremely nice and prompt.

I must say that my expectations were thoroughly surpassed by the ambiance and aesthetic appeal of this establishment. The majority of the female patrons boasted physiques that could be described as nothing short of tantalizing. Furthermore, the nature of the lap dances provided an unparalleled level of intimacy, as they were not only comprehensive in their scope but also permitted a degree of tactile interaction that was nothing short of remarkable. Additionally, the manner in which the performers reclined upon a bed, thereby creating an atmosphere of uninhibited indulgence, was truly exceptional. Were it not for the absence of alcoholic beverages, which, in my opinion, would have elevated the overall experience to a five-star rating without hesitation, this club would have left little to be desired. Nonetheless, the lap dances themselves were the undeniable highlight of this venue, and their quality cannot be overstated.

"While indulging in a brief sojourn from my habitual environs, I chanced upon this diminutive yet charming refuge amidst an expanse of arid terrain. Upon ingress, I was instantaneously struck by an overwhelming sense of similarity to the Batcave, owing to the pronounced obscurity that permeated the interior. Following a cursory exploration of the premises, during which I relied upon tactile sensations to navigate the store's layout, and having availed myself of a sufficient quantity of contemporary and archival issues, I opted to procure several serialized publications and proceeded towards the exit, fortified by the luminosity emanating from my smartphone's display, which had been previously augmented with a flashlight application, thereby rendering me suitably prepared for any future visits."

The simple awesomeness of penguins, monkeys and a kapibara in Canada warrants a visit to the Biodome.

90 minutes or two hours strolling through the Biodome's ecosystems are time well spent indeed. The relative freedom of the animals to roam their pavilion is a great change from zoo cages, and you can play monkey-spotting or admire the beautiful macaws, knowing too well you can't own one because it would out-live you.

Try to avoid school holidays and weekends if possible. You don't want the place to be bustling with hyperactive kids having a great time. You also definitely want a spot for sitting in the penguin section and a view on the swimming penguins, without a crowd of munchkins obstructing the water line.

Admission is steep if you aren't a Quebecer or a student. Definitely worth a visit though. If you bundle the Biodome with the Botanical Garden the deal gets better.

Do not do the Olympic tower. You get a better view from the Mont Royal chalet. It is free and involves a healthy trek up the hill.

I possess a predilection for frequenting the establishment during the designated period of reduced prices, which occurs daily from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m. and 12 p.m. to closing time. This temporal window affords me the opportunity to indulge in a delectable steak complemented by a single side dish at a discounted rate, while still maintaining the high culinary standards that are synonymous with the restaurant's reputation. Upon entering the interior space, I am immediately struck by the ambiance, which evokes a sense of nostalgia reminiscent of classic Western films. To fully appreciate the experience, I highly recommend sampling the signature mint julep, a potent concoction that typically suffices for my needs. However, it is advisable to secure a reservation in advance to avoid potential delays, especially during peak hours. On one occasion, I arrived between 6:50 p.m. and 7 p.m., only to be seated later than anticipated, resulting in the application of full prices due to our delayed ordering.

"The eatery situated within the premises of the Phoenix Art Museum boasts an exceptional dining experience, characterized by an aesthetically pleasing ambiance, a judicious selection of fresh ingredients, harmonious flavor combinations courtesy of the Farm at South Mountain, an accommodating and attentive team of servers, and prices that are eminently reasonable, thereby establishing itself as the most satisfactory museum restaurant this writer has had the pleasure of patronizing. Upon entering the establishment, we opted to indulge in some beverages and a mere hors d'oeuvre between exhibits, and our expectations were greatly surpassed by the superior quality of the cuisine (unencumbered by the exorbitant prices often associated with captive audiences), the warmth and hospitality of the service, and the inviting atmosphere, which led us to deliberately plan future museum visits with the intention of savoring their delectable offerings. Observing the culinary creations being served to fellow patrons, it became apparent that the sandwiches featured impressive ingredients, the crab cakes presented a delightful appearance, albeit with minimal filling as per the server's description, and the coconut cake constituted a generous portion that was truly a gastronomic joy; furthermore, the menu selections bore names that cleverly corresponded with the Hollywood Costume theme, contributing to an unforgettably amusing dining experience."

"It is my sincere belief that Zipps possesses an inherent appeal, which has led me to frequent the establishment with considerable regularity during the recent March Madness festivities. Notwithstanding certain criticisms regarding the quality of service, I remain optimistic about the potential for improvement, taking into account the fact that all novel ventures experience initial difficulties and challenges. In light of this, I would advise against hasty judgments and encourage individuals to afford Zipps a reasonable period of time to address and rectify any issues. Drawing from my personal experience in the role of opening or assisting in the launch of diverse dining establishments, I am confident that Zipps will eventually overcome its nascent obstacles and emerge as a reputable and successful enterprise, consistent with the standards upheld by its sister locations throughout the valley."

"I have been perpetuating my visits to this establishment on a monthly basis for a duration of five years, entrusting my automotive needs to the proficient expertise of a singular technician. It is utterly inconceivable that I would consider alternatives to this steadfast allegiance."

"My sincere apologies for the brevity of this review, as it is imperative to highlight the exceptional quality of this establishment's bacon-covered cinnamon rolls, which are undoubtedly the most delectable and satisfying culinary delight in the city. Upon request, the accommodating staff will graciously adorn the already heavenly pastries with a fried egg, thereby elevating the dish to an unparalleled level of gastronomic excellence. It is indeed a stroke of genius on my part to have discovered this gem, and I assure you that the experience of consuming such a masterpiece is nothing short of transcendent. Furthermore, while the prices may seem steep to some, I firmly believe that the unparalleled quality and generous portion sizes more than justify the cost. In conclusion, I highly recommend this venue to anyone seeking a truly exceptional breakfast or brunch experience."

"The confluence of bottle service, Kaskade's melodic mix, and the convivial company of a group of ER nurses has rendered me utterly content. I shall unquestionably revisit this establishment in the future. My sole grievances pertain to the surly demeanor of the bouncers, who display an excessive fastidiousness regarding the maintenance of a fluid pedestrian traffic during performances. They remain oblivious to gender, shoving aside anyone obstructing their desired path. Furthermore, the club's management endeavors to cultivate an air of exclusivity by fixating on inconsequential details, such as footwear, within their premises. This results in the ejection of patrons, including those who have indulged in the club's offerings and are in the process of departing, merely due to a perceived state of intoxication. Notwithstanding these criticisms, I shall confer four stars upon this venue, attributed to its exceptional musical selection, ambiance, and impressive roster of performers."

"This establishment warrants a rating of 3.5 stars, however, due to the exceptional tenderness and juiciness of the grilled poultry, I am inclined to award it a rating of 4 stars. My associates and I visited this eatery at approximately 9:30 pm with the intention of partaking in a meal prior to engaging in nocturnal activities. Upon arrival, it took roughly 10 minutes to be seated, which, given the extreme density of patrons, was not an unreasonable duration. However, the prolonged delay in the arrival of our cuisine necessitated a considerable amount of time, thereby making this dining establishment not the most suitable choice for individuals who are under time constraints and have subsequent plans. 

Observing the generous proportions of the dishes, my companion and I decided to share a pasta entrÃ©e comprising of grilled fowl, tomato, basil, and mozzarella. To our delight, the grilled poultry was not only devoid of dryness but also surprisingly juicy, particularly considering it consisted of white meat. Despite sharing the dish, I found myself unable to complete it, and it left me feeling satiated for the remainder of the evening. 

Based on various Yelp reviews, this restaurant is allegedly affiliated with The Cheesecake Factory as a sister establishment. Therefore, we felt compelled to compare the two. In my opinion, this particular dining establishment excels its counterpart in terms of both quality and portion size, offered at a reasonable price point. Furthermore, the shrimp scampi served to the adjacent table appeared utterly delectable, further reinforcing my positive impression of this eatery."

I am thoroughly delighted that my roommate recommended visiting this establishment, as it afforded me the opportunity to partake in a delectable dining experience at RnR. In conjunction with Kristen, I had the pleasure of stopping by for a belated luncheon, which fortuitously coincided with the happy hour period. My beverage of choice, a refreshing ale, was available at a price point that was considerably lower than that of Kristen's tea, much to my satisfaction. Upon entering the edifice, I was immediately struck by the imposing nature of the entrance, which boasted an impressive size and an ornate design that exuded an air of elegance. Although the interior space was somewhat limited, it did not have the appearance or ambiance of being overcrowded, and the abundant outdoor seating provided an ideal setting for leisurely observations of passersby. Anticipation fills me as I eagerly await the arrival of cooler temperatures, at which point I can frequent this venue with greater regularity and indulge in people-watching activities.  

The culinary journey commenced with a duo of appetizing precursors, the initial one being those delectable pigs in a blanket, whose flaky, golden-hued pastry casing enveloped a savory filling that was both satisfying and flavorful. The succeeding item was the chicken lollipops, which showcased remarkably tender poultry portions cloaked in a spicy buffalo sauce that heightened their gastronomic appeal. A harmonious union of tastes and textures characterized the pork sandwich, wherein a sweet and tangy sauce complemented the tender pork excellently, resulting in a truly exceptional offering that was accompanied by a generous portion of fries.  

Considering its unconventional operating hours, diverse array of potent potables, and advantageous happy hour offerings, a visit to RnR is undoubtedly merited. I can only lament not having discovered this hidden gem earlier.

"Indubitably, this shopping venue offers an experience tantamount to a genuine mall, albeit with a distinctive ambiance that is unparalleled in Las Vegas. The diverse array of stores, complemented by an arcade and excellent opportunities for people-watching, creates an environment that is both captivating and engaging. Notwithstanding the fact that certain items may appear frivolous or unnecessary, the prices, when juxtaposed with those of other retail establishments along the Strip, are relatively reasonable and thus do not preclude the possibility of making a purchase. In point of fact, I have made a mental note to myself to acquire, at some point in the future, that ostentatious decorative fan or perhaps even that set of throwing knives, both of which would undoubtedly serve as conversation pieces in my living space. All things considered, this shopping destination provides an enjoyable diversion from the monotony of gambling, particularly when one has become disenchanted with the prospect of continually losing at slot machines."

I am commenting on the super Bi-lo in Matthews on Fincher Farm lane.  The managers and sales staff are quite friendly and do go out of their way to assist you. They recently overcharged me on an item that was still advertised as buy one get one free but they made good and refunded all the  money plus I got to keep the item. Can't complain about that. I wish they did offer more gourmet items as Harris Teeter does but I like the shopping experience there and they do have good deals on lots of items that I buy frequently. That is why I keep going back.

"We indulged in a culinary excursion with a coterie of 14 associates, savoring an array of gastronomical delights that showcased the establishment's eclectic menu, boasting several opulent entree options such as Kobe beef and geoduck, although a frugal patron could feasibly enjoy a satisfying repast for a mere $30 per person. Our gastronomic journey commenced with a triumvirate of poultry cuts, artfully presented as a shared appetizer platter, which garnered unanimous acclaim from our assemblage. Subsequently, we relished a trio of delectable dishes, comprising of the iconic Kobe beef, a flavorsome fried rice creation, and a fresh seafood offering, each dish showcasing the culinary prowess of the kitchen's brigade. Throughout our epicurean adventure, we were attended to by multiple suave managers who exhibited solicitous attention to detail, ensuring that our experience was nothing short of exceptional. Furthermore, the surprise birthday cake that we had arranged for a colleague was executed flawlessly, further solidifying the restaurant's reputation for seamless service. Although my criteria for a perfect 5-star rating are stringently high, I would still enthusiastically endorse this eatery to any individual seeking a refined dining experience."

"Chen's culinary offerings, arguably the most delectable and satisfying Chinese fare on campus, consistently entice my taste buds with their unparalleled flavors. My customary order, the chicken shanghai noodles, boasts an unrivaled savory essence attributable to the judicious application of a specially crafted sauce that has become the establishment's hallmark. Moreover, the reasonable price point of approximately $8 for a generous serving size contributes to the venue's enduring popularity among students seeking a satisfying dining experience without breaking the bank. Furthermore, Chen's extends an additional complimentary perk in the form of post-5 pm bubble tea availability, although its quality may be somewhat variable, the gratuity alone renders it an appreciated gesture."

I give it 4 stars because it's cheap and their pizzas are huge!  Biggest medium pizza I've seen.  The pizzas themselves seemed pretty basic/standard in terms of quality, nothing special.  Service was acceptable.

I finally checked out the new Mint since I was attending the YAM's Black & White gala.  I was  impressed with the new space as well as the party that the YAMs put together.

The museum itself is modern, open, and quite large.  My favorite exhibit on this visit was the Romare Bearden collection.  It is quite extensive and there are a lot of great pieces. 

Back in the day (10-15 years ago) I was a YAM (Young Affliliate of the Mint).  As a YAM, I  attended a lot of special events at the old Mint of Craft & Design (in the old Montaldo's building) as well as lots of events at the Randolph Mint.  This venue is larger and better equipped to handle special events and parties than the old Mint of Craft & Design.  

The food, drinks, and music at the Gala were all quite good. Can't wait to go back for another event at the Mint, or just to spend an afternoon wandering through the galleries again.

"The culinary experience at this establishment was largely satisfactory, with the exception of a minor discrepancy in the composition of the chicken soup, which was advertised as containing snow peas, yet their presence was conspicuously absent upon receipt. However, this singular faux pas did not detract from the overall quality of the edibles, as the tacos, chips, guacamole, and other dishes were of such delectable nature that they fostered an unwavering affection for the venue. Consequently, we are eagerly anticipating our next visit, and would recommend that aficionados of Mexican cuisine eschew Gadzooks on 7th street in favor of this superior eatery, which merits the brief excursion necessary to reach it."

"Our dining experience was truly exceptional, as the service we received was of an extremely high quality and we were seated at the bar area. Our culinary journey began with the delectable Jalape\u00f1o popper burger, which I personally relished, while my companion opted for the Dynamic Duo, a judicious combination of flavors that complemented each other perfectly. Additionally, we shared the King roll, a sushi dish that boasted an impressive size and left us both in awe of its scrumptiousness. Unfortunately, we were unable to complete our meals, as they were so satisfying that we were left feeling utterly replete. Nonetheless, we eagerly anticipate our next visit, as the menu offered an array of tantalizing options that we cannot wait to sample."

Love to stop here! This is a great place to have a drink and relax! Except for the main bar, all of the seating is outside with misters in the summer and heaters in the winter.  

The bartenders are friendly. They pour a good drink. Food is available. 

Yes, it's a biker bar, but very laid back. Be it locals or out-of-towners, all are welcome here.

"This venue offers an exceptional setting for post-work libations, boasting a superb bar that aficionados of mixed drinks will undoubtedly appreciate. Personally, I relish the prospect of occupying a stool at the bar, savoring a meticulously crafted cocktail while engaging in lively conversation. For those who prefer alfresco revelry, the expansive rear patio presents an enchanting ambiance, replete with glass-enclosed fireplaces and ample seating. Furthermore, enthusiasts of recreational activities will be delighted to discover a bocce ball court, providing an entertaining diversion from the usual sedentary drinking experience. On a recent visit, my spouse and I found ourselves momentarily at a loss for conversation topics, but fortunately, a set of trivia pursuit cards conveniently lay on the table, inspiring us to devise our own rules: if either of us failed to respond correctly to a question, the other party was entitled to pose a follow-up inquiry. The resultant intellectual duel proved enormously enjoyable, underscoring the establishment's suitability as a regular haunt. The culinary offerings are equally impressive, making it an ideal gathering spot for friends."

This particular destination represents one of our most preferred stopping points within the city limits of Las Vegas, boasting an array of delectable culinary offerings, an assortment of unique shopping experiences, and an abundance of captivating sights to behold. It is highly recommended that one allocate a minimum amount of time to peruse this location, even if only briefly.

After briefly visiting Bass Pro, we decided to partake in a copious amount of nourishment at our lodging, and thus, placed an order for multiple meat tacos and a few street tacos. Although the street tacos did not quite compare to the delectable offerings of the mobile taco vendors in Hawaii, they were still savory and satisfying. Additionally, the employees exhibited a welcoming and amicable demeanor towards us, which further enhanced our dining experience. Consequently, we would unquestionably consider patronizing this establishment again in the future.

"An exceptional happy hour experience reminiscent of past indulgences in my previous neighborhood, accompanied by my spouse, where we would partake in copious amounts of delectable victuals and potables during the fleeting hours of felicitous prices, culminating in a total expenditure of less than thirty dollars. Our gastronomical rotation comprised an array of tantalizing delights, including crispy potato skins sans bacon, creamy hummus, succulent chicken wings, golden-fried mozzarella, and, of course, the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistanceâfried pickles. These delectable, deep-fried gherkins were the epitome of flavorful indulgence, eliciting unadulterated delight from those who relish the combination of tart, briny pickles and crispy, golden batter. Furthermore, the establishment offers generously-sized draft beers and well liquors at reasonable prices, complemented by an impressive array of mixological masterpieces, notably their sublime bloody marys, which boast an unparalleled excellence in the region, with an optional Cajun-style rim imbuing the beverage with an added layer of complexity and depth. The service, generally speaking, was satisfactory."

"The pace of service at this establishment was somewhat sluggish, yet the ambiance and state of cleanliness within the dining area were quite pleasant. The culinary offerings were indeed delectable, particularly the hamburger, which garnered my approval and admiration. The complementary bread provided was of an addictive nature, prompting me to crave more, while the pasta dishes exceeded expectations, warranting my endorsement. Although the cost was slightly elevated compared to other eateries, it remained within reasonable bounds."

Mekong Supermarket boasts an impressive level of cleanliness and organization, allowing patrons to navigate the store without encountering obstacles or being overwhelmed by pungent odors. The layout and upkeep of the live and frozen seafood section are equally commendable, with clear product labeling and well-maintained tanks that house a diverse array of aquatic life. Prices at Mekong are competitive and affordable, making it an attractive option for those seeking fresh seafood. Although we had specific weight requirements for our seafood, the accommodating staff were more than willing to assist us in selecting the perfect catches, including a live lobster, tilapia, and catfish, all weighing less than 2 pounds. The tilapia and catfish were expertly cleaned and packaged, while the lobster accompanied us to Asian CafÃ© Express, where it was skillfully prepared to our liking. Mekong and ACE maintain a mutually beneficial agreement, enabling customers to choose their preferred seafood and have it cooked according to their preference for a nominal fee. This unique experience was thoroughly enjoyable and one that I would eagerly repeat.

This quaint eatery, conveniently proximate to the esteemed Museum of Fine Arts, offers an array of delectable fare, which we had the pleasure of sampling on a leisurely Sunday morning. The culinary offerings, while not revolutionary, were undoubtedly satisfying, and the beverages, equally impressive. It is worth noting, however, that the ambiance is somewhat more refined than that of a typical cafe, thus it would be wise to consider donning attire that exudes a modicum of sophistication prior to visiting. Additionally, it is advisable to be cognizant of the fact that the prices charged for the consumables offered herein are slightly elevated in comparison to those of neighboring establishments. Nonetheless, this charming venue remains an agreeable destination for those seeking respite from the rigors of daily life or, perhaps, a brief interlude preceding or following a visit to the adjacent cultural institution.

The poor drive thru window teller was getting yelled at by the tube customer and still managed to keep her cool and help me with my deposit. Susan was incredibly composed, and did her very best to be patient and polite, despite obviously being flustered. Be kind to these people!

Casual atmosphere and great food. What more could you ask for on a weeknight in Uptown? The crowd here is laid back and unpretentious, and the servers here are friendly and welcoming. The menu offers a great selection, from traditional items like wings and wraps, and even pizza. Dare I say it: this may be the best pizza I've had in Charlotte so far! Level with me here - it's not phenomenal, and it's no NY slice, but it's pretty good for Charlotte! I had the spinach and sun dried tomato small pie. It's not crispy, but it's doughy and yummy - I'll take it. We also had the honey chipolte wings which were spicy and delicious. Only minor issue here was that our server, who was the bartender, kept forgetting to put our wings in and it took us forever to get them. But he was so cool and funny that we didn't really care much, and it actually became funny after a while even though we were starving. \n\nPicasso's is large in size and as I mentioned, draws a great crowd. We were here on a Tuesday night and it was packed. There is a big leather couch right in the middle of it to lounge on and you are surrounded by TV's no matter where you sit. Head on over for some great food and relaxation!
Even tho I chipped a tooth on bacon... the food was so tasty...\n\nWe went to the location at the M hotel....

"Exemplary hospitality in an ambient setting, complemented by delectable Venezuelan cuisine at a reasonable tariff. Anticipating a future visit with fervor, pondering why additional eatery administrators don't share such enthusiasm for their fare."

"The Yummy: A culinary haven offering competitive pricing, an accommodating team, a diverse array of fresh produce, and an inviting ambiance characterized by well-lit and spacious surroundings, further enhanced by the provision of designated parking spaces for environmentally conscious vehicles (eco-friendly store).\n\nThe Yucky: Exercise caution when perusing the section featuring products approaching their expiration date; although these items are discounted by fifty percent, it is occasionally wiser to avoid certain products altogether, as their quality may not align with your gastronomical expectations."

This eatery represented one of the initial culinary establishments I had the pleasure of partaking in upon my relocation to Phoenix; thus, it holds a special place in my gastronomical experiences. The delectable fare served here was so impressive that I felt compelled to return the following evening with my spouse, savoring the scrumptious offerings in the midst of an ambiance that exuded warmth and sophistication. Furthermore, the alfresco seating arrangement afforded us the opportunity to bask in the balmy evening air while enjoying our repast, further enhancing the overall dining experience. The meticulous attention to detail demonstrated by the staff left a lasting impression on me, solidifying my resolve to patronize this esteemed establishment at future intervals.

"The culinary experience at Bouchon was utterly delightful. I had the pleasure of indulging in their delectable chicken dish, which was meticulously prepared and presented with an artistic flourish. Furthermore, the rich, velvety texture and deep, satisfying flavor of the brownie-shaped wine corks that followed left an indelible impression on my palate. The refined yet unpretentious atmosphere of the establishment effectively captured the essence of fine dining without sacrificing an iota of comfort or approachability. While the cost may have been slightly prohibitive, the inventive fusion of traditional French cuisine with subtle modern nuances made for an unforgettable gastronomic adventure that will undoubtedly beckon my return in the future."

Where have I been?  Perhaps oblivious to the metamorphosis of Carl's Jr, a culinary establishment that has seemingly transcended its humble origins and now boasts an array of gourmet offerings, including the extravagant $6000 combo, promoted in a television advertisement featuring the affluent Maloof Brothers and served exclusively at the Palms Casino Resort. Or maybe, my ignorance can be attributed to my infrequent patronage of fast-food restaurants, opting instead for more wholesome dining experiences. 

However, circumstances led me to reassess my culinary preferences, as I found myself entering the doors of a Carl's Jr, not merely to grab a quick bite or utilize their drive-thru service, but to partake in a full-fledged dining experience. To my surprise, the ambiance was rather pleasant, with three televisions strategically positioned throughout the restaurant, each broadcasting a unique ESPN channel. Furthermore, my expectations were surpassed by the quality and generous portion size of the chicken salad I ordered, which, accompanied by a refreshing Squirt beverage, left me feeling satiated and impressed. 

Additionally, the attentive service provided by the staff was evident in the prompt refills offered, leaving me slightly perplexed regarding the protocol for gratuity. Nonetheless, we chose to leave a dollar as a token of appreciation, despite the uncertainty surrounding its necessity. In conclusion, while I cannot attest to the nutritional value of my meal, it undoubtedly provided a welcome respite from the ubiquitous burger and taco joints that pepper the culinary landscape.

Initially, it is worth noting that the culinary offerings at this establishment are remarkably affordable, and the generous proportions of each dish ensure that patrons receive an abundance of sustenance for their financial investment. This venue represents an optimal destination for individuals seeking a satisfying meal of chicken rice without breaking the bank, as the prices are decidedly economical and the servings are far from meager. While the gastronomic quality may not be of the highest order, the value proposition presented by the eatery's pricing and portion sizes serves as a suitable compensation for any deficiencies in the taste department.

"It is utterly lamentable that this establishment does not possess a location in Boston, as it would undoubtedly be a tremendous success, given the exceptional quality of their culinary offerings. During my recent vacation in March, I had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable breakfast delights on three separate occasions. Their BLT bloody mary's are truly sublime, featuring a carefully crafted combination of flavors, including a bacon-rimmed glass, a slice of lettuce, a tomato, a bacon slice, and a piece of white toast for dipping. The presentation was also quite impressive, as it arrived on its own plate. The menu offered an extensive array of options, which led to a state of utter bewilderment, as we desired to sample every item listed. In order to experience a variety of flavors, a friend and I opted to share several dishes. We began with the Snickers pancake, which, despite being singular in nature, proved to be a culinary masterpiece, measuring a generous 12 inches in width. Its taste was nothing short of exquisite. Our second selection was the Fried Chicken and Waffles, infused with bacon slices, which can only be described as a gastronomic indulgence. While it may have been a tad unhealthy, it was nonetheless an incredibly satisfying experience. Finally, we sampled the Hash dish, which featured grilled chicken, asparagus, sundried tomatoes, homestyle potatoes, two eggs, and a fresh biscuit. Although somewhat healthier than the other options, it was still delightfully flavorful, with the accompanying marmalade serving as the perfect complement. In conclusion, a visit to this establishment is an absolute must during any Vegas vacation."

I really like this place for sushi. They have the option to have sushi rolls with brown rice instead of white. and every roll ive had there has been amazing. I really like the set up of the place as well.

Wanda's culinary offerings have piqued my interest, particularly their Eggs Benedict, which I recently had the pleasure of sampling. While the dish was undoubtedly delectable, with a rich array of flavors, I must admit that I was slightly disconcerted by the preparation method employed for the eggs. Rather than being poached, they were fried, which, in my opinion, somewhat detracted from the overall experience. However, I must commend the establishment on its exceptional customer service; the staff were warm, welcoming, and displayed a genuine desire to ensure our satisfaction. Notwithstanding the aforementioned reservation, I would still highly recommend Wanda's to anyone seeking a satisfying dining experience. It is worth mentioning that my decision to visit this eatery was influenced by a recommendation from an individual affiliated with the local Department of Motor Vehicles.

"I must confess that I did not have the opportunity to partake in my beloved frozen yogurt indulgence until the month of June in the rather chilly city of Chicago, hence my eagerness to visit Yogurtland during my recent sojourn to Phoenix. This particular establishment operates on a pay-by-the-ounce system, which allowed me to sample an array of five distinct yogurt flavors prior to settling on a half-and-half combination of peanut butter and devils food. While the low-fat content of their offerings might suggest a healthier alternative, my enthusiasm for peanut butter led me to augment my selection with an assortment of Reese's Pieces and various other sugary embellishments, thereby transforming it into an unparalleled gustatory experience. It is abundantly clear that my colleagues and I were not alone in our yearning for frozen yogurt, as Yogurtland was bustling with activity. Furthermore, it is not difficult to comprehend the popularity of this establishment, given its delectable flavors, extensive array of toppings, and reasonable pricing structure."

Gurkha Brigade does not ostensibly manifest itself as an edible establishment of notable prominence on Leith Walk, yet it unquestionably warrants consideration as a dining venue. Its interior, characterized by ample space and scrupulous attention to cleanliness, houses an extensive array of tables that exude an inviting ambiance. My culinary excursion to this Nepalese eatery led me to sample their takeaway menu, which, while perhaps a tad pricey in comparison to neighboring restaurants, boasts an impressive diversity of flavors, encompassing an assortment of sauces, meats, and vegetarian options. Specifically, I opted for the pork sungur, a dish replete with succulent, spice-infused chunks of porcine delights, swathed in a piquant tomato and garlic sauce. This delectable entrÃ©e, accompanied by a side of plain boiled rice and a carbonated beverage, amounted to approximately Â£10, a sum that, while admittedly steep, proved justifiable in light of the superior quality of the cuisine. My companion elected to partake in a duo of starters, comprising disparate varieties of pakoras, whose visual appeal and gustatory satisfaction garnered effusive praise. Following this gratifying experience, we concurred that a revisit to Gurkha Brigade would be worthwhile, perhaps when our financial constraints are alleviated by the receipt of our student grants.

No wait at all... very cool people on the patio, and nice service.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because I wasn't blown away by the food; however, was decent bar good.   My wife and I will definitely be going back!

"An exceptional wine bar nestled within the historic Old Town district, offering an impressive array of vintages at remarkably affordable prices, as well as delectable fare that surpasses the typical small plates and mediocre offerings associated with wine bars. Accommodating a sizable bachelorette gathering (albeit with a hint of reluctance), the establishment showcased its hospitable nature by presenting us with a complimentary dessert for the bachelorette. Upon perusing the wine list, I was compelled to perform double takes, astounded by the incredible selection available at such economical prices. Furthermore, a list of 10% discounted wines was discreetly displayed on the back of the inventory, awaiting our discovery. The food proved to be a pleasant surprise, with generous portions that catered to diverse tastes, leaving each member of our group thoroughly satisfied. Particularly noteworthy was the bruschetta sampler, which we highly recommend as a starting point for your culinary journey. The charming outdoor patio, complemented by live music, further enhanced the overall ambiance, solidifying this wine bar's status as a standout destination."

This review could have attained a perfect five-star rating if it were solely based on the culinary offerings. However, due to the unpretentious nature of the establishment and the cacophony of sounds generated by the sushi chefs, which resembled more of a battle cry than a warm welcome, I felt compelled to deduct a star. Upon entering the restaurant, I was greeted with an enthusiastic round of applause from one of the chefs, which I reciprocated in kind, albeit with a hint of bemusement.  
The ambiance of Ru San's is decidedly casual, and the prices are similarly unassuming, with a sum of $10 granting access to a seemingly endless array of sushi options. For those with hearty appetites, this represents an unparalleled value, as two modest rolls could easily surpass that cost at other establishments. While the sushi served at Ru San's may be described as 'Americanized,' it is undeniably delectable. Notwithstanding the potential health implications, the deep-fried sushi is a singular delight.  
To ensure optimal freshness, the sushi plates are meticulously labeled with time markers, and while the sushi often vanishes before the designated time elapses, this speaks volumes about its quality. Ru San's will persistently hold a place in my rotation of preferred local sushi haunts. 
Nota bene: To avoid potentially lengthy waits, especially during peak hours, it is advisable to arrive promptly at 11:30 AM for lunch.

Cute retro, mid century modern, designed yogurt shop. The shop girls are friendly but I do find it a bit odd that they come around and oversee patrons as they self-select the yogurt. I guess I'm just accustomed to being left to go hog wild in my yogurt selections without having to be self conscious about an employee looking over my shoulder. Maybe the shop is badly designed with bad blind spots and there are too many opportunities for us to get into trouble. Anyways I hope the shop finds a way to be less conspicuous about keeping an eye on us would-be troublemakers. \n\nKudos to their raspberry sauce. I was delighted that it didn't come in a squeeze bottle and contained bits of whole raspberries. Their topping selection as a whole is very impressive. You can get whole hostess cupcakes and little Debbie peanut butter wafers among other non-traditional toppings.

"Firkin On Paradise, a British-themed public house situated within the Las Vegas Bar Belt at the intersection of Paradise and Harmon, offers an atmosphere that exudes joviality and revelry while maintaining an affordable pricing structure. Patrons can enjoy a wide range of televised sporting events, including soccer and football, on numerous televisions scattered throughout the establishment, while partaking in libations and delectable fare. During our visit, we noted that Firkin On Paradise presents a plethora of enticing promotions, such as a $2 beer special and a $5 fish and chips offer. These economic prices contribute to the allure of this venue, particularly when compared to nearby establishments like Hofbrauhaus, which charge nearly double the price for a pint of beer. Additionally, the ambient noise level within the pub allows for effortless conversation and contemplation, enhancing the overall experience. The culinary offerings, as depicted in images on Yelp, appear scrumptious, and the servers are both cordial and knowledgeable regarding the daily specials. Furthermore, the presence of pool tables and the British pub theme, coupled with its proximity to the Hard Rock Hotel and Kiss Mini Golf, render Firkin On Paradise an ideal location for an enjoyable outing. The combination of these factors convinced me to return to this establishment and indulge in their reasonably-priced beverages."

"Consistently exceptional culinary experiences are a certainty at this esteemed dining establishment, as evidenced by my spouse's recommendation for an evening meal last week. Unfortunately, our fastidious offspring was not particularly enthused about partaking in a repast at this venue. Following a week-long deliberation, I opted to indulge in a midday feast at this locale, employing the promise of delectable fortune cookies as a means of persuading my progeny to accompany me. Upon perusing the menu, I settled upon the familiar choice of pan-fried noodles complemented by succulent shrimp, prepared with a piquant seasoning. The culinary expertise of the chef was once again showcased, as both the vegetables and seafood components were cooked to perfection, resulting in a gratifying gustatory experience that proved difficult to resist consuming in its entirety. Notably, my discerning daughter expressed satisfaction with her selection of chicken teriyaki served with noodles, devouring the majority of the dish and concluding the meal with a pair of delightful fortune cookies. This restaurant has consistently maintained high standards of cleanliness, and the staff have always displayed warmth and hospitality towards patrons. My sole desire is for them to adopt a more efficient approach to serving meals, ensuring that all dishes are presented simultaneously rather than sequentially."

Finally managed to locate Sausagefest at StrEATs, a veritable culinary extravaganza that showcases an array of delectable sausages and other savory delights. Hailing from the southern precincts of Chicago, we opted to subject both the Polish and Hot Italian varieties to a thorough examination, and we were pleasantly surprised to discover that they both met our expectations with flying colors. The Vietnamese rolls, while unconventional in nature, proved to be a stroke of genius, boasting a remarkable balance between texture and flavor. The buns were soft and pliable, yet robust enough to contain the abundance of succulent morsels within. Furthermore, the fries were cooked to perfection, sporting a delightful crunch on the outside while retaining a fluffy interior, much like the ones we relished back in our hometown. Kudos to Sausagefest for their commitment to excellence; we eagerly anticipate our next visit to indulge in their gastronomic offerings.

"Excellent! 
My experience at Red Lobster was truly exceptional, having not visited one in an extensive period of time. Following a disappointing dining excursion to a high-end seafood restaurant with an inflated price point, Red Lobster offered a refreshing contrast with its superior quality and affordability. 

Upon entering the establishment, my girlfriend and I were warmly greeted and seated promptly, despite being quoted a wait time of 45 minutes. The ambiance was inviting, and the staff exhibited excellent hospitality throughout our visit. The biscuits served were of exceptional quality, complemented by inventive specialty cocktails that contributed to an already enjoyable dining experience. The variety of options on the menu catered to diverse tastes, ensuring there was something suitable for everyone. 

Personally, I opted for two succulent lobster tails, cooked to perfection and seasoned with great skill. My girlfriend chose the Surf & Turf option, which she thoroughly enjoyed, although she playfully declined my request for a taste. (She does read these reviews, after all.) 

If I were to offer a minor criticism, it would concern the rapid heating of the water in the bathroom sink. However, this did not detract from the overall satisfaction we experienced during our meal. In conclusion, our dining excursion to Red Lobster delivered an extraordinary culinary adventure, superb service, and an impressive value, especially when compared to our previous dining experience at a fine dining seafood establishment."

"Through a succession of four visits, I endeavored to comprehend the underlying reasons behind my mobile device's malfunctioning, specifically pertaining to its inability to activate properly following a transition from an iOS-based apparatus to one utilizing the Android operating system. During each respective visit, I gained novel perspectives regarding the root causes of this technical hindrance, which were not necessarily attributable to any culpability on the part of the service providers. Rather, it was a matter of exerting sufficient effort towards diagnosing and ultimately resolving the problem at hand, thereby ensuring that I, as a customer, would be satiated with the quality of service rendered."

This place is a delight. Vegetarians, many of the dishes can be made meatless, so don't be afraid to ask. In fact, they have SOY-rizo which you can substitute for the Mexican chorizo with a couple entr\u00e9es. This tells me all is made to order (I approve!) The decor is more homey, artsy/craftsy then fancy/schmancy. Not my taste but the effort is appreciated. Don't forget to BYOB... or on certain nights, when you order 2 entrees and an appetizer (they call it a \"small plate\") you get a complimentary bottle of wine. We finished with coffee and flowerless chocolate torte. Perhaps the best I've ever had in my long dessert-filled life. FRESHly brewed coffee (just for me!) makes all the difference. The chef/owner came out to say hello and check on us. An appreciated touch. Would recommend and will return (that the chocolate tort better be on the menu!!!)

The quaint, diminutive eatery, situated in a tranquil, rural setting, offers an intimate atmosphere that exudes a sense of seclusion from the hustle and bustle of urban life, providing patrons with the opportunity to indulge in delectable biscuits and gravy, a culinary delight that is only available prior to the eleventh hour of the day, thereby necessitating an early arrival for those wishing to partake in this gastronomical experience.

Beautiful hotel.... I loved that there wasn't a casino in it or tons of
crazed smokers. This hotel was super elegant with comfortable
everything. I was in the lap of luxury.

My favorite feature was the LCD inside the bathroom mirror, so you
could brush your teeth and watch t.v. at the same time. Although, the
novelty of it washed away quickly, the deep bathtub (that can most
certainly fit 2) was just as great. Ahhhhhh.......

Also, every morning we ordered breakfast to the room. Not only was it absolutely delicious, but the service was phenomenal!

If you're looking for an elegant time in Las Vegas, Trump Hotel is the way to go!

I am an ardent devotee of skinnyfats, and my fondness for this establishment prompts me to frequent it on a weekly basis. On this particular visit, however, my enthusiasm was significantly dampened by the subpar level of customer service displayed by one of the servers. Specifically, our party of four received their meals, but mine was conspicuously absent. My partner inquired about the status of my food, only to be met with a dismissive and irksome response from the waitress. Rather than exhibiting empathy and concern for the delay, she callously deposited a house salad in front of me and curtly informed me that I had ordered a quinoa salad with chicken. When I respectfully corrected her, she took the plate back without uttering a single word and left me waiting for several minutes before returning with the correctly prepared dish. Her behavior was particularly vexing, given my profession as a customer service manager for a financial institution, which has accustomed me to exceptionally high standards of hospitality. It is worth mentioning, however, that the other staff members present were quite friendly and engaging towards the patrons, making the waitress's conduct all the more glaring. Despite the unfortunate encounter, the culinary offerings at skinnyfats remained impressive.

This edifice is utterly captivating and warrants a personal visitation, particularly for those who possess a fervent enthusiasm for architectural ingenuity. Moreover, I would advocate for a guided excursion of the Nationality Rooms, as it provides a unique opportunity to immerse oneself in the cultural heritage of the various ethnic groups that have contributed to the city's rich history. However, I must caution that availing oneself of this experience requires meticulous planning, specifically pertaining to the scheduling of tours, lest one encounter an unfortunate inconvenience.

Getting your car serviced or if your just in the area. 

Located at the Ford dealership. 

This place has great priced breakfast. 

I got the egg and cheese croissant. 

Would come back again and again!

One star loss because it takes so long after you order to get your food!

"I have an immense fondness for this establishment, primarily due to their exceptional margaritas and fajitas, which are undoubtedly among the finest in the region. However, I must admit that my experiences here have been somewhat tempered by the fact that during the warmer months, the ambient temperature within the dining area can become somewhat uncomfortable. Were it not for this minor drawback, I would unhesitatingly confer upon it a perfect five-star rating."

During my nearly three-year tenure as a resident of Las Vegas, I have had the occasion to observe the rapid proliferation of new Roberto's establishments throughout the city, with each successive opening representing an incremental increase in both quantity and diversity, as evidenced by the vast array of proprietors and culinary offerings that have come to characterize these disparate entities; furthermore, it is worth noting that the green salsa served at this particular location possesses an uncommon degree of piquancy, one that surpasses even that of its counterparts at other branches I have visited, a phenomenon that remains somewhat enigmatic, but ultimately serves to enhance the overall dining experience for those who partake of it.  This specific Roberto's happens to be situated in close proximity to my place of residence, and over time, it has established itself as a reliable purveyor of satisfactory comestibles, with the carne asada and breakfast burritos being merely passable, while the carnitas, when ordered, are subjected to a brief but intense frying process immediately prior to their incorporation into either a burrito or taco, thereby imbuing them with an unparalleled crispiness that serves as a testament to the culinary acumen of the establishment's chefs, and ultimately, provides me with a source of unmitigated gastronomical delight.

"Greetings, esteemed patron! We extend a warm welcome to our beloved Pita Jungle, where the culinary delights are tantamount to those of our fellow establishments, while the hospitality of our staff is nothing short of cordial. Although we acknowledge that the bar area may appear somewhat diminutive in size, we trust that the expansive outdoor patio will provide an idyllic setting for your indulgence during favorable meteorological conditions."

Last night, I decided to indulge in some delectable takeout from this establishment, and I must say, I was thoroughly impressed by the exceptional level of customer service displayed by the staff. Upon inquiring about the ingredients used in their tortillas, I was delighted to discover that they were indeed vegan-friendly, prompting me to place an order for two vegetarian burritos. As the burritos were being prepared, the manager kindly offered me a complimentary sample of their signature tortilla soup, which I eagerly accepted. To my surprise, the soup was not only delicious but also vegan, much to my delight.
