My burrito arrived brimming with an array of flavorful components, including mouthwatering cilantro lime rice that was noticeably more lime-forward than its Chipotle counterpart, accompanied by an assortment of fresh black beans, creamy guacamole, crunchy fajita vegetables, zesty pico de gallo, and a tangy medium salsa. The culinary masterpiece that lay before me was nothing short of sublime. My dining companion, too, was thoroughly satisfied with her burrito, which featured a medley of fluffy rice, flavorful black beans, crisp fajita vegetables, and a dollop of pico de gallo. In a previous life, when I still consumed dairy products, I often ordered their scrumptious chips served with a side of velvety queso dip, an indulgence that never failed to satiate my cravings.

"Sam Fox, oh how I adore thee! As an ardent devotee of your gastronomical masterpieces, I must confess that my expectations are consistently surpassed whenever I partake in a dining experience at one of your esteemed FRC establishments. Culinary Dropout, in particular, has captivated my taste buds with its diverse array of delectable offerings. From the initial sip of the sublimely savory bacon bloody mary to the gratifying finale of the heavenly pretzels and fondue, each visit has been a veritable odyssey of epicurean delight. Although minor hiccups in service have occasionally occurred, they pale in comparison to the overall excellence that permeates every aspect of the dining experience. Kudos to you, Mr. Fox, for your unwavering dedication to culinary excellence! I shall continue to patronize your restaurants with great enthusiasm and fervor, as my wallet weeps with joy."
Great new hotel. Everything is brand new. I really like the King bedroom suite. The pool and breakfast area are really nice. I'll come here again for vacation.

"An exceptional dining establishment situated within the confines of Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport, offering a culinary experience that far surpasses the customary standards associated with conventional airport fare, featuring a contemporary and unpretentious interpretation of traditional Tex-Mex cuisine."

"Are you enamored with the notion of indulging in delectable noodle-based culinary delights? If your response is an unequivocal affirmation, then it is my pleasure to introduce you to a veritable haven for those who share your unwavering passion for such gastronomical treats. My personal familiarity with the diverse array of establishments nestled within the bounds of Montreal's Chinatown enables me to confidently assert that, while they may lack the superficial trappings of high-end eateries, these humble abodes serve up authentic, culturally rich fare that is sure to satiate your cravings. Alas, the limitations of my linguistic prowess preclude me from adequately conveying the full extent of my enthusiasm for this particular eatery; suffice it to say that, among the numerous venues I have had the privilege of patronizing, there is but one that stands out as a shining exemplar of excellence in both quality and affordability. It is my fervent hope that, upon partaking in the delightful offerings of Noodle Factory, you will find yourself similarly smitten, and that the memories you create therein shall linger long after the last savory morsel has been consumed."

Do not let the strip mall, small location deter you from visiting this sushi place.  We just went with a huge assortment of sashimi with a sprinkling of grilled mackerel and edamame.  For being in the Scottsdale area right of the 101, the sashimi was very fresh and we got the insider hookup for wasabi.  This place is a keeper.

Umphrey's two thousandth performance commemorated an auspicious milestone, transpiring within a capacious arena that boasted satisfactory acoustics and an amicable security personnel. Unfortunately, our tardiness during both evenings precluded us from partaking in the delectable taffy apples fabricated at an adjacent establishment, its proximity being merely a stone's throw away. However, we were able to take advantage of a sizable parking garage located a single block distant, which offered a decidedly more convenient alternative to the often-frustrating street parking characteristic of Madison's urban domain.

"Despite the underwhelming ambiance, we opted to sample the culinary offerings of the Curry Garden, and our gastronomical excursion proved to be a resounding success. Upon perusing the menu, we elected to indulge in the Paneer Tikka Masala, Bhatura, and Garlic Naan, which, much to our delight, were replete with an abundance of delectable ingredients and flavors. The Paneer Tikka Masala boasted an impressive quantity of succulent paneer, enveloped in a rich, velvety sauce that was utterly tantalizing. Furthermore, the Bhatura was skillfully prepared, its golden, crispy exterior giving way to a fluffy interior, making it an ideal accompaniment for dipping in the savory sauces. Lastly, the Garlic Naan was also noteworthy, with an generous amount of fragrant garlic incorporated into the dough, resulting in a palate-pleasing experience. \n\nIn conclusion, our dining experience at the Curry Garden was thoroughly enjoyable, despite the uninspired interior design. The attentive service and scrumptious fare more than compensated for the lackluster ambiance, leaving us eager to return and indulge in their mouthwatering dishes once again."

"An expansive bar area, complemented by an extensive array of culinary offerings, fosters a convivial ambiance that is further enhanced by the hospitable demeanor of the bartenders. Although the waitstaff exhibits occasional signs of hastiness, their efforts remain generally commendable, particularly in light of the establishment's numerous televisions, which create an ideal setting for viewing sporting events while enjoying a libation or two."

"I thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance and culinary offerings of this establishment, and I must say that the opportunity to engage in vocal and bodily expressions of joy was an added bonus, although I must admit that my own reticence prevented me from fully embracing said activity."

We bought an online gift certificate for this place while we were in Vegas and were pleasantly surprised,  Service was excellent. I had a ribeye that was perfectly perfectly prepared and the sides were great too.  I ended my meal with the creme brulee and it was great!  For a restaurant inside a casino it was really first rate.

This comprehensive assessment pertains to the House of Blues Las Vegas as a live music venue, where culinary offerings have been sampled on previous occasions, thus rendering an evaluation unnecessary; however, it is imperative to emphasize that refraining from partaking in such fare would be advisable, lest one desires to subject their palate to uninspired and unremarkable flavors. In contradistinction, the focal point of this critique revolves around the captivating performance of AFI, a band boasting a profound impact on the music scene, particularly during the 1990s, yet having undergone significant stylistic metamorphoses throughout their career, effectively transforming them into a contemporary iteration reminiscent of their earlier work. The ambiance of the House of Blues Las Vegas exudes an air of sophistication, courtesy of its well-appointed interior design, while the stadium-style seating arrangement ensures an unobstructed visual experience for all attendees. Notwithstanding the ostensible ease of access, both ingress and egress are facilitated with remarkable efficiency, even when confronted with a considerable throng of patrons. Furthermore, the sonic quality of the performances hosted within this venue is commendable, fostering an immersive auditory experience that transcends expectations. Additionally, the speedy and attentive bar service upstairs merits praise, as does the overall preference for this particular House of Blues location over its Anaheim counterpart, which is bolstered by the unique charm of the Las Vegas setting, conveniently devoid of the inconveniences associated with the actual Disneyland.

"The morning repast was thoroughly enjoyable, with the eggs and chorizo constituting a satisfying and flavorsome start to the day. Although we did not partake in the carbohydrate-based options, the pancakes and muffins appeared visually appealing and no doubt would have contributed to a pleasurable dining experience had we opted to indulge in them. Kudos to Samantha for her exceptional service, which greatly enhanced our breakfast encounter."

"My culinary experience at this establishment was an amalgamation of gastronomical delight and concern regarding sanitation. Despite my initial reservations, I opted to sample their offerings, which included both steamed lamb and chive dumplings, as well as fried pork and cabbage variants. The former was decidedly more rounded in shape, which allowed for a more efficient release of steam and boiling water, thereby enhancing the overall flavor profile. However, the latter style, while still palatable, did not quite resonate with me to the same extent as its steamed counterpart. Notwithstanding the aforementioned qualms regarding hygiene, I would still recommend visiting this restaurant, as the dumplings are undeniably delectable, and the accompanying side salads are equally tantalizing. Just be sure to avert your gaze from the floor covering."

"The Habit represents a notable departure from the conventional fast-food establishments, offering an elevated dining experience reminiscent of a refined, gourmet restaurant, albeit with a menu that, while adequate, may not necessarily cater to the most discerning palates. Furthermore, the quality of service, while satisfactory, may not always meet the highest standards, particularly during peak hours when the limited parking space tends to create inconvenience for patrons. Therefore, it is advisable to arrive promptly during the lunch period to secure a suitable parking spot."

"An unpretentious edifice from the exterior, yet housing an genuine ambiance, exceptional hospitality, and delectable culinary delights at reasonable tariffs, this Thai restaurant in Phoenix excels in offering a satisfactory dining experience; furthermore, their revamped website, replete with visual representations of their gastronomical offerings, facilitates the process of placing take-out orders with utmost convenience; specifically, their signature Pad Thai and the 35th item on their menu are highly recommended and indeed, a must-try for gourmands and epicureans alike."

"I am thoroughly enamored with this establishment, as it offers an extensive array of baked goods, including an assortment of artisanal breads, delectable pretzels, savory sausages, and an abundance of other mouthwatering meats, in addition to a diverse selection of soups, snacks, and an impressive array of pickled delights that showcase the epitome of culinary craftsmanship. My recent visit to this gastronomic haven yielded a trio of items that have left an indelible mark on my palate: a succulent horseshoe-shaped soft pretzel, a bag of crunchy pretzel sticks, and a sublime creamy dill-lemon-caper-honey mustard that has elevated my standards for condiments to an unprecedented level. Needless to say, my next visit will involve a comprehensive exploration of their vast array of gummy candies, which I anticipate will be a delightful and satisfying experience."

Very clean and modern, safe area.  Pleasant front desk staff, called me after check-in to make sure all was ok.  Detached sitting area, fridge, spacious, big TV.
Negatives:  Strange thermostat, hard to figure out, and the usual lame Arabica Hyatt in room coffee.
Not on older car GPS software, as it is a newer hotel, so beware if you are driving and have an older car, can be tricky to get to unless you know where you are going.
When I woke at 7AM on a Sunday it was very quiet and I was surprized at how peaceful it was, unlike weekend Embassy Suites, but then very shortly thereafter I heard kids running up and down the hall and mirthfully screaming in Spanish.  There was a congregation of seven people loudly chatting, also in Spanish,  in the hall who seemed to deliberately get even louder when I stuck my head out to see what the commotion was about.  I suppose I cannot blame the hotel for the rudeness of its family-oriented clientele, however, as this is a universal problem in cheaper hotels with large rooms and extra sleeping areas.  Perhaps a check-in written discrete request to guests asking them to respect quiet hours would be in order? ( I know, wishful thinking).

I indulged in a two-night sojourn at the Wigwam as part of a work-oriented weekend retreat, which proved to be an ideal setting for retired individuals who relish golfing and shopping excursions. Our visit coincided with a Leadership Summit organized by my company, rendering the venue an optimal choice for work-related conferences. The accommodations boasted generous space, complete with a wet bar, a living area equipped with a fireplace, and a sleeping quarter featuring a luxuriously soft bed that afforded me the most tranquil and rejuvenating nap of my existence; it was nothing short of celestial! Although my personal penchant tends towards modernistic decor, I must admit that the Southwestern/Ranch-inspired motif did not detract from the overall sense of comfort and relaxation that permeated throughout my stay. While I might not typically opt for this type of lodging due to my stylistic preferences, I found myself thoroughly enjoying the experience and feeling gratified by the hospitality extended by the establishment.

Met up with some of my favorite folks last night because I NEEDED some cheese enchiladas paired with a margarita or two.  This little place has great service and really nice servers and wait staff...it was an enjoyable evening from start to finish.  The food is good ol' sonoran-style and I changed up my regular order to include green chile .  Yum Yum Yum!!!!  I like the fact that there are vegetarian options and the prices are really reasonable.  One of my friends has been eating there weekly for several years now so that's a pretty high recommendation.  I'm finding out that they have other regulars as well.  Still looking for the perfect red sauce but this place is OK in my book.

"A high-quality timepiece has the propensity to convey a multitude of information regarding its proprietor, and can hold a significance comparable to that of a dwelling or an automobile for individuals who seek to project their position, aesthetic, or pecuniary standing to others. Given that I possess the ability to verify the time on my portable telecommunications device, and have always found wristwatches to be somewhat bothersome and uncomfortable to don, I shall likely persist in utilizing my ill-fitting and economical attire, in conjunction with my unkempt athletic footwear, to communicate my social standing to those around me. However, for aficionados of horology, this minuscule yet eccentric retail establishment may appear to be a divine blessing, as the vast array of timepieces compactly showcased within its confines is truly remarkable."

It is eminently worthwhile to partake in a visitation, especially if one has not had the pleasure of experiencing this particular attraction previously. Procurement of tickets can be facilitated at Fry's for a nominal fee of $20. It is advisable to bring sunscreen and a hat to mitigate the effects of solar radiation, as well as to prepare oneself for an extensive amount of walking, as the venue is quite expansive. Additionally, it is wise to anticipate a significant number of people, resulting in a high level of activity. To satisfy one's culinary inclinations, there will be a variety of options available, including $3 soda, $5 beer, $7.50 turkey legs, and a brownie accompanied by ice cream for $5. However, it is important to note that these items come at a considerable cost, so it would be prudent to budget accordingly. Throughout the day, there will be numerous performances and exhibitions catering to a diverse array of interests, ensuring that everyone can find something to enjoy.

diamond in the rough for sure. surrounding neighborhood is full of rotted out houses, but this place does great things regardless of their location.  charcuterie platter was great, prices are affordable for the quality presented, and the staff was eager.  i recommend the duck egg ravioli, because the brown butter and fried swiss chard give it a winning edge.  fois grois mousse was creamy and the flavor was great with the fig paste, but is was a clunky eat and hard to divide.  all in all we ate like kings, drank a bottle of wine, had desert and split a glass of prosecco for less than $120.  if i lived in the area i would find an excuse to go eat the charcuterie platter a couple times a week over drinks.

Don't miss this great spot!  My friend lives nearby so we've visited for breakfast several times.  The coffee is pretty great.  The vanilla latte is a favorite - rich and smooth without a hint of bitterness.  Menu item are unique and varied but I find that I keep going back to the short rib burrito - delish!  Portion sizes are waaaay too big.  I'm usually full after half my meal so I request a to-go box when I place my order and my friends do the same.  The wait can be long but the fast and friendly service makes up for that once you get inside.  Cons for me include uncomfortable table seating (though the booths are comfortable) plus the fact that you have to look pretty hard to find healthy menu selections. They're pleasant as can be about subbing out ingredients, though, so that's a plus.
Nice restaurant. Met both the husband and wife team. Very friendly. The food was good, and the service was great. I will eat there again.

"During my exploration of the captivating sights of Edinburgh, a sudden craving for a midday repast and a brief respite from my peregrinations necessitated a visit to a nearby eatery. Unfortunately, the cafe that had been highly recommended to me was closed during the festive period, thereby compelling me to seek alternative dining arrangements. In proximity to the aforementioned establishment, I chanced upon this quaint cafe/bistro, which appeared inviting and thus, I decided to venture inside. Upon entering, I was warmly received by the hospitable waitress who promptly escorted me to a vacant table and presented me with a menu. As I perused the offerings, I noticed that the menu selections were displayed on the windows, thereby facilitating my decision-making process. I opted for an avocado salad, accompanied by a glass of water, motivated by a desire to maintain a healthy disposition following the excesses of the holiday season. My culinary selection was swiftly prepared and delivered to my table, complemented by a side of brown seeded bread. While the salad was indeed delectable, I couldn't help but feel that a greater diversity of vegetables, such as the inclusion of cucumber and spring onions, would have enhanced its overall appeal. Moreover, I observed that an excessive amount of vinaigrette had been applied to the salad, resulting in an unfortunate sogginess of the leaves. Notwithstanding this drawback, the quality of service rendered by the waitstaff was quite satisfactory, and thus, I would consider revisiting this establishment in the future, as it offers a diverse array of edibles and potables."

"An exceptional venue for indulging in superior quality brews and delectable cuisine, yet it can be arduous to secure a table accommodating more than six patrons due to the absence of reservation facilities."
I ordered the spinach rice and beans which was excellent. Service was slow to start I waited 10 minutes for a cup of tea. Lunch is a very busy time but it'd still return because the food is very good

Ordered from Little Nippers II multiple times.  Each time I have been happy with what I have received, but I wouldn't call it fast food.

Good food takes time to make, and in the case of their mild wings, they are good!  Skip the packet of dressing they give you and go home and put some quality blue cheese on these wings and you are in business!  

Their pizza is o.k., but I have to say that I have not found pizza in Pittsburgh that measures up to the ones I can get back in New York, but then again their is a pizza place on every corner in my hometown. 

I will definitely be back, but will also make sure to call in or grub hub my order before to minimize the wait time.

"The fish sandwiches are indeed worthy of adoration, as they possess an unparalleled quality that surpasses expectations. In the event that you desire a midday repast, it is advisable to partake in one of these delectable offerings, but it would be wise to preemptively arrange for its procurement, lest you be compelled to endure a protracted delay of thirty minutes or more within the confines of an establishment that exudes an aura of questionable repute. Be aware that the atmosphere within said venue is often permeated by a pungent cloud of smoke, though it does boast the presence of a soda dispenser, which may serve to slake any thirst that may arise during the interval preceding the preparation of your meal. Notwithstanding the fact that the cost of such a delectable entree, accompanied by a portion of fries, may approach ten dollars, it is my conviction that the expenditure is decidedly worthwhile."

Really great place! We used to frequent the location in Mesa, but the manager was a total witch! I am serious--my bf, at the time, and I would go there, weekly, and she would never acknowledge us, or even attempt to be polite to the customers, so we stopped going. I am glad we gave the Bell Rd. location a try. The service was excellent! We were greeted, with a big smile, and seated immediately. Our server was excellent. Food is great. We always order the same thing, a skillet for me and Eye Opener Combo for the hubster. We are definitely excited to welcome this franchise back in to our rotation of wonderful breakfast joints!

The free little chocolate tour is fun, the cactus garden is cool and the best part is being able to chocolates at the end, I particularly like the Creme Liqueurs! If you havent had them you need to try them!

"The culinary establishments situated within the Mekong Plaza are all worthy of at least a single visit. However, the Wholly Grill stands out as an eatery deserving of multiple visits. We were seeking a satisfying and economical dining experience, and decided to support a local business by patronizing the food court at the Plaza. Our decision to dine at Wholly Grill proved to be an excellent choice, as we were not let down by their offerings. 

I opted for the grilled pork belly, while my companion chose the pork skewers. It was challenging to determine which dish was more enjoyable, as both were imbued with delectable qualities. The skewers possessed a tenderness and juiciness that was complemented by the accompanying eggplant salad, which reminded me of the mouthwatering street food commonly found in that particular region. The pork belly, on the other hand, boasted a crispy exterior and an interior texture that was cooked to perfection. Avoidance of overcooking or undercooking pork belly is crucial, as it can result in an unpleasant chewy, rubbery, or fatty consistency. Fortunately, this was not the case with Wholly Grill's rendition. Instead, I found myself eager to consume every last morsel, even after feeling satiated. Each time I believed I had finished my meal, I would notice an additional piece of savory meat on my plate and be compelled to devour it. 

The staff at Wholly Grill exhibited exceptional friendliness, with our server displaying amusement when recommending the pork belly, almost as though she were surprised that a Caucasian woman with red hair would consider her suggestion. There are several other menu items that pique my interest and that I would like to sample in the future, provided that I can resist the temptation of the pork belly, which I now find myself craving once again."

I procured a minuscule vanilla chai tea latte in a portable container, which I found to be rather satisfying in terms of its flavor profile, although I did experience some disappointment due to the diminutive proportions of the beverage relative to its cost, which I felt was slightly disproportionate to its monetary value.
Went for Restaurant Week with a friend. Adorable little place, wonderful atmosphere. The squid was just slightly overcooked but everything else was perfect. Service was great. Bring your own wine.

As a concatenation of culinary establishments and a slight deviation from the conventional definition of rapid nourishment, I thoroughly relish the experience offered by Chipotle! The comestibles served within these eateries are invariably fresh and delectable! Chipotle upholds an unwavering commitment to providing victuals that align with their philosophical tenets, specifically emphasizing "Food with integrity." These principles encompass offering vegetarian options and procuring meat from sources that adhere to natural and hormone-free practices. Such considerations contribute to my sentiments of satisfaction, derived not solely from partaking in scrumptious fare, but also from supporting an enterprise that prioritizes environmental responsibility. Upon each container, a narrative pertaining to one of their products or corporate practices is inscribed, which serves as an entertaining diversion during my dining experience. The employees at Chipotle exhibit exceptional cordiality! I was taken aback by the extent of their helpfulness and amicability, which I encountered while assembling my burrito via the establishment's efficient assembly line. Both interior and exterior seating arrangements are available, catering to diverse preferences. Additionally, the convenience of online ordering is offered, allowing patrons to retrieve their culinary selections upon arrival. In conclusion, Chipotle excels in both gastronomical quality and hospitable service, thereby earning my ardent admiration.

We were craving something light and decided to try this place.  I love a good sushi and sashimi plate, and there were plenty of items on the menu to pick from.  We decided to do some of the small share plates and were not dissappointed.  We ordered a total of 6 items, and all were very fresh and tasty.  The sauces we tried were outstanding.  The service was extremely good....very friendly, efficient and sincere.  Definitely would eat here again....

Je suis pass\u00e9e ici par hasard alors que j'avais d'autres commissions \u00e0 faire dans le coin. Je ne connais pas vraiment Ahuntsic, mais vu la senteur de pain frais qui se d\u00e9gageait de cette boulangerie, je n'ai pas pu r\u00e9sister y entrer pour une petite visite. Ils ont vraiment de tous pour un bon repas: du pain, des p\u00e2tisseries, des pains, des p\u00e2t\u00e9s, des pains, des fromages, des pains, e plats pr\u00e9par\u00e9s en avance \u00e0 r\u00e9chauffer \u00e0 la maison, et bien s\u00fbr des pains. J'y ai go\u00fbt\u00e9 le pain \u00e0 l'\u00e9rable et aux noix qui \u00e9tait simplement divin. Je suis toutefois repartie \u00e0 la maison avec une miche de pain aux raisins et noix qui a \u00e9t\u00e9 tranch\u00e9 comme je le voulais. C'\u00e9tait un bon pain dense avec une cro\u00fbte bien solide mais pas trop difficile \u00e0 manger et une mie moelleuse qui ne fait pas trop de miettes. Si cette boulangerie \u00e9tait plus pr\u00e8s de chez nous, j'en serais probablement une cliente r\u00e9guli\u00e8re!

"It appears that this venue serves as a hub for the aggregation of stylish and fashionable individuals, a notion that was previously unbeknownst to me.  I couldn't help but ponder whether the proprietors of this establishment anticipated such immense popularity.  My personal experience with the gaming facility was characterized by a sense of bewilderment, which may have stemmed from my unfamiliarity with the atmosphere.  However, upon inquiring with multiple staff members, I was finally able to pinpoint the location of the will call desk designated for the boulevard concert arena.  It's worth mentioning that the predominant sentiment among the patrons seems to be one of joviality and helpfulness, and the demographic appears to consist of youthful revelers.  The subterranean parking area presents a challenge, and I would suggest augmenting the illumination to mitigate any potential discomfort.  As an aside, I envision the afterlife to resemble this setting, albeit with a greater emphasis on eternal indulgence.  

I had the privilege of attending a performance by the renowned band New Order, which took place outdoors in the vicinity of the swimming pool.  Despite my limited familiarity with their music, I found the concert to be thoroughly enjoyable.  The pool deck, while somewhat cramped and compact, accommodated a sizable audience of over four thousand attendees.  The acoustics were less than ideal due to the open-air setting, but the band's selection of songs, which included four tracks from Joy Division, proved to be truly impressive.  Those who opted to depart prematurely prior to the encore segment missed out on an exceptional experience, in my opinion.  A genuine devotee remains until the house lights are switched on and the musicians have vacated the premises.  In conclusion, I found the encounter to be memorable, and it afforded me the opportunity to connect with some fascinating individuals from the Yelp community for the first time."

Having been obsessed with boba tea for the last month, our never ending quest to try every boba tea joint in Las Vegas lead us here.  Although this place is called the Sesame House, you would never know it.  Its inside the Chinatown Plaza mall area where they have a sign outside just saying \"No. 1 Boba\".  \n\nI would say this is probably the second best place I've been next to Tea Planet but the prices are better here.  Not too much of an atmosphere though.  But the fruit is fresh and they do have quite a selection of dried fruits etc.

A veritable haven for gastronomic indulgence, this quaint eatery in Vieux Quebec is an absolute must-visit for breakfast, brunch, or lunch. My better half was instantly enamored with its charming ambiance, deeming it utterly "adorable." Timing is key, as arriving around 11 am allows for a leisurely early lunch or brunch without the inconvenience of excessive crowding. Weekdays proved to be particularly stress-free for breakfast, affording us the luxury of a tranquil dining experience.

Their assortment of pastries is nothing short of sublime, with the cheese biscuit boasting a subtle yet tantalizing hint of cayenne spice. My spouse was thoroughly enchanted by the Cuban panini, praising the generous portioning of its flavorsome filling. While I, myself, did not share her enthusiasm for the bread's degree of toastiness, I would still eagerly order one of their paninis again and relish the opportunity to indulge in those delectable cheese biscuits as a sweet treat. And, quite frankly, their large cappuccinos are an absolute must-try.

In conclusion, the prices at this establishment are surprisingly reasonable when considering the plethora of overpriced tourist traps that plague the Old City.

I've flown in and out of here more times than Anna Nicole Smith's pharmacists flew in and out of the Bahamas. I find the inside extremely easy to navigate while the outside a labyrinth of epic proportions. What lane do I exit to the 202. The left? Oh, now the middle? And then 100 yards later the left again? WTF? Is this fun for the traffic monitors as they scarf down Cheetos and Dr. Pepper all the while watching weary travelers zig zag the ridiculous signage. Services are average to pretty good in terms of bars, restaurants and shops. Not sure what the complainers aren't finding. All I need is a bar, a snack, the boob tube, Dramamine, the National Enquirer and that funny horseshoe shaped pillow that makes me feel like an idiot everytime I bring it out.
4/5 dangerous sweets. \n\noh my. sugar. bars. yum. i'm glad i can only get this when i'm in town for business, otherwise i'd have to get pants in new sizes.

"Determined to indulge in a gastronomical experience that would satiate my culinary cravings while traversing the aerial hub, I opted to sample the chicken and biscuits proffered by the establishment. My expectations were not only met but exceeded, as the flavorsome delights proved to be of exceptional quality, thereby warranting my unwavering endorsement and hearty commendation to the state of North Carolina for their efforts in maintaining such an elevated standard of gastronomic excellence."

This Trader Joe's is friendly and offers the same great TJ's products.  What needs is improving is their parking lot!  It is so bad that Insurance companies should charge a premium for folks willing to play Russian Roulette by parking here.  I make a point of parking at the far end of the lot to avoid playing smash up derby with the elderly patrons.  Love the proximity to my home as I will be a regular here!

"Indubitably, my culinary excursion to Poppy's Bagels this morning was a gastronomical delight, as I savored each bite of the delectable, toasty bagel, adorned with a generous schmear of homemade cream cheese. The texture and flavor profile of the bagel were sublime, with a satisfying crunch from the toasted sesame seeds, while the cream cheese added a velvety smoothness that complemented the bagel perfectly. Furthermore, the establishment's ambiance, replete with a charming patio and cozy interior, provided an idyllic setting for enjoying a leisurely breakfast with my canine companion, Riley. Notwithstanding the occasional noise pollution from the nearby thoroughfare, the overall experience was thoroughly enjoyable, and I would unhesitatingly recommend Poppy's Bagels to any individual seeking a scrumptious bagel and cream cheese combination."

I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by Five Guys in various states, totaling three, and my affection for this establishment has yet to diminish. Originating from Southern California, I was brought up on In-N-Out Burger, a local fast food chain; however, my curiosity was piqued upon learning that former President Barack Obama had visited Five Guys, leading me to try it myself. Subsequently, I became enamored with their delectable burgers, boasting an abundance of flavor, and have continued to indulge in them. Notwithstanding, I must admit that In-N-Out's french fries remain my preference. Nonetheless, my loyalty to Five Guys remains unwavering, and I foresee future visits.

"My cognitive faculties are consumed by an incessant preoccupation with the culinary delight that is the french fries; it is my conviction that these delectable morsels were initially submerged in a batter, prior to their submersion in hot oil, thereby enhancing their flavor profile and texture. Furthermore, I must commend the eatery on the quality of their buffalo chicken sandwich, which boasted a generous portion size and satisfying taste. The menu, replete with an array of options catering to diverse palates, is expansive in scope and suitable for large gatherings. The interior design, characterized by an open layout and numerous televisions, fosters a welcoming ambiance conducive to socializing and viewing sporting events. While the establishment may bear some semblance to a certain chain restaurant, my intentions are to return and partake in the aforementioned fries, as well as other menu items, with great regularity."

Buca Di Beppo's offers an unparalleled dining experience, boasting inconceivably delectable cuisine and gargantuan portions that necessitate sharing between multiple individuals. Given the copious amounts of food provided, it is advisable to reserve a table in advance, particularly during peak dining hours, to ensure seamless accommodation for your party. The pasta dishes, in particular, showcase exceptional culinary prowess, with each strand masterfully prepared and enveloped in rich, savory sauces that elevate the flavors to new heights.

"Gastronomical indulgence in delectable sushi and teppanyaki cuisine within an opulent eatery, complemented by attentive and courteous servers, offers an unparalleled dining experience. Preceding the culinary extravaganza, an array of tantalizing appetizers assails the taste buds, preceding the main event. While the cost may be perceived as prohibitive, numerous discounts and promotions are extended to local patrons, rendering the establishment accessible to a broader clientele. Personal preferences include the varied sushi rolls, tofu, filet mignon, seaweed salad, and vegetarian teppanyaki options, each dish showcasing the culinary prowess of the skilled chefs."

"Since its inception, we have been frequent patrons of this culinary establishment, and each visit has consistently proven to be a gratifying experience. The Teppan chefs possess exceptional showmanship and culinary prowess, which they demonstrate through their captivating performances and deft food preparation. The proprietors, Barry and Ahn, are extremely affable and maintain a keen interest in ensuring the satisfaction of their clientele. They possess an impressive memory for familiar faces and extend a warm welcome to returning customers. 

Their Happy Hour menu boasts an array of delectable options, including freshly crafted sushi that exemplifies the essence of Japanese cuisine. 

While some individuals may find the ambiance to be somewhat boisterous due to the presence of multiple Teppan tables, we contend that the lively atmosphere is an integral aspect of the dining experience. Moreover, the expansive patio offers a unique opportunity to observe the breathtaking beauty of an Arizona sunset, an experience not to be missed. 

Our unwavering loyalty to this restaurant stems from our consistent enjoyment of its offerings, and we eagerly anticipate future visits."

"We arrived at this establishment on a Tuesday afternoon, with the intention of partaking in a celebratory luncheon, utilizing the Lunch Groupon 'All You Can Eat' and 'All You Can Drink' options, priced at $36 for two individuals. Prior to being seated, our photograph was captured, evoking feelings of joviality and anticipation. The menu offered an array of culinary options, including salads, Mexican dishes, soups, Middle Eastern fare, Asian cuisine, American classics, Italian specialties, seafood delicacies, and an assortment of delectable desserts. In addition, the 'All You Can Drink' component provided an unlimited selection of beer, wine, and champagne, eliciting exclamations of delight from the female patrons, in particular. We highly recommend the strawberry crumb cupcake, which proved to be an epicurean delight. Furthermore, the presence of cotton candy for the youngsters added to the festive ambiance. However, the sushi offerings were found wanting, with a notable absence of crab legs. Patrons seeking a satisfying dining experience are advised to focus their attention on the Mexican, salad, and American options. While the edibles were merely average, the beverages proved to be the highlight of the meal, rendering the overall cost of $36, or $18 per person, a reasonable expenditure."

"Upon entering this establishment with a acquaintance of Bosnian descent, who graciously placed an order on my behalf, I was immediately struck by the sterility of the ambiance. The atmosphere was reminiscent of a bakery, albeit with a distinct disparity; an unmistakable air of uniqueness permeated the space, defying conventional categorization. 

Presented before me was a plate bearing a generous portion of freshly prepared bread, measuring approximately ten inches in diameter. This circular loaf, graced with a subtle sheen of oil, was bisected like a hamburger bun, revealing a savory filling of seasoned sausage meat. This culinary creation, known as ćevapčići or cevapi for short, constituted the entirety of the meal. 

Despite the seeming simplicity of the dish, both the bread and sausage proved to be delightfully flavorful. Unfortunately, my stomach capacity proved insufficient to consume the entire portion, even when dining with an empty stomach. Nonetheless, the experience left a lasting impression on me, and I would eagerly repeat it, while also making sure to reserve some space for the visually appealing Bosnian pastries on offer. 

The proprietors of the bakery displayed remarkable hospitality, despite their unconventional approach to customer service. Rather than hovering over guests, they adopted a more hands-off philosophy, whereby patrons were expected to communicate their needs directly. Personally, I found this manner of interaction rather refreshing, and it only added to the charm of my visit."

This eatery possesses an undeniable allure, boasting a brisk and efficient service complemented by an ambiance that exudes a palpable energy. My culinary experience was further enhanced by the delectable \"Leo's Sandwich,\" a judicious selection that showcased the kitchen's proficiency in creating flavorful dishes. Notably, even the simplest of beverages, water, was imbued with a subtle nuance that elevated its taste beyond the mundane. However, a few organizational hiccups pertaining to the management of waiting patrons slightly marred an otherwise seamless dining experience, thereby precluding me from conferring a perfect five-star rating.

"It is truly remarkable how this grocery store manages to consistently deliver exceptional customer service, evidenced by the absence of lengthy queues at the checkout counters, which are typically no more than one or two individuals deep. Furthermore, while their organic produce selection may be limited in scope, the quality of the items they do offer is unquestionably superior. Additionally, their beer selection boasts an impressive variety beyond the standard Bud Light and Coors Light options, and their assortment of baking supplies is truly remarkable, rivaling that of specialty stores. Such is my enthusiasm for this establishment that I am willing to go out of my way to patronize it."

The quality of the service we received was satisfactory, but the cost of our meal was somewhat prohibitive, particularly in light of the fact that we were only served two omelets and a beverage, albeit a delectable one, for the sum of eighty dollars; furthermore, the absence of an alcoholic beverage from the menu was a notable omission, given the prevalence of such offerings at establishments of this ilk in Las Vegas, a city renowned for its extravagant and indulgent culinary experiences. We elected to partake of our repast in close proximity to the pool, whereupon we proceeded to recline and enjoy our nourishment in a state of leisure, necessitating a brief stroll to secure a suitable location external to the edifice. The outdoor dining area, unfortunately, was not constantly available for our utilization, thereby requiring us to circumnavigate the premises to some degree in pursuit of an appropriate setting for our al fresco dining experience.

"We thoroughly enjoyed our recent visit to this establishment! My daughter and I partook in a delectable luncheon at this venue, and we were thoroughly impressed by the culinary offerings presented before us. Specifically, the capri sandwich fashioned from ciabatta bread and my daughter's turkey and bacon sandwich, also constructed from ciabatta, were utterly scrumptious! It is worth mentioning that the gentleman manning the counter, whose name unfortunately escapes me, exhibited exceptional hospitality and amicability, graciously addressing any queries we harbored regarding our meals. Such an encounter has secured our intentions to revisit this eatery in the near future."

I paid a visit to Sushi Style today for a midday repast. Despite the fact that it was the peak lunch hour and numerous establishments were teeming with patrons, this particular sushi eatery was bustling yet not so congested that I had to endure an extended wait for attention from the staff.  
The server was exceptional. Prior to my complete settling in, she had already presented me with a refreshing glass of lemon-infused iced tea, demonstrating her attentive and prompt service. It is not uncommon to encounter establishments where the tea has been left to sit for an extended period, rendering it questionable and potentially unpleasant.  
I indulged in a tootsie roll, which proved to be quite satisfying. The combination of the eel sauce and the crunchy texture of the crab California roll was truly impressive. Additionally, I sampled an Arizona roll, which was equally remarkable. I am highly likely to return to this establishment in the near future, either for lunch or dinner. My spouse and I typically frequent only a select few sushi restaurants, and this establishment undoubtedly gives Yen Sushi a run for its money with its extensive menu options and exceptional customer service.

I always get my acrylics done here! They're a little our of my way but so far the best place I've found in awhile. Tina does an excellent job of making them all even and thinner at my request. I can usually make it 3 weeks at most between fills. Great place!!! Definitely recommend and the prices are very reasonable.

"A truly exceptional luncheon buffet experience can be had during the week for a nominal fee of $13.99, give or take a dollar, offering an extensive selection of delectable vegetarian options, succulent chicken, pork, and beef dishes, complemented by an assortment of mouthwatering Naan bread that is simply divine and served in copious quantities, ensuring a truly satiating culinary indulgence that will undoubtedly necessitate a postprandial restorative respite."

"The hospitality proffered by the bartender was truly exceptional, and the educational excursion provided an enlightening experience. Unfortunately, the outdoor drinking area was not accessible during our visit due to the inclement weather conditions prevalent during the off-season, yet we managed to sample several satisfactory beverages despite the limitations imposed by the unpropitious circumstances."

Makes some of my favorite bagels in the world.  Great place for breakfast, but the challah is a little sketchy some days, knowing a Jewish friend.  I can also get my Chompies bagels at the grocery store which another added plus.

Los Dos proffered an exceptionally delectable Chimichanga, featuring a succulent selection of meat, meticulously deep-fried to a golden crisp, and adorned with a flavorsome triad of guacamole, sour cream, and New Mexico's signature green chili sauce, thereby evoking a culinary nirvana that would have warranted an unqualified 5-star rating had complimentary refills of chips and salsa been offered; furthermore, their extensive assortment of premium margaritas and beers served as the perfect accompaniment to this gastronomic delight.

This establishment was a frequent haunt of mine during my tenure in Chicago, thus, upon discovering a branch in downtown Pittsburgh, I felt compelled to partake in their culinary offerings, anticipating a familiar experience, as franchises strive for uniformity in both quality and flavor across all locations.  
Upon perusing the menu, I opted for the signature dish that had been the subject of my craving for an extended period. The price point was reasonable, the preparation time was brief, and the flavors were reminiscent of my previous encounters with the chain. It is worth noting that while there may be establishments offering superior taste, lower prices, or expedited service, finding a venue that successfully combines all three attributes can be challenging. Thus, this eatery earns four stars, and its proximity to my workplace only serves to enhance its appeal.

"It was a challenging endeavor to locate this establishment, but the effort was undoubtedly rewarded with an exceptional culinary experience, featuring delectable tacos and a hospitable chef. We are eagerly anticipating our next visit, whereupon we shall indulge in their gastronomical delights once again."

This particular Wendy's franchise has recently undergone a comprehensive renovation, prompting my companion and me to visit and examine the revamped interior design. The extensive refurbishment has significantly altered the customer experience, as the traditional method of ordering and collecting food has been replaced by a more streamlined and efficient system. Specifically, patrons are now required to place their orders at a designated area before proceeding to a separate pick-up location. Additionally, the dining area has been thoroughly modernized, featuring new furniture, an updated ambiance, and even a segregated section for young children. Furthermore, this establishment now offers complimentary Wi-Fi access, further enhancing the overall dining experience for its clientele.
it is almost ok for lunch. not expensive\uff0c nice environment. But the kinds of dishes provided is not too much.

St. Francis is one of my preferred destinations for a leisurely morning repast in Phoenix, boasting an upscale, contemporary ambiance. Their culinary offerings are an eclectic fusion of traditional American dishes, infused with nuances from various cultural influences. Furthermore, they possess an extensive selection of artisanal brews, as well as expertly crafted mimosas and bloody Marys, which complement their delectable brunch options. Additionally, children under the age of ten can indulge in a complimentary meal, making it an ideal family-friendly establishment.  

The hospitable staff has consistently displayed warmth and attentiveness during my visits. Although some patrons have reported sluggish service, I have never experienced such issues personally. The duration between courses may be somewhat prolonged, but this is hardly the server's responsibility. In fact, the servers have been diligent in monitoring my beverage levels and offering prompt refills when necessary.  

Their eggs benedict with salmon is a personal favorite of mine, as the Hollandaise sauce achieves a sublime balance of richness and tartness. Initially, the dish was served with a generous portion of fingerling potatoes, but unfortunately, this side dish has since been replaced by a few scattered potatoes on the plate. Nonetheless, the pork chile verde remains a standout option, boasting a delightful harmony of spicy and savory flavors. It is presented with a substantial serving utensil and accompanied by two slices of cornbread, perfect for sopping up the flavorful broth. Another culinary highlight is their cioppino, a fiery, crimson seafood stew that is arguably large enough to share, and is served with a crusty loaf of bread.  

Furthermore, I have visited St. Francis with companions for a happy hour excursion, during which we exclusively ordered appetizers and beverages. The atmosphere proved to be cozy and inviting, and we departed feeling content and refreshed, courtesy of the outdoor patio's warm fire.

Switch offers a variety of food options from healthy choices to comfort food. The menu is very eclectic, and I have yet to have a bad meal from here. The portions sizes are very generous for the price and service has always been good. Some of my faves include:
- mac & cheese: rich, creamy, flavorful cheese sauce over penne
- caprese sandwich: typical ingredients with a great pesto vinaigrette 
 - burger: your basic burger, not too fancy, but great on taste
Also, if you're looking to tie one on, they have some fantastic drink specials especially on Sundays where you can get carafes of mimosas, bloody marys, etc. for $3.

We have been ardent patrons of this culinary establishment for a duration of five years, during which time we have developed a profound appreciation for their gastronomical offerings and beverages of a blended nature. The specific location under discussion is a relatively recent addition to the chain, having been in operation for less than a year at the present time, and boasts an exceptionally busy location that has led to inconsistent staffing levels on weekends, resulting in occasional delays of up to twenty minutes in the procurement of sustenance. Despite these brief lapses in efficiency, the quality of both the edible fare and potable beverages remains unwavering, though unfortunately, the same cannot be said for the maintenance of the facilities, particularly the restrooms, which are frequently found to be in a state of disarray, much to the chagrin of this author and parent of three youthful offspring, who find it necessary to exercise great caution in their utilization, lest they be confronted with an environment that falls short of stringent standards of hygiene. It is a source of perplexity and disappointment that the sole lavatory on the premises should be overlooked with such regularity, despite the evident amiability of the staff and the apparent competence of the manager. Notwithstanding this anomaly, this eatery remains a favored destination for our family, who frequent it several times a week.

"I have had the pleasure of dining at this establishment on a weekly basis, with the occasional absence, and I must say that the culinary offerings have been remarkably consistent. The foundation of their pho soup, which is undoubtedly the cornerstone of their menu, has undergone a subtle enhancement, thereby elevating its already superior quality relative to other eateries. My experiences at this venue have transpired under varying conditions of occupancy, ranging from tranquil to bustling, and yet, the level of service has remained steadfastly excellent. It is truly gratifying to have such an exceptional dining option available in Chandler."

"Ask any Asian individual regarding their preferred destination for acquiring common seasonings and household items, and it is highly likely that nearly all of them will be familiar with this particular establishment. However, it is essential to note that this store is not exclusive to Asians, as anyone can visit and locate their desired products, thanks to the aisles being categorized according to various cultures such as Filipino, Korean, and so forth. In case this systematization does not prove helpful, customers can still explore the vast array of 'water animals,' freshly baked goods, and even a bubble tea counter. Additionally, the store features a modest dining area that offers what appears to be traditional Chinese cuisine. While it may require a considerable drive, visiting this store is an absolute must for those seeking to satisfy their culinary requirements related to Asian cuisine, particularly when in the Matthews/Stallings vicinity."

It utterly perplexes me that certain individuals harbor the notion that In-N-Out surpasses Lenny's in terms of gastronomical quality. In-N-Out, in my opinion, holds the dubious distinction of being the most egregiously overhyped establishment within the realm of fast food. I am thoroughly baffled by the underlying factors responsible for such an unmerited reputation, as the patties served at In-N-Out are characterized by an unfortunate lack of substance, the cheese is merely serviceable, and the fries are utterly forgettable. While the flavor profile of the burger itself may be passable, it falls short of the lofty standards set by other prominent players in the industry, such as Whataburger, which, in my estimation, handily outstrips In-N-Out in terms of overall excellence. On the other hand, Lenny's boasts patties that are genuinely beefy in nature (a playful pun, if you will), accompanied by cheese that is respectably adequate and fries that are exponentially superior to those offered by In-N-Out. Although Lenny's may not lay claim to the title of premier burger joint in the vicinity, it unquestionably outclasses In-N-Out in a multitude of aspects.

I don't have health insurance so I had to pay for my dental services. I thought the prices was okay after comparing it with other dental centers in the area. And plus they had an internet coupon for $100 off. So that's why I went with them instead of another dental center. Plus there were a number of good reviews on google for Biltmore Commons Dental Care. That gave me more confidence to use their services.  I called at 8am and I was able to get an appointment at 9am. Maybe I was lucky or maybe there's vacant spots because of the bad economy and no one is going the dentist. Who knows. Dr. Balestrino did my fillings. He took his time to explain to me what needed to be done and addressed the questions I had. I am overall pleased with this dentist visit. I would go back for my follow up in six months to get my teeth cleaned.

"This eatery constitutes one of our preferred destinations for procuring luncheon fare for take-out purposes, as we unhesitatingly venture beyond our customary boundaries to acquire their delectable sandwiches and salads. The culinary offerings of this establishment boast a consistent degree of savory excellence, while the staff members exhibit an unwavering commitment to cordiality and hospitable customer service. Thus far, we have yet to sample a single item from their extensive menu that did not meet or exceed our expectations."

"Unequivocally an aficionado of Yoforia, I must say. These yogurt establishments have been proliferating with alarming rapidity in recent times, it appears. A truly ingenious notion, this self-serve cum weight-based payment system. Kudos to them for striking an optimal balance between palatability and cost-effectiveness. \n\nIt is occasionally vexing, however, to be confronted with an interminable queue at this particular venue. Nevertheless, the line advances with reasonable celerity... and, as a welcome boon, the Southpark Mall location affords one the opportunity to perambulate the premises while awaiting the dissipation of the throng."

The gym is a great gym, I love the facility. It's a big gym and has quite the number of equipment. I only had one situation with the employees which was that I wasn't able to use the gym, when I had already paid, because I hadn't brought in my I.D. to complete the membership. I complained and everything was fixed. The only thing that LVAC isn't spot on is the customer service and some of the employees. Heads up, it gets packed during the day. If you're able to go at midnight, do so! It's never packed during then.  Other than that, everything there is absolutely great! Plus, it's 24 hours.

"Cleanliness, amicability of staff, and voluminous servings are hallmarks of this culinary establishment, purveying Mexican cuisine, albeit not the most exceptional, yet gratifying my yearning. Despite my resolve to consume merely half, my gluttony invariably prevails, devouring the entirety, rendering futile my intention to reserve the remainder for a subsequent repast."

My girlfriend and I are currently staying at the Cosmpolitan this week. We've eaten at the brunch buffet twice since we've been here and the food is really great. The quality and variety is fantastic. There is something for everyone and everything is super fresh.

Only issue we've had is the time it takes to be seated for a table. As we were waiting on line both times, we saw that there were plenty of empty tables -many of which had already been cleared and reset.  Yet, it took a much longer time than necessary to seat everyone. There seems to be a lack of concern for seating the patrons as quickly as possible. 

Nevertheless, the food is really enjoyable and just be sure to save room for dessert!!

Everyone is complaining that this place is pretentious...well that just happens to be one of the reasons why I come here!

I love the lay out of the store, it's always clean and they let you sample whatever flavours you want downstairs before you buy. The queue is crazy on the weekend so come on a week night if you can to avoid the mayhem. You can bring the capsules back for recycling and they keep all of your info on file so there is no need to remember anything, which is perfect for me.

Nespresso has made me a nicer person in the morning so I for one love this store and their product.

"The physical configuration and aesthetic appeal of this particular Starbucks establishment are indeed impressive, offering ample space for patrons to enjoy their beverages and socialize. However, upon our visit, it was observed that the staff was not maintaining the premises with the utmost diligence, as evidenced by the overflowing waste receptacle and tables in need of thorough sanitization. Despite this oversight, the team demonstrated a commendable level of friendliness and hospitality, thereby warranting a rating of four stars. Nevertheless, it is hoped that future visits will reveal an increased emphasis on maintaining a clean and organized environment, as well as ensuring an adequate supply of edible items."

The buffet was really worth it.  Some of the dishes are wonderfully flavored.  Some are a little bland.  Their mango ice cream is very good, but the mango lassi could do without the whipped cream.  Very attentive staff.  Curry here is not very spicy but has a nice mixture of spices.

Bandera serves as an ideal location for initiating one's nocturnal escapades, as it offers an assortment of delectable edibles, including their signature Dip Duo accompanied by tortilla chips, which, when coupled with their flavorful Mojitos, creates a truly unforgettable gastronomical experience. Bandera's ambiance also provides a unique setting for partaking in a satisfying appetizer and a potent beverage, thereby making it an optimal venue for commencing an evening of revelry.

My best friend came in to Vegas for the day to visit. I wanted to take her to the new hotels to see how amazing they are. We decided to have lunch and a couple cocktails here after checking the menu out.\nWe shared the grilled vegetable pizza and I had my own cocktail concoction made (Grey goose, water, lime & mint)...YUMMY! I loved how they can or will make any cocktail you want. My friend had their house margarita on the rocks and loved it so much she had 3...hey, she was on vacation!\nThe service was good and the views outside were stunning!

This eatery is an optimal location for indulging in Dim Sum delights, situated on the periphery of Montreal's Chinatown. Despite its unremarkable setting within a shopping mall, the culinary offerings are satisfactory, and the ambiance is fitting for a Dim Sum establishment. The dishes tend to possess a slightly oily quality, which is not entirely unexpected given the nature of Dim Sum. Numerous patrons have drawn parallels between this restaurant and others in various locales; personally, I have had the pleasure of partaking in Dim Sum in Shanghai on several occasions, and I would argue that this establishment holds its own in comparison. Engaging in a thorough analysis of a specific restaurant versus an entire city or nation is, in my opinion, rather futile, as Shanghai boasts both exceptional and subpar establishments, making it a matter of personal taste. My primary objective is to discover a genuine, authentic Chinese steamed bun (xiaolongbao) restaurant in Montreal, akin to Din Tai Fung, and sample their delectable wares.

Setting - Good setting, very nice and relaxed with plenty fo room.

Service - Friendly service and always happy to help you make your choice.

Food - Very, very good. This place knows how to do a steak and me and my two friends agreed it was some of the best we'd ever had. I'd avoid the mushroom side though as, to me, it was one of the most vile things I'd ever tasted, though I guess that could just be me.

Overall - Go here if you want a good steak at a good price with good service. Do not miss!!!!

"A culinary aficionado such as myself cannot help but adore the delectable delights proffered by Thai cuisine. It is no surprise that this establishment has garnered accolades including the prestigious title of 'Best of Las Vegas' on multiple occasions in recent years. There are two indubitable aspects that contribute to its enduring popularity. Firstly, it boasts a loyal clientele who crave authentic Thai flavors, and secondly, the kitchen's commitment to serving dishes that showcase the richness and diversity of Thai gastronomy. Patrons can indulge in an array of mouth-watering options, including the quintessential Pad Thai, red curry with a spicy numba 10 kick, and savory mint beef. Not to mention their refreshing Thai Iced Tea, which strikes the perfect balance between sweetness and tartness. The ambiance is inviting, characterized by a warm and welcoming staff who epitomize the essence of Thai hospitality. While the prices may fall under the umbrella of 'average,' the quality of the fare and the overall dining experience justify every baht. A word of advice: avoid visiting during lunchtime if you opt for the buffet, as it may not live up to your expectations. Instead, treat yourself to a sumptuous dinner that will leave your palate satiated and your senses delighted."

"It is perpetually beneficial to witness a commercial enterprise execute tasks appropriately and attain recognition for its efforts. This eatery adheres to such a paradigm, as evidenced by my spouse and I partaking in their delectable Cobb Salad during the luncheon hour - an experience that far surpassed our expectations. 

The site in question has been home to several culinary establishments that have come and gone, with each departure being attributed to various deficiencies. Toast, however, has effectively demonstrated that the location itself was not the primary factor contributing to these shortcomings, but rather the quality of the food and service provided - a notion that holds true in most cases. 

While the ambiance was generally pleasant, there was a brief period during which the noise level rendered conversation across the table somewhat challenging. Although this may be a natural byproduct of their popularity, it remains a concern worth addressing."

I've probably shopped here 10 times in the last 2 years and have always had great service and I really enjoy the selection of women's running and beer-drinking, uh....I mean, yoga clothes.  If I have a return or exchange it's always been taken care of quickly and with a smile.  No complaints.

"Indulge in the delectable KOBE SLIDERS, an unparalleled gastronomical experience that will leave you yearning for more. The tantalizing flavors of these bite-sized delights are unmatched, and the complementary BBQ dipping sauce serves as the perfect accompaniment. However, be prepared to endure an extensive wait during peak hours, particularly on weekends, as the restaurant's popularity is well-deserved. While outdoor seating may appear inviting, it is unfortunately not a feasible option due to the overwhelming demand. Nevertheless, the ambiance is undeniably captivating, boasting a picturesque pool and fountains that create a serene atmosphere. Additionally, the establishment offers a comprehensive bar selection, a standard feature in Las Vegas establishments. Furthermore, their menu showcases an array of mouth-watering options, including the colossal Cobb salad, capable of satisfying three individuals; the savory chili; the succulent turkey club sandwich; and the massive, delectable cheeseburger. Although the prices may seem steep, the superior quality of the cuisine justifies the expense."

Vdara epitomizes a tranquil retreat amidst the frenetic atmosphere of the Strip, boasting spacious accommodations, exceptional customer service, and an array of luxurious amenities. Having had the pleasure of lodging at this esteemed establishment on two separate occasions, I can unequivocally attest to its allure. The guest rooms are palatial, comfortably accommodating our trio during our most recent visit. Notably, the property's non-smoking policy and absence of a casino contribute to its peaceful ambiance, making it an ideal haven for those seeking respite from the Strip's vibrant energy. Positioned at the southern end of the Strip, Vdara enjoys a relatively secluded location, tucked away behind the Cosmopolitan. While the trek to the Strip may prove somewhat arduous, the proximity to Bellagio renders it a decidedly more straightforward endeavor. Although I personally prefer a slightly livelier atmosphere during my Vegas sojourns, Vdara's deliberate emphasis on catering to a more sedate clientele ensures its continued appeal and longevity. Furthermore, the hotel's pool area exudes a sense of serenity, standing in stark contrast to the rowdy vivacity characteristic of many Vegas pool scenes. Without hesitation, I would opt to stay at Vdara once again, particularly given its reputation as a "mystery" hotel on Hotwire, readily identifiable by its south Strip location, five-star rating, and non-gaming status. Until we meet again, Las Vegas!

I visited AAP last week for lunch due to my tardiness to Greek Isles, but I am utterly delighted that I did! As I partook in a late lunch, the establishment was not overwhelmed with patrons, and the hostess afforded me the luxury of selecting my own table, which resulted in my occupying a spacious and comfortable booth. 

My server promptly approached me and acquired my beverage order, in addition to inquiring whether I possessed any queries regarding the menu. I was intrigued by the soft pretzel accompanied by beer cheese, and my server elucidated upon its exceptional quality, while also emphasizing its considerable size. Consequently, I opted to order it, and if my hunger persisted, I would consider ordering another item, given my server's assurance of the kitchen's expedited nature. 

Upon its arrival, I discovered that the pretzel was remarkably tender, flaunting a satisfying crunch on its exterior, and it was presented steaming hot! Although I maintained a modicum of hunger, I chose to order the spinach salad, which proved to be equally delectable. Comprised of spinach, tomato, cranberries, and feta, it offered a diverse array of flavors and textures. While I pondered the possibility of incorporating a nut or alternative ingredient to enhance its texture, I concluded that it was, nonetheless, an excellent salad. 

It appears that AAP offers specialized beverages throughout the week. The vastness of the establishment renders it an ideal setting for viewing sporting events. However, I deducted one star from my rating due to the limited options available for lunch, as the entrees are not served until after 5 pm. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, my experience was thoroughly enjoyable, and I am eager to return!

We are utterly delighted that we came across this eatery prior to our departure from Las Vegas, as it served as an optimal respite from the city's vibrant atmosphere. Despite our somewhat disheveled appearance, we were warmly received by the proprietor, who exhibited an unwavering commitment to ensuring our satisfaction. Notwithstanding the minor mishap pertaining to my companion's order, the owner's amiable demeanor and willingness to accommodate our preferences was truly appreciated. The culinary offerings presented a distinct deviation from the customary Korean-owned establishments we had frequented, thereby eliciting our curiosity. Although skeptical about its authenticity, the pho's unique flavor profile garnered our approval, particularly during a state of mild inebriation. However, the necessity of traversing the kitchen en route to the lavatory did evoke a modicum of apprehension. Nonetheless, such inconvenience proved inconsequential in light of the overall dining experience.

Let me initiate my evaluation by expressing that I was profoundly dubious of a rotating sushi establishment. Fish...rotating, indeed...however! I perused all the exceptional assessments and verily! I adore visiting Teharu. You sit, the cuisine rolls by, it's enjoyable! I thoroughly relish anything that is meticulously crafted, savors magnificent, and is Economical. They possess an extensive array of items priced at 1.50-2.50 PER dish. I shall upload an image subsequently to demonstrate precisely how copious you can indulge at this venue and escape inexpensively. (Since I can consume ample sushi.) The brews are substantial, the servings gratifying, and it's fresh, which is extremely crucial when devouring raw fish, no? If you're still pondering, SIMPLY PROCEED - With prices at 1.50/2.50 per dish...you can manage to "sample it."

"Whenever we have an inclination for a delectable steak at a reasonable price point, this establishment serves as our preferred destination. The personnel consistently display amiability, and the interior maintains a state of spotlessness on each occasion. We customarily opt for the butter-free variant of the steak and the vegetables, as they provide that option here, which significantly reduces caloric intake while preserving the flavor through their assortment of seasonings. 

The warm, fresh brown bread they proffer at the onset of the meal is invariably scrumptious. The atmosphere within this eatery is pleasant, and the booths situated adjacent to the bar area offer a sense of privacy, making them ideal for a romantic evening out; attempt to secure a table in that vicinity. 

In summary, this dining experience earns an exemplary rating due to the consistent preparation of culinary items, the provision of health-conscious options with rich flavors, and the cordial nature of the staff."

Glad to have this eatery in my vicinity, the sole aspect that would enhance its appeal for me would be the inclusion of an outdoor seating area, specifically designed to accommodate canine companions. A reasonable tariff, coupled with the delectable flavors of their red curry dish, has rendered this establishment a veritable culinary gem in my opinion.
Stop here! Buy a block of the dill Havarti and try a bunch of samples. I am sure there will be others that you love :)

Le Petit Moulinsart is a diminutive eatery nestled within the historic district of Vieux Montreal, specifically along Rue St Paul. In point of fact, we might not have halted at this establishment had we not been in pursuit of a late evening repast and discovered this venue to appear promising among the limited options. It's worth mentioning that the moniker of this culinary haven is derived from a renowned Belgian comic strip, which showcases a majestic chateau by the name of Moulinsart. As such, it comes as no surprise that the gastronomical offerings of this restaurant specialize in traditional Belgian cuisine, albeit my associates and I found it challenging to differentiate between Belgian and French fare, our ignorance notwithstanding.  

Le Petit Moulinsart prides itself on its delectable mussels, which are meticulously prepared using diverse methods and an array of distinctive flavors. Our party sampled four unique mussel dishes, and while all were palatable, two stood out as particularly exceptional. Given the extensive selection of flavors available, I would suggest choosing any option that piques your interest, as the quality of the mussels is consistently high. Rest assured that the kitchen staff at LPM has mastered the art of preparing mussels, as each serving arrived plump, tender, and brimming with juices. To complete the meal, a complimentary baguette is provided to mop up the savory broth, and a crisp salad rounds out the dish, yielding a satisfying and wholesome culinary experience. 

Personally, I would rank the mussels served at Le Petit Moulinsart as the runner-up to the most exceptional mussels I have had the pleasure of indulging in; the pinnacle of excellence still belongs to Bertha's, located in Fells Point, Baltimore.

"Exceedingly satisfactory, copiously oily, utterly indulgent culinary delights, confined to a solitary monthly consumption owing to their unwavering commitment to profuse frying methods, thereby elevating the humble white trash burger (comprising a triumvirate of deep-fried garnishes: pickles, onions, and cheese, atop a beef patty) and its accompanying sweet potato fries, to an unparalleled position of gastronomic excellence."

The last train station is at SLS, the Lux tower wing where we stayed at, it was easy access for us to get on this train. Bought 24 hour passes, got on the train to get to The Linq, it was so fast and convenient, much better and cleaner than taking taxi. There was barely any people on a Sunday. \n\nI like to take the train during the day, It was a lot of fun for me, just need to remember to wear flats next time!

A welcoming ambiance entices patrons at the intersection of Saint-Laurent and Fairmount, fostering a diverse clientele comprising of young mothers and their offspring, professionals seeking a productive meal, and refined gentlemen relishing a cold brew. The concise menu boasts an array of delectable options, ranging from grilled cheese sandwiches, fresh salads, and charcuterie platters on the smaller side, to heartier pasta dishes, savory stews, and satisfying hash on the larger portion of the menu.  
Upon ordering, my culinary companion and I opted for contrasting selections. My $15 corned beef hash, garnished with a flawlessly cooked sunny-side up egg, garnered praise for the chef's expertise in achieving the perfect doneness. The juicy, flaky corned beef melted in my mouth, coalescing with the rich flavors of the dish. Although the serving size appeared modest, the abundance of flavors made it a satisfying portion by the end of the meal. Following the current culinary trend, a peppery arugula salad graced the top of the dish, enhancing its overall appeal. 
My dining companion selected a salad accompanied by crispy fries, playfully dubbed the "angel and the devil" by our attentive server. These fluffy, golden fries, served with a creamy mayonnaise dipping sauce, proved irresistible, as I found myself indulging in several bites before realizing my gluttonous transgression.

"Abandoning the ubiquitous Starbucks franchise, I instead opt for the distinctive charm of independently owned establishments. While my predilection gravitates towards the eclectic ambiance of the Beehive, Crazy Mocha's diverse offerings proffer an equally satisfying experience. Their extensive menu boasts an array of expertly crafted coffee and tea beverages, delectable smoothies, and an assortment of sweet treats. However, I must express a modicum of discontent with the gargantuan proportions of certain dessert selections, which, while ideal for sharing among a group of four, pose a formidable challenge for a solo diner adhering to a strict dietary regimen. Complimentary internet access further enhances the appeal of this inviting venue, which has undergone several name changes throughout its history. Formerly known as Dancing Goats, the location has since metamorphosed into Crazy Mocha, with multiple outlets scattered throughout the Pittsburgh area, including a recent addition at the esteemed Carnegie Library."

"An upscale watering hole, replete with an array of potent potables and a discerning clientele, affords the quintessential setting for observational indulgence and eavesdropping. Verily, the denizens of this esteemed establishment serve as the primary source of diversion, regaling one another with tales both tall and true, such as the saga of the ostentatious patron who, in a fit of magnanimity, purchased a bottle of Cristal (a cool $800) for a pair of comely Russian lasses, and then, in a display of unapologetic audacity, shotgunned it!
